story:
Short Summary

Paranormal Magic is a passion project that has been picked up by a television production company! However we soon realized that in order to bring our vision to the screen we have to produce the show ourselves!  With so many fans of magic and horror we don't want this show watered down!

  • Hello my name is Dr. David Shareef I started magic in 1975 when the greatest of all time Muhammad Ali paid a visit to my school and performed magic for me and my class room!  Yes that's right Muhammad Ali was a Magician and I was his protégé!
  • This Campaign is so important to our team because I have wanted to do this for years also I'm  a creator for four other television magicians who you all know.  By producing the television series without hollywood watering down subject matter and style you the viewer will see pure magic, mind reading and see exactly what the artist has wanted to show the world! .
  • There has NEVER IN THE HISTORY OF THE WORLD BEEN A MAGIC, ILLUSION SHOW ON TELEVISION LIKE PARANORMAL MAGIC; EVER!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Funding will be used for paying for camera crew also major actors not as secret helpers but as Victims lol ! Netflix is very specific on the equipment used in filming its shows we have to use Netflix approved camers.  We have to pay for each location also the celebrities that will appear on the show.  The show will start with a short horror film that requires a makeup artist, actors and film crew: we have J Anthony Kosar 2 time winner of SyFy's hit television show FACE OFF as our makeup artist!.  Also Paranormal Magic will require a PR company employed full time!  Having a PR firm will ensure that the word is out before Paranormal Magic is on television, this includes Magazine write ups, appearances on Jimmy Fallon, Ellen and local news shows!
  • T-shirts, Blu Rays and producer credits on the show are just some of our perks!
  • As stated before some funds go to PR, paying for locations, new magic apparatus, paying celebrities for appearances, music licences, air fare, hotels, television crews and so on.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • We have been talking to the fan base; this is a show that is wanted around the world and you have the opportunity to take part of it now!
  • We have a track record of success; our live Las Vegas show was called one of the top ten magic shows in all of Las Vegas!
  • We will have an open set! come be a part of the filming at anytime; if you are a contributor!  you will see your self on television if you come to one of the cities we are filming in! Thus far we plan on filming in Chicago, San Antonio, Las Vegas, Los Angeles and New Orleans!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • It is also very helpful that if you can't contribute to share share share! Tell all your friends and family about our campaign.
  • Also don't forget when sharing this campaing  to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it! Please help us create history!

story:
The Show 

Say Nice Things is a character-driven, place-crucial “dramedy” about siblings Natalie and Leyroy Hendrix, inheritors of the Tireman Trade Center. They struggle to maintain the Detroit landmark while big-money developers gobble up the city around them. All the while, the siblings’ personal lives are unraveling: Natalie’s drug addiction is resurgent; Leyroy is resentful over the loss of his budding music career; their mother’s long placement at a psychiatric hospital strains their time and money. All of it combines into a daunting pile of roadblocks the two must confront. However, the series is not without joy and laugh-out-loud humor. The brother and sister nurture their chosen family which is flourishing inside the Tireman Trade Center: a former factory repurposed as a post-industrial wonderland mishmash of flea and farmer’s market, odd-ball retailers, public music space, and comfort food café with a noteworthy chef. It all makes for an unlikely keystone community to a swath of eclectic “Old Detroit,” but that might be the very thing that saves them all! 

Everything is at risk in this dynamic and heartfelt family struggle. It is told as a series of short, interrelated vignette episodes that will air as streamable content on YouTube.  

 

Goals & How the Funds Will Be Used

Our goal is to raise $120,000 by the last week of filming, slated for October 2021. Your contribution will help produce the over 250 hours of work necessary to bring this project to completion, alongside equipment, payroll for all cast and crew, location fees, licenses, and the production costs for all 14 episodes.

The show will premier December 2021 on YouTube to be released for free, just in time for the holidays!

This Indiegogo campaign supports the production of this project to completion. Contributors also obtain unique, on-brand perks. Your donations fuel our visions. Your monetary gifts make it all possible. 

 

Detroit Hustles Harder: A Pandemic Story  

Writer and showrunner Veronica Frick, alongside writer Radfan Ali Alqirsh, collaborated to bring Say Nice Things into being. Filming was planned for 2020. Then the pandemic happened. Michigan was hard hit at the onset, with the city of Detroit at the heart of the response of shutdowns. Live performances were cancelled, productions postponed, artists and performers waited and watched as the artistic communities we built were devastated by the grief we all experienced living through such unnerving times.

It was during this moment of deep angst that Veronica reached out to writer and editor Craig Bernier to revise the original script via phone and Zoom sessions. The result is this current project. 

In April of 2021, Veronica, through a twist of fate, found director LeShawn Bell. Throughout this process, LeShawn has been diligently working with the actors via Zoom every week to get them acquainted and comfortable with their characters to prepare for filming. 

The money that is sourced from this Indiegogo campaign goes directly to the artists, creators, and organizers who have dedicated themselves so wholly to the project. Actors have been cast, director and film crew secured, the production staff is onboard. We need backers to bring the project to fulfillment. That’s how this Indiegogo campaign functions. We need your help.

 

Follow Us!

Instagram @_say_nice_things_

Facebook Group Say Nice Things

YouTube Account Say Nice Things

TikTok SayNiceThingsTV

story:
We made our initial goal!  Now for the stretch goals....

We made our initial goal of $6100!  Thank you to all who've helped us get this far!

Next -- our stretch goal of $30,500 -- to develop the next five episodes.  Read on:

So Proudly We Hailed

“So Proudly We Hailed” is a webseries which honors veterans by dramatizing and musicalizing their story in their own words.  

We pair our honorees with an artistic team comprised of a composer, lyricist, director, and dramaturg, and shape their story into a short musical retelling in a digital platform. 

We’ve filmed the first eight episodes of the series, and we're now fundraising so that we can film the five remaining Finalists!

Stipends go directly to Veterans.

 

"$6100?  How can you produce a webseries for $6100?"

$6100 covers just one episode.  We're actually hoping to raise enough for the next five episodes ($30,500); and THEN a second season of another thirteen ($79,300) and a live stage show and additional seasons.  Now that we've raised the first $6100, can you help us get to the stretch goal of $30,500?

 

New Musicals Inc.

New Musicals Inc has developed over 400 musicals, working with such producers as the Celebration Theatre, Deaf West Theatre, Latino Theatre Company, Northern Sky Theatre, the University of California Irvine's prestigious Department of Drama, and we are active members of the National Alliance for Musical Theatre, a national network of musical theatre producers and theatre companies. We have worked with established writers such as Jeff Marx (Avenue Q), Mark Hollmann (Urinetown), Hunter Foster (Bonnie & Clyde), Stiles & Drewe (Mary Poppins), and Placido Domingo, Jr. (Soul of Darkness).

 

Sneak peek of the series

So Proudly We Hailed, a musical webseries honoring veterans in their own words, provides a vibrant record of veteran experiences, and through the creation of musical theatrical short films, participants and audience may experience more insight and understanding of the military experience.   

Here's a short excerpt of one of the episodes, Christmas in Afghanistan:

 

Here's a sampling of several episodes, combined into one video:

 

The Five Finalists we're trying to fund

This campaign hopes to fund these five Veterans’ stories to life:

The Shooter, by Brenda Garcia.  The U.S. Navy gave her a camera instead of a gun.

The Air Force Jumper, by Shannon Corbeil.  At some point, you have to pull your own rip cord.

The Observer, by Steve Bingley from the British Armed Forces.  You never forget watching a friend try to hang himself.

The Collector, by Diarra McCormick.  The worst job in the Air Force?  Tracking down your fellow service members who owe money to Uncle Sam.

The Ant Man, by Jeffrey Golden.  Attacked by fire ants.  Twice.

 

Want to see some finished episodes?

We have launched the first round of completed episodes, along with interviews with Veterans, actors, and writers.  You can see finished episodes at:

www.nmi.org/veterans

 

Where will your donation go?

Stipends go directly to the honoree Veteran, and all the writers and artists associated with the program receive compensation.  Additional funds we raise will offset the cost of cameras, lights, greenscreen studios, editing, etc.  (Plus any additional costs for COVID health/safety.)

Each episode costs us about $6,100 to develop, film, and edit.  We found initial funding for eight episodes (approximately $49,000), through generous grants from the California Arts Council, the Helen and Jose Colton Foundation, and our own general operating budget.  We've already raised $7000 towards the five Finalists' episodes, from The Peter Glenville Foundation, and the Anonymous Fund (Marin County)...now we have less than $20,000 left to raise.  You can help us get there!

 

Stretch goals!

If you respond with more funds than we need for the finalists' episodes, we would then begin Phase Two of the project:  developing and producing a LIVE stage version of the series, to be offered in schools, veteran organizations, and commercial theatres.

We're also getting wonderful pressure to have another call for submissions, focussing in particular on veterans around the globe.  We would love to finance additional seasons of more episodes.

 

An introduction from the series creator

These are fascinating, eye-opening, sometimes frightening, sometimes comical glimpses into the world as seen from the Veterans' perspective.  Here's a word from the series creator, NMI's Executive Director, Scott Guy:

 

Testimonials from some of the Veterans and writers:

 


"NMI’s support of Veterans is truly inspiring. When I returned from Afghanistan, I was ready to make some changes in my life. Writing was my way of coping.  Writing is not only my passion. It’s also therapy. But I also like to get my work out there.  NMI understands that the experiences that Veterans go through, though often painful, have the potential to become art that not only entertains but educates. In a nation where less than one-half percent of the population has served in the military, getting this information out is vital."

Elaine Little
Veteran of Guantanamo, Bosnia, and Afghanistan

*


"This project gave me the opportunity to tell my story of three different deployments, and face the emotions that have been hidden for over a span of fifteen years. I hope my story can help open up insights into other veterans to talk about their experiences. To realize to live and not choose to die by their own hands. To choose to live life now not in the past or even the future but now. To believe in themselves, and go for their dreams. I have had a wonderful team from Scott Guy, Elise Dewsberry, Angela Parrish, Evelyn Halus, and Johnny Coppola. New Musicals Inc. is an amazing company and so very proud to be chosen to represent my fellow veterans through this project. They made it look so easy even though it was difficult to dig in memories.   That each veteran and family members have a way of grieving and dealing with emotions that are scary to really look at but we need to."

HM1 Estes Billie


*

"My story was among the first chosen for development, and it would be difficult to express exactly how much the interaction brightened up the long and lonely all-by-myself days of the pandemic.  My creative team from New Musicals, Inc., couldn’t have been any nicer or encouraging to me, nor more sensitive to keeping the authenticity of my story as we turned it into song.  Everything about working with New Musicals was so rewarding and strangely enough, something I didn’t expect:  It seemed to validate my military experience. Many veterans, especially female veterans, actually don’t believe their service is acknowledged, much less valued by society.  But no matter what job they held in the military -- from dental techs to payroll specialists to Humvee mechanics -- everyone works together to support the troops who are on the front lines to keep our country and its allies safe. Everyone who serves makes some type of difference even if it is not always apparent.

More than twenty veterans a day die from suicide, at a rate of one death every 65 minutes.  Female veterans are 250 times more likely to commit suicide than a female who has never served in the military.  I know my own struggles. And my interaction with New Musicals helped me during a rough patch.  We will probably never know whether "So Proudly We Hailed" will save any lives, but honoring veterans is a step in the right direction."

Melissa Renee Milich
Former LT, US Navy 

*

"As a writer of musical theater and as a former Army spouse, I can tell you first-hand how meaningful and important this project is. When I was an Army wife I felt very isolated and misunderstood by the civilian world. I felt like non-military people just saw me as a stereotype and an object of pity and/or derision. I noticed the service people around me were viewed in a similar, one-dimensional manner, and the media's portrayal of us felt like it mostly perpetuated these stereotypes. 

This project is doing an excellent job at dismantling that outlook, opening up the military world to an audience that is normally cut-off from it, and the narratives are diverse and complex. The episode I worked on centers around military sexual assault, the on-going "invisible" war our female service members battle in order to serve their country. It is appalling to me that this issue is still unknown to most people, and I know this episode will help to bring the awareness it needs.

Lastly, this project is giving work to musical theater writers for which I know we are all extremely grateful, especially during a pandemic. It is such a privilege not only to work but to get to work in your chosen field. It has helped to restore a sense of purpose and dignity."

Natalie Rebecca Lovejoy
composer/lyricist


Thank you.

On behalf of Veterans, and musical theatre writers, thank you for supporting this inspiring project.

story:
In Nero: Black Girls in Rome

Have you ever toyed with the idea of just tossing everything you own in storage, throwing caution to the wind, and starting over somewhere new?

In Nero: Black Girls in Rome is a fiction web series loosely based on the creator's experience of taking a huge leap of faith and moving abroad to Italy after suffering a broken heart.

I'm Tamara--said creator. I also write children's books, curate for artists, and generally do what I like and enjoy in life. It's been a long, windy road, but I believe this web series will provide an entertaining and inspiring as well as fresh perspective on the creative existence as well as the treasures that await when we just get comfortable with being uncomfortable.

I never really set out to film enough footage for a first season. But that's how the creative process works, isn't it? It's unexpected and addictive! What was supposed to be a pilot episode is now just shy of sufficient content for seven or eight short episodes. We (the crew) are just looking for funding to add a few necessary scenes to ensure the series pops the way it should and to ensure stellar post-production. Making stuff ain't cheap, ya'll, and this series was mostly self-funded and powered by favors from a host of incredibly gracious and talented people (painters, filmmakers, actors, musicians & more).

Check out the trailer for the web series here--

As the creator of Black Girls in Rome, I believe that this project is timely and necessary. I think that Black and Italian cultures, curiously enough, have something in common as far as how they're portrayed in the media--mainstream outlets rarely (if ever) get the two cultures right. I mean, from over-exaggerated accents to stereotyped roles, Black folks and Italians can't seem to catch a break when it comes to how they're shown in shows. This series provides an interesting and authentic glimpse into Italian life from an ethnic expat's perspective, and captures just a bit of the whimsy and wonder that the eternal city and its inhabitants have to offer.

The cast and crew filmed in three continents and several cities. From NYC to Rome to Morocco, this web series displays mobility and the beauty of naturally occurring cultural exchanges amongst true friends. 

Finally, to be honest, I'm not a professional actress. I decided to execute this web series to make good on a bet with myself. After losing my sister and only sibling to cancer in March of 2014, I decided that I would give myself permission to thrive. I am committed to doing all the things that pop into my mind as good ideas. I made the decision to be fearless and to do the work that I feel needs to be done. The thought of a bunch of people seeing me do something that I'd never done before with no formal training (see: write a scripted series, direct it, produce it, act in it) terrified the **** outta me...and that's precisely why I did it. My life has taught me in the last couple of years that if you just push past the fear, only treasures lie on the other side of the obstacles.

We've all got these great ideas, I believe--ideas that are persistently knocking on our imagination's door gently requesting permission to be pulled into reality through us. 

In Nero: Black Girls in Rome is one of those gentle ideas, and we're right on the cusp of having a finished product that can be shared and discussed around the globe. We're asking for some assistance in the final stretch, and thank you for considering throwing your support behind the project.

What We Need & What You Get

Check out the perks for this campaign because they really are incredible.

It's my opinion that high art is funding high art with this indiegogo project, and there's something for everyone in the perks.

We're looking to raise at least $10,000--but oh, what we could do with a bit more! With the funding, the more you have, the more you can do. So even once filming is complete or editing is all wrapped up, there's still so much work to do that requires significant financial resources. Meeting and exceeding our goal would allow us to put resources into making sure as many eyes as possible see the web series, through advertisements and other campaigns. We'd also love to submit to festivals as well as hold screenings.

So, I figure $10,000 is an attainable goal. Theoretically all we need is 100 friends to donate $100, or 200 friends to donate $50, and we're all set.

As I stated earlier in the campaign, making quality stuff isn't cheap. And once filming is a wrap, production is far from over. Scoring, color correction, laborious editing, voiceovers, submitting to festivals, looking for distributors and more are all expenses to consider.

We understand the amount we're looking to raise is significant, and we believe the perks listed warrant the amount we seek to obtain. From chiseled stone to a dress specifically designed for this project to masterpieces painted by a renowned Italian artist, we hope to have provided perks that are as unique as the In Nero: Black Girls in Rome project itself.

Check out the image gallery to view the perks. They're gorgeous.

The Impact

There's no such thing as a little bit of help with a project like this. Every single cent counts--every gesture, and every kind and motivating word means the world. Every dollar has a huge impact. I've put so much into In Nero: Black Girls in Rome and its development and so have countless other creatives who believed in the project from the very beginning. So if you find it to be a project worth your time and generosity, you're joining a family of creatives here who believe that this web series can really make a difference for viewers.

As we like to say in Texas, this isn't my first time at the rodeo. I've done a few crowd funding campaigns successfully in the past. In fact, my first children's book, The Ghanaian Goldilocks, which is award-winning, (I've published eight to date) was funded via crowd funding. You can trust that your donation is going to be used in the ways described above to assist in producing an incredible web series that you can be proud you were a part of creating.

Risks & Challenges

There's an old Italian proverb that says, "Tra dire e fare c'e di mezzo il mare." Loosely translated that means the sea lies between saying you're going to do something and actually doing it. Even though we've completed most of the filming for the series, there are still some challenges to overcome. Sticking to a strict timeline for editing can be a bit difficult. We're shooting to launch the series in the summer, so that really leaves a couple of months for the last bit of shooting and all the post production to be executed. However, I'm confident that everything can be completed in a timely manner.

Other Ways You Can Help

Like what this campaign is about? PLeAsE--Make like Bob Marley and pass it on!

Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, email, smoke signals--whatever works!

We'd love and appreciate your support.
story_txt:
In Nero: Black Girls in Rome
Have you ever toyed with the idea of just tossing everything you own in storage, throwing caution to the wind, and starting over somewhere new?
In Nero: Black Girls in Rome is a fiction web series loosely based on the creator's experience of taking a huge leap of faith and moving abroad to Italy after suffering a broken heart.
I'm Tamara--said creator. I also write children's books, curate for artists, and generally do what I like and enjoy in life. It's been a long, windy road, but I believe this web series will provide an entertaining and inspiring as well as fresh perspective on the creative existence as well as the treasures that await when we just get comfortable with being uncomfortable.
I never really set out to film enough footage for a first season. But that's how the creative process works, isn't it? It's unexpected and addictive! What was supposed to be a pilot episode is now just shy of sufficient content for seven or eight short episodes. We (the crew) are just looking for funding to add a few necessary scenes to ensure the series pops the way it should and to ensure stellar post-production. Making stuff ain't cheap, ya'll, and this series was mostly self-funded and powered by favors from a host of incredibly gracious and talented people (painters, filmmakers, actors, musicians & more).
Check out the trailer for the web series here--

As the creator of Black Girls in Rome, I believe that this project is timely and necessary. I think that Black and Italian cultures, curiously enough, have something in common as far as how they're portrayed in the media--mainstream outlets rarely (if ever) get the two cultures right. I mean, from over-exaggerated accents to stereotyped roles, Black folks and Italians can't seem to catch a break when it comes to how they're shown in shows. This series provides an interesting and authentic glimpse into Italian life from an ethnic expat's perspective, and captures just a bit of the whimsy and wonder that the eternal city and its inhabitants have to offer.
The cast and crew filmed in three continents and several cities. From NYC to Rome to Morocco, this web series displays mobility and the beauty of naturally occurring cultural exchanges amongst true friends. 
Finally, to be honest, I'm not a professional actress. I decided to execute this web series to make good on a bet with myself. After losing my sister and only sibling to cancer in March of 2014, I decided that I would give myself permission to thrive. I am committed to doing all the things that pop into my mind as good ideas. I made the decision to be fearless and to do the work that I feel needs to be done. The thought of a bunch of people seeing me do something that I'd never done before with no formal training (see: write a scripted series, direct it, produce it, act in it) terrified the **** outta me...and that's precisely why I did it. My life has taught me in the last couple of years that if you just push past the fear, only treasures lie on the other side of the obstacles.
We've all got these great ideas, I believe--ideas that are persistently knocking on our imagination's door gently requesting permission to be pulled into reality through us. 
In Nero: Black Girls in Rome is one of those gentle ideas, and we're right on the cusp of having a finished product that can be shared and discussed around the globe. We're asking for some assistance in the final stretch, and thank you for considering throwing your support behind the project.

What We Need & What You Get
Check out the perks for this campaign because they really are incredible.
It's my opinion that high art is funding high art with this indiegogo project, and there's something for everyone in the perks.
We're looking to raise at least $10,000--but oh, what we could do with a bit more! With the funding, the more you have, the more you can do. So even once filming is complete or editing is all wrapped up, there's still so much work to do that requires significant financial resources. Meeting and exceeding our goal would allow us to put resources into making sure as many eyes as possible see the web series, through advertisements and other campaigns. We'd also love to submit to festivals as well as hold screenings.
So, I figure $10,000 is an attainable goal. Theoretically all we need is 100 friends to donate $100, or 200 friends to donate $50, and we're all set.
As I stated earlier in the campaign, making quality stuff isn't cheap. And once filming is a wrap, production is far from over. Scoring, color correction, laborious editing, voiceovers, submitting to festivals, looking for distributors and more are all expenses to consider.
We understand the amount we're looking to raise is significant, and we believe the perks listed warrant the amount we seek to obtain. From chiseled stone to a dress specifically designed for this project to masterpieces painted by a renowned Italian artist, we hope to have provided perks that are as unique as the In Nero: Black Girls in Rome project itself.
Check out the image gallery to view the perks. They're gorgeous.
The Impact

There's no such thing as a little bit of help with a project like this. Every single cent counts--every gesture, and every kind and motivating word means the world. Every dollar has a huge impact. I've put so much into In Nero: Black Girls in Rome and its development and so have countless other creatives who believed in the project from the very beginning. So if you find it to be a project worth your time and generosity, you're joining a family of creatives here who believe that this web series can really make a difference for viewers.
As we like to say in Texas, this isn't my first time at the rodeo. I've done a few crowd funding campaigns successfully in the past. In fact, my first children's book, The Ghanaian Goldilocks, which is award-winning, (I've published eight to date) was funded via crowd funding. You can trust that your donation is going to be used in the ways described above to assist in producing an incredible web series that you can be proud you were a part of creating.

Risks & Challenges
There's an old Italian proverb that says, "Tra dire e fare c'e di mezzo il mare." Loosely translated that means the sea lies between saying you're going to do something and actually doing it. Even though we've completed most of the filming for the series, there are still some challenges to overcome. Sticking to a strict timeline for editing can be a bit difficult. We're shooting to launch the series in the summer, so that really leaves a couple of months for the last bit of shooting and all the post production to be executed. However, I'm confident that everything can be completed in a timely manner.

Other Ways You Can Help
Like what this campaign is about? PLeAsE--Make like Bob Marley and pass it on!
Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, email, smoke signals--whatever works!
We'd love and appreciate your support.

story:
In a span of a few minutes, our online restaurant video news network will deliver cutting-edge topics and critical thinking on improving the restaurant experience and improving financial performance. Tune in to our first show on Mobile point of sale! And come back for more—this is just the start of Season One! Support our Phase I crowdfunding campaign.  What’s in store for restaurants as technology, competition, Millennials and Generation Z usher in change? What’s possible? We'll follow up the first show with shows on digital-casual and virtual restaurants, IoRT, new social media tools, modern restaurant design, operational best practices and culinary innovation.

DC-area restaurateurs will gain the tools to help them succeed and stand out from the pack through the Eatery Pulse News network.

Catch us on YouTube, social media and on our soon-to-be-launched content platform. We are also asking you to help us select the most engaging trade news anchors who will deliver your trade news by voting in our competition currently on YouTube.

Get exclusive commemorative items when you help us build this network

The Phase I campaign funds will fuel Season One pre-production and production and help hire experts to plan our first live educational event in the Washington, DC market:

  • The expenses include finding and hiring the right cast to host the show, as well as additional production expenses-including video, audio, lighting, make-up and editing/graphics
  • The technology platform is crucial because it will help us build the entry point where viewers, readers and advertisers will arrive. We need to build a portal that works not only for our customers, but also for our sponsors, giving them access to and the chance to become a partner of our productions and publications

Contributors can gain special access to the show and obtain special mementos of the launch shortly after participating, through our perks program and schedule. Be a part of the team that will create this special network for the restaurant industry in Metro DC

Bolstering the restaurateur toolkit in an age of disruption and constant change

Eatery Pulse News will present a thoughtful and hearty/forceful dissemination of current trends and consumer behaviors. We’re creating a new, unique, focused and all-digital source of trade news, insights and best practices for the local restaurant industry. While DC is receiving accolades for its exciting restaurant scene,  restaurant owners, operators and executives still face many challenges.

There are increasing economic pressures to the financial models of restaurants, including rising labor, regulatory, food/beverage and real estate costs. An onslaught of marketing and technology tools are making the promotion of restaurants and the engagement of its customers more complex, but potentially more rewarding.

We will sift through all of noise to get to the meat of the solutions and associated best practices! Live events will do more to give hard-working restaurateurs a chance to experience information and insights in a more direct and interactive fashion.

Challenges: We're in it for the long run

This is not a project without risk and rewards:

  • Zambrano's experiences in finance, business systems support, research, small-business consulting and publishing make him the ideal person to give this project momentum and make it successful
  • The many challenges to trade media, include a lack of energy, momentum, entertainment value and operating in an environment of declining advertising support. We feel we have the ideal formula to push past these challenges and succeed. Our industry deserves it
  • All the while, we will do thorough out-reach to industry purveyors, distributors, technology vendors and suppliers to turn this into a media company with a profitable economic model!

Be a Rock Star and help us share!

You can help us spread the word by sharing on social media, restaurant industry channels and using the IndieGoGo share tools!

story:
Oh yeah, and there’s also some other stuff about LSD, dick pics and a homeless guy named Whistlin’ Jimmy.

Aussie Gen Y'ers and Millennial's are both generations of Young Adults raised on American adult animated comedies, there's not a single one among us that couldn't riff a Simpsons quote – "DENTAL PLAN!" We believe Australian adult animation is grossly underrepresented on both TV and Online. This is something we want to change, and with your help we'll give it a red hot go!

 

Schooled! is an Australian adult animated comedy project by Ryan Clayton, Jess Wheeler and Tim O'Shea, that aims to independently fund and produce a 7 minute pilot, with the help of collaborators from Indiegogo. And, like most great adult animated series, it’s a bit fucked up. We love Rick & Morty. We love Archer. We love Bojack Horseman. But we want to bring some Australian flavour to the Adult Swim-esque world of balls-to-the-wall animated shows. We're a trio of advertising creatives from Melbourne (please don't hold that against us). We'll be teaming up with some super talented industry professionals to help make this project a reality. But we're still missing our most important collaborator to date, and we're hoping that could be YOU!

Meet the residents of Bonner House at F.U.C.T. Get to know Ray, Benny, Kush, Fibba, Bucklow, Dale, Selby, Lana, Lexi, Tommi, Mildred & Blinks, The Judgey-Roos and Poss over on our dedicated website.

 

 

Subscribe to our Facebook, Instagram and YouTube channel
to stay updated with our progress.

 

Share this Indiegogo page or our with your rich friends
who have a history of making really bad investments.

 

Back the show (above) on Indiegogo and claim those sweet-sweet
prizes and rewards to help us end the drought!

 

We'll give you a shout out for supporting 'Schooled! on our Facebook page, every little bit helps. Cheers!

Who said an education had to be expensive?  Receive a personalised Digital Degree from F.U.C.T. Don't forget to remind us what degree you studied – the more creative the better! 

Keep your tinnies cool at your next 'Study' session with a 'Schooled' stubby holder + digital rewards!
Please include $5 for postage in Aus ($12 worldwide).

We'll send you a banging full colour A2 'Schooled!' poster + digital rewards!
Please include $5 for postage in Aus ($12 worldwide).

Get decked out in a 'Schooled!' AS Colour T-shirt + digital rewards + exclusive preview link!
Please include $10 for postage in AUS ($17 worldwide).

We'll officially credit you as a Financier on IMDB + digital rewards+ exclusive preview link + T's get degrees!
Please include $10 for postage in AUS ($17 worldwide).

Carry on like a pork chop and be the voice of a featured extra in the Beer Pong Championship scene + all previous rewards.
Please include $10 for postage in Aus ($17 worldwide). Excludes travel costs. Must be available in Melbourne for voice recording session, date TBA. We'll give you plenty of notice.

 

We'll create a character in your likeness and feature them in the pilot + send you your printed A4 character profile + all previous rewards (except 'You're the Voice').
Please include $10 for postage in Aus ($17 worldwide). Excludes travel costs. Please provide at least 2 mugshots.

 

Help us make casting decisions, review changes, stay looped in and generally become a pain in our ass + all previous rewards (except 'You're the Voice' & 'You're a Character').
Please include $10 for postage in Aus ($17 worldwide). Excludes travel costs. We reserve creative control, but we'll humour you.

  

 

Here's the thing. Animation is expensive, which is probably the reason you don't see much of it in Australia. We plan to keep the entire production in Australia, so the bottom line is the majority of the funds will be channeled into illustration and animation production costs. And Animators and Illustrators do not qualify for the Governments new $4/hr ‘internship’ scheme. We do this for fun, but our partners do this for a living so we need to pay them. See the graph below for a top-line budget breakdown.

 

Because we've opted for flexible funding, regardless of how much funding we receive, we'll still be distributing it in the same way, it just means a higher quality production for each division.

 

Thanks for lending us your eyes and ears! We hope our pitch has excited you as much as it excites us and has inspired you to open your heart... but mostly your wallet. If it is the later, thank you in advance from the bottom of our ass... is that the saying?! You're a bloody legend!

 

Q:  Don't you actually have to be funny to create a sitcom?

A:  Well, we haven't seen this explicitly stated in any of the rule books yet, so we're just going to keep pretending until we get busted. Shhhhhh!!!

Q:  If Alex Williamson, Nick Boshier and David Quirk say no, can I audition for a role?

A:  Let's be honest, they're probably all going to say no, so... we'll pretty much take anything we can get. That and the fact there's heaps of other roles to fill. If you fancy yourself as a bit of a voice talent pick a character(s), and send your audition to us here. 

Q:  When do I receive my Prizes & Rewards?

A:  Hold your bloody horses. We've listed the Estimated Delivery date for each perk in the item description, but just so you know they won't be ordered until the campaign is completed so we can minimise wastage. Also, sometimes delays in production happen, but we'll notify you if this is the case.

Q: Can I upgrade to another Perk?

A: Unfortunately not through Indiegogo if you've already contributed, but we recommend simply donating the difference and contacting Ryan Clayton directly. He loves a sneaky DM.

Q: What if I forgot to add postage to my order?

A: It should be added automatically at checkout. If not, similar to the procedure for Perk upgrades, organise a separate payment with Ryan Clayton directly so we can actually ship you your order.

Q:  Why can I only use PayPal to make my contribution?

A:  This is an Indiegogo thing, but it's basically to do with ease of handling Aussie dollars. You can read more about it here. It's no biggie though, you can still use your credit card to pay without creating an account. If our Mum's can do it, so can you. Just follow the prompts at checkout.

Q:  Can I claim my contribution back on tax?

A:  That all depends how 'creative' your accountant is. The short answer is no. Because we're not a charity and we're offering goods in exchange for your contribution, we don't qualify to issue tax deductible gift receipts. But consider how great it will feel knowing you've helped bring an original Aussie adult animation to life, better than any tax return we've had.

Q:  What are you guys going to do with all this money?

A:  Strippers and cocaine mostly. For whatever is left, see our Production Budget Breakdown on the main page. Regardless of how much funding we receive, we'll still be distributing it in the same way, it just means a higher quality production for each division and we can extend the length of our bender.

Q:  So is this money to produce the entire series?

A:  We wish it was that cheap to create an entire series. This amount is to fund a 7 minute pilot which we will make available to everyone (eventually) on YouTube and Facebook and then pitch it to production companies.

Q:  Why don't you just apply for a Government film grant or something?

A:  Do you really think the Government would trust Tim with money? We actually would have, but because we've only got ads under our belts, we don't qualify. You have to already be credited on a film or short. The irony is we make films and shorts for a living... just in an advertisingy-30-seconds-at-a-time-type-cram-the-product-in sort of way. 

Q:  Why could you afford a slick crowdfunding video but not a measly 7 minute animation?

A:  Are we on trial here or what? Jeez. When you have generous friends who happen to be directors, cinematographers, producers, editors, writers and art directors who love an idea, amazing things can happen... and if you weepily beg them, they pity you and then are forced to work for free. Most of us are doing this for fun, but the craftspeople who will be physically creating the show do this for a living. They have to pay for equipment, staff and studio hire. And that ain't cheap.

Q:  Why don't you just pay for it yourself?

A:  Righto money bags! Settle down. Some of us still have HECS debts and enjoy the odd smashed avocado latte every now and then. The fact is we are all paying for it in one way or another. Some are contributing large sums of cold hard cash. Some are donating many hours of their time and expertise. But we're still a few goon sacks short of a punch party, and what better way to build an engaged audience in the process than through a crowdfunding campaign.

Q:  If I pay to have a character created in my likeness will they appear in the pilot?

A:  Yep. Sure will. There is a big Beer Pong Championship party scene which your character will appear in. We promise not to kill you off for at least 2, maybe even 3 episodes.

Q:  Do you really have a Cayman Islands account? Is that where my money is going?

A:  Well, not under the aliases we used in the video. We're not stupid. Where possible all dollars raised will stay on Australian shores to go towards production of the Animation and sorting out those sweet-sweet prizes & incentives. 

Q:  Did you draw the characters yourself?

A:  We wish. That's the handy work of the uber talented illustrator Simon Childerhouse and in the case of the storyboards, Sacha Bryning. We need funding to unleash these two further to bring this thing to life with the help of our Animation Director Cameron Gough.

Q:  Can Ryan please create a finger painting for me?

A:  Ryan will probably do anything for contributions. Well, not anything... let's keep it to fingerprinting until things get desperate. Hit us up on Facebook if you have a special request and we'll put him to work. 

Q:  Can I ask another question not listed here?

A:  Yeah mate. Just hit us up on our email here or access our media kit here.

Q:  Don't you actually have to be funny to create a sitcom?
A:  Well, we haven't seen this explicitly stated in any of the rule books yet, so we're just going to keep pretending until we get busted. Shhhhhh!!!
Q:  If Alex Williamson, Nick Boshier and David Quirk say no, can I audition for a role?
A:  Let's be honest, they're probably all going to say no, so... we'll pretty much take anything we can get. That and the fact there's heaps of other roles to fill. If you fancy yourself as a bit of a voice talent pick a character(s), and send your audition to us here. 
Q:  When do I receive my Prizes & Rewards?
A:  Hold your bloody horses. We've listed the Estimated Delivery date for each perk in the item description, but just so you know they won't be ordered until the campaign is completed so we can minimise wastage. Also, sometimes delays in production happen, but we'll notify you if this is the case.
Q: Can I upgrade to another Perk?
A: Unfortunately not through Indiegogo if you've already contributed, but we recommend simply donating the difference and contacting Ryan Clayton directly. He loves a sneaky DM.
Q: What if I forgot to add postage to my order?
A: It should be added automatically at checkout. If not, similar to the procedure for Perk upgrades, organise a separate payment with Ryan Clayton directly so we can actually ship you your order.
Q:  Why can I only use PayPal to make my contribution?
A:  This is an Indiegogo thing, but it's basically to do with ease of handling Aussie dollars. You can read more about it here. It's no biggie though, you can still use your credit card to pay without creating an account. If our Mum's can do it, so can you. Just follow the prompts at checkout.
Q:  Can I claim my contribution back on tax?
A:  That all depends how 'creative' your accountant is. The short answer is no. Because we're not a charity and we're offering goods in exchange for your contribution, we don't qualify to issue tax deductible gift receipts. But consider how great it will feel knowing you've helped bring an original Aussie adult animation to life, better than any tax return we've had.
Q:  What are you guys going to do with all this money?
A:  Strippers and cocaine mostly. For whatever is left, see our Production Budget Breakdown on the main page. Regardless of how much  funding we receive, we'll still be distributing it in the same way, it just means a higher quality production for each division and we can extend the length of our bender.
Q:  So is this money to produce the entire series?
A:  We wish it was that cheap to create an entire series. This amount is to fund a 7 minute pilot which we will make available to everyone (eventually) on YouTube and Facebook and then pitch it to production companies.
Q:  Why don't you just apply for a Government film grant or something?
A:  Do you really think the Government would trust Tim with money? We actually would have, but because we've only got ads under our belts, we don't qualify. You have to already be credited on a film or short. The irony is we make films and shorts for a living... just in an advertisingy-30-seconds-at-a-time-type-cram-the-product-in sort of way. 
Q:  Why could you afford a slick crowdfunding video but not a measly 7 minute animation?
A:  Are we on trial here or what? Jeez. When you have generous friends who happen to be directors, cinematographers, producers, editors, writers and art directors who love an idea, amazing things can happen... and if you weepily beg them, they pity you and then are forced to work for free. Most of us are doing this for fun, but the craftspeople who will be physically creating the show do this for a living. They have to pay for equipment, staff and studio hire. And that ain't cheap.
Q:  Why don't you just pay for it yourself?
A:  Righto money bags! Settle down. Some of us still have HECS debts and enjoy the odd smashed avocado latte every now and then. The fact is we are all paying for it in one way or another. Some are contributing large sums of cold hard cash. Some are donating many hours of their time and expertise. But we're still a few goon sacks short of a punch party, and what better way to build an engaged audience in the process than through a crowdfunding campaign.
Q:  If I pay to have a character created in my likeness will they appear in the pilot?
A:  Yep. Sure will. There is a big Beer Pong Championship party scene which your character will appear in. We promise not to kill you off for at least 2, maybe even 3 episodes.
Q:  Do you really have a Cayman Islands account? Is that where my money is going?
A:  Well, not under the aliases we used in the video. We're not stupid. Where possible all dollars raised will stay on Australian shores to go towards production of the Animation and sorting out those sweet-sweet prizes & incentives. 

Q:  Did you draw the characters yourself?
A:  We wish. That's the handy work of the uber talented illustrator Simon Childerhouse and in the case of the storyboards, Sacha Bryning. We need funding to unleash these two further to bring this thing to life with the help of our Animation Director Cameron Gough.
Q:  Can Ryan please create a finger painting for me?
A:  Ryan will probably do anything for contributions. Well, not anything... let's keep it to fingerprinting until things get desperate. Hit us up on Facebook if you have a special request and we'll put him to work. 
Q:  Can I ask another question not listed here?
A:  Yeah mate. Just hit us up on our email here or access our media kit here.

story:
The Charity Shop

As this is will be our last production we ever make at westminster we would like to go out with a bang. We've spent time writing a great script that we're all extremely proud of and are working hard in order to do it justice. It's a great idea, a great concept and really showcases who we've become throughout our three year degree. Together we have made a number of productions but none like this. With your help we are guaranteed to make this dream a reality. Any donation is a step towards achieving our goal so if you can and if you believe in us as much as we believe in ourselves then please help us get there. Please help us make this production look as authentic and professional as it possibly can.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise £500 to cover the cost of our actors and extras travel, printing, refreshments for cast and supporting cast, costumes, props and set design.
Depending on the amount you donate, contributors will receive a credited thanks at the end of our programme, a 'The Charity Shop' poster signed by the writers and cast, exclusive behind the scenes digital images, a 'The Charity Shop' T-Shirt or a ' The Charity Shop' Thank You card signed by the crew and producers.


What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

If we do not reach our entire goal. All funds will go towards as much as we can cover. We will prioritise actors expenses, set design and contributors rewards.

We have made a number of projects over the course of our three year degree including documentaries, adverts and multi-camera shows. All of which can be viewed on our universities vimeo page. Please search for University of Westminster on vimeo if you would like to see what we have created so far. Our course is also known for winning a number of awards at events such as the Royal Television Society Student Awards.

Risks & Challenges

We are really hoping to reach our entire goal. However, it is well known that many do not have a lot of faith in student projects and because of this students can sometimes struggle to create a professional piece of work. 
We have anticipated this and there for are only raising as much money as we need in order to make our show a success. Just because we are students doesn't mean that we are less capable of creating something great and worth backing. We are talented and hard working and work just as hard as people in the industry. Sometimes even harder as we have less resources and less access. Our actors that we have auditioned so far are fantastic and will really help to drive this production.
And hopefully by paying for their expenses and food will be an incentive for them to continue this journey with us.
As a precaution we have tried to fundraise within the university through bake sales. However, this only raised enough money to cover the cost of paint and wallpaper.

What If I Can't Contribute?

If you just can't contribute financial. Don't worry there's still a way to help us.
Share our campaign with friends and family and help us get the word out!

Also follow our Facebook and Instagram pages and get people to like and share them. 
Facebook: @TheCharityShopW
Instagram: @charityshopwmin

And don't forget to use the indigogo share tools!

Thank You All!

story:
About the Comedy Series

Randy Fisher came from the mid-west, hoping to find success in the entertainment industry. After being manipulated, and taken advantage of, Randy decides to become the one in control. Using his charm, and limited acting skills, Randy becomes the world's first honest con man. However, he makes the difficult decision, that, during his cons, he will never lie.

Please watch the "No Refunds" short. If you enjoy it...support the project!

 

We are an enthusiastic group of actor/writer/film makers who love the process of making moving pictures.

 

Andrei Mirzoyan - Andrei began as a software engineer, and holds a degree in Applied Mathematics. After getting involved with acting, Andrei decided to make, and share stories with the world. He built the camera system, wrote the camera software, and now has the ability to shoot cinema quality movies. 

 

Rich Volkening - Aside from acting, Rich has been a singer in multiple bands, has written and released solo music, and was a recording engineer/studio owner. Rich is also a screenwriter and a stand-up comedian.

Kevin Akopian - Kevin is a talented engineer and cinematographer; who has worked on several projects, including the short films "No Refunds" and "id." 

Amy Ellis - Actress, writer.  Amy describes herself as, "An underdog actress from a little desert town in California; ready to share her stories, experiences and horrible sense of humor with the world."

Mic-I HyLu - is an actor and spoken word artist of Ethiopian descent. He's played various American and foreign characters on camera and stage; ranging from the lovable guy next door who brings warmth and the human element to the cautionary tale of Artificial Intelligence in the sci-fi film "Distrakt" by Vidya Mahendran to the fast talking, neurotic paparazzo in the film "I Am a Whale" by Prateek Gupta. His stage repertoire includes the suave all-American Duke in John Patrick Shanley's, "Women Of Manhattan" at The Larry Moss Theatre to the bohemian, helpless romantic of a Jazz Pianist, Sonny in the stage adaptation of James Baldwin's " Sonny's Blues" at the Acting Corps Black Box Theatre.

What We Need

We need money to shoot the first installment of the series. If we raise enough, we will shoot multiple episodes. We have all the cinema equipment, but we need to hire technical crew, pay for the insurance, licenses, rent. This is where you come in...

Risks & Challenges

The shooting will be conducted locally with our own equipment. The first episode will not involve any stunts, explosions, fighting, etc. Therefore, we don't see any risks. The challenge is to make you laugh out loud.

Other Ways to Help

People often underestimate the power, and value, of simply sharing on Facebook. It costs thousands of dollars to promote a campaign on Google, Facebook, etc. In short, if you decide not to contribute money, share this campaign on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter or Google+. Tell your friends and family!

story:
Welcome, thank you for visiting us!​

We are glad to be sharing our campaign with you.   So let's get straight into the potatoes of what we're doing here.   As you might suspect by now.. we are making an animated cartoon series and we want to bring you along for the ride.  We are putting our efforts together to create the first episode (pilot episode).  We will use this along with concept art, story descriptions, and the campaign results to pitch to networks in hopes to create a full season for TV or Web.  We believe in this project and hope to have you on board too!

 

'Best Friends! With Fuzzy & Kazoo'

This is the story of 2 furry best friends who live on a Sanctuary Farm.  Where they spend their days making new friends and going on fantastic adventures.  They can go wherever their imagination takes them.  Through their encounters on the Farm they meet creatures in need of a new home who come from all walks of life, but there is one reoccurring trait we see.  Compassion, understanding, and a respect for everyone even if they are different or unfamiliar.  

 

What we have so far..

Story bible. check.   
Pilot episode script. check  
Strange voices. check
Weird, lovable, and hilarious characters. check check check.

Speaking of strange voices.  
Here are some voice samples from the characters in our project. Enjoy a listen...

 

What we need...

It’s quite simple.  We are seeking Funding and an Audience.  We would be so grateful for any monetary support you can offer in our project and campaign.  If you would like to go far and beyond we would be happy if you would share our project and link with your family, friends and extended contacts.  Want to donate just $1, or any amount,  you can click 'Back It' and enter any number. 

How will the funds be used?...

 

All money raised will go directly into production of our cartoon series as well as the campaign necessities outlined above.  This will allow us to hire the necessary artists and animators to create the cartoon series.  Donation to charities (explained below)... Plus studio space and other important production requirements, like coffee.  Lots and lots of coffee.  

Well, that didn't seem so complicated. Are you ready to open your hearts and wallets to our lofty project? Yes? Maybe? Hmmm...  should i tell you a bit more about the other aspects of the campaign first? 

 

Help us so we can help others.

Seems simple, but how does that work?  End of the day we want to create a kids cartoon series that takes us into a world all it's own.  With characters, imagination, adventures, and most importantly life lessons.  But, we realize we have a chance to do something bigger than put our creative ideas in stone.  At the end of the campaign we will donate 10% of all funds to various charities including but not limited to.. sanctuary farms, animal rescues, wildlife rehabilitation centers.   We will be transparent in this announcement post campaign and we think it will be a great opportunity to bring even more awareness to these facilities and their causes. 

How will you decide on what each charity gets?

We ask that You the donor state which charity group you'd like to sponsor. Simply write a comment after you support our campaign and which charity you choose.  If you can provide their social media link and/or government issued EIN # this would be appreciated.   If you can't decide or prefer, we can help direct your donation to various charities.  If you have a charity close to your heart that's outside of furry creatures, please do.  Kindness is kindness any way you give it.  

Need to find a charity's EIN#? Check here on the IRS site... https://apps.irs.gov/app/eos/mainSearch.do;jsessionid=ZmL8lbddQW3ReXs01LZdeMaTRomdZl0BvtukP446.-?mainSearchChoice=pub78&dispatchMethod=selectSearch

 

Why don't I just donate directly to the charity to give them 100% of my gift?

This is a great point, and we would be happy to see you donate directly to any charity that helps those who are less fortunate or in need.  Our thought process is this.. To facilitate real change you have to change the CULTURE of society as a whole.  To share and enable a mind to what is possible, especially at a young age, can be the change that can do this.

For example: Your x-donation to y-charity may help temporarily, but changing the perspective of a young mind, and possibly an entire generation, through a collective creative effort can be a positive change for  a lifetime.  In addition bringing the conversation, whether online or in person, to the table about xyz-charity can expand the efforts and awareness of everyone connected around you.  So 10% may seem like a modest piece of the pie, but we're looking at the big picture.

 

To the good stuff!

For EVERYONE  who generously donated any amount...
Join us to view the finished Pilot Episode through a private link in early 2018!  

For Starters... we have a lot of cool swag, as the kids say, for rewards.  Including pins, stickers, keychains, t-shirt’s, mugs, postcards and lots more to come!  If you get a 'Surprise Gift Bag' in your Level you might end up with just about anything (or everything!) ... we know you'll love the swag either way..

Even Better.. We have many great production rewards.  Copies of the original pilot script, autographed art work from the creator, exclusive behind the scenes videos, and personalized voice memos from Fuzzy & Kazoo. These are just to name a few.

The WOW stuff... join in on a live google video chat, ask the creator questions about the story, production, or anything Best Friends! related.   Want to be invited to the early release, plus a meet and greet in person?  Join us for our live screening in nyc.  Want to help create a character for the show?  We're all ears.  These are just some of the super duper rewards for being a part of our project from day 1. 

In Addition... We also have more rewards in the works that will be announced later in the campaign.  They will be free additions or possible upgrades.  We haven't decided yet.  It's just so hard to keep things a secret!  Also look out for future SUPER rewards for our biggest SUPER-DUPER supporters and fans!

Creating positive change through the arts.

We understand the influence and power of visual arts.  We remember the tv shows, films, and childhood pop culture that shaped our youth minds.  Sure it may not define who you are today, but it most likely is a big part of your earliest memories. With this in mind, help us create a cartoon series that not only entertains, but brings fundamental values to the message of every episode.  Who said compassion, empathy, and acceptance can't be part of popular culture?  Whether your best friend is human or animal (or somewhere in-between), everyone could use a Fuzzy to their Kazoo. 

What happens to the funds if our goal isn't met?

This is a reality that we hope to avoid, but as with all creative fundraising, it's difficult to gauge the interest until the campaign has launched.  In the instance we do not meet our production funding goals, we can still move forward.  As planned, we will pitch the concept to potential networks.  If we are close, we will use our own funds to finish the pilot episode.  If it is a stretch and we fall flat in our fundraising we will do our best to create short scenes to show what our series is about.  Quality over quantity.  Every dollar counts and helps even if our goal isn't met. 

What if we exceed our fundraising goal?

Excellent!  We would be so ecstatic.  10% will still go to charity donation. While the remainder will go to future expenses of expanding our Best Friends! universe. Hiring additional writers, artists, voice over talent and animators to develop more episodes.  When the time comes Stretch Goals will be added.  We would love to independently create and release our own series.  This is what we DREAM of! 

When does production begin on this project?

As you are reading this the wheels of production are already in motion.  Pre-production is in full swing with final script edits and storyboarding already being laid out.  By the time this launch campaign concludes we will be set 'creatively' for 2d Animation Production to being.  Raising the necessary funds will help us secure the creative talent and other production logistics needed to continue this process.  Shortly after this we can begin full Production.  We are happy to give updates on this process as we reach our goals.

When will this project finish?

We have an external finish date of mid April 2018 for our pilot episode to be wrapped and ready to gift to you all.  Although, to be very transparent, we hope to finish much earlier than this given time frame.  As with all creative deadlines, we hope for the best and plan for the worst.  Mid April is our 'worst'.

 

Please & Thank you!

We would like to take a moment to **THANK YOU!!**  for taking the time to explore our project and campaign.  If you're interested but unable to donate you can still help.  Please share our story and link with your friends, family, or any relevant media outlet or charity.  For this we are so grateful.  We look forward to sharing our pilot episode with everyone who participates.

If you have any thoughts, suggestions or just want to be Best Friends! we are happy to hear from you! Please reach out to us and join us on the following social media platforms.  Include the following hashtag to keep us all connected in this grand effort... #fuzzyandkazoo

http://Instagram.com/fuzzyandkazoo

http://Twitter.com/fuzzyandkazoo

http://facebook.com/fuzzyandkazoo

 

A special Thank You..

to Safe Haven Farm Sanctuary for hosting us for our campaign launch video.  We greatly enjoyed meeting you and your animal family.  Duncan is a Star among stars! Please visit our new friends and say hello... 
Instagram: @safehavenfarmsanctuary
Facebook: @safehavenfarmsanctuary
 

------------

You're as good as the people your surround yourself with, so a big THANK YOU!  to James Meyer, Rafael Villar, & Tucker Klien for your creative input, thoughts, and advice through the creation of this project and campaign.  

Let the adventures begin!​

 

 

To see the past creative and professional work from the creator
of 'Best Friends! with Fuzzy & Kazoo'  visit...  http://retrorerun.com

© 2017 Josh Delaney. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

Why don't I just donate directly to the charity to give them 100% of my gift?
This is a great point, and we would be happy to see you donate directly to any charity that helps those who are less fortunate or in need.  Our thought process is this.. To facilitate real change you have to change the CULTURE of society as a whole.  To share and enable a mind to what is possible, especially at a young age, can be the change that can do this.
For example: Your x-donation to y-charity may help temporarily, but changing the perspective of a young mind, and possibly an entire generation, through a collective creative effort can be a positive change for  a lifetime.  In addition bringing the conversation, whether online or in person, to the table about xyz-charity can expand the efforts and awareness of everyone connected around you.  So 10% may seem like a modest piece of the pie, but we're looking at the big picture.
 
To the good stuff!
For EVERYONE  who generously donated any amount...Join us to view the finished Pilot Episode through a private link in early 2018!  
For Starters... we have a lot of cool swag, as the kids say, for rewards.  Including pins, stickers, keychains, t-shirt’s, mugs, postcards and lots more to come!  If you get a 'Surprise Gift Bag' in your Level you might end up with just about anything (or everything!) ... we know you'll love the swag either way..

Even Better.. We have many great production rewards.  Copies of the original pilot script, autographed art work from the creator, exclusive behind the scenes videos, and personalized voice memos from Fuzzy & Kazoo. These are just to name a few.
The WOW stuff... join in on a live google video chat, ask the creator questions about the story, production, or anything Best Friends! related.   Want to be invited to the early release, plus a meet and greet in person?  Join us for our live screening in nyc.  Want to help create a character for the show?  We're all ears.  These are just some of the super duper rewards for being a part of our project from day 1. 
In Addition... We also have more rewards in the works that will be announced later in the campaign.  They will be free additions or possible upgrades.  We haven't decided yet.  It's just so hard to keep things a secret!  Also look out for future SUPER rewards for our biggest SUPER-DUPER supporters and fans!


Creating positive change through the arts.
We understand the influence and power of visual arts.  We remember the tv shows, films, and childhood pop culture that shaped our youth minds.  Sure it may not define who you are today, but it most likely is a big part of your earliest memories. With this in mind, help us create a cartoon series that not only entertains, but brings fundamental values to the message of every episode.  Who said compassion, empathy, and acceptance can't be part of popular culture?  Whether your best friend is human or animal (or somewhere in-between), everyone could use a Fuzzy to their Kazoo. 

What happens to the funds if our goal isn't met?

This is a reality that we hope to avoid, but as with all creative fundraising, it's difficult to gauge the interest until the campaign has launched.  In the instance we do not meet our production funding goals, we can still move forward.  As planned, we will pitch the concept to potential networks.  If we are close, we will use our own funds to finish the pilot episode.  If it is a stretch and we fall flat in our fundraising we will do our best to create short scenes to show what our series is about.  Quality over quantity.  Every dollar counts and helps even if our goal isn't met. 
What if we exceed our fundraising goal?
Excellent!  We would be so ecstatic.  10% will still go to charity donation. While the remainder will go to future expenses of expanding our Best Friends! universe. Hiring additional writers, artists, voice over talent and animators to develop more episodes.  When the time comes Stretch Goals will be added.  We would love to independently create and release our own series.  This is what we DREAM of! 
When does production begin on this project?
As you are reading this the wheels of production are already in motion.  Pre-production is in full swing with final script edits and storyboarding already being laid out.  By the time this launch campaign concludes we will be set 'creatively' for 2d Animation Production to being.  Raising the necessary funds will help us secure the creative talent and other production logistics needed to continue this process.  Shortly after this we can begin full Production.  We are happy to give updates on this process as we reach our goals.
When will this project finish?
We have an external finish date of mid April 2018 for our pilot episode to be wrapped and ready to gift to you all.  Although, to be very transparent, we hope to finish much earlier than this given time frame.  As with all creative deadlines, we hope for the best and plan for the worst.  Mid April is our 'worst'.
 

Please & Thank you!
We would like to take a moment to **THANK YOU!!**  for taking the time to explore our project and campaign.  If you're interested but unable to donate you can still help.  Please share our story and link with your friends, family, or any relevant media outlet or charity.  For this we are so grateful.  We look forward to sharing our pilot episode with everyone who participates.
If you have any thoughts, suggestions or just want to be Best Friends! we are happy to hear from you! Please reach out to us and join us on the following social media platforms.  Include the following hashtag to keep us all connected in this grand effort... #fuzzyandkazoo
http://Instagram.com/fuzzyandkazoo
http://Twitter.com/fuzzyandkazoo
http://facebook.com/fuzzyandkazoo
 
A special Thank You..
to Safe Haven Farm Sanctuary for hosting us for our campaign launch video.  We greatly enjoyed meeting you and your animal family.  Duncan is a Star among stars! Please visit our new friends and say hello... Instagram: @safehavenfarmsanctuaryFacebook: @safehavenfarmsanctuary 
------------
You're as good as the people your surround yourself with, so a big THANK YOU!  to James Meyer, Rafael Villar, & Tucker Klien for your creative input, thoughts, and advice through the creation of this project and campaign.  

Let the adventures begin!​
 

 
To see the past creative and professional work from the creatorof 'Best Friends! with Fuzzy & Kazoo'  visit...  http://retrorerun.com
© 2017 Josh Delaney. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

story:
Who We Are:

Little Engine Pictures is a great company and team who is passionate about showcasing issues that affect young adults today by creating content that brings the real-life scenarios into a fantasy world. Little Engine Pictures want to show that the issues that make people feel like outcasts are actually shared by plenty of people, and is more the norm than some may originally assume. We hope to create this new norm through its breakout hit ‘The Annex’. We plan to make the topics that are considered taboo in mainstream television into every episode and cover topics of mental health, sexuality, gender identity, race and diversity.

An extremely important aspect of television to us is representation. As content creators, we see the stereotypical straight white couples we, as a society, are constantly shining a spotlight on, and want more diversity. To us, it is extremely important that not only do we cover different controversial and uncomfortable for some topics but also that we have a representation of those topics constantly on our show.

The idea of authenticity is also important to us, which is why we will be making sure that we cast every person who plays an identity on screen is a person who actually identifies as that label in real life. We would never want to have a whitewashed cast or not accurately portray them. We never want to be offensive to our audience or not accurately represent them. That is why we are making sure our writers do research on identities of our characters that they might not identify with.  Overall, it is our goal to create content that every person can see themselves in, whether that be in terms of race, sexuality, gender, or mental illness, we want audiences to view our content and feel represented in an accurate and true way.
 

 

Story Synopsis:

The Annex follows Samantha Cooper, a pansexual, depression and anxiety-ridden 19-year-old, small town girl trying to live out her dream. Desperate to make it as an actress, Sam leaves her small town and moves to Toronto. Sam provides the excitement and spontaneity of trying to follow a dream, with the hustle and bustle of big city living. Alone with limited funds and not that many friends; Sam posts an advertisement on Kijiji for two roommates.  Sam’s life turns upside down when she realizes her two new roommates have feelings for her, and she has feelings for both of them. Sam struggles as she navigates her new home, new city, mental health and love life.

 

Where The Funds Will Go:

 

All funds raised on behalf of this project will go straight into all of our production needs. These costs include; location, travel expenses, wardrobe, marketing, craft services, marketing and per diem expenditures.

 

Call To Action:

Want to become involved and apart of this production? We here at Little Engine Pictures appreciate any help we get! Become involved by:

  • Donating funds to the project
  • Raising awareness by spreading the word

Either option would be greatly appreciated as our main purpose is to get LGBTQ+ characters and mental health issues out of controversy and into the norm.

 

Be sure to keep checking this page along with our Facebook and Instagram pages for continued updates as we begin production!
