story:
Short Summary

My name is Kunmi Ogunsola. I'm a filmmaker based in Manchester, UK. My last project was a short film that I wrote and directed titled: Sunflower. It is a film that highlights the effects of positive affirmation and effective communication in families. The film was received very well at both our Manchester & London screenings with a review by The Nubian Times. 

"From its contents to the beauty in its mis-en-scene, the short film is a must see" - The Nubian Times

I've always been interested in using my projects as an opportunity to dialogue about social issues. As my sophomore solo project, Millennials is a perfect mix of social commentary and entertainment.  This web series is the culmination of conversations i've had with a few of my friends reviewing the commonality and uniqueness in all our struggles as young adults in today's world. I created this show to reflect the shared experience of millennials: our triumphs and failures, our love and heartbreak, our collective desire for all round fulfilment and our rollercoaster journey to self discovery. I truly believe this show could be an outlet for many people, to see their varied idiosyncrasies reflected in the fictional characters I've created. 

Contributing to this series would mean that you are joining me as co-creators for a show we can truly call ours.  A series that doesn't shy away from highlighting the socially sensitive, often marginalised topics such as mental illness, rape & consent, race relations in the workplace, and a few others.

 

Why We Need Funding 

We're looking to raise £3,000 and this will go towards the following:

Pre-Production

  • Casting
  • Costumes
  • Set Design
  • Licences 
  • Filming and Lighting Equipment Hire
  • Locations

Production 

  • Principle Photography
  • Sound Capture
  • Catering
  • Transport
  • Public Liability Insurance 

Post Production

  • Editing
  • Sound Design
  • Sound Production
  • Colour Grading
  • Music/ Score

Marketing 

  • Artwork / Graphic Design
  • Social Media Paid Advertisement
  • Web Design
  • Press Release
  • Press Junket 
  • Cast Interviews
  • Cast Photoshoot

Advanced Screening

  • Venue Hire
  • Videography
  • Refreshments
  • PA

As you can see there's a lot of work that goes into a production of this scale. Ideally our budget should be about £7 to £8,000 but Kunmi is very resourceful and will absorb a  lot of the costs.

 

Perks

We have some fantastic perks associated with your contributions.

  • For £5  you get social media shout out from us
  • £10 you get private exclusive online viewing of Sunflower, my short film. Its not out anywhere else
  • £25 you get a signed poster from the cast
  • £50 you get to be an extra or put someone forth to be an extra
  • £75 you get a ticket to the Millennials Advanced Screening
  • £100 you get a VIP ticket to the Millennials Advanced Screening with a private meet and greet & photo opportunity with the cast
  • £150 You get your name in Credits as a sponsor
  • £200 You get to Name A Character in the series
  • £250 You get a Speaking Role in the series, or you could put someone forth.
  • £500 You get to become an Executive Producer of the show, joining the ranks of Weruche Opia herself

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

We would probably extend our production timeline to buy time to find other was of raising our goal budget. We would probably also make some changes to suit the actual budget we are able to raise. The show must go on! 

 

Your Impact

As mentioned earlier, the series looks to highlight some important issues, for instance mental illness, particularly within the black community. We believe film and television are platforms that spark conversation and change. We are already looking to partner with some charities and provide our viewers who might struggle with any of these issues with the charity's contact information. A helpline number could be the difference in saving someone's life.

Risks & Challenges

Some of the risks & challenges we anticipate include: not raising our goal budget, (where required) acquiring permits for locations to shoot, getting the right actors and crew, on-set accidents or damages to gear, etc. 

However, we believe we are tenacious and could be creative in solving some of these issue.

  • we've already explained our plan of action if we dont raise the goal budget
  • if we can't get permits, we'll become more resourceful and find free locations to shoot
  • Kunmi is going to be working with our actors to bring our their best on screen
  • We already budgeted for Employer's and Public Liability Insurance, should there be any accidents. Prevention is however better than cure, so we will cultivate a healthy and safe working set for all present.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We do realise that not everybody can contribute financially, but we all have access to our friends and families. You can help by

  • sharing our campaign video & link on social media.
  • following us on our social media
  • liking, sharing and reposting our content
  • if you know any one that could offer a service for us, connect us
  • Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

You all are simply amazing! We're truly humbled by your support! Thank you!

Together Let's Make Something We'll All Be Proud Of.

story:
Watch peopleWatching season 1 here

I grew up on Mad Magazine and Calvin & Hobbes and Star Trek and the Simpsons and I learned that entertainment can reveal the human condition while also satirizing it and placing it in unfamiliar scenarios, because the truth shines through no matter the context it's put in. I grew up on music too, and I learned that the best way to get an emotional response is to write about things that evoke the strongest emotions in yourself. And when I grew up I saw shows like Girls and Master of None and I learned that TV is absolutely the best place to convey what life is REALLY like and the realities of being young in a world that has changed faster than at any point in history and yet is home to the realities that have been common to people throughout history. And then I got the opportunity to make a show of my own and I put all of that together and the best name for it was peopleWatching.

And I wrote a bunch of young characters who are all secretly half me and half fiction and who embody the kind of fundamental contradictions that we all have but are so often simplified in the shows we watch— characters like the musician who has fright everywhere except the stage, and the pervy feminist cool nerd, and the right-wing progressive girl, and the stripper with the 180 IQ who doesn't do it for the money, she just likes being naked in front of people even though she hates being objectified, and even if those characters aren't literally realistic they say something about the world in their descriptions.

And I tried to say something about what it's like to be a person by presenting those characters in self-contained stories that each explore a single idea using dialogue-heavy scenes that still find ways to be visually dynamic...

And I wrote an episode about how depression is like an entity that keeps tricking you into self-hatred because that's how it feels to me, and I wrote an episode about a guy struggling to write to his favorite teacher because that's what I was doing at the time, and I wrote an episode about a woman hoping there's some kind of scientifically derived afterlife in the future because she can't deal with all the tragedy and death in the world, and I wrote it because that was the way I felt all throughout 2016 and I needed to process those feelings and as an artist the best raw material to work with is whatever you feel strongest about. It's an infinitely deep well too—trying to explain what it's like to be a person is easily the world's longest conversation...

I also wrote an episode about a Non-Religious Confessional Booth where people confess their inner secrets and then discover that they're nowhere near as alone or different as they think they are, and I wrote it because to me that's what art IS—it's being yourself and then showing the world and then being stunned when a bunch of people put their hands up and say, “hey, me too!” All the better when you can do that using tight narratives with satisfying endings, and distinctive characters that give it all an emotional core, and the limitless potential of animation that allows for the kind of variety  that would otherwise be impossible.

I grew up learning that the package you put your message in is super important—almost as important as having a message to begin with, and having that message be something that draws parallels between people instead of dividing them.

That's the other thing I've learned— that one of the best things that art can do is to make people feel less alone, and to do that all you need is to tell the truth— even just your personal truth— regardless of the context. Even if it's a 10-minute cartoon with swearing and time travelers and jokes about having no money.

You can say a lot in 10 minutes, and have fun doing it— that's what I'd want people to learn from peopleWatching.

Thanks for reading,

Winston Rowntree,

Summer 2017

Toronto

story:
Strobe Vision Pictures is a student-run production company based out of the heart of downtown Toronto.  Launched in January 2017, the team is well into production of their first ever television pilot: Sugar Coated.

The team is passionate about the Canadian television market, and feels there is an opening for a series like this.  The cost of living in Toronto as a young female is incredibly high and as a team we want to show the diverse pressures of living in such a demanding society that influences ideal images for women to achieve and maintain.  Sugar Coated shows both the good and the bad of benefactor relationships.  Our series and scripts are inspired by true events of sugar babies across Canada.        

 

 

Unfortunately, Strobe Vision Pictures does not have their own sugar daddy, which is why we need YOUR help! One thing you can be thankful for is that our taste doesn’t come close to measuring up to our character’s in Sugar Coated, so remember that every SINGLE dollar makes a difference in reaching our $5000 goal. If you want the logistics of where your money will be allocated when you donate to Sugar Coated, here is a percentage breakdown of all our costs. The bigger the pie slice, the more money we need to make it a reality!

 

 

 

Follow us on social media:

Instagram: @sugarcoatedtv

Facebook: Sugar Coated

All photos are courtesy of @crookedabstract (Instagram)
story_txt: Strobe Vision Pictures is a student-run production company based out of the heart of downtown Toronto.  Launched in January 2017, the team is well into production of their first ever television pilot: Sugar Coated.The team is passionate about the Canadian television market, and feels there is an opening for a series like this.  The cost of living in Toronto as a young female is incredibly high and as a team we want to show the diverse pressures of living in such a demanding society that influences ideal images for women to achieve and maintain.  Sugar Coated shows both the good and the bad of benefactor relationships.  Our series and scripts are inspired by true events of sugar babies across Canada.          Unfortunately, Strobe Vision Pictures does not have their own sugar daddy, which is why we need YOUR help! One thing you can be thankful for is that our taste doesn’t come close to measuring up to our character’s in Sugar Coated, so remember that every SINGLE dollar makes a difference in reaching our $5000 goal. If you want the logistics of where your money will be allocated when you donate to Sugar Coated, here is a percentage breakdown of all our costs. The bigger the pie slice, the more money we need to make it a reality!   Follow us on social media:Instagram: @sugarcoatedtvFacebook: Sugar CoatedAll photos are courtesy of @crookedabstract (Instagram)

story:
Vivors…We Are One

Hello Everyone! We are Godfrey Nelson and Lorraine Nelson Wolf (also know as Nelson and the Wolf), composers/musicians in Hudson, NY.

Our show, Vivors, is about a community of people from different walks of life who have come together to tell their stories, to share their strength, hope, and belief that WE can change the future for the better.

Last year Vivors was scheduled to be part of Basilica Hudson’s NEA Grant, “Hudson As Muse,” but was canceled due to the Covid Pandemic. 

Welcome 2021! Basilica Hudson has invited us back to present what we’re calling an Experimental Virtual Performance, EVP. Being that the word “Vivor” is short for “survivor,” we think the time is perfect to move ahead. Our project goal is now a July broadcast date of a virtual performance.

Please help us realize our dream. The Hudson As Muse NEA Grant is not sufficient to cover our expenses and we need to raise additional funds. Our goal is to raise $5500 which will allow us to pay our cast and crew plus cover technical expenses for six weeks of virtual pre-production and one month of onsite filming in June.

Any donation amount is welcome. If you can't donate, you can still help us by spreading the word about our project. We thank you for your support. 

After everything that’s happened this past year, we are all VIVORS! 

 

Creative Staff:

Godfrey Nelson - Composer/Lyricist/Producer

Lorraine Nelson Wolf - Composer/Lyricist/Music Director

Jake Holmes - Composer/Lyricist

Claudia Frank - Film Director 

 

Cast:

Maytech - Faith Grumberg-Otey

Ivory - Gabrielle Hondorp

Pigeon - Mackenzie Alexander

Split - Walter Roman

Meryl - Dianne Davidson

Shepherd - Michael Mishaw

Hawk - Gregory Lee Rodriguez

Kite - Haydn Kellermeyer

story:
Hi, my name is Kevin Bhall and I’m the lead animator from Scraps Animation in Trinidad. We’re working on an animated web series called Scraps! 

Scraps is a lavishly animated and illustrated web-series featuring endearing kid-friendly characters and uniquely Caribbean settings.

                               

It stars the titular character, Scraps, a lovable scamp of a stray cat who lives in the fish market of a coastal Caribbean village, and the exciting adventures (and misadventures) he has with the inhabitants there, both human and animal.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  

 

We plan to produce eight episodes, five minutes each, over the course of a year.

Animation, though our passion is a very slow and time consuming process, and  for us to meet our ambitious target we need your help! 

The entire project will cost $40,000 USD, however, we are breaking up this project into smaller goals. So for this campaign, we want to raise $5,000 USD to complete one pilot episode for your viewing enjoyment. We will use this pilot to raise the remainder of the funds.  Using these funds we plan to focus exclusively on the development of the remaining episodes and to hire another animator and an illustrator.

We heavily utilize  online collaboration techniques to help keep costs down and quality high to make the most of your contributions.

Please feel free to check out some of our past work below, and of course our teaser trailer! Its just a taste of what we have in store for your viewing pleasure. 

Whether you come from the Caribbean and are dreaming of home, or are just a fan of great animation, we hope you will decide to help us on this ground-breaking project animated from Trinidad and Tobago!

Support this project and choose the reward you desire. We have rewards in various tiers, which will include early access to the episode on Youtube, high quality download links for the episode, access to preliminary production material, associate producers’ credits and Skype chats with the production crew!

  
                    
  
                                              
Check out our teaser trailer below!

story:
--------------------------------------------------

HEAR WHY TEDDY'S TEAM DECIDED VIDEO

WAS THE BEST MEDIA FOR THIS MESSAGE

----------------------------------------------------

 

 

How different is Teddy's Friends compared to Sesame Street and Mr. Rodgers?

Jason:  While both programs are so wonderful and great, and I grew up watching them, their target market is 3 to 5. Our target market is 8 to 12 years of age. Which is an under-utilized market. Eight can be a challenging age and it is important to get kids these life lessons before they are teenagers and going through puberty. It would be great to have all the tools available to deal with what comes with this challenging, and potentially awkward, phase of life.

Teddy: Dude seriously… Mr. Rogers was my hero and I think our world needs more of that right now… seriously dude. He passed the torch to me. Let’s do this! Booya!

 IS THERE MORE THAN JUST ONE CHARACTER?

Jason: Yes, Episode 1 Season 1 has 4 characters; Teddy, TJ, Gloria Bun Bun and Frankenscary. Each episode introduces a new character/monster that becomes part of Teddy’s Club.

Teddy: This animated entertainment series, starring yours truly, will give little monsters the tools they need to tackle real-life situations like anger, racism, fear, acceptance, and many other topics that might be hard for some to address.  All while having a blast with me and my friends as we travel the globe helping monsters from everywhere! We meet a new friend / monster in every episode.

 

WHEN WILL THE EPISODES BE AVAILABLE?

Jason:  As soon as they are funded...

It takes about three months to complete an animation from start to finish, and our initial goal of this crowdfunding campaign is to take this idea and bring it to life.  Teddy is gaining steam and we can't wait to get everyone involved in this very special project.

Teddy:  If you want to help transform the “little monsters” in all of us then do what Mother Theresa used to say; “Seriously dude … Break out your check books, break out your pens and start writing checks.”  Booya!!

---------------------------------------------

TEDDY WANTS TO LET YOU IN ON A BEAR OF AN OPPORTUNITY!

THANK YOU FOR LISTENING TO MY TEDDY TALK

-----------------------------------------------

HOW DO YOU ENVISION KIDS WILL ACCESS THIS SERIES?

Jason:   Initially we primarily will be on YouTube and YouTube Kids. We will be open to white label in the future with the right partner such as Cartoon Network, PBS, Nickelodeon and Netflix.

Teddy:  Wherever there is a TV screen. The wider and larger the screen the better.

-------------------------------------------------

GET PERSONAL WITH CREATOR & FOUNDER JASON KADLEC

THE CLARINET LESSON HE WILL NEVER FORGET

TRANSFORMATIVE FIRST HAND EXPERIENCE

----------------------------------------------------

 

WHAT IS THE NEXT STEP FOR THOSE INTERESTED IN TEDDY'S FRIENDS?

PLEASE FOLLOW, SHARE & CONTRIBUTE! 

Your monetary contributions will be the best option to bring this idea to life.  However, if you would like to contribute in another way, we are open and appreciative to any equity you can offer to our series.  Whether you're an animator wanting to lend your skills, or a public relations master ready to pound the pavement for our cause,  we would love your involvement.

story:
Short Summary

In late 2017, Aaron Johnson Levy was cast in the feature film Hey, Mr. Postman (2018) which stars Omar Gooding, Paula Jai Parker and many other veteran actors. The production gave him an opportunity to play an openly gay character unlike any that he had ever seen on-screen. The experience inspired him to write the LGBT thriller known as "Out: A Saga". 

The Team

Aaron Johnson Levy began his acting career in Israel when he played Tom Collins in the country's first production of Rent. He was soon signed to one of the top agencies--Look--and has continued to hone his acting, writing and production skills since. 

Perdell Richardson is a highly-accomplished producer, director and editor. He has won four awards on three projects that he directed and edited. One of his unique skills is aerial cinematography, which he used in his last project The Seventh Commandment (2017).

The Budget

Together we have crafted a modest $2000 budget to complete the pilot episode. The funds will be roughly distributed equally among the following three categories:

  • Pre-production: Transportation, Permits, Food 
  • Production: Cast & Crew Payments, Food, Equipment Rental
  • Post-production: Editing, Marketing, Development.

The Perks

There are three tiers of amazing perks: Fan Level, Cast Level or Crew Level. And there are three options for each level.

Fan Level perks include:

  • Membership to a private Facebook group which allows access to exclusive footage.
  • A social media follow from your favorite cast member. 
  • A phone call from your favorite cast member.

Cast Level perks include:

  • Be cast as an "Online Audience Member" during a live-stream broadcast in Scene 1.
  • Be cast as a "Nightclub Patron". 
  • Be cast in a speaking role as Yourself.

Crew Level perks include:

  • Become an Associate Producer.
  • Become a Producer. 
  • Become an Executive Producer.

Welcome to the saga!

story:
The reason I'm creating this series is because of the serious lack of accurate, relatable, or open representation of asexuality in media, and especially for people of color. In general, there's also just a huge question mark that still floats overhead the topic of asexuality, which demands the spread of awareness. So this series is here to continue that dialogue and to help people understand what asexuality is, how we view the world, and to understand that each person's experience as an asexual (or someone sitting on the spectrum) varies from one person to the next. Overall,  it is a show that will not only further the already lacking visibility of asexual characters in mainstream media, but highlight other sexual and romantic spectrums that are often not discussed candidly. 

The show revolves around two women who come from very different walks of life, and have different perspectives, yet at the same time are so similar in the way that they have to face societies judgments for their lack of sexuality or hypersexualitiy. As women, and especially women of color coming from very traditional cultures there are certain roles and ways of behaving and looking that they’re expected to adhere to. But just like many of the modern women of today, they break away from those expectation and allow themselves to experience continuous growth as they enter new stages of life and self-realization.

 

The majority of the funds will be spent on paying our actors, locations, food & craft services, and even travel expenses for some of out cast who are commuting from out of state. But the budget doesn’t stop there! We also need the funds to secure equipment that we don’t already have access to, wardrobe, and POSSIBLY even post-production so that we can ensure we can provide you the best possible quality sound design and music! Overall, literally EVERY penny helps in trying to provide the best possible show for you guys on a small budget. 

 

Besides receiving the opportunity to support underprivileged and unrepresented voices and stories, you will get my enthusiastic and overwhelming GRATITUDE, merch merch merch (more perks to come), first and/or bts access, credits, the opportunity to CREATE……A CHARACTER (how cool is that), and of course be an amazing awesome producer of the web series who will get to come to the premiere! 

 

Our cast and crew are filled with diverse people who are INCREDIBLY talented women,  people of color, and LGBTQA individuals. For the sake of authenticity and representation I’ve always believed it’s important to tell stories and create teams and cast that can personally identify with the story being told in some aspect or another.  

 C R E W

DIRECTOR - VICTORIA KEE (RIGHT)

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY - ALEX JONES (LEFT)

MORE FROM CAST AND CREW IN THE VIDEO BELOW!!

 

C A S T

Maya (Khiana Sizemore) 

is an asexual who’s straightforward and sassy. However, as she has to deal with the persistent societal pressures to date and be sexually active she finds it harder and harder to be comfortable in her own skin. At times, it seems the only place she can be herself is online, or with her friends, but, when she’s not busy building up her online social presence, she’s working as an intern for a small production house.  

Jasmine is an incredibly strong, independent, woman who – quite literally – “don’t need no man”. She’s an aromantic sex-positive pansexual who is a programmer by day and a writer by night. Not the type for commitment, she’s a woman who boldly embraces the freedom to express her own sexuality whenever and with whomever she pleases – carrying herself with confidence and allure, often against criticism from her family and the unwelcome opinions of men.   

Jared (Andrew Reid) is Maya’s closest guy friend, who she meets at an asexual meetup. He doesn’t necessarily like labels but he identifies as queer. Overall, Jared is a chill free-spirit who brings out the sort of geeky enthusiastic side in Maya when they bond over common interests.   

 

 

As with everything in life there will be risks and challenges that we face in the creation of this project. We’re shooting most of it in the winter so….❄️Brrrrr❄️. We expect to face unpredictable weather conditions, and potential shifts in shooting schedules. But we’re fully prepared and equipped to take on these possible challenges and will make sure you guys get to enjoy the experience of watching this show by the end of 2018!

 

I am so very thankful for all forms of contribution you decide to make, whether it’s by donating, spreading the word, etc. Whatever it is. Thank. You. For all your support! 

And if you want to think of other ways you can support other than by donation, and you happen to be incredibly gifted in something or want to offer some form of in kind service we’d be so so so grateful and welcome you to reach out to us at idgafwebseries@gmail.com . 

Make sure to SHARE the campaign with your family and friends. Follow the show on Facebook and Twitter. We’re excited to hear from you.

Please email us at idgafwebserieis@gmail.com if you have any further questions and concerns!

**UPDATE**

As indiegogo no longer supports payments via paypal, we've put up a separate link for you guys to use if you would like. https://paypal.me/idgafwebseries

I am so very thankful for all forms of contribution you decide to make, whether it’s by donating, spreading the word, etc. Whatever it is. Thank. You. For all your support! 
And if you want to think of other ways you can support other than by donation, and you happen to be incredibly gifted in something or want to offer some form of in kind service we’d be so so so grateful and welcome you to reach out to us at idgafwebseries@gmail.com . 
Make sure to SHARE the campaign with your family and friends. Follow the show on Facebook and Twitter. We’re excited to hear from you.
Please email us at idgafwebserieis@gmail.com if you have any further questions and concerns!
**UPDATE**
As indiegogo no longer supports payments via paypal, we've put up a separate link for you guys to use if you would like. https://paypal.me/idgafwebseries

story:
Hi! My name is Becca Beberaggi and I am a NYC based writer, actress, and comedian. I'm so happy to announce that I will be shooting a 5 part series called "B-Sides" this winter, co- directed by Jonah Levine! The story centers around a native New Yorker named B (No relation to me at all!) as she takes on day to day life in Brooklyn, NY. You might ask "Becca, why should I care about that?" and I would reply, "I don't know. I can't read minds" but I will say this. All my life I have desperately wanted to tell stories through my lens as a woman of color and share them with you! I have always used the phrases like "I want to be the female version of so and so" or "I want to be the brown version of this successful white person". I hate these phrases and I'm ready to just tell the stories I'm dying to tell. For example: Ever cried so hard you got your period? Me too. Ever been talked at and not talked to. Me too. Every wanted your life to be a silent film? Me too! 

I have finally found an awesome team to help me bring these dumb ideas come to life! AlI I need is a little bit of help so that I can pay everyone for their hard work. This includes food, location rentals, more food, coffee, food, and last but not least funds to pay my incredible crew and actors. 

I promise to make you laugh and I'll try not to make you uncomfortable, regardless I hope you join me :)

story:
Welcome!

Just for Laughs  wants to produce episode 1 of my web series!  The renowned Canadian production company  plans to launch the video on their platform and based on its reception, potentially offer a  bigger development deal. 

ALRIGHTY THEN... 

We need $2,000 to cover the cost of production. This money will go towards financing all aspects of filming,  including photography, sound, editing, props, costumes and talent. 

THE IMPACT

This project is valuable because it's a tiny seed  that has the chance to GROW into a fully funded web series by an AWESOME production company. 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

SPREAD THE WORD!

story:
A second series!?

YES! The characters of Forward Slash/Jobs (the entire Series One can be seen for FREE on Amazon Prime here) are back by popular demand for a brand new adventure at Maxus and Berns in another six episodes of awkward, British comedy!

Professional interviewer Joseph Pecker (Murphy Rhodes) finds himself out of work and out of luck as we follow his attempts to get his life back on track and his office back from Robert Hampton (Andrew Games), the new resident interviewer. Everyone's favourite cleaner/receptionist combo of Glenn James (James Kemp) and Jane Melia (Laura Cotter) return, too, along with delivery guy Hermes (Leonidas Pan) and the hand puppet fella Mr. Broonshoon with Mr. Flizzy (Sean Bradshaw and Sean Bradshaw's hand respectively) - but there's new faces, too.

The series has been completely filmed from start to finish, but in typical Murphy Rhodes style, he's paid for the whole thing with his bank overdraft. And he needs your help!

Full transparency, here's a breakdown of the costs:

  • Crew expenses (travel from North Wales to Liverpool and back over six days + travel between stations in Liverpool): £141.30
  • Printing costs (callsheets, script excerpts, posters, photographs for set): £16.30
  • Canva subscription for two months (poster creation, all graphic design needs, social media covers/images): £22.00
  • Props (1 x pack of five cigars = £6.15, 2 x pints of lager = £7.60, 1 x pack of 50 envelopes = £4.99, 1 x First class stamp = £0.70, 2 x Belts - £5.00, 2 x red bic pens = £1.58, 1 x Memo block of post-it notes = £3.99, 1 x Clipboard = £3.49, 1 x pack of white chalk = £1.49, 1 x Portfolio = £3.49, 1 x Door name plate = £8.15, 1 x Desk name plate = £5.60, 1 x Pair of Sunglasses = £4.39): £56.62
  • Refreshments on set (tea/coffee, snacks, milk for six days filming and with us using as little as possible): £25.22
  • Social media marketing (we want as many eyes to see our hard work as possible, and sometimes you have to pay for people to look! This will be mostly Facebook ads, but not limited to): £100
  • Premiere Night in Liverpool (we don't expect you to pay for our drinks, but the cast and crew will all be invited to watch the final series in a small venue in the centre of Liverpool before the series is released. It's a reward for all of their hard work, and this amount just covers the cost of the venue hire): £50.00
  • Indiegogo Charge for Transacting in GBP: £25

This all comes to £436.44, but with the fees that indiegogo attach and the processing fees per transaction (they take a percentage of whatever we earn), we've put our goal up to £500.

The series release date is set as 1st November 2019, so only a couple of months until you can watch, what we consider to be, a second series that's 1000 times superior to it's predecessor!

If you can't donate, you can help in other ways! Either give this project a share on your Facebook, Twitter or whatever social media you find yourself on (don't know what the kids are using these days. Is Habbo still a thing?). You can also give our pages a like:

Facebook Pages:

  • XRhodes Films
  • Forward Slash/Jobs
  • Murphy Rhodes

Twitter Feeds

  • @XRhodesFilms
  • @FSlashJobs
  • @theMurphyRhodes

YouTube Channel:

  • XRhodes Films

Thank you!

From the team at XRhodes Films!

P.S. You can find our other films over at the official XRhodes Films website here.

Risks and challenges

Honestly, the main challenge will be not receiving the funds. Gotta eat, right? The project itself is complete and is in post-production, being edited aka slaved over (isn't that right, editor? I SAID ISN'T THAT -) and so any challenges we faced, we overcame. We can 100% guarantee the receipt of the incentives we've offered above.

Murphy Rhodes

Thank you!
From the team at XRhodes Films!
The scene we shot where the girl was half plant. Sort of a low budget Poison Ivy. The character, not the species of flora.

Risks and challenges
Honestly, the main challenge will be not receiving the funds. Gotta eat, right? The project itself is complete and is in post-production, being edited aka slaved over (isn't that right, editor? I SAID ISN'T THAT -) and so any challenges we faced, we overcame. We can 100% guarantee the receipt of the incentives we've offered above.

story:
On The Fringe

With the rise in access to information through the internet, we've seen a rise in awareness about the vast number of communities and identities that exist different from our own. Unfortunately, much of the screen time given to these communities is created with the members as the butt of a joke. Whether that's depicting Furries as deranged sex maniacs, or stereotyping Adult Babies as weird dudes who can't find girlfriends, much of this content is created with the intent to entertain through laughing at those who are different from ourselves.

As a member of the LGBTQ community myself, I've seen firsthand how harmful this type of stereotyping and "othering" can be to someone who already feels that they are different from the norm.

The goal of this series is to create entertaining and educational content, without making a spectacle of those living alternative lifestyles. In each episode, I will not only sit down and interview members of various fringe communities and identities, but spend time in each community, doing my best to literally walk a day in their shoes. 

 

Risks and challenges

This is my first full production docuseries, a project larger than anything I have undertaken before, and I want to do it well. That's why I need your support. I am so excited to be able to hire an incredible crew (videographer, editor, production assistant), but it is a lot to take on financially.

Even so, I think that these fringe communities deserve fair representation, and that this series will help those who feel different or "not enough". And of course, as with all my content, I want to create something that brings people together through entertainment and laughter!

 

What We Need & What You Get

I plan to create 6 episodes for this first season, and have estimated a budget of $1200 per episode. I've added $300 to give room to fulfill rewards, and that's where the goal of $7500 comes from!

Here's how the money will be used:

  • Hiring and paying a videographer
  • Hiring and paying an editor
  • Hiring and paying a production assistant (*hopefully*)
  • Paying for travel costs
  • Funding in-video props and equipment
  • Designing series branding

 

Some of the neat perks you can get your hands on:

  • Exclusive behind-the-scenes content
  • Be the first to receive On The Fringe merch - signed!
  • Get your name in the official credits
  • Know that you are supporting an independent creator wanting to use her platform to spread some awareness

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially, there are other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign to your social media. The more eyes we get on it, the more likely we are to reach our goal! Indiegogo has some great sharing tools to make this easy.
  • Follow me on Instagram to stay up to date on this project!

 

I want to say thank you up front for all your support. I can't wait to get started on creating this thing!

story:
Short Summary

This series celebrates everything about the black culture; from the African society to the thoughts and frustrations of Black Americans. It explores the history of slavery and racism, the power and beauty of black people and the preservation of their identity. For instance, our lead character, HELEN, comes from a long line of BLACK DRUIDS who were once slaves of the Lockharts (a very notorious family of vampires and witches). Today in "post racial America", the tensions between these supernatural factions still exists, creating a conflict between a white supernatural world, and a supernatural world of colour. 

To have a BLACK FEMALE lead and a majority black cast in a young adult fantasy will be ground breaking. Helen's story is more than just her being in love with the son of her former master, it is representative of the messy and complex vision of black womanhood. It is our hope that EVERY black woman out there will see their lives reflected back at them. through Helen; her frustrations of a lifetime of discrimination from the Lockhart Vampires, which has resulted in subconscious self loathing. These frustrations and insecurities appear in many forms such as straightening and bleaching her hair blonde in order to fit into today's "beauty standards".

 

Why do we need extra money?

Working with practical effects, stunts, period settings etc takes a big jump. We made a trailer with absolutely no budget (for a student project), it turned out okay. This time, we sat down, and discussed how we can improve our craft. Because if we are going to tell this deep and personal story, we have to do it right. But doing it right means more money (to hire experienced crew and good gear), but unfortunately, this isn't realistic for the budget we have. So this is why we need your help. Anything that you can give and/or do will be greatly appreciated. 

All funds raised will go towards completing production, post production and every other expense incurred during the production of this series. 

Here's what your funds will cover:

PRODUCTION: Experienced cast and crew, equipment rentals (lighting, cameras, sound, vans, stunt equipment, insurance, medics, locations and period props).

POST PRODUCTION: Editing and visual effects.

The series will be available on youtube for everyone to watch. NO PROFIT will be made from the series.

Everyone who donates will receive updates and production information. We will be giving away some of the props used during filming i.e. period clothing (that we don't need anymore), daggers and stakes, grimoires, posters,  jewellery and so much more!

Crew

Director: Katarzyna Kochany-- https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3344354/

Producer: Natasha Heschelle -- https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9947883/

Script Editor: Samantha Nemeth -- https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3588394/

Director of photography: Justin Arjune --https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3903693/

story:
WHO am I and WHY this project

My name is Ina and I am the writer/director of "Homies," a web series project. I've been a filmmaker and a TV production professional for about 4 years.

Last year, I began to visualize a web series. One that would explore different experiences of relationships that my friends and I have come to experience - with people who looked like us.

As a Filipino immigrant and a queer woman, I wanted to create stories that feature Filipino queer women - ones that I rarely see in media. I also wanted to give a stage to others who are people of color and in the lgbtq+ spectrum. Many times these groups are portrayed by their struggles: their coming out stories and their stories of oppression. While these are important experiences, the media ignores other aspects of their lives - ones that end up being told by people who look and act nothing like them.

The Homies web series aims to normalize our stories within society.

WHAT is Homies

"Homies" will be a web series of 4-stand-alone episodes. (Maybe more if things go well) Each episode has different characters and has a different theme, all featuring queer-identifying people and people of color. 

Brief Description

1st EP: Two best friends navigate their friends-with-benefits relationship

2nd EP: A couple enjoys their last day before a long-distance relationship

3rd EP: A homeless couple tries to get clean and get off the streets together

4th EP: A middle-aged couple look back on the start of their relationship

WHEN do you see the product

The FIRST EPISODE has already been produced and is being submitted to film festivals this year. It has already been included in a few film festivals!

Our aim is to produce the next three episodes early next year with a Summer release. We want to take the rest of the year to raise our goal of $10,000.

WHERE does the money go towards

The Cast and Crew! Everything is about them!! We want to pay everyone for their hard work and we want to make sure they have enough to eat. Equipment rentals and location fees are the least of our worries. 

(For the 1st episode, the cast and crew worked pro bono and that production still cost me $2,000! )

Other Ways You Can Help 

Share, share, share!!! In addition to trying to get funds, we are also trying to build an audience so getting the word out is very important.

Please follow us 

ig: @homiesdc

FB: https://www.facebook.com/homiesDC

story:
OUR STORY

We are THE PUMA SQUAD - the female-driven production company who brought you the hit supernatural LGBT web-series, Last Life. We currently have over 134k subscribers on our channel with over 56 MILLION views. 

As you can see from our videos, we work with super low budgets and put out high quality content. However, nothing can be done for free. That's why we need your help. We have never reached a budget goal before. Maybe this time we can!
 

Synopsis:

YOUSTALK is a mystery thriller about a famous social media influencer who is being stalked by the secrets of her past. 

Kori, former owner of the unsuccessful psychology vlog, "Dr. K," stumbles upon internet fame when she invites her girlfriend, Ashley to do a video with her. Their quirky chemistry attracts views and their video goes viral. #Kashley

By the end of the first episode, we discover Kori is being watched, not just via her videos but also in her private life. We quickly discover her internet persona is not indicative of her actual life as we watch what we thought to be true unravel before our eyes. 

Throughout the series, the secrets grow deeper as Kori receives anonymous e-mails and menacing phone calls threatening to reveal a dark secret from her past. Members of her old high school friend group begin disappearing as Kori realizes she may be next. Now somewhat of a public figure, Kori does all that she can to hide the person that she once was.

Where does the money go?

*** This is the budget for SEASON ONE only. Our goal is 8 - 10 episodes. 

- Equipment
- Crew help
- Editing help
- Music rights
- Feeding Cast and Crew
- Set Design
- Paying Actors
- Permits
- Insurance

Other Ways You Can Help

- SHARE the campaign and spread the word!
- SUBSCRIBE to the channel and encourage others to do so as well!
- SHARE our videos

However, nothing can be done for free. That's why we need your help. We have never reached a budget goal before. Maybe this time we can! 

Synopsis:
YOUSTALK is a mystery thriller about a famous social media influencer who is being stalked by the secrets of her past. 
Kori, former owner of the unsuccessful psychology vlog, "Dr. K," stumbles upon internet fame when she invites her girlfriend, Ashley to do a video with her. Their quirky chemistry attracts views and their video goes viral. #Kashley
By the end of the first episode, we discover Kori is being watched, not just via her videos but also in her private life. We quickly discover her internet persona is not indicative of her actual life as we watch what we thought to be true unravel before our eyes. 
Throughout the series, the secrets grow deeper as Kori receives anonymous e-mails and menacing phone calls threatening to reveal a dark secret from her past. Members of her old high school friend group begin disappearing as Kori realizes she may be next. Now somewhat of a public figure, Kori does all that she can to hide the person that she once was.

Where does the money go?
*** This is the budget for SEASON ONE only. Our goal is 8 - 10 episodes. 
- Equipment- Crew help- Editing help- Music rights- Feeding Cast and Crew- Set Design- Paying Actors- Permits- Insurance

Other Ways You Can Help
- SHARE the campaign and spread the word!- SUBSCRIBE to the channel and encourage others to do so as well!- SHARE our videos

story:
Short Summary

Hello! We are Concord Pictures, currently entering our last year at Ryerson University. 

Our team consists of Victoria Salituro (Producer), Connor Martin (Director), Chloe Hazard (Assistant Director), Alexandru Titu (D.O.P), Sarah Hurst (Marketing Lead) and Jayda Mangat (Social Media Lead). 

"Faces of Resilience" is a passion project created by our director Connor Martin who is Six Nations of the Grand River, from the Mohawk Nation and a member of the Bear clan. 

Each Episode of "Faces of Resilience" will follow the story of a successful Indigenous leader and how their background, family, and community contributed to their path. This project is incredibly important to us because we see the lack of representation for successful Indigenous people and the abundance of negative representation there is. 

Our goal is to inspire and lift the spirits of Indigenous youth by showing them Indigenous figures to look up to and to see what each and every one of them is capable of. 

If we are able to achieve our goal of $7000, it is our mission to execute "Faces of Resilience" in the most true and authentic way possible; as well as reach as many Indigenous youths as possible. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding goal is $7000. 

This funding will go towards rental equipment, travel expenses, editing softwares, as well as food for our crew. 

For our incredible donors, we have some amazing perks! These Include; a limited "Faces of Resilience" sticker for donations of $30+, tickets to our premiere event for donations of $50+, free downloadable versions of the docu-series for donations of $80+ and lastly YOUR name in the credits for donations of $120+. 

If we are unsuccessful in reaching our funding goal of $7000, all of the funds which we are able to raise will still go towards this project. It is our goal to make this happen and we will continue to crowdfund until we can. 

 

The Impact

This project will be made possible by each and every individual who contributes to this campaign. 

"Faces of Resilience" is a valuable series because of the message it conveys. The message of hope, perseverance, and determination. All qualities which are not only valuable to Indigenous youth, but everybody. 

Our director, Connor Martin, has experience working for the "Creative Native" and has first-hand experience working with Indigenous youth. Additionally, our Director of Photography, Alexandru has had years of experience filming projects of this calibre- so we can also guarantee that "Faces of Resilience" won't just have incredible stories- but incredibly beautiful cinematography to match.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Executing a docu-series of this magnitude will come with its challenges. We are planning to work with three separate individuals who come from completely different upbringings, which means several locations to film at. 

We are fully prepared to make decisions about these filming locations and other obstacles that will be thrown in our direction. If need be, we have back-up locations for our interviews and footage. 

However, it is our hope to not have to turn to these back-up options as it is our mission to convey each individuals story as true and authentic as possible. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donating to our campaign isn't the only way to help!

We appreciate each and every share to social media to spread the word of "Faces of Resilience". You can also follow us on Facebook for Instagram for updates on this wonderful project. 

From the whole team at Concord Pictures, we thank you!

www.thefacesofresilience.com/

story:
Short Summary

Lifties is an indie comedy web series and the first of its kind to originate from the Midwest. The series follows the crew of Mt. Schole, Minnesota as they struggle through the ski season and deal with a shell shocked head of ski patrol, a soulless city council bureaucrat, and the occasional moose encounter. There are currently three episodes available for free streaming online.  

In order to continue the series, donations from viewers and sponsors are vital! The series has the potential to become the next Letterkenny, Trailer Park Boys...but it needs support to make it as great as it can possibly be. 

We are asking for your support to help create the first-ever viral live-action web series to come from the Midwest! Help us revitalize snowboard/alpine culture and showcase the creative talent that our region has to offer, and finally to prove that the best creations don't have to come from a studio lot in Los Angeles. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our current goal to produce the rest of Lifties Season 1 is a minimum of $500.  Your contribution will go towards funding the production and nothing else. 

We are currently offering Lifties merchandise including custom travel mugs, stickers, t-shirts, and hats as perks for your support.

The creators of the series are not taking a paycheck. Even if we are unable to reach the $500 goal we will use what we do raise to help offset the costs of production. Your money will go towards hiring crew members and cast, catering for the production, equipment, and licensing, merchendise, and advertisement. 

The Impact

In order for us to elevate the series to the professional quality it deserves, we need your financial support. Your donation will go towards creating something that has never been done before in the Midwest or snowboard industry. 

Our first two episodes were made on almost a zero-dollar budget with most of the costs being paid out of pocket by the creators themselves. If we can accomplish that with almost nothing just imagine what we can do with your help!

We are not wealthy, trust-fund creatives, we are ordinary people with a passion for art and storytelling. Help us tell our story and the story of midwest snowboarding!

Risks & Challenges

We understand that COVID-19 has made things financially difficult for everyone this year.  Running a production during uncertain times presents a lot of unique challenges, but we are well tasked to mitigate these risks with safe, COVID conscious sets, and a tight budget to ensure not a cent of your donation is wasted. 

Our production team includes experienced filmmakers who have handled far greater amounts of money on feature-length projects. Your donation is in good hands. If you are interested in learning more about our budget breakdown and how the money you donate will be used feel free to reach out!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you are able to donate,  please share our campaign with those you think may be interested! 

Remember to use the share tools built into the Indiegogo campaign website! 

See you on the slopes!

story:
During an ordinary Witcher day, in a small village near Novigrad, Geralt stumbles in a very peculiar contract: the search of an artifact in an abandoned castle.
Geralt will manage to sneak into the castle, but a mysterious black figure seems to be watching him... who is this figure? What is this artifact? Who will join Geralt in this adventure? A Trilogy of episodes will reveal you the whole story, if you support us!

Watch the Episode 1, the prologue to our story

 

The Team

I'm Daniele Cosenza, an italian photographer that is focusing mainly on Cosplay. During my activities, i met many amazing cosplayers, loving the way they were passionate about their characters.
Since i'm also a big Witcher fan, i was amazed by the work of Taryn Cosplay, and when someone proposed me to produce a short video about this wonderful universe he was the first on my list. I also needed someone skilled on videomaking, someone that could be passioned to make an experience like this, and i found it in Davide Morabito, another Witcher fan that surely knows how to hold a camera. Last but not least, in a fantastic world like the one of The Witcher, i knew i would need a visual effects editor, and i was lucky to already have him as a friend: Gianluca Vecchio is a master in his field, worked on many popular titles, like "Star Wars: Rogue One" and "The Martian", and he will surely be a key value to our final product.

Taryn Cosplay

Actor, Screenwriting, Costumes, Props

28 yo, Cosplayer since 2015, winner of many awards all around Italy, with an incredible handcraft talent for costumes and props. Great fan of Witcher games and books, his Geralt creations now includes Kaer Morhen Armor, Wolf Armor, Ursine Armor and Cat Armor.
In 2018 he was chosen as testimonial of "Festa dell'Unicorno", the main fantasy convention in Italy.

Daniele Cosenza

Director, Producer, Assistant editor, Photography

44yo Cosplay photographer based in Sicily, active since 2014. In 2018 he got 1st, 2nd and 3rd place in "F.U.O.CO" photographic contest, that brought, amongst others, Taryn Cosplay to be testimonial of "Festa dell'Unicorno", the main fantasy convention in Italy that is taking place in the town of Vinci every year. His goal is to bring to life into video his cosplay photography style.

Davide Morabito

Camera, Director, Editor

A greatly talented 26yo sicilian videomaker, worked in many commercial and music videos projects, collaborating with many popular italian Youtubers. Great fan of the CD Projekt Red version of The Witcher, ambitious and focused on his target, he can bring to life scenes, sequences and images with an high visual impact.

Gianluca Vecchio

CG and Visual Effects

An Italian digital artist and compositor. He started working on cg projects since late ’90 and after a quick experience as webmaster he turned his study and work on video post-production and digital visual effects, taking part at important Italian advertising projects and then being employed in London by several companies like Double Negative, Cinesite, Prime Focus, Bluebolt, Peerless Camera Company to create visual effects on movies as Fast & Furious, Hercules, London has fallen, The Martian, Star Wars-Rogue One and many more.

 

What We Need & What You Get

With this crowdfunding campaign we are willing to fund a trilogy of 6-8 minutes long episodes, using same structure of the pilot (music + images), adding epic voice-over acting to better explain what is happening on screen.
If you watched our short movie, you already know what to expect. The episode 1 was made at totally zero budget. We also had a very short time window: only 1 day of filming and 1 month to edit and publish it.

Now, imagine what we could do if we will be properly funded! Just some examples:

  • Rent a "Roach" for our Geralt, and other horses for other characters
  • Hire Live GDR groups to recreate the atmosphere of a Witcher Village
  • Invite best Cosplayers from all around Europe to impersonate other characters
  • Travel in amazing locations to make Geralt adventures even more epic
  • Rent professional equipment, for better video quality
  • Better CGI and Visual Effects

And this is only an example! 


The Community

Your opinion is important to us, this is why our project is highly community-based. You can join our Facebook page and partecipate to our polls, topics, feedback requests. You will also be always updated, with activities descriptions and backstages photo/videos.
You can also easily contact us for every inquiry or feedback!

 

How we plan to use funds

We are not planning to earn money from this, we just want to avoid giving up to something just because it's expensive, and you can be sure that every penny will be used for the production of the movie (we will keep you updated on every expense).

  1.  Equipment Rental 
    This is very important for us, because what we did till now was done using our own not-so-professional equipment. We want to overcome this limit, and will dedicate about 20% of the funds to this purpose.
  2. Cosplayers travel and expenses 
    We are planning to invite one or two cosplayers to play key roles, we will have to pay them expenses for travels, room and board. We will limit our search to European countries and use about 15% of the funds.
  3. Crew travels and expenses
    We are planning to travel and discover new locations all around Italy, to give the movie an intriguing mood, we will keep all expenses to the minimum, travelling by car and sleeping in hostels, and you will get all about what we do in our socials. About 25% of the funds will be dedicated to this.
  4. Horses rental
    What is a Witcher without his Roach? We will use professional support to have horses into our project. 5% of the funds should be ok.
  5. CGI and Visual Effects
    Our new episode will make a stronger use of CGI and Visual Effects, and we won't  compromises on quality! That's why it gets the bigger slice of the pie, about 30%.
  6. Advertising
    We would like to perform a strong advertising campaign to spread our creation all around the Witcher world community, so we can get even stronger for future projects! We will dedicate 5% of the funds to it.
  7. Various
    We can plan as much as we want, but there will surely be unexpected expenses, so we will keep a small purse for that by saving  money here and there ;)


Under-funding and Over-funding

Our campaign is flexible, it means we don't have to reach our goal to begin production, but of course the amout of funds we get will impact what we do.

  • 0 - 1000 €
    it means we failed, we will refund you if you ask us, or keep it as donation and support to try it again and better
  • 1000 - 2000 €
    we will produce another episode with same features of the first one, it will be just better because we will take our time
  • 2000 - 3000 €
    same as before, we will add a bit of CGI/Visual Effects features
  • 3000 - 5000 €
    better equipment renting, to bring the production on another level
  • 5000 - 7000 €
    we will consider travelling to other locations to bring Geralt adventures on a more epic level
  • 7000 - 9800 €
    Only within this range we should be able to give all as promised, maybe saving some money here and there ;)
  • > 9800 €
    every penny we get over our planned goal will open the door to many other possibilities, like:
    • original soundtrack and professional sound editing
    • bonus episode
    • more cosplayer invitations
    • travel to film in foreign countries (Poland? :P)

You can be sure about one thing: every euro we get (less or more than planned) will be used to the best, to give you that true feeling that only a "made by fans, for fans" can give.

 

Timing plans

If we get a full funding, we are planning to begin shootings by the end Q2 2019 and release the first episode in the begin of 2020. Partial funding could lead to different timings, depending on what we do, but surely we won't go over this time.

 

Risks & Challenges

We know this is not an easy task, we will face lot of expected and unexpected problems, but you can be sure that there's a true Witcher heartbeats in this project and we won't do anything that goes against it. If we face a problem doing something, instead of doing it poorly we will rather not do it at all, or do something else instead.  That's our philosophy.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • SHARE, SHARE and SHARE ^_^
  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign around all Witcher communities!
  • If you are a Youtuber, talk about us!
  • Use Indiegogo Share tools!
  • ....and SHARE! :P

story:
Tales From The Otherside will be a web series that is going to challenge the status quo. Each episode will be heavily influenced by the writer's own unique perspective on today's cultural issues; issues that many of us encounter but are often afraid to talk about and discuss.  Our host Candy Girl will introduce every episode. She will provoke the audience to ask questions about society while inviting them to venture into a new frame of mind. 

We're just getting started so we need you to help us finance the pilot episode, "Does It Stink Like Rotten Mean?" written by Micheal Cox and inspired by the poem "Harlem" by Langston Hughes. The story follows a Los Angeles deputy who is brought to poetic justice through mysterious forces after he murders an unarmed black teen.

In order to take this series to the next level we are looking for at least $10,000 to produce the pilot. This story deserves to be handled carefully, respectfully and to our fullest ability; we cannot do that without the proper funding. In order to bring you a high quality production, we will use all of money for necessities like equipment, crew and catering and solid locations. 

By contributing to our campaign you will be directly involved with perpetuating the point of view of a diverse team that is giving a voice to those who are usually told to be silent. You will be introducing our audience to a new kind of horror that is culturally relevant and terrifying.

We have a hard working, talented team but film making is still an ambitious venture. Every film that is made has a village behind it and a lot of money. Basically, we're trying to avoid racking up credit card debit. For a more detailed breakdown of the budget feel free to email us at tftoside@gmail.com .

*All funds raised through the campaign will go directly towards the production costs for "Does It Stink Like Rotten Meat?" 

 If you don't have the funds, you can support us in other ways: 

Follow us on social media at the below handles:

Instagram @talesfromthe0therside

Facebook https://www.facebook.com/talesfromtheotherside/

Twitter @tfto7

And SHARE!!!!

Sincerely, Rose, Gina, Sumeet, Michael and Geordan
story_txt:
Tales From The Otherside will be a web series that is going to challenge the status quo. Each episode will be heavily influenced by the writer's own unique perspective on today's cultural issues; issues that many of us encounter but are often afraid to talk about and discuss.  Our host Candy Girl will introduce every episode. She will provoke the audience to ask questions about society while inviting them to venture into a new frame of mind. 


We're just getting started so we need you to help us finance the pilot episode, "Does It Stink Like Rotten Mean?" written by Micheal Cox and inspired by the poem "Harlem" by Langston Hughes. The story follows a Los Angeles deputy who is brought to poetic justice through mysterious forces after he murders an unarmed black teen.
In order to take this series to the next level we are looking for at least $10,000 to produce the pilot. This story deserves to be handled carefully, respectfully and to our fullest ability; we cannot do that without the proper funding. In order to bring you a high quality production, we will use all of money for necessities like equipment, crew and catering and solid locations. 
By contributing to our campaign you will be directly involved with perpetuating the point of view of a diverse team that is giving a voice to those who are usually told to be silent. You will be introducing our audience to a new kind of horror that is culturally relevant and terrifying.


We have a hard working, talented team but film making is still an ambitious venture. Every film that is made has a village behind it and a lot of money. Basically, we're trying to avoid racking up credit card debit. For a more detailed breakdown of the budget feel free to email us at tftoside@gmail.com .
*All funds raised through the campaign will go directly towards the production costs for "Does It Stink Like Rotten Meat?" 
 If you don't have the funds, you can support us in other ways: 

Follow us on social media at the below handles:
Instagram @talesfromthe0therside
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/talesfromtheotherside/
Twitter @tfto7
And SHARE!!!!
Sincerely, Rose, Gina, Sumeet, Michael and Geordan

story:
Overview

Conservative Indian patriarch Amol Tyagi allows college friend Akash Malhotra and his family to stay for a few days at his house before they move across the country. The two families find themselves at odds due to their conflicting worldviews, all the more complicated by an inconvenient secret Akash is hiding. 

 

Our Story

In the 90s, there was Friends and Seinfeld. More recently, there was The Office. And they were all... amazing. 

Not simply because they were funny, but because they related to a particular tone that everyone had towards their daily lives. Friends was for the feel-good crowd while Seinfeld was for the sarcastic- regardless, we all had a Joey, Ross, Rachel, George, and sometimes even, a Kramer in our lives. 

What about the Indians? Where was the show like that for them?

To be honest, it's not a question many of us even considered. Why would we? We had Bollywood, with its larger than life heroes, and the feel-good drama that they brought to our families.

Plus, who ever heard of an Indian sitcom? "First focus on studies. Your grades- that is real joke."

Everyone's likely heard the occasional roast from their parents, the judgmental vibe a family friend gave when they did something remotely  "controversial", and faced the stresses it means to be an Indian-American growing up today. In fact, we have a meme group dedicated to this shared experience - Subtle Curry Traits -The Facebook Group. 

So when a family friend asked us, "Why don't you make an Indian sitcom", the question was baffling. We laugh at everything our community says and thus, and nonetheless we embrace it. But a public comedy? What would our parents say?? Would they let us watch this "garbage"? 

That's when it hit, we had to make this show. We had to take this shared experience we have, and show the most honest portrayal of it, one where no one had a filter. They were just being themselves, living their daily lives, being the memes they are and experience. Because they're us. And we're them. 

The Office meets an Indian-American household. The satire our community needs. For the demand that definitely exists. 

Cast and Characters

The Tyagis

Mehak Arora -  Mehak is currently an MBA student at DePaul University, in her spare time she enjoys acting in short films, working out and trying new restaurants in the Chicagoland area. She hopes to continue acting in projects that help narrate the stories of the South Asian diaspora.

Swati Kukian - Swati grew up in India and pursued her education in MBA Finance. She is currently working in the finance sector as an Analyst and in her leisure time she loves cooking, dancing and acting. She believes and says that "to be an actor you need to have a certain kind of madness", and believes that madness is within her :).

Rajesh Hatkar - Rajesh is an avid cricket and movie lover. He has been living in Chicago with his family for the past 25+ years. Acting has been his long-lost childhood dream.

Yash Hatkar - Yash is the creator of Thuggood Films and Co-Creator of Upside Brown - The Series, has worked with a wide variety of projects ranging from documentaries, film scripts, and TV show trailers and episodes.  As a writer-director specializing in satires and dramas, he seeks to create movies and shows that highlight the difficult situations society deals with on a daily basis, in the most light and entertaining way possible, never forgetting to make us laugh while we think about ourselves and the world around us. 

Lata Hatkar - Lata has been living in Chicago with her son Rajesh for the past 15 years. She is a loving grandma with a heart full of youth. 

The Malhotras

 

Rahul Dhiman - Rahul, the Co-Creator of 2 EC Productions and Co-Creator of Upside Brown - The Series, is a Chicago based actor-writer with experience in content creation in a wide range of genres. He looks forward to bringing to light the experiences of Indian-Americans through his current and future work.

Madhura Sane - Madhura is the Director of Nritya Natya Academy, a Kathak Institute, and actively teaches Kathak worldwide and conducts exams at Gandharva Level in the same. Madhura has extensive background and experience in Acting in Theater and Films. She has recently completed a Punjabi Regional Film, along with an Urdu, Hindi, and two Marathi films. She has worked in English, Hindi, and Marathi theater and has training in the same. Madhura, actively direct, choreographed and performs Dance Musicals. Her profile and details can be found on madhuraonline.com or facebook.com/actordancermadhura.

Raj Dhiman - Raj has been part of various filmmaking ventures through 2 EC Productions, both internationally in India and domestically in the United States. He looks forward to producing more projects that foster growth in the realm of Indian and Indian-American content creation.

What's Next?

Our trailer and pilot episode are ready for you! But we don't want to stop there. We want to make the rest of Season 1, and give you more of the antics this crazy group of characters has to offer. 

Fundraising Period - April 2021 - May 2021

Pre-Production - June 2021 - September 2021

Production - October 2021 - January 2022

Post-Production - February 2022 - May 2022

 

Where Does The Money Go?

 

How You Can Help!

1. Donate to our campaign and choose your favorite perks.

2. Share this campaign with your friends and family!

3. Follow the show on Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube! 

Thank you so much for your support!

- The Upside Brown Team

story:
Who I Am & Why Am I So Passionate About Recovery Unplugged!

Hi! I'm Amy Leigh McCorkle, an award winning, bestselling author, blogger, screenwriter and filmmaker. I have published 27 books, 3 of them non-fiction detailing my journey from diagnosis with bipolar to 11x Amazon Bestseller, including the international bestselling memoir Letters to Daniel. The award nominated Something to Believe In (a part how to/part memoir on how to thrive creatively while coping with serious mental illness). And the behind to scenes memoir on the Making of Letters to Daniel, the feature film adapted from the memoir of the same name.

In 2014 my producing partner and I established Healing Hands Entertainment. Since then we have written 34+ award winning scripts and 23 award winning films, including Letters to Daniel, which I directed.

Recovery Unplugged is an extension of that film's legacy about and on my life. Recovery Unplugged seeks to demystify and destigmatize mental illness by interviewing celebrities and putting a recognizable face to it. And recognizing independent artists who are beating the odds and succeeding, and providing them with a leg up in their chosen field. Be it filmmaking, acting, publishing, screenwriting, ect.

Everyone at Healing Hands Entertainment believes in order to change the landscape of mental health awareness you have to be willing to think outside the box and we and the rest of the team believe Recovery Unplugged is just the way to do it! This is a highly personal project to me. I was diagnosed with bipolar disorder 21 years ago and although the journey was arduous, my strongest purpose in life is to shine a light for others struggling to let them know they are not alone. And that there is hope, there is healing, and that there is recovery.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to film this pilot and make it the most beautiful and effective that it can we've broken the budget down to $3,000. That will cover the basics, such as sound cards, video cards, the need to rent some lighting equipment, transportation and housing costs, location costs, crew payment, wardrobe, make-up, and catering and the editor. It all goes towards making the show as impactful as it can be.

That's what we get. What do you get you ask?

Some of the awesome perks include a shoutout on social media. Sponsorship, you make a set donation and you and your project get a plug DURING the pilot episode! Another perk, a special thank credit at the end of the show! And there's even a perk to be a guest on the show should the show get picked-up by a network for distribution! Not to mention an IMBD co-producer credit which will get you a private zoom screening with the producer, director, and stars of Letters to Daniel!

ALL FUNDS go directly to the production of the television pilot. This show WILL tape, God and corona willing in February 2021. And a private zoom screening of the finished product will held for ALL donors.

The Impact

Recovery Unplugged is important to me because it allows me to give back a community that has given me so much over the past 21 years. The mental health community has provided me with proper treatment (albeit after a rocky start) and support as I grew into my stability. I feel it is important to the world, is because though people are more open now there is still a tremendous amount of stigma in this world and it keeps the people who need it from getting help. A show like this would let them know they are not alone and would let them know where to get help.

As I've mentioned I've directed 23 films. With Black Gold, Letters to Daniel:Breakdown to Bestseller, Something to Believe In and Broken all receiving distribution. The Letters to Daniel feature film is being screened for distributors, investors, and producers, in September and already has an offer of distribution from ParablesTV.

1 in 5 people will be diagnosed with a mental health crisis in their lifetime. Close to 50 million people are currently diagnosed with a serious mental illness in the United States. A show like this is needed to not only open up the dialogue on mental health further, but to start to create change in how we address the mentally ill population as a whole.

Risks & Challenges

Shooting and launching a TV Talk Show takes money, time, and connections. You usually  need a platform. And usually when people think of platforms people think of Kelly Ripa, Kelly Clarkson, Oprah Winfrey, Dr. Phil and Dr. Oz.

Since 2013 Letters to Daniel has been a popular blog, a bestselling memoir, an award winning documentary, spawned a behind the scenes memoir, as well as an award nominated how to memoir, and award winning feature film. Recovery Unplugged continues in that legacy and I am uniquely qualified to do it because of my successful recovery journey which includes a successful career which started in February of 2011. Since which I have won 111 awards across my body of work.

I plan on tackling the above challenges by utilizing my skills for making the most of a microbudget. Assembling a crack team of producers, crew, and post production team by drawing from amazing pool of filmmaker friends I have amassed during my career.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give monetarily, I encourage you to vocally support the Recover Unplugged mission by using the Indiegogo share tools!
