story:
Summary

"SHAYLA'S CATCH"  REBOOT - The Prequels. By Sonya Jenkins

With the Coronavirus Pandemic shutting down the film industry for a while and many actors not knowing when they'd work again, I wanted to continue bringing forth creative content that afforded actors a chance to showcase their talent, even when they were social distancing. I also wanted to continue with my first filmmaking initiative - "Shayla's Catch" film project - and celebrate our 1-year Anniversary on Amazon Prime Video., Sharing the backstory of "Shayla's Catch" seemed like the best option for me to continue creating, so within weeks of getting the idea to relaunch the "Shayla's Catch" initiative (with prequels), I successfully birthed my first self-taped web series. "Before The Catch" was released via YouTube (via Sonya's Spotlight) and FilmFreeway.com October 15, 2020. Each actor in "Before The Catch" was responsible for self-taping their own scene and given a deadline to send the director their scene back - approximately one week. I only provided the actors with sides (script) and a few details. Hence, 10 out of 13 actors I approached got their scenes back to me within a few days, and "Shayla's Catch Prequel" was born - "Before The Catch." On November 16 "Shayla's Catch Prequel" premiered on Amazpm Prime Video. You can check out the first episode here:  https://www.amazon.com/Catching-Feelings/dp/B08....

Synopsis:

 "Before The Catch," the melodrama prequel to "Shayla's Catch" film, introduces viewers to the lifestyle of Calvin CK Moore, a wealthy NFL star wide receiver, played by Oshea Russell. The football journey and the intimate life of CK Moore is lavish and complicated. He often brags, "The more they see me, the more they want me," but is put to the test as he juggles multiple women, who all claim him as their man. CK's main girl, Mia Falana, played by Amina Buddafly,  has to come to terms with whether she should hang on to her playboy boyfriend or give him a dose of his own medicine. The story presents many questions about faithfulness and loyalty - even down to CK's cousin Dexter Moore (Isaiah Lucas) who always watches out for (and sometimes lies for) his popular football star cousin, CK. "Before The Catch" also introduces Shayla Lucas (played by Kyleigh Campbell in the prequel) who is seeking an ultimate catch.  In "Before The Catch" viewers will also meet lovebirds, Steve and Tacara, Shayla's mom, Connie, Shayla's aunt Sydney, Deidra (a designer who owns her own boutique), Epiphany (an NFL owner's daughter), and her soon-to-be mentor, Claire Jones (played by me), who often advises her son, Diego Jones, in his own relationship dilemmas. The "Before The Catch" prequels will be less than 20 minute each - giving glimpses into the lives of each character - leading up to "Shayla's Catch."

 

Director's Statement:

The process of preparing for "Shayla's Catch," the film, began before it even became a book, but when my nephew, a former college football player at Arizona State University, had a football game in Los Angeles against the USC Trojans in 2018, I scheduled a Table Read the next day. It went so well, that I had actors calling me to be a part of the project. I scheduled another Table Read and knew exactly who I should choose as Lead and Supporting actors. My first Shayla in "Shayla's Catch" is the daughter of Super Bowl Champion and former Wider Receiver of the Chicago Bears and L.A. Raiders (and the fastest man in the world in his age group) Willie Gault. I knew that Shakari Gault would be a good fit for the role of Shayla based on her acting ability (I had viewed some of her work), her knowledge about the football life and her beauty. 


The two tables reads and auditions, and my already promoting SHAYLA'S CATCH (the novel), garnered so much attention that people began texting and calling me (out of the blue) to ask if they could be a part of the project. Many offered something in return - their location (if they weren't actors) or wardrobe. But my actors auditioned for and earned their roles. 

I am so proud of my cast and the way we all came together. If I didn't choose them through an audition, I saw their work in film projects or on stage. I also took referrals. In short, I have the best cast I could ever dream of having. I wanted to wait out for Michael B. Jordan as CK Moore,  a character who is flamboyant and cocky (yes, I dream big), but I figured forging ahead with the actors I had at hand was to my best interest. 

I wanted "Shayla's Catch" and "Before The Catch" prequel to get to the core of what it's really like to date or marry a man of stature, who has prowess and money. The twists and turns will sometimes have viewers on an emotional roller-coaster, and at other times, the audience will feel a sense of romance and enlightenment. I present to you, "Before The Catch," the prequel for "Shayla's Catch."

Your contribution as an Angel Investor to keep this project going - from production to pitching - would be greatly appreciate. Please check back for the breakdown of what is needed.

You can also contribute via $GoSJ via CashApp - the personal CashApp of Sonya Jenkins. Each $200 or more contributor will get a walk-on (2 line) role in "Before The Catch" prequel. 

Thanks, in advance.
Sonya Jenkins 
Producer/Director/Writer

My first Shayla in "Shayla's Catch" is the daughter of Super Bowl Champion and former Wider Receiver of the Chicago Bears and L.A. Raiders (and the fastest man in the world in his age group) Willie Gault. I knew that Shakari Gault would be a good fit for the role of Shayla based on her acting ability (I had viewed some of her work), her knowledge about the football life and her beauty. The two tables reads and auditions, and my already promoting SHAYLA'S CATCH (the novel), garnered so much attention that people began texting and calling me (out of the blue) to ask if they could be a part of the project. Many offered something in return - their location (if they weren't actors) or wardrobe. But my actors auditioned for and earned their roles. I am so proud of my cast and the way we all came together. If I didn't choose them through an audition, I saw their work in film projects or on stage. I also took referrals. In short, I have the best cast I could ever dream of having. I wanted to wait out for Michael B. Jordan as CK Moore,  a character who is flamboyant and cocky (yes, I dream big), but I figured forging ahead with the actors I had at hand was to my best interest. I wanted "Shayla's Catch" and "Before The Catch" prequel to get to the core of what it's really like to date or marry a man of stature, who has prowess and money. The twists and turns will sometimes have viewers on an emotional roller-coaster, and at other times, the audience will feel a sense of romance and enlightenment. I present to you, "Before The Catch," the prequel for "Shayla's Catch."Your contribution as an Angel Investor to keep this project going - from production to pitching - would be greatly appreciate. Please check back for the breakdown of what is needed.You can also contribute via $GoSJ via CashApp - the personal CashApp of Sonya Jenkins. Each $200 or more contributor will get a walk-on (2 line) role in "Before The Catch" prequel. Thanks, in advance.Sonya Jenkins Producer/Director/Writer

story:
Short Summary

Each episode of this full-length television series touches upon a different issue that many people all over the world struggle with today. All who back Gorama, will be helping support:

  • Ocean Conservation
  • Public Schools
  • Bee conservancy
  • Clean Air
  • Solar Energy
  • Endangered Animals
  • Poverty struck areas
  • Refugees
  • Woman's equality
  • Racial equality

And so on...

Overall, this series will be helping around 23 different charitable groups.We hope to bring insight into some of the tribulations of today and also give back a physical aid to these groups. A portion of each episode's budget has been allocated to giving back to a specific movements.

Gorama is a world of its own, inhabited by Goramites. Goramites are those that have achieved higher spiritual enlightenment in their past life through many principles of self control; the next world for them was the one you live in. Your donation will serve as a priceless aid in helping benefit the world we share.

Why me?

I came from Gorama with a purpose. My family has personally faced the hardship of immigration as I know many other families have. Learning form this experience and the experiences of others has inspired us to make this benevolant series that gives back and try to have some laughs along the way. This is a collaborative effort so really, 'Why us?' and not just me, because we Goramites are here to make a stand for what we believe in.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make the full-length pilot and our first step in benefiting this world we need to gather a total of $15,000. I myself will match this with my own funds to the best of my abilities. So in return for your generosity, we have put together a selection of skits that you may choose from in the rewards.

What your donation is going to:

  • Donation to ocean conservation first
  • Indiegogo takes their cut
  • Insurance for the crew members
  • Equipment (insurance for that too)
  • Securing Locations 
  • Transportation 
  • Food for set
  • Crew comp.

If we do not reach our goal but go beyond half, we will still make the donation of $1,000 to Ocean conservation however, the Gorama series is dead and all of the other organizations are left out in the cold. With any money left over, we will be giving away 10% of that to our next organization and the rest goes back into keeping this project alive.

The Impact

Your contribution will aid in the longevity of our world and the peacefulness of it.

Your individual role in this by making any. ANY, sort of donation is an incredibly valuable and appreciated help in saving our world. 

The world is in danger but you can be proactive in saving it by donating today.

Risks & Challenges

Since this is considered a low budget production it is hard to secure all the locations we want or book the cast and crew that we want but you may have comfort knowing that the Gorama Crew is here to deliver at any rate. Our collective passion and drive is with the sole purpose to deliver to you, future Goramites.

Nothing will stop us.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you are unable to donate, but spreading the word don't cost a thing so flap those gums in every which direction and let people know what Gorama is!

 

FOR GORAMA!

story:
Welcome to season five  of "Child of the '70s."  Our first four seasons were largely self-funded by its creator, Michael Vaccaro, along with donations from fans like you.  This season we really want to step it up a notch and help reward the cast and crew with more than just "copy, credit and meals."  Our team worked tirelessly to bring our show to the world and we would like to thank them.

A remarkable amount of money actually goes into producing a show like ours. Equipment rentals, location fees, gas, food and lodging are but the tip of the iceberg. There are also music licensing, post production costs and operating expenses.

We certainly hope you can find it in your hearts and your pocketbooks to donate to our fifth and final season of "Child of the '70s."  

Here are some of the stars of Child of the '70s:

Comedians Bruce Vilanch & Judy Tenuta, Ted Lange (The Love Boat), Gina Hecht (Mork and Mindy), Geri Jewell (The Facts of Life), Lynne Marie Stewart (It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia), Carole Ita White (Laverne and Shirley), the original cowboy from The Village People Randy Jones, LATalk Radio Host Sheena Metal, Amy Linker (Square Pegs), Terry Ray (From Here On Out), Bonnie Sher (Soap), Susan Olsen (The Brady Bunch), Donna Pescow (Angie), Mel England (Ron and Laura Take Back America) and Broadway stars Duane Boutte, Chuck Saculla, Natalie Toro and Lorinda Lisitza, and of course, the creator Michael Vaccaro. 

The show is co-written by Michael Vaccaro and Terrence Moss.  

Co-executive producers are Charlie Vaughn and Michael Vaccaro.

Directed by Tom Pardoe.

story:
About

A mature coming of age series that focuses on a hard-headed drop-out who must deal with consequences when her attitude & selfish actions bite her back.

 

 

Crew

 

Jenna Lam | Creator

Jenna

Jenna is the creator of “Ambitious”, a mature coming-of-age series. She has past experience at Playhouse West Philadelphia as an Acting student and is pursuing Film and Media Arts at Temple University. She creates work with the goal of expanding people of color’s stories through media and hopes to use “Ambitious” as a vessel to push people of color’s narratives.

 

Samantha Tan | Showrunner

Samantha

Samantha is from Lansdale, PA - originally born and raised in Massachusetts. Before going into producing, she has done a lot of animations, voice acting, and poetry. As she continues to develop herself as a filmmaker, she finds herself falling more in love with producing, writing and directing. She wants to open up her own production company one day.

 

Matthew Jenkins | Creative Producer & Writer

Matthew 

Matthew recently graduated Summa Cum Laude from Temple University with a degree in Film and Media Arts. He is from the Eastern Shore of Maryland, and grew up with a passion for writing. Matt is dedicated to telling diverse stories in a visual medium, and would one day like to publish a novel.

 

Chineme Aniagba | Head Writer

Chineme 

Chineme is a rising senior film major and art minor. Born in Queens, NY with her eyes glued to a TV screen - it was a medical anomaly that very few doctors could understand - she always enjoyed good serial content. She hopes to make a whole bunch of television shows in the near future.

 

Gabby Miele | Head of Marketing

Gabby

Gabby is a one of a kind, running around, worldly gal. After going through every phase possible in thinking about careers, she decided Marketing was her best choice to be the career woman she always wanted to be. She is the Head of Marketing for Ambitious, works as an Account Manager at another company and goes to school on top. Constantly exhausted, she is ready to roll. 

 

Budget

 

 

Cast - With such a beautiful cast working beside us, we would like to thank them for making this film possible. We value and appreciate them for all of their hard work and would like to pay them for their extraordinary talents.

Transportation - Ambitious' cast and crew will consist of 15 to 30 people on each shooting date. When it comes to traveling from one location to another, we want to make sure that we transport our cast and crew safely. Another priority would be efficiently transporting all of our equipment. 

Props & Wardrobe - As colorful as our cast already is, we want to make sure that our characters come to life! With all the props and the right wardrobe, not only will we be able to demonstrate different cultures and aesthetics, but we can also tell a stronger story.  

Location - Ambitious is a six episode series that requires a lot of attention to the locations; there are at least 3 to 5 different locations per episode. In order to create the right atmosphere for each scene, we fit the cost into our budget so we can find the best possible locations to film at.

Equipment - With a goal to deliver the best quality possible for our web series,  we want our cinematographer and crew to have all the equipment they need to make this film the best it can be. Although Temple University is generous enough to provide us with some equipment, we will also be renting equipment from other rental house, as well.

Craft Services - Who's hungry?! Our cast and crew will be, while they're working hard on those long film dates! On each film date, we will have 15 to 30 people, so we want to make sure everyone's happy and well fed!

Festivals - Not only are we planning to submit our web series on different platforms, but we are also going to submit our web series to festivals! We want to be able to show everyone our cast and crew's endless efforts, amazing talents, and support throughout this project.

Post-Production - What was that? We finished filming an episode? It's time to contact our Editor then! Our Editor will be working his or her magic to polish our episodes up! Post-Production  is another important step to any film, and we want to be able thank him for his time and efforts. We would also like to save some money for any potential composers our Editor may like to work with. 

The Impact

I want to present a different perspective on the Asian Americans’ experiences. Asian Americans are usually categorized as the ones who are the most accomplished, efficient, and put-together. Not only does this project challenge that viewpoint, but it also helps relieve the pressure to be perfect off of many Asian Americans’ shoulders.

Additionally, this project reveals another intersectionality: the black bi-sexual female nerd who is still learning how to accept herself for who she is. The show takes pride in developing characters that are unique, as well as learning how to validate themselves. We open the doors for discussion on identity, relationships, friendships, college pressure, and our loyalty to uphold the family’s expectations.

Risks & Challenges

These are a few of our concerns while creating this web series:

1. Transporting a 15+ cast and crew, as well as equipment
2. Renting all the necessary equipment we need 
3. Purchasing all props and wardrobe materials 
4. Paying for any and all locations 

Being fully funded would help us prepare for these challenges, as well as any other obstacles we may face in the future. We want to be able to face this production with confidence and preparation for any possible challenges along the way. In order to make this web series the best as it can be, we have to prepare to transport our cast and crew, as well as equipment, efficiently and safely.  With a goal to avoid any issues during production, we have to properly prepare for any risks and challenges in order to make this film the best it can be. We want to be able to present a story that a lot of people are familiar with and can relate to, no matter what their cultural background is. 

Be AMBITIOUS with US!

Loving what you see? SAY NO MORE!

Like our Facebook Page at "Ambitious, the Web Series," and follow us on Instagram for more updates and photos @ambitious.series!

We will be launching our website very soon, so keep an eye out for that, as well!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Let me introduce you to my new docuseries, Travel Queen ❤️;

Travel Queen will focus on volunteering for various altruistic organizations while also traveling on a budget as a single woman. It will highlight various subjects such as safety, gratitude, mental & physical health, and the amazingly rewarding experience that is volunteering. 
The series will also explore whatever shenanigans I get myself into as a sideshow and burlesque performer, and enthusiastic extrovert, as well as exploring the amazing connections that can be made when traveling and the transformative experiences one goes through.

It will be raw. 
It will be honest. 
It will not be overproduced.

I feel like this series may be especially pertinent due to our current political environment here in the US. It's been so hard for me and so many other people I know to just sit back and watch the craziness. There's only so much we can do, and it varies for each of us. I hope that this series can help shine a light on the fact that there are other ways we can help, too. And that you don't need to be independently wealthy to travel and have amazing experiences, while simultaneously helping out the animals, the planet, or your fellow human.

In order to get Travel Queen off the ground I am looking to raise $35,000.  The money will be used to cover travel, crew, equipment, production, and post production costs in order to be able to complete filming in Thailand at an elephant sanctuary and return to the States to do post production, after which I intend to use the footage to pitch the show in order to get it picked up as a regular series.

Don't forget, if you can't donate, PLEASE share!  I want to get the word out about Travel Queen so I can make this happen, and you have the power to help me do it!

The show will be dedicated to the memories of Erin Briana O'Brien and of my father, Gerrit de Beer. (Therefore I'm gonna have to make sure the production we've got in the works kicks as much butt as possible). 
Thank you to everyone that believes in me. I'm so grateful to everyone that's been there for me over the past few years. They were some of the toughest I've ever had to live through but
I've come out ravenous for life on the other side and I can't wait to sink my teeth into this exciting new adventure. 
This is just the beginning...
❤️
- Reina

story:
Some small town folks from a farming community in Central California have masqueraded themselves into the Big City to show them that AWESOME TALENT can be found everywhere. Several residents from Hanford/Visalia area have quickly established themselves as formidable opponents in the Hunger Games that is Hollywood. A Talent Manager, A Filmmaker, Two Actresses, An Actor, Four brilliant boy wonders and a darling diva are making waves. Represented by some top agencies and management, booking roles on their FIRST AUDITIONS and staying humble to their roots.

That is how COMMUNITY THEATER was inspired. Our common thread is the admiration we have for the training and source of entertainment we received at our local struggling, Play Houses. Now that we are in the door, its time time to give back to our community and film a legitimate web series in our home towns and pay homage to the awesome and mostly crazy folks that bring theater to life and teach our children performance art, when the school system cannot. 

Kasey Atkins is a recent Film School Graduate. For several years he has been producing short features, documentaries and spec commercials. When his wife Christa found representation in Los Angeles, along with his nephew Wyatt Danger Schmitt. They decided to team up with other local child actors from the area that are also pursuing a career in Hollywood. This Pilot Presentation hopes to gain popularity and investments to carry on a full 12 episode season. Each webisode will be approximately 10 minutes. 

In a rural area like Kings/Tulare County (3 hours North of Los Angeles) there is not a lot of opportunity for performance art, certainly not film. Most anyone who wants to perform does so at  their local Community Theater, which we are blessed to have a few of. Drama programs are cut all around the country and these outlets allow kids to learn performance art education hands-on and discover their inner talents. The several children in this series all started on the small stage locally and were discovered and encouraged by their teachers to pursue a dream of professional acting in Hollywood. Each of them have defied the odds very early and have found success that is building a career and future for them. 

The Pitch

A local worn out but not forgotten community theatre is on the brink of being bought out to a pair of greedy real estate developers. Somehow Less Moore, the altruistic theater director must collaborate with his friends and oddball kids who never leave the Theater to create a plan, a play and a promise.

Aren't You DYING To Know What Will Happen?

Then support this pilot so we can continue our plan for a full hilarious season. With a production number in the Season Finale that will leave you...... 

The CAST

Caleb Brown (Mother's Day, The Odd Couple)

     

Corey Ralston  (KIDS Incorporated, Youth Talent Manager)

Henry Allen (Big Brother Trouble)

Christa Atkins (Summerhouse)

Ty Correia (Emma Rae)

Wyatt Danger Schmitt (My Father, The Serial Killer)

Becca Coffey (Stage Ingenue)

Tarrick Walker (NIKE)

Corrina Castro (our fresh new actress)

 

The Message

While "Community Theater" will poke fun at the various characters you might run into on the small stage it carries some very important underlying messages. 

  1.  Arts Education is vitally important to our youth. California has slashed the budget for such programs and no such opportunity could exist without the amazing leaders in the community that donate their time to run non-profit community theaters and youth drama programs. By showcasing the tireless efforts of the community theater members and the kids whose inner diva was about to burst, we shed light on a sect of your community volunteer efforts you may not have been aware of and hope you will seek out a local theater to patronage. 
  2. Theater is NOT a dying art form. For decades there is ongoing speculation that theater is a dying art form, especially in our media obsessed culture. While it is hard for local community theaters to get butts in the seats and keep the lights on, there is renewed energy in today's youth that are in need of an artistic sanctuary to express themselves. The kids find a strong love for plays and musicals and ditch their peers suggestions of pop music for show tunes. In recent years Broadway has had a renaissance of modern and compelling theater that crossed cultural and socio-economic barriers like Hamilton and Book of Mormon. Keeping the youth engaged in theater assures its survival and promises another generation that will shake NYC up and create even more cutting edge productions. 

Why We Need You?

Here is how $2000 in donations will just begin to help us in getting this to your media screens:

  • A  required minimum insurance policy is needed to not only protect the actors but the venues we will shoot in as well. Quotes received range from $1600 to $2000 for a weekend shoot.
  • Our union performer receives a standard "day rate"  plus possible overtime upwards of $200
  • Since everyone else (volunteer cast and crew) is working for peanuts, we must provide them with FOOD. A craft service budget for the weekend can cost at least $150 for a cast and crew of over 20.
  • Some Audio and Video Equipment will be rented and insured costing a fee of more than $300
  • Post-Production and Marketing efforts can range from at least $250
  • That puts us at a minimum of $2500 for producing just the Pilot !

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If funds are tight YOU can still help us:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the share tools to announce to your circle about us!
  • Local volunteers may be needed - Email for more information
  • Support Arts Education and Community Theater efforts in your home town!

Visit our inspirational local Theater Pages:

The Kings Players in Hanford

Tulare County Office of Education - Theatre Co.

The Visalia Community Players

Tulare's Encore Theater
story_txt:
Some small town folks from a farming community in Central California have masqueraded themselves into the Big City to show them that AWESOME TALENT can be found everywhere. Several residents from Hanford/Visalia area have quickly established themselves as formidable opponents in the Hunger Games that is Hollywood. A Talent Manager, A Filmmaker, Two Actresses, An Actor, Four brilliant boy wonders and a darling diva are making waves. Represented by some top agencies and management, booking roles on their FIRST AUDITIONS and staying humble to their roots.
That is how COMMUNITY THEATER was inspired. Our common thread is the admiration we have for the training and source of entertainment we received at our local struggling, Play Houses. Now that we are in the door, its time time to give back to our community and film a legitimate web series in our home towns and pay homage to the awesome and mostly crazy folks that bring theater to life and teach our children performance art, when the school system cannot. 
Kasey Atkins is a recent Film School Graduate. For several years he has been producing short features, documentaries and spec commercials. When his wife Christa found representation in Los Angeles, along with his nephew Wyatt Danger Schmitt. They decided to team up with other local child actors from the area that are also pursuing a career in Hollywood. This Pilot Presentation hopes to gain popularity and investments to carry on a full 12 episode season. Each webisode will be approximately 10 minutes. 
In a rural area like Kings/Tulare County (3 hours North of Los Angeles) there is not a lot of opportunity for performance art, certainly not film. Most anyone who wants to perform does so at  their local Community Theater, which we are blessed to have a few of. Drama programs are cut all around the country and these outlets allow kids to learn performance art education hands-on and discover their inner talents. The several children in this series all started on the small stage locally and were discovered and encouraged by their teachers to pursue a dream of professional acting in Hollywood. Each of them have defied the odds very early and have found success that is building a career and future for them. 
The Pitch
A local worn out but not forgotten community theatre is on the brink of being bought out to a pair of greedy real estate developers. Somehow Less Moore, the altruistic theater director must collaborate with his friends and oddball kids who never leave the Theater to create a plan, a play and a promise.
Aren't You DYING To Know What Will Happen?
Then support this pilot so we can continue our plan for a full hilarious season. With a production number in the Season Finale that will leave you...... 
The CAST
Caleb Brown (Mother's Day, The Odd Couple)
     
Corey Ralston  (KIDS Incorporated, Youth Talent Manager)

Henry Allen (Big Brother Trouble)

Christa Atkins (Summerhouse)

Ty Correia (Emma Rae)

Wyatt Danger Schmitt (My Father, The Serial Killer)

Becca Coffey (Stage Ingenue)

Tarrick Walker (NIKE)

Corrina Castro (our fresh new actress)

 
The Message
While "Community Theater" will poke fun at the various characters you might run into on the small stage it carries some very important underlying messages. 

 Arts Education is vitally important to our youth. California has slashed the budget for such programs and no such opportunity could exist without the amazing leaders in the community that donate their time to run non-profit community theaters and youth drama programs. By showcasing the tireless efforts of the community theater members and the kids whose inner diva was about to burst, we shed light on a sect of your community volunteer efforts you may not have been aware of and hope you will seek out a local theater to patronage. 

Theater is NOT a dying art form. For decades there is ongoing speculation that theater is a dying art form, especially in our media obsessed culture. While it is hard for local community theaters to get butts in the seats and keep the lights on, there is renewed energy in today's youth that are in need of an artistic sanctuary to express themselves. The kids find a strong love for plays and musicals and ditch their peers suggestions of pop music for show tunes. In recent years Broadway has had a renaissance of modern and compelling theater that crossed cultural and socio-economic barriers like Hamilton and Book of Mormon. Keeping the youth engaged in theater assures its survival and promises another generation that will shake NYC up and create even more cutting edge productions. 


Why We Need You?
Here is how $2000 in donations will just begin to help us in getting this to your media screens:

A  required minimum insurance policy is needed to not only protect the actors but the venues we will shoot in as well. Quotes received range from $1600 to $2000 for a weekend shoot.
Our union performer receives a standard "day rate"  plus possible overtime upwards of $200

Since everyone else (volunteer cast and crew) is working for peanuts, we must provide them with FOOD. A craft service budget for the weekend can cost at least $150 for a cast and crew of over 20.
Some Audio and Video Equipment will be rented and insured costing a fee of more than $300

Post-Production and Marketing efforts can range from at least $250

That puts us at a minimum of $2500 for producing just the Pilot !


 
Other Ways You Can Help
If funds are tight YOU can still help us:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Use the share tools to announce to your circle about us!
Local volunteers may be needed - Email for more information
Support Arts Education and Community Theater efforts in your home town!

The Visalia Community Players

story:
We're a group of young, hungry, diverse & dynamic filmmakers and actors trying to bring joy to anyone who encounters our work. Creating anything of substance in Hollywood is incredibly difficult and made even more difficult when you don't have the financial backing from the major players. We want to tell stories that reflect who we are and that go outside the cookie-cutter norms. Representation is important to us. And we want to showcase that we too can make successful and inclusive content.

 

What we are looking to do here is simple - tell stories that will resonate with our audience with characters that look like them and sound like them and can be them. Because representation and inclusivity matters. Our stories have merit and are important.

 

By donating to this campaign, you are helping us show the powers that be that inclusive content and diverse casting and story-telling can be successful and people are craving for stories and characters who they can identify with and relate to.

 

Your contributions will make this show become a reality. Every single penny will go towards ensuring that IGPD is top-caliber entertainment and that will include, salaries, locations, casting,  equipment and marketing.

 

We want to make you laugh and show all the kids out there that if they dream big, work hard, are accountable and never make excuses - they too can make their dreams come true.

story:
What is MY FUTURE SELF?

Have you ever wondered what advice you would give yourself 10 years ago? Or wonder what yourself 10 years in the future would say to you now? What if you had the chance to speak to the future version of you 10 years in the future only to find out that your life has been completely derailed and you've become a hot mess? What would you do? Are you doomed to your fate, or do you have the ability to change it?Our TV show explores that exact concept in a fun, smart and original way.

What we need

As you can imagine, TV and Film get's VERY pricey to produce. Major Hollywood studios get millions of dollars to produce their shows. We have asked for favors and bargained our hearts out to find the cheapest possible way to shoot this project without compromising quality. All we need is 5000 dollars to pay for locations to film, camera rental, lighting equipment rental and insurance. All the cast and crew are donating their time and energy for free because they are all so excited about this project.

What you get

We have compiled a list of tons of cool rewards. Not only do we have rewards related to our product but also rewards that you would want in your day-to-day life. Some are fun, some are practical, and some are both. In any case, by choosing to buy a reward you will be helping this project get one step closer to becoming a reality.

story:
​Using the tricks of the trade, writer/producer extraordinaire, Sam, takes the average ordinary, unknown, southern belles and turns them into sassy, sultry, catfighting, divas that the media and fans can't get enough! With the help of a few friends, Sam gives the whole world and exclusive behind-the-scenes look at HOW TO MAKE A REALITY STAR. She live streams her play by play every step of the way. The result? Pure comedy and drama… of course!

 

 

  • Nazanin Mandi - IMDB
  • Cara Manuele - IMDB
  • Chelsea Alana Rivera - IMDB
  • Sheriee Nicole - IMDB
  • Aundre Dean - IMDB
  • Mikayla S Campbell - IMDB
  • Jillisa Lynn - IMDB
  • Zoe Lillian - IMDB

​

​

Director of Photography Show Reel 
 
  • Richard Bakewell - IMDB
  • Ellie Bootorich - IMDB
  • Patrick Dupree - IMDB

 

The show has completely wrapped filming and now we're ready to begin post-production, but there's one thing… we ran out of money. We're so close to being finished and want you to be a part of the SUCCESS! We've shot the show in its entirety so we are raising funds to complete post-production. The $15,000 we raise will go towards crew, post-production and fees. Things like: 

  • Editing
  • Color Correction
  • Sound (design and mixing) 
  • Soundtrack
  • Animation
  • Audio Description (to enable Closed-Captioned) 
  • Festival Submission Fees
  • Outstanding Fees Due to the Crew 

 

3 OTHER EASY WAYS TO HELP

Your voice counts! If you contribute, let people know. If you can't contribute, but like the project, let people know. Did we say let people know???  As often as you can, but without completely annoying the crap out of your friends.... Let people know!

#SHARE our Indiegogo page with your social network.

#TELL 10 friends or family members. Be an ambassador and ask them to join you in making a contribution.

#FOLLOW&LIKE our Indiegogo campaign (on the far left) and social media pages (click links below).

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • YouTube

 

We successfully wrapped production (HOORAY), so our number one risk is that there is no turning back!  This is Sheriee Nicole's first production in the role of Executive Producer/Director and with it, comes a huge learning curve. However, she is not only fortunate to have the guidance of industry vets mentoring her along the way, but she also has an AMAZING CAST & CREW who are passionate and excited about bringing the project to life! 

..And despite this being Sheriee's debut production, she, like the rest of the cast and crew,  have worked on countless other films, shows, commercials, and music/theatre productions and have over 20 years of combined industry experience!

story:
Our pilot episode follows 'Jude', who has just moved into a share house in Melbourne's inner-city. Jude is a kind, quiet young man, who just wants to get back on the straight and narrow. He soon finds it quite strange that his other three housemates, Ryan (a socially awkward med student), Maggie (a passive aggressive vegan), and Chloe  (a brutally honest and spoilt princess) - are incredibly stereotypical, and consumed by the milennial obsessions of the modern world. Jude attempts to confront his housemates, but his past catches up with all too soon.

 

Sharehouse revolves around core themes of stereotypes, reality vs. fiction, relationships, co-existing, social media addiction and the meaning of secrets.

Writer and Director, Alexandra, is a Film and TV student at JMC Academy. She has been involved in several projects from short films, music videos, TVC’s, however, has ultimately always wanted to make a TV series.

Her ultimate goal is to make something that revolves around the characters more than anything else.

She is influenced by classic 80’s films like The Breakfast Club, Ferris Bueller’s Day Off, Pretty in Pink. As well as more contemporary stories set in the modern world; Australian TV show, Please Like Me, Broad City, Go Girls and the Norwegian web series SKAM.
 

 



Catering - $300
With a crew and cast of over 15 people on each shooting day, we need to make sure everyone is well fed and looked after! Food is very important part of creating a happy set! Hanger is a real thing...

Airbnb - $850
We are currently looking for a real and authentic sharehouse place to film in. Airbnb has many great properties in Melbourne's inner-city suburbs, where we plan to shoot over 4 days.

Props and costumes - $200
The characters in the story are represented by their belongings and assets, rather than their personalities. We want to create your typical university sharehouse!

Perk Creations - $100
In order to reel you in, we need to make some paraphernalia to impress you! These creations will be exclusive to our 'Sharehouse' campaign and you can have these tangible little goodies forever! 

Equipment $150
We are aiming to use as much filming equipment from our Uni as possible, however, we will need to externally hire a few additional items, such as lighting and sound gear.

 

 

We feel very fortunate to have a cast and crew who are not only extremely talented, but also incredibly dedicated and hard working. Our 'Sharehouse' team are a fabulous bunch, alas, we need your help to bring our pilot to fruition. 

Any contribution, no matter or how great or small, will help us tremendously.

You can follow us on our Facebook and Instagram pages! We will regularly post photos throughout the entire production process, so our followers/audience can feel like they're right there with us!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sharehousewebseries/

Instagram: @sharehousewebseries

Also, each of the 4 characters will have their own Instagram pages with exclusive behind the scenes, actual videos as seen in the pilot, and general opinions and pictures from the character’s perspective, exclusive of the series itself.

Let's all live in a big metaphorical share house of our own! Spread the love and support our campaign!

Thanks so much,

The 'Sharehouse' team!

story:
Summary

My name is Zack Margaret. I am a senior at New York University studying film and television with a specialty in documentaries. I was born and raised in Connecticut and I'm so proud to be from there. That is one reason why Culture Un-Shock! is so important to me; I want to show what can come from my home state. I want to be able to give the people who may not have the proper representation in the media a chance to show their talents and speak their opinions in a way that will be heard. By contributing to this project you will be contributing to the change in the local narrative. By contributing to this project you will be helping educate people on cultures they would not be exposed to in their everyday lives. You will be giving people an outlet to have their own voices heard.

What We Need & What You Get

The primary use of the funding will go directly into the production. We are looking to upgrade our equipment to provide better quality footage, paying animators and licensing music so we will be able to promote the series on all platforms without any complications. Other uses of the funds are going to be for advertisement and travel expenses. By donating to this project you are giving back to the community because we are giving 20% of all proceeds to six local charities and organizations that correspond with the themes of our episodes!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate please share on your social media platforms! That would help the cause tremendously becuase it helps get the word out to others!

story:
UNBOXING is a web-series born out of the trending unboxing videos on YouTube with a dark twist. The concept was originally pitched at Melbourne Webfest 2019 which saw creator, Mitchell Holland, win the ABC iView Pitch competition, sending him to Marseille France for a writers room experience with LA industry professionals. Since then, a six part series has been written, a team of collaborative creators collected, actors auditioned and a funding video shot just in time for COVID to sweep the world and bring everything to a grinding halt. 

But excitement around UNBOXING still exists! We know the strength UNBOXING has. It has received glowing reviews at table reads, won development awards and is just in need of funding to help bring it to life.

How we want to make you smile.

We want you to know your contribution is integral next step to having UNBOXING come to life. By contibuting it will be you who has made this possible. We are looking at a minimum goal of $45,000AUD to cover the costs of creating this project. This amount will help to pay our talented crew and actors, cover location hire, post production, marketing and catering. Whilst any spill over funds will pad us with insurance around any unexpected surprises, further script development for seasons 2 and 3, and a percentage donation to a men's mental health foundation.

As a thank you for your contribution you will be eligible for:

  • your name in the credits of every episode! We don't mean just a blink, we'll linger. We'll linger for a good while!
  • a crisp high five (geography dependent)
  • A day script development workshop with Mitchell Holland for YOUR project.
  • Access to Behind the Scenes content (always great to know what's happening with your investments)
  • An invitation to an advanced screening of the whole series, delivered in an exclusive feature length edit.
  • Eternal gratitude for being there at a pivotal moment in our careers.

What your contribution really means to us.

All of us involved in creating UNBOXING are early in our film careers. Actors, writers, directors, DOPs and producers respectively. Together we know that our collaborative efforts can produce amazing content and stories we wish to tell. We all have to practice our creativity around our day jobs limited to whatever down time we can wrangle. UNBOXING is another stepping stone to conquer so we can get consistent work and continue to entertain you through the film medium.

Other Ways You Can Help.

Coming out of 2020 we know that finances are drying up. COVID and unexpected job loss have affected all of us. So whilst your financial support is essential, you can also offer your support in other ways, such as:

  • catering for filming days (they're 10hr shoots - even one team meal that day would make our day)
  • lending a location (Melbourne, Australia) - this would be a minimum of two weeks
  • prop design/donation

Just send us an email to mholland231@gmail.com and we'll keep you in the loop for when the action is kicking off!

OH! AND of course...

SPREAD THE WORD!

Tell friends, families, your barista, other creatives, strangers at parties and other creatives - yes we're saying that twice because we love to collaborate. Filmed media is rarely made by individuals. They are made by armies. The further you can spread the word and excitement about UNBOXING the further your generosity and kindness will carry.

To hear more from the creators go to: https://vimeo.com/477893107 

Again we thank you for taking the time to review this campaign. Enjoy our sizzle reel and we can't wait to bring this project to you soon!

We are looking at a minimum goal of $45,000AUD to cover the costs of creating this project. This amount will help to pay our talented crew and actors, cover location hire, post production, marketing and catering. Whilst any spill over funds will pad us with insurance around any unexpected surprises, further script development for seasons 2 and 3, and a percentage donation to a men's mental health foundation.
As a thank you for your contribution you will be eligible for:

your name in the credits of every episode! We don't mean just a blink, we'll linger. We'll linger for a good while!
a crisp high five (geography dependent)
A day script development workshop with Mitchell Holland for YOUR project.
Access to Behind the Scenes content (always great to know what's happening with your investments)
An invitation to an advanced screening of the whole series, delivered in an exclusive feature length edit.
Eternal gratitude for being there at a pivotal moment in our careers.


What your contribution really means to us.
All of us involved in creating UNBOXING are early in our film careers. Actors, writers, directors, DOPs and producers respectively. Together we know that our collaborative efforts can produce amazing content and stories we wish to tell. We all have to practice our creativity around our day jobs limited to whatever down time we can wrangle. UNBOXING is another stepping stone to conquer so we can get consistent work and continue to entertain you through the film medium.

Other Ways You Can Help.
Coming out of 2020 we know that finances are drying up. COVID and unexpected job loss have affected all of us. So whilst your financial support is essential, you can also offer your support in other ways, such as:

catering for filming days (they're 10hr shoots - even one team meal that day would make our day)
lending a location (Melbourne, Australia) - this would be a minimum of two weeks
prop design/donation

Just send us an email to mholland231@gmail.com and we'll keep you in the loop for when the action is kicking off!
OH! AND of course...
SPREAD THE WORD!
Tell friends, families, your barista, other creatives, strangers at parties and other creatives - yes we're saying that twice because we love to collaborate. Filmed media is rarely made by individuals. They are made by armies. The further you can spread the word and excitement about UNBOXING the further your generosity and kindness will carry.
To hear more from the creators go to: https://vimeo.com/477893107 
Again we thank you for taking the time to review this campaign. Enjoy our sizzle reel and we can't wait to bring this project to you soon!

story:
My Name is Jesper Lasthein,  I live in Copenhagen with my wife and 3 children. When my youngest child was 6 months old was I was diagnosed with Parkinsons disease.

I have always felt much younger than my years, and had a passion for extreme sports in my youth, I couldn't understand how this could be happening to me and was determined to fight my diagnosis in every way possible for myself and my family.

I am in the process of making a documentary about my journey with Parkinsons, I do not use conventional medicine and have the goal to become symptom free by changing my diet, using supplements, training hard and meditation. I believe that the body if given time and looked after properly can heal.

My aim is to complete the hardest mountain bike race in the world Yak attack, if you consider right now I cannot button my own shirts and need help cutting up my food you will understand the magnitude of the journey I am about to embark on. Parkinsons disease has not only affected me physically but also mentally, I am now prone to bouts of depression, I have seen a huge change in my personality and am looking to challenge both my body and mind.

My Personal aim is to improve my personal health and well being I want to be able to pick my own children up again (my physical conditions prevent this at present) I want to improve my mental health the lack of dopamine in Parkinsons has taken a huge toll on me. This project has the potential to change both mine and my families future.

 I  also aim to inspire others not to give up, to keep fighting and to live as full a life as possible whatever their condition.

I am looking for funding to support the making of this documentary and for equipment needed for training and my new lifestyle. The production of this documentary costs approx. 160,000USD

I know everyone cannot support this financially but please share my story and my campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
"I AM THAT I AM "  TV Show is a modern day, Faith Based, Suspense Drama Series that features the struggles that everyday people face who are seeking the Love of God, or are in need of God's Love. The original TV Pilot Title, "Warriors GO!  I AM," was changed to "I AM THAT I AM"  TV Series, on December 3, 2020,  to better express the Show Creator, Executive-Producer, Linda Fruster's, God given Vision of creating a TV Series that would feature issues that the world and the Church of God face today. 

I'm Cathy Irby Durant, Producer-Director with Devine Communications attached to produce, direct and develop 3 Episodes of  "I AM THAT I AM"   to pitch for pick up by Network TV or a Video Streaming Company such as Netflix, Amazon and Hulu. The Goal of the Indiegogo Campaign is to raise funds for a production budget to the level of a SAG AFTRA Ultra Low Budget so that the TV Series can attract and cast Bankable Union Actors and pay Non Union Actors and Crew. 

As Producer-Director, I am very impressed with the production work that Executive Producer, Linda Fruster, the Cast and Crew have done with the production of the Pilot entitled "WARRIORS GO! I AM." Devine Communications Video & Film Production, LLC came aboard a few days ago and created a trailer from the existing TV Pilot. As a new business relationship, I admire how Linda Fruster has pushed her dream forward by paying for production from her own finances. As a Judge for the Telly Awards, I feel this series will be a very impactful Faith Based, Family Entertainment Show, a Genre that is in big demand by Hollywood at this time and desperately needed for spiritual and social conscientious awareness.

Please take a look at the "I AM THAT I AM"  TV Pilot Trailer, if it touches you in any way please generously donate from your heart and help us bring this much anticipated TV Series to life. Thank you in advance for your charitable donation and for supporting Linda Fruster who is a very proud Military Veteran. I truly appreciate her service and I'm proud to work with her shoulder to shoulder to launch the "I AM THAT I AM"  TV Series.

About the Executive Producer

Linda Fruster has 20 years of US Military experience from November 12, 1986 - December 6, 2006. She served 13 years in the Army, 3 years in the Army National Guard, and 4 years in the Air National Guard. While in the Military, Linda worked in Finance & Accounting, Information Management, and personnel. Her Military Tours include Israel, and Korea during the Desert Storm War. She also was stationed in Germany, Spain, and retired in Alaska where she lived for over 15 years before moving to Atlanta, GA. Mrs. Fruster has a Master's Degree in Entrepreneurship, a Graduate of Eagles International Training Institute for dance and prophetic, BSOE in Human Services/Minor Business from Wayland Baptist University, and BFA in Digital Filmmaking from the Art Institute of Atlanta. Linda Fruster also, has over 20 years of experience in acting, writing, directing and producing.

Video Production starts mid February 2021. Actors are now rehearsing for Episode 1, entitled "THE SIN." Your financial support is greatly needed to pay the Director, Crew, Cast, Production Equipment, Locations, Wardrobe, Post Production Editing of Episode 1,  plus the creation of pitch trailers, and marketing and promotions as we prepare to shoot within 60 days minus the holidays.   

As an added incentive we plan to sell "I AM THAT I AM"  TV Shirts and invite Donors to appear as  Extras on the Show. Your support makes you family to us. "I AM THAT I AM"  the TV Series will address many issues. As the project goes into production, please feel free to tell about issues that you are passionate about and we will do our best to add your concerns to our list of concepts for upcoming shows. Your contribution will be a great help. Although there are concerns about getting through production during the COVID-19 PANDEMIC, please know that all shows will be shot according to CDC Safety Guidelines, including wearing Masks and Practicing Social Distancing. 

Production Location:

The first 3 Episodes of the "I AM THAT I AM"  will be shot in the Metro Atlanta, Georgia area. Not only will the show make an economic impact to Atlanta and surrounding areas, it will be good entertainment worldwide. For the past 7 years, I have developed the movie "Going Out a Champion," the Coach Joe Ellis Story  based on a true story novel written by Doris M. Ellis.  We just wrapped up our 3rd year at the American Film Market Festival (AFM), which is usually held in Santa Monica, CA, but due to COVID-19 it was hosted Live Online, worldwide, for 5 days via Zoom. I have raised through a LOI 1.7 million dollars for Going Out a Champion which is expected to start production hopefully by Fall of 2021. 

As a Member of the AFM Film, Cinando Directory, I have access to contact information for mostly all of the Independent and Major Studios, Distributors, TV Networks and Video Content Streamers which will be a great help for "I AM THAT I AM" TV Series in seeking distribution and TV Acquisition deals. 

As a Telly Awards Judge and CEO of Devine Communications Video & Film Production, LLC, I feel we have helpful Resources and knowledge to lead this project to a TV or Video Streaming Content Deal. It was my suggestion to Linda Fruster to aim high by raising funds to get "I AM THAT I AM" TV Series the best shot at success to make a great impression in the Film Market Place among other prominent TV Family Entertainment Shows.  

Risks & Challenges

Please know that there is always risk involved with completing all TV and Film projects. Sometimes Executive Producers and Filmmakers don't reach their production goals due to various personal and business reasons, but many projects do make it, based on the strength and drive of the Production Team. As a former Writer, Producer-Director for many video projects including Documentaries for the US Pentagon, Army Division, I am accustome to finishing goals no matter how long it takes. Determination is what Linda Fruster and I have in common, we are finishers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that giving may be a challenge at this time for some, but please check with Linda Fruster to see if you can contribute in other ways, and please feel free to share our fundraising campaign with someone you know. For those of you who can donate, this show will give you bragging rights to say that you invested in a good cause and supported a Military Veteran. On behalf of the Show Creator, Executive Producer, Linda Fruster, thank you very much for your attention and kind donation.

Our fundraising campaign is for 30 days,  we hope to raise funds immediately so that we can meet the financial needs of production now. Your donation will be collected safely by Indiegogo.com and released in a timely manner to us to be used toward development and production of "I AM THAT I AM,” Episode 1. If we acchieve our fundraising goal all extra funding to go toward Episodes 2 & 3.

Thank you again. Wishing you and your Family a Blessed and Joyous  Holiday Season. Stay safe. 

With warm regards,

 

Cathy Irby Durant, Producer-Director

cathydurant1@gmail.com

 

Devine Communications Video & Film Production, LLC 

Atlanta, GA 

 

P.S. For more information about me please visit my website at:

www.cathydurant.com

www.devinecommunicationsvideofilmproduction.web

story:
Short Summary

  • We are Women Aren't Funny Productions: the women behind McGillicuddy Comedy and The Progressive Lady.  
  • "The Clash Pad" is our first stand alone project: an original, comedic limited series written specifically to the strengths of these actors who are starting out in the industry. 
  • Your contribution will directly impact the quality of this production and benefit both the actors and the women of WAF. By participating in this project, the actors will get the priceless experience of working on a physical set as well as getting more material for their reels that is tailor made. And you'll be directly supporting the goal of WAF, which is to make great content centering around the female perspective. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The money donated will go directly towards for top of the line film equipment, location rentals, set design, covid compliance measures, food on set (fed actors are happy actors), and festival entries. 
  • The funds will also be supporting the future of these talented actors and women on a mission to make you laugh! 
  • By donating you could receive access to actively watch all stages of production, get exclusive behind the scenes material, and bonus content you can't get anywhere else!
  • Anything and everything helps.

The Impact

  • The goal of this project is to provide industry standard material for these up and coming actors to use in their reels as they seek representation and go on auditions in the entertainment industry. WAF has put in time to cater the story and characters to these actors and we are beyond excited to start filming! 
  • Investing in this project is investing in the future actors and story tellers headed into the entertainment industry.

Risks & Challenges

  • One of the biggest risks and challenges will be handling Covid19  during production.  We are prepared to abide by CA state compliance rules along with our own safety measure of proper PPE and testing. We want to keep everyone safe.
  • It is not an easy task to write a cohesive script for 18 people which gives them each an equal amount of screen time while still being an entertaining and unforced story.  Our writers have put in a great amount of time and are up to the challenge.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign with your family and friends! Tag us on Social Media @womenarentfunnyproductions 
  • We are also still looking for a location to film!  If you or anyone you know has a home they would be willing to let us shoot in please reach out and we can talk in more detail!

We are Women Aren't Funny Productions: the women behind McGillicuddy Comedy and The Progressive Lady.  
"The Clash Pad" is our first stand alone project: an original, comedic limited series written specifically to the strengths of these actors who are starting out in the industry. 
Your contribution will directly impact the quality of this production and benefit both the actors and the women of WAF. By participating in this project, the actors will get the priceless experience of working on a physical set as well as getting more material for their reels that is tailor made. And you'll be directly supporting the goal of WAF, which is to make great content centering around the female perspective. 

What We Need & What You Get

The money donated will go directly towards for top of the line film equipment, location rentals, set design, covid compliance measures, food on set (fed actors are happy actors), and festival entries. 
The funds will also be supporting the future of these talented actors and women on a mission to make you laugh! 
By donating you could receive access to actively watch all stages of production, get exclusive behind the scenes material, and bonus content you can't get anywhere else!
Anything and everything helps.

The Impact

The goal of this project is to provide industry standard material for these up and coming actors to use in their reels as they seek representation and go on auditions in the entertainment industry. WAF has put in time to cater the story and characters to these actors and we are beyond excited to start filming! 
Investing in this project is investing in the future actors and story tellers headed into the entertainment industry.


Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest risks and challenges will be handling Covid19  during production.  We are prepared to abide by CA state compliance rules along with our own safety measure of proper PPE and testing. We want to keep everyone safe.
It is not an easy task to write a cohesive script for 18 people which gives them each an equal amount of screen time while still being an entertaining and unforced story.  Our writers have put in a great amount of time and are up to the challenge.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your family and friends! Tag us on Social Media @womenarentfunnyproductions 
We are also still looking for a location to film!  If you or anyone you know has a home they would be willing to let us shoot in please reach out and we can talk in more detail!

story:
Summary

phase two is a piece exploring what it's like being a twentysomething living in London - and what a mess it is. Your best friend might as well be your phone because let's face it, you never actually have the time, or the money to see the people you want to hang out with face to face.

Hashing out the plot of each episode was surprisingly easy when we started development, because we are our own audience. Our friends, social media circles, the media we were consuming all seemed to be telling different chapters of the same story. We saw that and we put that into phase two.

For the past four months the web series has been self funded, from hiring equipment to renting locations and feeding the cast, but in order to get it finished we need help.

Sassy Jam

The brains of the operation, Satema is the ultimate producer, able to juggle multiple tasks without dropping the ball. Working within the Television industry she has picked up numerous skills when it comes to running the ship on a production. Able to shoot, edit, and corral - we're still looking to find something she can't do backwards and blindfolded.
 

Jen is the story teller, penning new idea's, developing characters and storylines to shock, relate and admire, she also spends a lot of time laughing at her own jokes. Also working in the Television industry, she is able to flip from creative to administrator; organising shoots, scheduling cast and crew, and then flip back again to direct and shoot.

What We Need

£2000

The amount we are asking for is going towards our edit. We have seven completed episodes, and though we have basic editing skills, we don't want this to be the place where all our hard work falls short.

Every episode has its own tone and style and the editor we hire needs to be able to picture cut, colour grade, add visual effects, as well as sound edit all seven episodes - all of this comes approximately to the length of a short film. 

Such a large job, requires us getting someone in who knows their stuff, will treat our project as something other than a quick patch job, and as such will be able to guide phase two to being the best version of itself.

What You Get

Even if you donate £1 you have our gratitude for supporting us on this! Upwards of this there are a range of perks for helping us on this journey from a shout out on our social media, first look at the pilot episode before it goes out on YouTube, to the chance for one lucky person to become an Executive Producer in the series. 

The Impact

This web series is the second of three projects planned for us in 2019. We started with a play towards the beginning of the year and hope to end with a short film.

phase two is the biggest project of the three and we want to show that it's possible to set your mind on a seemingly insurmountable task - get up, make a plan, execute, conquer and repeat.

Though we are of course two women of colour, and the characters we've created follow suit: that doesn't mean our stories focus solely on race. 

It was important for us to create something that showed people of colour go through the exact same highs and hardships as the people around them with some of our storylines focusing on: mental health, relationships, dating and the heavy reliance of technology in keeping friendships alive.

phase two is universally relatable and at its core creates a community.

Challenges 

Getting to this point has been far from easy. We have been completely self-funded and were navigating sourcing locations, actors, unexpected drop outs, and coming up with a suitable day to film that fits with seven peoples schedules whilst having demanding full time jobs.

But we got here and we are thrilled!

Our biggest challenge right now is time. Ideally we want the edit to be completed by December 2019 so we can shift focus and work on promoting the series for its debut. As outlined above that requires finding an editor who can take on this large job. This requires them committing to an editing schedule that may have awkward timings, as it fits around our jobs and the other related bits and pieces that needs to be done to get phase two ready for launch.

So far with all the roadblocks that have tried to derail us, we have managed to find create solutions and make sacrifices in order to keep going. It's that mentality that has gotten us to where we are now and will help us to overcome.

Other Ways You Can Help


We are working on growing a following for Sassy Jam Productions, and so we would really appreciate your follows and your positivity.

When we start promoting in preparation for the launch we want to get phase two out to as many pairs of eyes as possible, so we would love your likes and retweets on Twitter (@SassyJam01) as well as your reposting on Instagram (@SassyJamProductions)!

Not to be forgotten is the power of word of mouth: Tell someone you know about us - you never know who they'll pass it along to.

Though we are of course two women of colour, and the characters we've created follow suit: that doesn't mean our stories focus solely on race. 
It was important for us to create something that showed people of colour go through the exact same highs and hardships as the people around them with some of our storylines focusing on: mental health, relationships, dating and the heavy reliance of technology in keeping friendships alive.
phase two is universally relatable and at its core creates a community.

Challenges 
Getting to this point has been far from easy. We have been completely self-funded and were navigating sourcing locations, actors, unexpected drop outs, and coming up with a suitable day to film that fits with seven peoples schedules whilst having demanding full time jobs.
But we got here and we are thrilled!
Our biggest challenge right now is time. Ideally we want the edit to be completed by December 2019 so we can shift focus and work on promoting the series for its debut. As outlined above that requires finding an editor who can take on this large job. This requires them committing to an editing schedule that may have awkward timings, as it fits around our jobs and the other related bits and pieces that needs to be done to get phase two ready for launch.
So far with all the roadblocks that have tried to derail us, we have managed to find create solutions and make sacrifices in order to keep going. It's that mentality that has gotten us to where we are now and will help us to overcome.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are working on growing a following for Sassy Jam Productions, and so we would really appreciate your follows and your positivity.
When we start promoting in preparation for the launch we want to get phase two out to as many pairs of eyes as possible, so we would love your likes and retweets on Twitter (@SassyJam01) as well as your reposting on Instagram (@SassyJamProductions)!
Not to be forgotten is the power of word of mouth: Tell someone you know about us - you never know who they'll pass it along to.

story:
Making TV Fun Again!

Thanks for visiting our campaign. Vegas the Network is a new, innovating Cable TV, satellite, and streaming channel dedicated to bringing you entertainment from Las Vegas 24 hours a day, 7 days a week! Not a travel channel with host-driven segments...because...that would be boring! Rather Vegas the Network will be a fun, energetic lifestyle and entertainment channel. Think of us as a faster-paced and interactive combination of Viceland, E!, VH-1, and Comedy Central.

Our company and group are storytellers and entertainers, and it bothers us how boring TV has become with few shows to watch, and then once you find something, you binge ten episodes in three days and it's over until next season.

So, our team of independent filmmakers along with interesting and unique characters of Las Vegas are teaming up to create a new Cable TV and streaming network, dedicated to having fun, and blurring the line with social media and 100% focused on Las Vegas.

We want to create more original content than another other network, and integrate you into the shows when you visit Las Vegas. And, when you are back home, we want to keep you connected and entertained until you can come back to visit us again.

Our campaign in the first step in our equity fund-raising process that will provide the capital to launch the network. It will also lay a solid foundation for marketing, allowing us to create the first revenue for the network!

Your contribution to Vegas the Network is your opportunity to have a voice in the creation of the entertainment you consume, and when you are in Las Vegas, will give you the opportunity to be part of the cast!

Campaign Overview

Our campaign has three objectives:

  1. Raise $7,750.00 to finish legal work needed to setup our corporation and prepare preferred stock offering for investors
  2. Raise $5,000.00 for our initial marketing push to create revenue from advertisers who will ultimately fund the network long term
  3. Get your feedback

We are planning to offer preferred stock through a crowdfunding platform, so we are asking donors to NOT contribute any more than $250.00 at this stage. If you want to contribute more, wait for the equity offering where you'll be able to buy a piece of the company, not just a perk!

Speaking of perks, on this first campaign, they are going to be pretty weak. Since we're a new company, we'll provide first edition logo swag for you. None of the core crew or creators have any swag yet, so you'll be first! Items will include resort and Vegas themed swag.

Since there is a chance we may not get to the finish line with a national launch, we are not offering perks that involve screen credits or on-camera appearances at this time. Our next campaign will contain those perks along with specifics about what shows you could appear on, if you aren't too shy!

In the crazy situation that we don't hit our total goal, we'll utilize the funds raised for the marketing and legal purposes outlined above. 

By Indie Filmmakers, for Indie Filmmakers

On the surface, Vegas the Network is all about an interactive network where the audience becomes the cast, and people are entertained. Below the surface, Vegas the Network is a media incubator with the goal to create jobs in Southern Nevada in the film sector, and to allow creative storytellers to bypass the huge media gatekeepers who dominate the world of Cable TV. This will allow us create and deliver better entertainment, and more of it.

Our diverse Indie film making team includes business development professionals, writers, cinematographers, sound techs, camera operators, lighting pros, and many other accomplished crew members.

Reality Check

Any creative endeavor that counts on advertising to survive is risky business, so we have to be realistic that there are likely challenges ahead. There is a chance that we could fail to get out of the starting gate if we fail to attract enough investment.

Due to our hard work and the credibility of our team, we are confident we will overcome the challenges ahead to create the most original, unique entertainment network and deliver on making TV fun again.

Our strategic approach to using the Indie film community for our crew, involving Las Vegas tourists and convention goers in our shows, and being creative as we engineer show concepts, we will be able to produce more content at a lower cost than any other network.

The more content for less money will allow us to produce more original content than any other network, and by integrating our social media conscious audience into the shows themselves, we'll be able to drive ratings beyond would our budget would predict.

We've already figured out the cost to launch the network in up to 30 million homes, engaged the production talent we need to start, and created the first 50 show concepts, forged the critical business relationships we need. We're ready to start production in June and look forward to launch this fall.

Follow our Journey

Even if you are unable to donate at this time, you can still be a huge help to us. Here's how:

  1. Follow and Like our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/vegasthenetwork
  2. Post on our page what you would like to see and give us feedback on the show concepts we've already announced
  3. Tell us what you don't want to see or are sick of seeing!
  4. Watch for our first interactive productions so you can plan your trip to Vegas and apply to be in a show.
  5. Tell your friends about our network and our campaign

Indigogo has share tools to help you get the message out to your social network, so take advantage and help us get our next steps moving!
