story:
Short Summary

We made the above video on our phones to give you an idea of our humour and some of the issues we have had.  We can then make something you can all be proud of with the right resources!  We promise!

Initially we did have a producer, equipment and location, however the producer decided to change direction taking the location and equipment with him!  Thankfully someone donated rehearsal space for our workshops, Mark had some costumes, and Stacha volunteered her time at the location in the crowd -funder video in order to pay for it.  So it felt all was not lost!

Stacha Hicks, Actor and Filmmaker, (www.StachaHicks.com) creator of the series  explains  a few things below:

'I had the idea for this series shortly after I left film school.  But I had no real idea how to pitch for television, or how to work in television then.  I made films.  They were very different disciplines at that time.   And I was doing okay making films. Several years on however, finds me working as an actor (with a bit of writing on the side) and for the most part loving it. However there are less roles for women once you enter your thirties, and most of them do not reflect the diverse, weird and wonderful women that are part of our lives. It hurt to see us so poorly reflected in a medium that I have loved and given a great deal too.  Frustrated creatively I ventured into stand up as a way to create and perform work that I found both challenging and exciting.  I could write, book and perform my own act!!  Who knew!!'

On the Stand Up circuit I met Sheila Holdsworth (a comedian and a professional viola player) and Mark Coltman (also a comedian ,TV Presenter, Theatre Director).  I loved Mark's ability to rise to a challenge.  Both had warm likeable styles and were great improvisers.  It was in meeting them that I realised it was time for Murder and Maime the series.  We started work.  

We actively sought out others who were keen to create something different, something that they really believed in. Workshops have begun and the actors cast.  I write around the actors, we workshop and then I write.  Its a real ensemble piece and I am very excited to be bring comedians and actors together to learn from each other and create something unique to them.

Other than Sheila and Mark, I am pleased that we have following talented people attached to the project:

Nicholas A Newman (NIGHTBUS, JUPITER ASCENDING, GHOSTS, 90 MINUTES) 

Aaron Gordon (POMPIDOU, NATIONAL THEATRE)

What We Need and What You Get

  • £2650  will cover costs of sound and camera equipment including crew.
  • £1350 Art Department - this includes the cost of the Art Director and office signage, stationary, posters and props.
  • £650 - Fees for using Indigogo platform and data storage( including predicted Transaction fees).
  • For your help and assistance we have some gifts we would like  you to have.  You can find them in the perks section!
  • Out total budget is £7000 (without indigogo and storage fees) we are aiming to raise the rest of the money by other means.
  • What happens if we don't make all the money we need? There are two plans depending on how much money has been raised.  Plan One:  Negotiate everyone down on their price.  Plan Two: Rewrite episode one into a pilot episode and use that as a pitch to gain funding and interest from potential investors. 
  • If we make more money than stated?  We will be able to put that towards publicity and be able to contribute towards a wage for the guest actors .

The Impact

  • We are hoping to make all six episodes so that we can use them to approach potential backers and supporters with a view to provide a platform and/or funding for the second series.  If we are very fortunate with the investment we will be making longer episodes.  We are also in discussions about creating a pilot episode for a full TV series,  this would still be be of a similar length to six five minute episodes.  

Risks & Challenges

  • We have already told you above what we would do if we do not raise all the funds.  However of course there are always other risks on projects of this nature.
  • Actors - book a job they are getting paid for.  All the actors will have signed contracts before filming starts committing to the project.  But of course things happen.  We have a wealth of acting resource to fall back on,  thankfully we  held workshops when looking for the rest of the cast and met some AMAZING people, who are really keen to work on the project and have already confirmed that they could be called upon should needed (most of whom we want in series two anyway!).
  • We are only asking for some of the money.  Stacha has taken an extra job to help get the rest.  Other cast  members are contributing where they can also.  All of them are taking deferred payment.  Which means we are not taking a wage.  We do not make any money unless the project makes money.  Please note:  this is unlikely to make money at this stage. Our professional camera and sound departments are also working at lower rates.   However if we have to take  the option of creating one pilot episode,  we will aim to pay the cast out of remaining budget as we don't know the life journey getting it to series will take.

Other Ways You Can Help

As we know some people are just unable to contribute.  Honestly, we know what that's like.  But there are other ways in which you can help.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!  Perhaps you know someone who would be interested, who could invest, or even help us with a location?  We are after an office location that could look like a start up, alternatively a 80's slightly run down style office.  We need a lot of light and space, if possible!  We are also after an open plan kitchen/living room, a little dated preferred.  This location will only be needed for one day and possible one day in the second series. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so very much for stopping by!  We really hope that you will join on us on this journey, in whatever capacity you can.

Our professional camera and sound departments are also working at lower rates.   However if we have to take  the option of creating one pilot episode,  we will aim to pay the cast out of remaining budget as we don't know the life journey getting it to series will take.


Other Ways You Can Help
As we know some people are just unable to contribute.  Honestly, we know what that's like.  But there are other ways in which you can help.

Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!  Perhaps you know someone who would be interested, who could invest, or even help us with a location?  We are after an office location that could look like a start up, alternatively a 80's slightly run down style office.  We need a lot of light and space, if possible!  We are also after an open plan kitchen/living room, a little dated preferred.  This location will only be needed for one day and possible one day in the second series. 
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so very much for stopping by!  We really hope that you will join on us on this journey, in whatever capacity you can.

story:
Our Story

Word of Mom has the opportunity to go global via radio and now TV on BLU Success Television streaming on Roku, Amazon Fire and Apple TV.

WoM has been sharing the wisdom of women for more than 7 years. Mompreneurs, women-owned and home-based businesses, are breaking those myths that we are “dabbling” in business. We are smart, savvy professionals who have learned that we do not have to sacrifice a home and family to be successful, and we bring these NEW Business Women to the forefront, giving voice to their incredible stories, often for the very first time, as we empower each other on our amazing journeys to create the life we desire.

Our story began on a show called the Three Wise Girls and a 2-part segment on mompreneurs - women like me, building a business from home and raising a family. I know what it is to hear the nay-sayers and the "When are you going to quit this and get a real job" questions. Often finding support as you are building a business is one of the hardest things to do. Realizing how mompreneurs and women in business was the niche - and Word of Mom Radio was born!

We began doing one show every Thursday and grew into 5 days a week with 9 different segment hosts, mompreneurs advertising their businesses and people like Sarah Mann and Liz Callaway airing on our Music Monday shows!

Our current line up includes: Music, Movie or Matinee Monday, The Tuesday Business Spotlight, Wednesday Mindful Healthy Habits, Thursday Mompreneur Model Show and, once a month on Friday we air Moms After Dark! We share stories that educate, inspire or entertain mompreneurs and business people.  We want to uplift those women and men who are working hard to promote themselves and make a difference in the world. Our brand keeps growing, our shows keep expanding and bringing this to television was logically our next step - so here we are - launching Word of Mom TV and the WoMMedia Network.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $20,000 to launch WoMTV and buy the WoMRadio Channel on BlogTalkRadio. The funds would be used to purchase 3-4 GoPro360 cameras, 6 LAV microphones, hiring 2-3 photographers to film, edit and mount each TV episode, all travel expenses for location filming on both the east and west coast, sponsoring small businesses who don't have the funds to have their voice heard, and adding social media advertising for their segments. Any and all donations are gratefully accepted, and perks begin at $150+.

What makes the WoMMedia Network unique is that we are focused on sharing mompreneurs - the new businesswoman - finding the balance between building a business and raising a family, as well as women in business who, like us, have grown from home-based to an office where now others are working with them. The journey is a remarkable one and WoM looks to empower, encourage, inspire and educate as we share the wisdom of women, in business and in life.

If we don't reach our goal of $20,000.00 the first $4,000.00 we raise will purchase our cameras and microphones and editing software, as well as incorporating the Word of Mom Media Network. The next $6,000.00 will help pay our film crew and cover our expenses when filming. $2,500.00 will enable us to purchase WoMRadio Channel on BTR - which gives us 4 live banners and a video on our show page for our advertisers.  The rest goes towards buying computers and recording equipment specific to podcasting and 12 months to rent a small studio to record. Once we accomplish all that, we want to offer production and administrative staff for both TV and Radio, a salary. With your help - we can make that happen!

The Impact

Empowering women and giving voice to their dreams, families and businesses is what the WoMMedia Network is all about. Building a business is not an easy task, and where do you go when you want to get the word out to the public? Our radio show/podcast has been educating, encouraging, inspiring and empowering women on a global scale for the past 7 years.

Guests on our radio show are given a platform to share their passions and they run with it. Our favorite story is one guest doing her first interview ever. She called into the show during her family's vacation, from the car as her husband and kids were in a restaurant! Fast forward 2 years and she was our first mompreneur advertiser...and 2 years after that, she was one of our many hosts that come in for 4-8 week segments - on online marketing. Now, she hosts monthly segments on bio-currency and long term wealth development!  This is just one of the amazing stories of women that Word of Mom has made a difference for, in business and in life!

We now have the chance to come to streaming TV on Roku, Apple TV and Amazon Fire. BLU Success Television broadcasts with a reach of 50 million viewers...imagine how we can make women's dreams come true on a scale like never before! Come join us because together we can make a difference!

Risks & Challenges

We are doing our best to mitigate the risk by partnering with the Connecticut School of Broadcasting and giving their students the experience they need to create careers in the field. We are able to use their facilities and expertise and have had wonderful results so far. We are editing our first episodes and getting ready to launch the TV show.

The biggest challenges we are facing is that their equipment is older and they have many other students signing out the film equipment, so we need our own cameras and microphones to make sure that we are able to create network quality shows.  We will also have the control we need to ensure timely completion of the editing and production process for each episode.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute financially - but please - be sure to hit the Indiegogo Share Button and let your friends know about us.  Our biggest strength is the network of women that support, share and empower each other that we have built along the journey.  Share us with YOUR network and let's even further strengthen this amazing global community!

What makes the WoMMedia Network unique is that we are focused on sharing mompreneurs - the new businesswoman - finding the balance between building a business and raising a family, as well as women in business who, like us, have grown from home-based to an office where now others are working with them. The journey is a remarkable one and WoM looks to empower, encourage, inspire and educate as we share the wisdom of women, in business and in life.
If we don't reach our goal of $20,000.00 the first $4,000.00 we raise will purchase our cameras and microphones and editing software, as well as incorporating the Word of Mom Media Network. The next $6,000.00 will help pay our film crew and cover our expenses when filming. $2,500.00 will enable us to purchase WoMRadio Channel on BTR - which gives us 4 live banners and a video on our show page for our advertisers.  The rest goes towards buying computers and recording equipment specific to podcasting and 12 months to rent a small studio to record. Once we accomplish all that, we want to offer production and administrative staff for both TV and Radio, a salary. With your help - we can make that happen!
The Impact

Empowering women and giving voice to their dreams, families and businesses is what the WoMMedia Network is all about. Building a business is not an easy task, and where do you go when you want to get the word out to the public? Our radio show/podcast has been educating, encouraging, inspiring and empowering women on a global scale for the past 7 years.
Guests on our radio show are given a platform to share their passions and they run with it. Our favorite story is one guest doing her first interview ever. She called into the show during her family's vacation, from the car as her husband and kids were in a restaurant! Fast forward 2 years and she was our first mompreneur advertiser...and 2 years after that, she was one of our many hosts that come in for 4-8 week segments - on online marketing. Now, she hosts monthly segments on bio-currency and long term wealth development!  This is just one of the amazing stories of women that Word of Mom has made a difference for, in business and in life!
We now have the chance to come to streaming TV on Roku, Apple TV and Amazon Fire. BLU Success Television broadcasts with a reach of 50 million viewers...imagine how we can make women's dreams come true on a scale like never before! Come join us because together we can make a difference!

Risks & Challenges
We are doing our best to mitigate the risk by partnering with the Connecticut School of Broadcasting and giving their students the experience they need to create careers in the field. We are able to use their facilities and expertise and have had wonderful results so far. We are editing our first episodes and getting ready to launch the TV show.
The biggest challenges we are facing is that their equipment is older and they have many other students signing out the film equipment, so we need our own cameras and microphones to make sure that we are able to create network quality shows.  We will also have the control we need to ensure timely completion of the editing and production process for each episode.
Other Ways You Can Help
We know that not everyone can contribute financially - but please - be sure to hit the Indiegogo Share Button and let your friends know about us.  Our biggest strength is the network of women that support, share and empower each other that we have built along the journey.  Share us with YOUR network and let's even further strengthen this amazing global community!

story:
Summary

How many people do you know who've had their dream come true?   --Jim Valvano

This quote perfectly explains the purpose of this documentary - Soar Mighty Eagles. While the 1989-1990 state basketball championship trophy is proudly displayed in the halls of Pella Christian High School, we don't always stop to visit it.  Instead, we have the memories of that entire season. Whether you were a starter, the 12th man on the bench, a coach, a team manager, the radio voice of the Eagles, or part of the crowd supporting the team at every game - you have unique memories of that time, 30 years ago.

Revisiting my memories about this great season, along with learning and sharing the memories of the team members, coaches, and the community, is why I'm doing this project.  As the student videographer for three years, I got to share many of the experiences the team did, and yet, when starting to do research, began to realize I had missed - or forgotten - a lot as well.

While I had the idea to do this documentary for a long time, marking the 30th anniversary of this first state basketball championship seemed like the perfect time to commemorate, celebrate, and remember that magical time.

This is a passion project for me, and I need a little help.  Financial assistance to complete this project is needed as well.  I am looking to cover the production and travel costs with your help.

What We Need & What You Get

The fundraising goal for this documentary is $10,000.  This will cover:

  • Equipment rental/purchase
  • Travel expenses
  • Post production: DIT, editing, HD mastering of old footage,transcription, capture of photos & memorabilia
  • Media rights (copyrighted footage needed, music)
  • Premiere presentation of the documentary in Pella, IA
  • BluRay/DVD Authorizing and Publishing
  • Contributor rewards

Challenges Ahead

Time and funding are the two biggest challenges to producing this documentary.  A date has been set in January 2020 to commemorate the 30th anniversary of the 1989-90 boys and girls basketball teams.  I would like to coordinate a premiere showing of the documentary around the same time.  That means that our initial timeline of release for March 2020 will be accelerated, and the full production (interviews, HD mastering, etc.) will need to be performed at the same time, rather than sequentially.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, here are other ways you can help:

  • Spread the word and make some noise about this documentary. Share this link on social media and let your friends know!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Six friends in a share house, juggle the pressures of work, bills and relationships. Each week the gang tackle new drama in the household on their path to adulthood.

The unsuspecting leader of the pack (that no one asked for), ANDII VAN HOULER has less sense than even the great onion eater - Tony Abbott. Like him, he works long, hard and absent mindedly at a car garage managed by his lazy but abusive UNCLE JIMMY. With Andiis five friends one of whom is his best friend and ex who are seeing each other behind his back, they are set to turn not only their lives but the lives of Melbourne upside down.

We wrote and made this show so people can relate to the everyday things we may go through in life. What it's like to be broke working hard, going on a date from hell, how boys and girls see things differently and no matter what we are struggling with we can always count on our family/friends.

The splash and buzz that the idea of the show on its own has created has been phenomenal. This show was created to put a comedic spin on the drama, stresses and problems we may face in our life. For people to have that relatability with it, when they watch it they sit there and point and say 'Yes, I've been through that'. Or 'I have a friend like that', and 'my first love was like that'.

Production companies have been contacted, and if we can raise the cash they will produce the show for streaming sites such as Netflix and Starz.

Social Media Marketing Strategy

1 - A dedicated videographer/photographer will create with our actors, pre-written skits and content that is exclusive for social media purposes.

2 - Our guest stars & featured extras will be selected from a combination of Melbourne actors, models & social media influencers that will assist with the marketing efforts of the show - similar to Fat Pizza with guest spots ft Kamahl, Angry Anderson etc.

3 - Utilising our fashion & location partners, we will do exclusive photoshoots and cross promotion to help promote our TV show via their social media platforms, whilst promoting their brand via the show. This will not only save money but also gain an audience in Melbourne.

4 - We plan to create a Facebook community called TWTBAF that the showrunners & actors will actively engage with our fans via. We will distribute exclusive content that way as well as get our audiences feedback.

TWBAF Story

Six friends in a share house, juggle the pressures of work, bills and relationships. Each week, the gang tackle a new drama in the household on their path to adulthood.

The unsuspecting leader of the pack (that no one asked for), ANDII VAN HOULER (21) has less sense than even the great onion eater - Tony Abbott. Like him, he works long, hard & absent mindedly at a car garage, managed by his lazy, but abusive uncle UNCLE JIMMY LEAFRON (39). Working side by side with his friends CHAN & GEOFFREY, they earn their pay and the scorn of many dissatisfied customers.

GEOFFERY HOLMES (22), is Andii’s partner in crime. He is a stereotypical African-Australian who wants to live the Scarface lifestyle, but is only a sickie away from the Centrelink lifestyle. He portrays himself as an African-American, with a deep love of rap and sport. Geoffrey and Andii like to think of themselves as God’s gift to women, but even they are no match for…

MIRELLA TARTINI (21) - A high maintenance Melbourne girl (an ex flame of Andii’s) with a new guy & matching handbag each week. ‘No’ is a word that isn’t in her vocabulary, neither is ‘frugal’. She is a highly volatile drama queen, and serves as the catalyst in the group and the reason for all the drama.

But the father of the household is Andii’s other best friend SIMON BLACK (24), an aspiring Gynecologist from an old money, well educated family. Well dressed, he is a consummate gentleman who is drawn to Mirella, which creates tension between upholding the bro code & listening to his heart.

One person who doesn’t care for the bro code is SOPHIA PRETTI (21) - a innocent & sweet gobstopper of a girl, with a shady, psychotic centre that you’ll crack your jaw over. She doesn’t let any man stand over her, but if the right one came along she’d be by his side… digging a shallow grave. She serves as the mother of the house - if the mother were Kathy Bates from Misery.

Without a father or a mother though is CHAN CHAN (24.5), who is a mix between a Wog and an Fresh of the Boat Asian. He is the house sheep who is left with all the dirty work, but always aspires for more. His arc revolves around finding his real birth parents, whilst dodging the immigration office & surviving through life with the only friends he has ever really known.

Together, we journey through their adventures in an episodic format, and whilst the dramas affect them, they can always rely on their friends because… that’s what the boys are for. .

Meet the Characters

Andii Van Houler 

ANDII VAN HOULER(21) thinks life is one large rainbow lollipop sugar coated in love and legos. His short attention span to anything often gets him into a lot of trouble or in very sticky awkward situations.

By day Andii works at a car garage which is riddled with dissatisfied customers, confusing Connect Four games, a lazy, abusive boss (who happens to be his Uncle) and the burning remains of customer tyres, set alight to cook his lunch. Food is constantly on Andii’s mind - and if he isn’t eating, he is waiting to eat, or begging Simon to cook him something, or or buying Mirella cook books and cooking utensils or stealing Chan’s Mi Goreng for lunch.

But his love life is like his underwear - holes everywhere, changes everyday and completely covered in sh*t. Andii has recently split with ex Mirella, who remain friends. However now his best friend Simon has an interest in her - which makes Andii think.. does he want her back?

Geoffery Holmes

GEOFFERY HOLMES(22) takes the word gangsta to a whole new level - the next level. With Ambitionz Az A Ridah, he wants to become the next Tupac, but struggles to buy a 6 Pack.

His smooth & confident personality creates his mindset of ‘God’s gift to women’ - which hides his deep need for substance, love and companionship with his on again, off again, girlfriend Tanisha. His arc will see whether he changes and his relationship survives.

Handicapped by his inability to read or write, Geoffrey makes up for it by being the coolest kid on the block (again to his detriment)

Geoffery takes it a day at a time, with his best mate Andii, coming in late, making up excuses, being plain lazy & also shirking any violent encounters or responsibility.

Mirella Tartini

MIRELLA TARTINI(20) A high maintenance, alpha bitch who wears a new handbag, with a matching leash (that happens to be attached to a guy) every week.  ‘No’ is a word that isn’t in her vocabulary, along with frugal. She is a highly volatile drama queen, and serves as the catalyst in the group and the reason for all the drama.

With catch-phrases like, ‘I don’t call guys, they call me’; Mirella is a girl that expects a great amount - and learns throughout adulthood, that what you want, isn’t always want you need.  

Her relationship with relationships is insecure - being unsatisfied with a hot man, or as a single woman. After moving on from the Andii due to immaturity, she now wants a ‘real man’ casting her eye onto Simon. Yet all of her old tricks don’t work

Mirella is unemployed, living off the contributions of others. Soon she will be forced to understand the value of independence and rely on herself to fix her own problems.

Simon Black

SIMON BLACK (23) is a well educated, wealthy, consummate gentleman, almost living the life his parents dreamed for him - as a gynecologist.

Simon believes in dressing to impress, even formal in his bedroom attire. A natural & responsible leader, this weighs heavy on his mind as he obsesses & stresses over pleasing others and doing the right thing.

Simon’s greatest chore is babysitting his best friend Andii, who often sabotages the stability in the household due to his stupidity. Simon’s friendship to Andii comes at a detriment to his own happiness & ambition…

Which conflicts with his own morality.  He will struggle whether to be a loyal friend and ignore Mirella (Andii’s ex) or be an adult and listen to his heart.

Uncle Jimmy

JIMMY LEAFRON(39), is a wild drunk, who is the antithesis of a self made man. Having inherited the family garage, he coasts on the back of others - whilst mooching all he can.

No need to put the Batman symbol in the sky, if the word ‘free’ is uttered, then you can be sure that Uncle Jimmy will be there, carting off the last of the goods.

As Andii’s Uncle, he serves as the only role model Andii (an already unstable human being) has ever known. Despite appearances, Jimmy genuinely cares for his nephew and will soon bail out the gang when they need it the most.

But until then, you can find Uncle Jimmy getting rejected from girl to girl (like a midget playing 1 on 1 against Dikembo Mutombo), down at the local pub if he hasn't passed out already at the garage.

Sophia Pretti

SOPHIA PRETTI(21) is both the most innocent girl you’ll have ever met - and the most murderously suspicious. Forever with an airtight alibi to get her out of a jam, Sophia has one foot firmly in the past, holding her back from really living with purpose & freedom.

Sophia’s big passion is set firmly in designing clothes and creating art projects - yet struggles to find meaningful and sustainable work.

A believer in monogamy (even when her man doesn’t know it) and traditional gender roles, Sophia doesn’t live life as a pushover - yet her aversion to Tinder & modern dating norms, leaves her love life drier than the Sahara desert.

Sophia’s past ends up catching up with her in the first season which hurts her standing in the group and raises questions - what has she been involved in, and what is she capable of?  

Chan Chan

CHAN CHAN (24.5) おはよう ございます is a misunderstood orphan, who needs friendship more than air (and mi goreng).

An Asian of some kind, Chan is disconnected from his heritage, having been raised by Greek parents. He desperately wants to find his birth parents (and avoid ASIO).

Chan lives on a steady diet of cocaine & hookers, mainly by following them on Instagram due to his lack of social confidence.

A prideful man, Chan sees the power of hard work, but is easily manipulated by his friends for their own gain.

Identifying heavily with Bruce Lee, Chan sees himself to be a kung fu master - which might be the most physically harmful & casually racist stereotype he has internalised about himself.

Episode 1 : Pilot

Andii wreaks havoc at the mechanic shop; whilst the house erupts in chaos over who will the dishes, forcing a trial judged by an uninvited guest - who abuses his power over the gang. A love triangle is formed.

Partners

The cast all dressed by

  • https://roqclothing.com
  • http://heskie.com
  • http://www.westsideapparel.com
  • http://symblapparel.com
  • https://theantiorder.co.uk
  • https://www.reptileapparel.com.au

What We Need

We are looking to raise $20,000 to help fund our 8 episode first season. All the funds raised will be spent on production and post production expenses as well as props for the show.

Expenses:

  • Cast and Crew (Director of Photography, Assistant Camera, Grip, Sound, Assistant Director, Production Assistant, Hair & Make Up,  Actors)
  • Production: Locations, Permits, Meals, Equipment, Wardrobe, Props.
  • Post Production: Sound Design, Music Licensing
  • We believe in supporting local talent. The creators Andrew and Adam will not be paid for their work, everyone else on board will be!

If we don't make the $20,000, we will use what we have raised towards the production of season 1

  • Any additional money after the $20,000 is raised, we will use it in production of season 1, advertisement and going into production for a second season.

The Impact

The splash and buzz that the idea of the show on its own has created has been phenomenal. This show was created to put a comedic spin on the drama, stresses and problems we may face in our life. For people to have that relatability with it, when they watch it they sit there and point and say 'Yes, I've been through that'. Or 'I have a friend like that', and 'my first love was like that'.

Also showing how being young and dating in 2019 is, with the whole social media movement changing the game. Showing what being friends really means, no matter what we go through or how hard times get our mates are always there. On the flip side showing what tears us apart, for good or stupid reasons.

The young creators are established actors/writers that have written short films and skits together.  Their vast fan base will allow this project to expand and grow hopefully getting regular air time or even as far as streaming platforms such as Netflix or streaming live.

Risks & Challenges

This series has been one that has been worked on day/night from the ground up making sure that it done to perfection.

We want to be able to shoot something amazing for the talent we have behind this, and we can bring that to you and the screens with the help of YOU. We cannot do this without you and every bit is rewarded.

  • We have been fortunate enough to have backing from clothing brands, locations and talented people in the film/tv industry
  • All the camera, sound and lightning equipment to shoot the best damn sitcom possible, with all the props that is going to put the cherry onto of this production
  • After this is completed and film, production companies have been contacted to jump on board with this series and have received nothing but great backing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Alot of people and business have given their helping hand in organising this series and contributing to it; money isn't the only thing you can help us out with.

  • Please share our project on social media! Including this campaign and our teaser videos.
  • Donate Music: Are you a singer, rapper wed love to not only have your tunes on the show, but also advertise for you.
  • Props/Wardrobe: We can use your a dinner set, or picture frame to help aid designing the set or got a clothing brand you want the characters to wear wed love to hear from you.
  • Locations: Would you like us to film our show at one of your locations. Donate your locations!  Bars, Restaurants, Office Spaces, Houses, etc. 
  • Donate Graphic Design Skills: You could help us design our posters and marketing materials, logos etc 
  • Donate your skills- What are you good at? Hit us up and we'll tell you how you can help! Email us twtbaf@gmail.com

Social Media

Be sure to like and follow us on social media

  • https://www.instagram.com/officialakook/?hl=en
  • https://www.instagram.com/twtbaf/?hl=en
  • https://www.facebook.com/TWTBAF/

Special Guests

We also have a bunch of social media influencers, and special guests to appear in the show with guest roles and cameos. Stay tuned for that!

and remember THATS WHAT THE BOYS ARE FOR!

Sophia’s big passion is set firmly in designing clothes and creating art projects - yet struggles to find meaningful and sustainable work.
A believer in monogamy (even when her man doesn’t know it) and traditional gender roles, Sophia doesn’t live life as a pushover - yet her aversion to Tinder & modern dating norms, leaves her love life drier than the Sahara desert.
Sophia’s past ends up catching up with her in the first season which hurts her standing in the group and raises questions - what has she been involved in, and what is she capable of?  
Chan Chan

CHAN CHAN (24.5) おはよう ございます is a misunderstood orphan, who needs friendship more than air (and mi goreng).
An Asian of some kind, Chan is disconnected from his heritage, having been raised by Greek parents. He desperately wants to find his birth parents (and avoid ASIO).
Chan lives on a steady diet of cocaine & hookers, mainly by following them on Instagram due to his lack of social confidence.
A prideful man, Chan sees the power of hard work, but is easily manipulated by his friends for their own gain.
Identifying heavily with Bruce Lee, Chan sees himself to be a kung fu master - which might be the most physically harmful & casually racist stereotype he has internalised about himself.
Episode 1 : Pilot
Andii wreaks havoc at the mechanic shop; whilst the house erupts in chaos over who will the dishes, forcing a trial judged by an uninvited guest - who abuses his power over the gang. A love triangle is formed.
Partners
The cast all dressed by

https://roqclothing.com
http://heskie.com
http://www.westsideapparel.com
http://symblapparel.com
https://theantiorder.co.uk
https://www.reptileapparel.com.au


What We Need

We are looking to raise $20,000 to help fund our 8 episode first season. All the funds raised will be spent on production and post production expenses as well as props for the show.
Expenses:

Cast and Crew (Director of Photography, Assistant Camera, Grip, Sound, Assistant Director, Production Assistant, Hair & Make Up,  Actors)
Production: Locations, Permits, Meals, Equipment, Wardrobe, Props.
Post Production: Sound Design, Music Licensing
We believe in supporting local talent. The creators Andrew and Adam will not be paid for their work, everyone else on board will be!

If we don't make the $20,000, we will use what we have raised towards the production of season 1
Any additional money after the $20,000 is raised, we will use it in production of season 1, advertisement and going into production for a second season.


The Impact
The splash and buzz that the idea of the show on its own has created has been phenomenal. This show was created to put a comedic spin on the drama, stresses and problems we may face in our life. For people to have that relatability with it, when they watch it they sit there and point and say 'Yes, I've been through that'. Or 'I have a friend like that', and 'my first love was like that'.
Also showing how being young and dating in 2019 is, with the whole social media movement changing the game. Showing what being friends really means, no matter what we go through or how hard times get our mates are always there. On the flip side showing what tears us apart, for good or stupid reasons.
The young creators are established actors/writers that have written short films and skits together.  Their vast fan base will allow this project to expand and grow hopefully getting regular air time or even as far as streaming platforms such as Netflix or streaming live.


Risks & Challenges
This series has been one that has been worked on day/night from the ground up making sure that it done to perfection.
We want to be able to shoot something amazing for the talent we have behind this, and we can bring that to you and the screens with the help of YOU. We cannot do this without you and every bit is rewarded.

We have been fortunate enough to have backing from clothing brands, locations and talented people in the film/tv industry
All the camera, sound and lightning equipment to shoot the best damn sitcom possible, with all the props that is going to put the cherry onto of this production
After this is completed and film, production companies have been contacted to jump on board with this series and have received nothing but great backing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Alot of people and business have given their helping hand in organising this series and contributing to it; money isn't the only thing you can help us out with.

Please share our project on social media! Including this campaign and our teaser videos.
Donate Music: Are you a singer, rapper wed love to not only have your tunes on the show, but also advertise for you.
Props/Wardrobe: We can use your a dinner set, or picture frame to help aid designing the set or got a clothing brand you want the characters to wear wed love to hear from you.
Locations: Would you like us to film our show at one of your locations. Donate your locations!  Bars, Restaurants, Office Spaces, Houses, etc. 
Donate Graphic Design Skills: You could help us design our posters and marketing materials, logos etc 
Donate your skills- What are you good at? Hit us up and we'll tell you how you can help! Email us twtbaf@gmail.com


Social Media
Be sure to like and follow us on social media

https://www.instagram.com/officialakook/?hl=en
https://www.instagram.com/twtbaf/?hl=en
https://www.facebook.com/TWTBAF/

Special Guests
We also have a bunch of social media influencers, and special guests to appear in the show with guest roles and cameos. Stay tuned for that!
and remember THATS WHAT THE BOYS ARE FOR!

story:
Take Two

Last year, myself (Gabriel Fowler) and my two closest friends (Alex Desjardin and Andrew Cohen) produced a five-episode season of an original web series titled, Art Less. We laughed, we cried, we fell in love with the show, and now we want to do it all over again. If you haven't seen season one, or want to rewatch, click here to watch it on YouTube or click here to watch it on Amazon Video.

Obviously, we want to make more episodes, and a lot of you share that hope too. Luckily, we have plans to film a new and rebranded Art Less, including a total of six new episodes.

What We Need 

Our budget includes feeding our crew for 10 days in July and  12 days in August, and once you factor in insurance, equipment rentals, post-production and promotional costs, etc. the budget is upwards of $3,000 all on a student budget. The point is, we need every dime we can get and rest assured, we will not be paying ourselves (everyone involved is volunteering their time and skills).

Here's what we need:

-Buying/renting equipment, especially a sound recorder, higher quality microphone, and a BLIMP Windshield, in order to make the dialogue/sound of the show as clear as possible. 

-Craft services for our crew. Not a bag of off-brand Fritos and the half-eaten box of Ritz Crackers that our Moms have in the cupboard

-Insurance, so that we are able to film at local businesses, city-owned property, etc. with permission so we don't get arrested whilst filming.

-Post Production editors, foley artists, and voice over work for two new characters. 

We hope to deliver a second season that improves in every way of that of the first season and that will make you laugh, cry and most importantly have a good time. 

In short, the more money that is donated, the higher the production value of the series will be. If we don't reach our entire goal, whatever funds we do raise will go towards production.

The Creative Team

The Impact

We're not trying to change the world too much here, but instead, make a sometimes comedic, dramatic, and realistic series that viewers of all ages can relate to and enjoy. We know web series are a dime a dozen these days, but we know with your help, we can make Art Less stand out just a bit more.

Risks & Challenges

Even if we raise nothing we still plan to create the show and put everything we've got all into it. We have a fantastic cast and crew on board, and now we need the help of you, our supporters, to make Art Less the best it can be! However, should the North-Eastern Seaboard fall into the Atlantic Ocean, there may be some delays.

story: ____________________________________________

"If you don't read the newspaper, you are uninformed; if you do read the newspaper, you are misinformed."  -- Mark Twain...or Winston Churchill...don't fact check us!

Hello, there 

Greetings and felicitations! My name is Eric VanDruff and with nearly 200 completed projects under my belt in areas such as commercials, promos, music videos, documentaries, live performances, international films, etc., I am excited to share with you my newest project, Technical Difficulties, a situation comedy series. This project is close to my heart because many of the stories are based off of me and two of my friends, Philip and Tyler, who co-created this show. We hope with your participation, we will bring to life a comedy series worthy of your support and we hope you will laugh and enjoy the show as much as we enjoyed laughing and creating it! To see my film work, please visit my site www.vimeo.com/vp. Also, please visit our Technical Difficulties: https://fb.me/TDTVseries

The Story 

Long Beach, CA. It may not be as glamorous as Hollywood, or as cozy as Orange County, but it’s right in the epicenter of the greatest region in the world. It’s the Jan Brady of metro Los Angeles. Well, with better boobs and no braces. So, like season four Jan? 

Regardless, this glossed over city of nearly 500,000 people needs news that’s local! Who’s to provide this niche content, you ask? Leave it to Around & About Long Beach News, the show-within-a-show run out of the Digital Media Center of a second-rate community college. This series follows AALB's student producers, reporters, and the small faculty that oversees their misadventures. 

This series, while satirical in its portrayal of broadcast news, still maintains a sense of realism by focusing closely on its characters---a group of diverse students who are all experiencing young-adulthood and transitioning into the professional world, as well as long-tenured professors and staff members who also face great conflicts, challenges, and decisions. 

The situations our characters find themselves in and their flawed attempts at overcoming their shortcomings heightens the comedy and makes the lessons resonate more strongly.

Proof of Concept

Our end game, of course, is to make Technical Difficulties a long-running episodic series. Whether that's producing a full Pilot and subsequent episodes in-house or pitching the series to networks, we must first prove to them, and most importantly, YOU, that this concept has all the necessary elements to entertain audiences. Thus, we are producing a modest 5-minute (approx.) medley of scenes from our season one scripts that will allow you to meet our characters and get a feel for the show. 

What We Need 

We're looking to raise $3,430 to cover a portion of our basic expenses, which are listed below! 

  • Studio Rental ($1,500)
  • 1st A.D. ($200)
  • Director of Photography ($100)
  • Gaffer ($200)
  • Sound Mixer + equipment ($200)
  • Asst. Camera Op. ($100)
  • Boom Operator + equipment ($100)
  • Props/Set Dressing ($320)
  • Craft Services 30 people ($250)
  • Permits/Fees/Incidentals ($310). 
  • Photographer/Second Unit Video ($150)  ​

​

Perks!

The exciting part about opening a portion of our budget to crowdfunding is the added experience of audience participation! The right side of your screen lays out a variety of incentives that correspond with your donation. Among the benefits...

  • Producer Credits
  • Exclusive Behind the Scenes Content
  • Signed Memorabilia 
  • Opportunity to join the cast as an extra
  • Opportunity to call "Action!" and "Cut!" during an actual scene! 

Your contribution not only inches us closer to production, but provides a boost of moral support that we cannot thank you enough for. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you're unable to make a donation, you can still contribute!

    • Indiegogo share tools allow you to spread this campaign accross your network!
    • Watch, follow, and subscribe to our various pages to keep up-to-date! 
    • Prayers, well wishes, and positive comments are invaluable and appreciated dearly.

story:
LAST CALL Season Two Production Begins!

 

THANK YOU!

Thank you, thank you, thank you to everyone who donated to make our first season a reality! With your help, we were able to make a full season of 12 episodes! Now, we are getting ready to continue Leo's quest to opening his own bar! 

TO WATCH SEASON ONE, CLICK HERE!

Follow LAST CALL on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram

You can also see all our behind the scenes videos on our YouTube channel! And, while you're here... follow Mike, Bianca, Michael, Robert, Mair, John Dylan, Moe, Cliff and Matthew too!  

________________________________________________

HOLY WOW!

Our first season, all 12 episodes, went LIVE on Youtube over the 2017 holidays! They were largely self-funded by its creator, Mike Dreyden along with generous donations from family, friends and fans like you. Thank you so much for your contributions.

We've accomplished so much over the last two years. First we became a Brooklyn Web Fest Official Selection and invited to premiere at the 2016 festival. In so doing, we received FOUR award nominations. PREMIERE SERIES AWARD, EMERGING VOICES AWARD, MADE IN NY AWARD and AUDIENCE AWARD. We were blown away and honored. Thank you BWF!

In December 2017 we received word that we were an Official Selection of qFLIX Philadelphia and screened 3 episodes at the March 2018 festival. This past summer we also received word we were a qFLIX Worcester Official Selection AND Centerpiece Selection!

On Sunday, October 14, 2018 we WON the

qFLIX Worcester Audience Award in New Media!

SWAG GALORE!

We want to step it up for our second season and reward the cast and crew with more than just "copy, credit and meals."  The entire team continue their tireless efforts to bring our show to the screen and we would like to better show our appreciation. Here's how you can help...

It takes a decent amount of money for a production like ours. From renting equipment, paying for locations, transportation, licensing music, post production costs, basic operating expenses, and of course lunch. It all adds up. We certainly hope you can find it in your hearts and your pocket books to back us.

There are a number of locations we are eager to book and you get to be a part of the process. Our VIPs will have first dibs in choosing and backing each location. Here's your chance to have a hand in designing the look of the show. Two lucky backers will be randomly chosen to attend the shoot at the location they back.

EXCLUSIVE PASSES TO ALL OF OUR PARTIES!

We can't wait for you to join us and celebrate!

________________________________________________

ABOUT THE SERIES

It all started 5 years ago when I decided to write my memoir. I was in a transitional space emotionally and living situation. After a break up that devastated me, then couch surfing until I found a place I could afford, I moved into an SRO in Chelsea. The memoir was put on the back burner after I read an article in Backstage where artists, after dealing with rejection after rejection started creating opportunities for themselves. That's when it hit me. I am sitting on years of experiences only I have, obviously, and I could tell that story about, a story about leaving my 10 year real estate career, working in fitness then jumping cannon ball style into gay New York City nightlife and porn. I still can't believe I did that and that it went so far.

~ Mike Dreyden

THE CAST

THE GANG'S ALL HERE! Mike Dreyden (Available Light, This Side of Heaven, Child of the 70s, LAST CALL), along with actors Michael Vaccaro (Child of the 70s) and Robert Maisonett (AS IS, Latin Lives), Mair Heller, Bianca Leigh (The Nap, Hurricane Bianca), Clifford Ray Berry (How To Make It Big), Moe Bertran (House of Mayhem), John Dylan DeLaTorre (People You Know) and Matthew Montelongo (Daniel's Husband, West 40s) are all returning to their roles and round out this amazing group of actors.

CHECK THIS OUT!

Season 1 has been a great success! We have 141 Youtube subscribers and growing. Watch time by our Youtube subscribers is up 25% and up 76% by non subscribers, with over 7 thousand views here in the US, Canada, UK, Spain, Germany, Switzerland and Australia. We also get fan mail from around the world too! We have 661 Facebook Likes and Followers and that is growing.

We need YOUR help to continue to grow and continue the next part this adventure. We are still a completely independent production. We don't have a big time studio or partner to help cover post production costs, so we still have to raise our production budget by April 25th or we won't be able to film this summer. $20,000 will allow us to produce a 9 episode season, and we have some exciting stretch goals planned if we pass our goal!

GUEST STARS & CAMEOS

HOLY MOLY YOU GUYS!! Do we have a incredible line up of guest stars and cameos or do we!? Season 2 promises to be hilarious, with lots of sexy, drama, laughter and even a Porn Star Awards ceremony featuring REAL LIFE SUPERSTAR PORN STARS! SIGN UP for alerts to get the weekly announcements.

OUR KICK ASS TEAM!

Mike Dreyden : Creator, Writer, Lead

Robert Mercado : Director

AJ Mattioli : Director of Photography

Matthew Breda : 1st AD

Ariel Mahler : Script Supervisor

SOUND TECHNICIANS

Nicholas Valva & Boris Palacios

PRODUCTION ASSISTANTS

Tiffany Carvalho / Jordan Allison / John Bart Skelton

STYLIST

Amron Hayes
 

AWESOMENESS!

STAREABLE is a platform creating connections for web series creators with audiences who care about independent content, between filmmakers and their peers, and with traditional television looking for the next great voice.

LAST CALL has had a page on Stareable.com for a while now. We've connected with many talented creators from around the world. Recently we've become a top ranked series on the platform. Thanks to all of fans! We're honored! CLICK IMAGE!

RISKS and CHALLENGES

Making a low budget series like LAST CALL (as compared to a lot of studio projects) brings many challenges. We learned this while shooting our first two episode, from losing locations to having actors drop out to having equipment break down, you have to be able to roll with the punches. We learned a lot of new lessons too, as we continue to create our first season, including the fact that some Indiegogo pledges don't ultimately go through if they are declined by the backer's bank--so make sure to verify your payment method will go through if you're interested in one of our higher level rewards!

With only our tenacity, AND YOU, our FAMILY AND FRIENDS backing us, you have a hand in us continuing our track record of producing a quality, award winning show on a shoestring budget. We love making the series and we are confident we can make a spectacular second season!

A note about the perks: This campaign we have special, one of a kind perks only OUR backers will receive. Delivery dates are only estimates and are subject to change-- but don't worry, Mike Dreyden will keep you updated! Some rewards also contain multiple availability dates for digital vs. physical delivery.

The VIP S2 Launch Party and Wrap Party will be held in New York City. We cannot provide transportation or accommodations, but we can promise it'll be all kinds of AMAZING!

There may be additional paperwork required to fulfill some rewards, such as producing credits or appearances on camera. This is for both your protection and ours!

Other Ways You Can Help

Now, we know some people just can't contribute, and we understand this. Here's another way you can help.

Our BIGGEST CHALLENGE is making sure that enough people hear about the NEW CAMPAIGN so that we can make our goal! Social media algorithms are not our friend. Email us today and we will send you our CAMPAIGN BADGES for you to share.

Use these hashtags every time you share the campaign.

#MIKEDREYDEN #MIKEDREYDENMEDIA #LASTCALLWEBSERIES

#ACTORSLIFE #SETLIFE #WEBSERIES #MADEINNY

WE KNOW WE CAN DO THIS WITH YOUR HELP! PLEASE BACK US AND SHARE THIS PAGE WITH ALL YOUR FRIENDS!

________________________________________________

SUBSCRIBE AND FOLLOW US

Facebook :: Twitter :: Youtube :: Instagram

Matthew Breda : 1st AD
Ariel Mahler : Script Supervisor
SOUND TECHNICIANS
Nicholas Valva & Boris Palacios
PRODUCTION ASSISTANTS
Tiffany Carvalho / Jordan Allison / John Bart Skelton
STYLIST
Amron Hayes 
AWESOMENESS!
STAREABLE is a platform creating connections for web series creators with audiences who care about independent content, between filmmakers and their peers, and with traditional television looking for the next great voice.
LAST CALL has had a page on Stareable.com for a while now. We've connected with many talented creators from around the world. Recently we've become a top ranked series on the platform. Thanks to all of fans! We're honored! CLICK IMAGE!

RISKS and CHALLENGES
Making a low budget series like LAST CALL (as compared to a lot of studio projects) brings many challenges. We learned this while shooting our first two episode, from losing locations to having actors drop out to having equipment break down, you have to be able to roll with the punches. We learned a lot of new lessons too, as we continue to create our first season, including the fact that some Indiegogo pledges don't ultimately go through if they are declined by the backer's bank--so make sure to verify your payment method will go through if you're interested in one of our higher level rewards!
With only our tenacity, AND YOU, our FAMILY AND FRIENDS backing us, you have a hand in us continuing our track record of producing a quality, award winning show on a shoestring budget. We love making the series and we are confident we can make a spectacular second season!
A note about the perks: This campaign we have special, one of a kind perks only OUR backers will receive. Delivery dates are only estimates and are subject to change-- but don't worry, Mike Dreyden will keep you updated! Some rewards also contain multiple availability dates for digital vs. physical delivery.
The VIP S2 Launch Party and Wrap Party will be held in New York City. We cannot provide transportation or accommodations, but we can promise it'll be all kinds of AMAZING!
There may be additional paperwork required to fulfill some rewards, such as producing credits or appearances on camera. This is for both your protection and ours!
Other Ways You Can Help
Now, we know some people just can't contribute, and we understand this. Here's another way you can help.
Our BIGGEST CHALLENGE is making sure that enough people hear about the NEW CAMPAIGN so that we can make our goal! Social media algorithms are not our friend. Email us today and we will send you our CAMPAIGN BADGES for you to share.
Use these hashtags every time you share the campaign.
#MIKEDREYDEN #MIKEDREYDENMEDIA #LASTCALLWEBSERIES
#ACTORSLIFE #SETLIFE #WEBSERIES #MADEINNY
WE KNOW WE CAN DO THIS WITH YOUR HELP! PLEASE BACK US AND SHARE THIS PAGE WITH ALL YOUR FRIENDS!
________________________________________________
SUBSCRIBE AND FOLLOW US

Facebook :: Twitter :: Youtube :: Instagram

story:
Meet Andrea Edgerson and Alex Campos, two friends that met in acting school and bonded over the mutual feeling of being misrepresented in the entertainment industry. They are also the ladies behind 2 Brown Girls Productions, a company formed with the hope of creating content that is diverse, inclusive and represents the people and stories they feel never get told. Together Dre and Alex have produced a short film, [written by Dre and directed by Alex]   a PSA centered on "Oscars so White," a dance film and have spent the last two years working on a new original webseries, "Bald"

      

          

Bald is more than just a passion project, it is the heart of soul of 2 Brown Girls Productions. We've put countless hours, sweat, lots of tears and so much of our hearts into this series. It is a semi-autobiographical series written by Dre about a woman whose foundation is rocked after being diagnosed with Alopecia, an autoimmune disease that causes hair loss, which in Sonja's case is full body hair loss. We meet Sonja a year after being diagnosed and we watch her desperately trying to get her shit together but she can't catch a break. She lost her hair, she lost her job, she's about her to lose her friends and she might just lose her damn mind. Dre has taken real-life experiences that are incredibly personal to her and has found the humor in them. She has written a series that deals with universal issues like body image, insecurities, the bond between women and dating all while staying true to her story and her experience. 

This series is important to us because it's personal, it's forcing us out of our comfort zone and it's said that some of the best work happens when you push yourself to uncomfortable place, [Hello, uncomfortable zone!]  it's a universal story that many people can relate to and it finally showcases different, unique stories and beautiful people of all colors, sizes, and backgrounds. This webseries is the epitome of 2 Brown Girls Productions and truly showcasing everything that is important to us but we can't make this without you. This is why you want you to be a part of the #BaldCrew or #TheBaldPack #TheBaldCrew

       

           

We have already filmed a teaser of the season one of "Bald" but we're ready to take it to the next level and film all of season one! After shooting the trailer we quickly learned it's not going to be easy to film season one BUT, we believe it takes a village to make a project like this and in order to make Bald a reality, we need you! Our goal is to raise $20,000 to hire a crew, equipment rental, feeding cast and crew and editing. Below is a detailed breakdown of exactly what your backing would go towards. 

  1. Hiring a Crew: We need to hire a director, the director of photographer, grip + electric, sound person, editor, producers, production managers, production assistants and every role in between. We strongly believe that everyone deserves to get paid for their time and we want to be able to properly compensate our crew.
  2. Paying our Cast: Actors deserved to be paid and we want to make sure the talented group of actors we've cast in this webseries is compensated for all their work!
  3. Equipment Rental:  Getting the right equipment is perhaps one of the most costly aspects of this project but it's also one of the most important. We want to make sure we are renting gear that will truly make this series shine and helps us tell the story as best as we can.
  4. Food: Our cast and crew have to eat and we would love to offer them healthy options that fit everyone's dietary needs.
  5. Editing: Once filming is wrapped it's time to head into post which means editing! We would love to be able to hire someone that can truly bring "Bald" to life! 

     

       

              

We might sound like a broken record but we really couldn't do this without you and we want to make sure we can give YOU something back too! Some of our perks are a private meal for two curated by Chef Colin Havens and made in the comfort of your own home, an invitation to our wrap party, joining us for a night out on the red carpet at our official premiere party and some Bald swag! 

    

 

        

Bald is all-encompassing. We all have perceived flaws that can sometimes hinder our relationships, change how we see the world and can be a block in finding our best self. Your support of this project is more than helping to raise funds so we can film the series. It’s about embracing those things we think are flaws. We know first hand what it feels like to be represented and to see yourself in a film or show and we want to be able to give that to other people. Bald is a project that we believe is important and can shed light on issues like alopecia, how women of color deal with hair/hair loss, the power and strength in female friendships. We think it's time stories like this get to shine and we would be honored if we could be the storytellers. 

               

There is no way we can do this without and we don't want to do it without you! 2 Brown Girls is all about collaborative work and we know Bald will be better with you on our team! Your support will help us to bring this webseries to life! Can you edit? have a discount where we rent our equipment, space (rehearsal, shooting etc) we could use, know a stylist who can offer free or reduced services? You know what goes into making a film, short or web series and if you have suggestions or guidance, we could use your knowledge :) You just sharing this campaign and spreading the word is so incredibly helpful and we are forever thankful for it! If you can't donate, don't sweat it! Send us some good juju, spread the word and most importantly, welcome to the #Bald Crew!

-Alex + Dre

story:
Hello to all of you who are reading us now! We are Bojana (23) and Milos (24). Attention (now, you will face a bunch of boring text) do not say later that we didn’t warn you.

But let’s go back to us- we finished the Faculty of Culture and Media. Since then we worked in our country as a Journalists for some period. Also, on our room wall you can find certificates in the field of public speaking, and acting.

Now I know that you think that we are some kind of brother and sister or boyfriend and girlfriend, but the real fact is that we are none of that. We really hate each other. The only thing we have in common is this crazy idea to implement our innovational project into action.

 

Pozdrav za sve vas koji nas trenutno gledate! Mi smo Bojana (23) i Milos (24), Upozorenje (susrešćete se sa gomilom dosadnog teksta) čisto da ne kažete posle da vas nismo upozorili . Dakle, završili smo fakultet za kulturu i medije. Nakon toga smo radili jedno vreme kao novinari. Imamo sertifikate u oblasti javnog govorništva i glume.

Znamo da ste pomislili na to, ali ne, nismo brat i sestra, niti momak i devojka, zapravo mrzimo jedno drugo. Zajednička stvar zbog koje smo ovde jeste taj korak da sprovedemo nasu ludačku ideju u delo. 

 

Svorc (Broke)  is a travelogue show, grounded on elements of entertainment and education. Svorc is based on expeditions of two young people that are going on a journey of modern pilgrimage. Relying primarily on the humanity of unknown people, hosts of this show are going on a journey passing through the cities around the world,using hitchhike methods as the only way of transport , a tent to crash in, and their possibilities for finding a place to sleep in.. In the beginning of the venture hosts of this show will have only 25 euros each and they have certain time limit to get to their destination. The main goal is to exit from the current comfortable position into the unexpected way of life.

The accent of this show is based on not so typical handling, tearing down stereotypes and prejudice of everyday life, through our uncommon actions we will try to inspire you with our humor and will. Meeting new people and their life stories are just passing actions of each episode, in which we wont be afraid to go and think outside the box and overcome our worst fears. Along the way, we will try to earn money by doing creative things so that we have enough money to survive. The dynamism and unpredictability of this show we will maintain through everyday activity along the way. They will provide a fun aspect of this show which is one of the most important things.

 

Švorc je putopisna emisija, zabavno-edukativnog karaktera, zasnovana na putovanjima dvoje mladih ljudi koji kreću na put modernog hodočašća. Oslanjajući se pre svega na humanost njima nepoznatih osoba, akteri emisije kreću u avanturu prolazeći kroz Evropske (svetske) gradove, koristeći auto stop kao osnovno transportno sredstvo, šator za spavanje, i svoje sposobnosti za pronalazak prenoćišta. Voditelji ove emisije sa sobom od finansijskih sredstava nose samo po 25 eura i imaju zadatak da za određeni vremenski rok stignu do zadate destinacije. Glavni cilj je izlazak iz dosadašnjih komfornih pozicija  i stupanje u sferu nepoznatog.

Akcenat emisije je na atipičnim snalaženjima, razbijanju stereotipa i predrasuda svakodnevnice, kroz naše nesvakidašnje akcije nastojaćemo da svojim humorom i voljom inspirišemo i vas. Upoznavanje sa novim ljudima i njihovim životnim pričama samo su usputne stanice svake epizode, u kojima se necemo libiti da prevaziđemo zacrtane granice i prebrodimo sve svoje strahove. Usput, pokusacemo da zaradimo novac na  kreativne načine kako bismo imali za osnovne potrebe. Dinamičnost i nepredvidivost emisije održavaćemo kroz svakodnevne aktivnosti na putu. One će doprineti polju zabave koji je neizostavan deo ovog projekta.

On the road activities:

  • Cringe-is a jar with tasks that the TV host couple will carry around with themselves throughout the whole trip, and which will contain little pieces of paper with written unpleasant tasks and public fears which will be written along the way. With certain task it will be concluded which of the hosts will draw out the paper and then try to fulfill the task.

  • Trying to make money on public places and other locations on as many different and interesting ways possible, without begging for money.

  • Meeting new people and their way of life, showing different cultures and unusual ways of thinking.

  • Every different transporter ( a person who will drive us ) will have an assignment to tell an interesting story about the situation it has found itself in.

  • Finding as cheap as possible food sources which will fulfill basic daily needs for food and water.

  • Showing the cities night life

  • „Catch the moment“ is an activity in which the host will visit the landmark of the city; on the given location, the people behind the small screens will have the oportunity to enjoy the surroundings while Milos and Bojana will try to bring to life the historical and cultural meaning of the object or landscape. They will emphasize the present as a one dimension where the past will be seen and the future loomed, and the moment of joy as the only parameter for a positive vibe.

 

Life without rules, boundaries, patterns and convictions at which people live by, are things that inspire us to give an example of a positive way of thinking. We will try to tear down the prejudice and prove that the potential poverty of life cant be the excuse for not proceeding with your dreams and wishes.

Život bez granica, pravila, ubeđenja i šablona po kojima čovek živi, su stvari koje nas inspirišu da kroz prikaz kreiranja sopstvene realnosti damo primer pozitivnog načina razmišljanja. Potrudicemo se da razbijemo predrasude i dokažemo da potencijalna nemaština i neuslovnost života ne smeju biti izgovori za odustajanje od vaših snova i želja.

 

 

We need your power as individual for sharing this idea of living to everyone you know. 

That will be biggest contribution from you to us.   

For the realization of this project we need money support for getting the technical equipment such as cameras, microphones, memories, batteries and the other following audio and video equipment. Travel equipment which are the tent, backpacks, and sleeping bags...and other crucial costs such as opening a production house, the expenses of the montage and sound adjustment, marketing and promotion of the project and so on... 

The show is open to all types of advertising and negotiation with companies that want to support the project​.

Location  we need to reach in our first season (first few episodes) is Italian City Palermo, the center of the Sicily.

From our starting point (Belgrade) we need to cross  minimum 2174 km to reach our destination. 

 

Pre svega potrebno nam je vaše učestvovanje u širenju ove ideje kako verbalnim putem , tako i putem društevnih mreža.

To će predstavljati vaš najveći doprinos.

Za realizaciju ovog projekta, potrebna nam je novčana podrska za pribavljanje tehničke opreme poput kamera, mikrofona, memorija, baterija i ostale prateće audio i video opreme. Zatim putna oprema koju čine sator, rančevi, vreće za spavanje...i ostali krucijalni troškovi kao što su otvaranje produkcijske kuće, troškovi montaže i obrade zvuka, marketing i promocija projekta i slično...

Emisija je otvorena za  pregovaranje oko reklamiranja svih brendova i sponzora koji budu materijalno podržali ovaj projekat.​

Lokacija na koju treba da stignemo u našoj prvoj sezoni (prvih nekoliko epizoda) je Italijanski Grad Palermo, centar Sicilije.

 

Od naše polazne tačke (Beograda) potrebno je da pređemo najmanje 2174 km kako bi stigli do naše destinacije.

The project  is written according to the idea of the host couple who were not selected to run the show, they spontaneously created this project together. The project is mirror of the nomadic spirit they possess.

Projekat je pisan po ideji voditeljskog para koji nije izabran za vođenje emisije, već je zajednički kreirao ovaj projekat. Projekat je ogledalo nomadskog duha koji poseduju.

 

 

“The journey is what brings us happiness, not the destination.” – Dan Millman.

Zatim putna oprema koju čine sator, rančevi, vreće za spavanje...i ostali krucijalni troškovi kao što su otvaranje produkcijske kuće, troškovi montaže i obrade zvuka, marketing i promocija projekta i slično...Emisija je otvorena za  pregovaranje oko reklamiranja svih brendova i sponzora koji budu materijalno podržali ovaj projekat.​Lokacija na koju treba da stignemo u našoj prvoj sezoni (prvih nekoliko epizoda) je Italijanski Grad Palermo, centar Sicilije. Od naše polazne tačke (Beograda) potrebno je da pređemo najmanje 2174 km kako bi stigli do naše destinacije.The project  is written according to the idea of the host couple who were not selected to run the show, they spontaneously created this project together. The project is mirror of the nomadic spirit they possess.Projekat je pisan po ideji voditeljskog para koji nije izabran za vođenje emisije, već je zajednički kreirao ovaj projekat. Projekat je ogledalo nomadskog duha koji poseduju.  “The journey is what brings us happiness, not the destination.” – Dan Millman.

story:
Short Summary

Kerstyn and Rachael met when they were cast in a play together. They clicked instantly over their equally crazy senses of humor. Quick and inappropriate, these girls have banter like no-one's business. As they were already completely in love they knew they had to do another project together, so they decided to write one! 

And two years later we have filmed and created the rich worlds of Natalie and Lexi,

What We Need and What You Get

We need money for a state of the art editor, sound editor, colour grader and for some distribution costs. We have worked so hard on this project for such a long time. We have both sunk meagre savings into the project. We just need a last little leg up to get this baby finished! 

We wrote this project for us as women. We were sick of the held back, beige versions of women so often displayed in film and TV. We want the real deal. The real funny, good, bad, and otherwise. This project was written by women, has two strong female leads and is directed by women. Our soundtrack will be comprised fully of female bands and musicians. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our page with your friends. 

Share our show when it comes out. 

Watch and support TV shows and Movies with strong female characters.

story:
My name is Angel and I run the TURKISH SERIES For English Speakers. We're  a small and close knit community that has been the go to platform for many people, in order to discuss Turkish shows and much more for nearly six years. We started out as a place where a handful of people could go to discuss one show and we've grown into a large community with members from every continent and cultural and social background. A community where people can go in order to share their common passion for Turkish shows and much more. Your generosity will help keep our wonderful community and second home to many of us up and running.  

Our goal is to raise $2400 to cover the expenses of our online community for the next year. It will cover the monthly license fee and well as occasional upgrades and enhancements to the community. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that some of you may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign or use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My mother always told me: “you may not be the smartest, maybe not the most handsome, but dammit you’re great at writing opening lines.” 

As a Brooklyn College student, we’re given the opportunity (forced) to work on dozens of different student films over four years. Each of these shoots taught me about how film operates, and about what not to do on a set. I’ve worked with some incredibly talented people, some have become close friends whom I plan on working with for the rest of my life. Others, ehh, not so much. 

Luckily for us, this isn’t just a student project. I’m fortunate to have a handful of professors here at Brooklyn College that believe in me. After a VERY rough pitch of Camp GetRight, I was approached by a professor about the Rosen Fellowship. One semester, two sleepless nights, and three rigorous interviews later, I was one of two film projects awarded funding. It wasn’t just money put behind this project, it was complete trust in my abilities, my team, and my passion. 

Your contribution to continue to bring this project to life means so much to me and to my creative team. Even though I had the idea for this web series, it isn’t mine anymore. I chose to write this project with four remarkably talented writers. I trust my cinematographer and producer with my life. The crew are all so excited to work on this project with me, for free, and that blind passion isn’t something I’ve come across on other film sets. 

Your donations go an incredibly long way. The money we’ve won to put this project on only barely covers the price of equipment, and we’ve got lots of mouths to feed. Our two biggest costs will end up being transportation and food. The entire cast and crew agreed to work for free because they love the script, the project, and the message. Each donation, in any amount, gives us the opportunity to shoot all of the pages we’ve already written. 

Anyone who donates to our campaign, in any amount, will receive a huge thank you in our credits and a video from the cast and crew with our thanks. Check out all the other awesome perks you'll receive if you donate certain amounts! And...if you singlehandedly fund our entire campaign, I’ll marry you. Seriously, try me. I’m not kidding. Oh, and you can also have the calendar. 

This project stands for what we can do as filmmakers. It’s our way of saying “Hey! Here we are, this is what we can do, please hire us.” This is our resume, business card, and our LinkedIn profile (we also have those too). This is our way of showing off what we have to contribute to the golden age of TV. 

Supporting this campaign is supporting us to do what we love. If you can’t donate, that’s fine! Helping to spread the word and sharing this on your social media is free, and a tremendous help. 

Thank you for your support!

-Dominick Famularo
