story:
THE SUMmary OF ALL FEARS

MISTER SANDMAN is a series of spooky bedtime stories for big kids.

Each episode tells the tale of some unspeakable horror that has been made manifest by the architect of our very dreams.  His goal is not to kill, but to conjure up intense emotions in his victims so that he may feast! He's not a cruel creature; he simply feeds on the fear that drips from so many stupefied souls. But sometimes, just sometimes, the fearsome nightly phantom is famished… and he goes a little too far.

 

BRING ME A DREAM

We are seeking $11,000 to produce 5 episodes of Mister Sandman: Nightmares Manifest.

Your support will go "all on screen", as they say. This means that every cent we raise will be put directly into the production costs of the show, such as: actors' fees, equipment, location fees and insurance, post-production costs, VFX, etc. 

We know that we already have the beginnings of something SPOOKTACULAR,  evidenced by the work we did on our first teaser short. The camera gear and light & grip package we used on that first "episode" really delivered and we have a highly skilled crew behind it all, who are also our long-time creative collective/dream-team.

If you've seen the Teaser Episode, the high quality we achieved with it was on a similar-sized ultra-indie budget. And the audience reaction has been tremendous, with around 150,000 views on YouTube, 1000's of likes, fantastic fan comments, and even some surreal reaction videos!

Then there's the fan theories...

One of those isn't too far off the mark! But you'll have to support our project and help us get it made to find out which one I mean.

=)

 

PARANORMAL PERKS

What? You thought we were asking for money for nothing? What do you think this is, Hollywood?

Lucky for you and your wallet, we have some AMAZING perks lined up to help make contributing to MISTER SANDMAN worth even more than the experience of being scared speechless alone. We're going to give you the chance to get your hands on Spooky Swag, like some of the more unique items/props from the set, and a membership to the Iron Flamingo Army, with behind-the-scenes access during the making of the series. AND we will be releasing surprise perks along the way, including some hard-to-find, hand-made Mister Sandman Gear, so stay tuned!

PS - For a sneak peek at the perks that are percolating, check out our director's Patreon page.

 

MANIFESTATIONS

If you've read this far, you've probably guessed by now that your support is vital in helping us bring this series of MISTER SANDMAN episodes to life! 

Our previous flight of dark fantasy - Death Wish (a film we also crowdfunded here on Indiegogo), went on to play at numerous festivals, win some awards (Audience Choice Award, Vancouver Short Film Festival; Best Actress, Burbank International Film Festival), and get distribution on iTunes, Amazon and ShortsTV. And, for a short time, it was even HUGE in Japan!

So it feels pretty exciting to wade back into the dark, murky, monster-filled water and... well, hopefully not die. We just need a little boost from all of you to help make it happen!

 

MONSTER MOVIES ARE EASY TO MAKE, RIGHT?

Ummmmm...? Let me see... Death, Taxes, Newborn Baby, Feral Cat, Divorce, MOVIES.

Nope. Movies are a NIGHTMARE to produce. But produce them we shall, because we LOVE them and we know that YOU love to be scared and horrified by them too!

But one of the biggest challenges in producing any piece of art, especially as entertainment, is finding an audience. Fortunately, we cast a devious spell to lure Crypt TV into our dark domain, and they are eager to distribute the remainder of the Mister Sandman series. Their marketing muscle makes them a key partner in getting our project in front of audiences far and wide, and their goal is to become the MARVEL OF MONSTERS. So, if the stars align, perhaps some day soon Mister Sandman himself will be at the forefront of that effort, and perhaps some day out haunting your nightmares from cinema near you.

 

THROW ME A SKULL AND BONE

REALLY? You want to do MORE??? Or, wait, you don't have a killer cash-flow but you still want to see Mister Sandman come to life? Well, either way we couldn't be more thankful!

Even if you can't contribute with coins or cash, you can most definitely help us get the word out! Be part of our team by letting your friends, family and social media community know about what we are doing, and re-post our posts about ghouls and ghosts as often as you can!

We will also be hosting some eerie online events to help dig up the dead and get them walking and talking, so don't forget check back soon!

 

SEE YOU IN YOUR NIGHTMARES,

Chad Costen - Writer / Director / Geeky man-child who is absolutely terrified of space aliens.

&

Timo Puolitaipale - Producer / Warrior / Only afraid of his own children turning into teenagers!

story:
Hello!

My name is Anna Dunbar, and I'm the writer and producer of Bottled Up. Welcome to our IndieGoGo campaign. We hope that you take a moment and consider helping us fund the web series of our dreams!

We here at Bottled Up are super passionate about creating and telling stories that make people laugh, smile, and think about the world around them. We want to create stories that we want to see in the world with diverse representation and strong women driving those stories. That's why this campaign is so important to us.

 

Why support Bottled Up? Here are a couple of reasons!

Reason 1: It's a Magical Story

Bottled Up has this beautiful coming of age story in college. Going to college or experiencing that first year out of the house can be pivotal in a person's life and self discovery, so getting to see classical mythological creatures going through the same things we do as humans is bound to be hilarious and fascinating. Medusa in an fraternity? Athena as an RA? Yes please!  It's guaranteed to be a colorful, lighthearted dramedy with some serious laughs!

Reason 2: Powerful and Talented Women are Leading

It's a story told by women supporting women with a cast and crew full of awesome women. This project is primarily female driven, and in an industry that still lacks a lot of women calling the major shots, we are proud to say that we have many leading the charge!

Reason 3: You are Supporting the Arts

Your contributions are an integral part of this project. We couldn't do this without you!

YOUR Contributions would be helping fund things like:

  • Equipment Rentals (camera, lighting, sound)
  • Location Rental
  • Building the set within our location
  • Building and Purchasing Costume Pieces
  • Building and Purchasing Props
  • Supplying Special Effects Make-Up
  • Providing Special Effects in Post-Production
  • Paying our Cast and Crew
  • Helping us feed our Cast and Crew during production and maintain a safe working environment
  • Plus you basically get to say that you made a TV show happen

Reason 4: We Have Perks

In return for helping us create the web series of our dreams, we want to thank you as much as we can with some awesome perks! We know investing in such a project is a choice, and we want to thank you for choosing to help us! Check out all our perks on the page!

 

Meet Some of the Team!

Writer/Producer: Anna Dunbar is a writer, performer, comedian, and content creator here in Chicago. She has written for and produced multiple works including the YouTube web series Scratch That!, a full length sketch show Sketch Me if You Can!, Late Bus (Sketch Cast at The Second City Training Center), selected scenes in Mary Scruggs Works by Women Festival, Bicker Park, and multiple individual sketches. She graduated with a Bachelor of the Arts degree in theatre, has completed The Comedy Studies program with Columbia College Chicago at The Second City, and has graduated from iO Chicago's improvisational program. http://www.anna-dunbar.com/

Director: Sarah Marie earned her Master's degree in public policy while living and working in Washington, DC. However, as the world shifted, she decided she wanted to pursue more serious work in comedy. To that end, she is wrapping up her final term as a student at The Second City's Harold Ramis Film School in Chicago. She directs, writes, acts, and improvises, and is drawn to content with a social message. She looks forward to directing Bottled Up because of the diverse representation the project carries both on and off camera.

Composer: Gabriella Hirsch is an instrumentalist, singer, songwriter, improviser, music director, and actress based in Chicago. She plays piano, guitar, ukulele, and a mean tambourine. This spring, her first original musical "Lucky, A Musical", for which she wrote lyrics, composed the music for a four-piece band, and portrayed the character "Brittany", premiered at The Second City Training Center. She is a member of the Barrel of Monkeys Theater Company and a teacher at the Old Town School of Folk Music. You can also catch her onstage or frequently at the piano at the iO Theater. Her musical heroes include Prince, Janelle Monáe, Cardi B., Lin-Manuel Miranda, and Rachel Bloom.

Graphic Desinger: Kyle DeMarco is a graphic designer and graduate of Samford University in Birmingham, AL. He has always had a passion for all types of art. While he is mostly involved in print design, he has enjoyed the opportunity to experiment and work with the production, design, and post-production branding of multiple of Anna Dunbar's projects including Scratch That! and now Bottled Up. When he's not designing, you can find him exploring Birmingham and the Southeast, enjoying a meal at the newest local hot spot with friends, or watching the next great award-winning film. http://www.kyledemarco.com/

 

Plea:

We know $9,000 looks like a lot of money. It is a lot of money. However, renting equipment and building the world of this web series through costumes, props, set, and makeup comes with a price. Rest assured, all of your money will be used to create the best web series that we possibly can. Each piece of the puzzle has been carefully calculated, reviewed, and decided upon, and contributions will be used to the full extent of their ability.

Even if you can't contribute financially, which we understand as artists, there is a lot that you can still do for this web series! Help us by getting the word out about the series and this particular campaign. Share it with all of your friends and family. Please! Then you can watch the series when it's released and share it with your family and friends.

 

Please help us create this quirky magical and mythical web series! Every dollar counts. :)

She is a member of the Barrel of Monkeys Theater Company and a teacher at the Old Town School of Folk Music. You can also catch her onstage or frequently at the piano at the iO Theater. Her musical heroes include Prince, Janelle Monáe, Cardi B., Lin-Manuel Miranda, and Rachel Bloom.Graphic Desinger: Kyle DeMarco is a graphic designer and graduate of Samford University in Birmingham, AL. He has always had a passion for all types of art. While he is mostly involved in print design, he has enjoyed the opportunity to experiment and work with the production, design, and post-production branding of multiple of Anna Dunbar's projects including Scratch That! and now Bottled Up. When he's not designing, you can find him exploring Birmingham and the Southeast, enjoying a meal at the newest local hot spot with friends, or watching the next great award-winning film. http://www.kyledemarco.com/ Plea:We know $9,000 looks like a lot of money. It is a lot of money. However, renting equipment and building the world of this web series through costumes, props, set, and makeup comes with a price. Rest assured, all of your money will be used to create the best web series that we possibly can. Each piece of the puzzle has been carefully calculated, reviewed, and decided upon, and contributions will be used to the full extent of their ability.Even if you can't contribute financially, which we understand as artists, there is a lot that you can still do for this web series! Help us by getting the word out about the series and this particular campaign. Share it with all of your friends and family. Please! Then you can watch the series when it's released and share it with your family and friends. Please help us create this quirky magical and mythical web series! Every dollar counts. :)

story:
Short Summary

I grew up as the youngest of three kids. I am 10 & 8 years younger than my older siblings and so to  entertain myself, I would write and act out my own stories. I knew exactly what I have always wanted to do with my life before I even knew what it was called. Starting my Junior year of college, I began writing and producing my own screenplays. With every screenplay I have learned something new. I am very proud of the lessons and trials that came as I learned this craft because it has truly made me a better writer and filmmaker for it.

Fate stepped in when I met Iesah Hunter, a fellow writer and one of my closest friends. She came up with a fascinating concept in 'Toll Booth'  and I was able to develop the idea into a drama series format. For season two, we have both had a role in writing screenplays. Toll Booth season 2 is just the start of what is to be a wild and amazing ride.

Toll Booth is about paying the tolls in our lives to get what we want and need. Nothing is for free and everything worth having is at a price. The residents of WaterView will continue to pay tolls for the life they want and sometimes it comes with more than they bargained for.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to finish this film, we need a little extra support. Filmmaking is an expensive art form, did I mention that?  Here's what we need to finish the film:

Director of Photography/Color Correction - we have to pay the pros to make it look good - $2800

Gaffer  - $1400

Sound and Final Mix - $1000

Music -$100

Cast and Additional Crew (Make-up, Production Assistance) - - $3700

 

If we don't meet our entire goal, the likelihood of the show gaining the attention of networks, producers and web series festivals goes down tremendously. Since festivals are where new filmmakers careers are made, this is especially important in the grand scheme of things. 

The Impact

1) Your contribution gets us one step closer to fulfilling our dream by making the best possible television series we can make.

2) We need more shows that includes the underrepresented and the oppressed. The kind of episodes we are filming this year for Toll Booth will lift people up, make them cry while entertaining them. 

3) I have made several short films. I have written several features and recently a TV pilot. The dream all started with episodic TV. I am ready to bring that vision to life and produce solid episodes of Toll Booth this season that our growing audience can enjoy.

 

** Season 1 is available on Vimeo at https://vimeo.com/user18127324

 

 

Here's what we will offer you in return for your help:

1) Credit in our film!

2) Personal link to our season 2 premiere episode!

3) A personal thank you note from me and our series creator

4) A Toll Booth Mix "Tape"

5)  Good Karma

6)  My undying and lifelong gratitude

 

Risks & Challenges

This is a no risk venture! You are helping someone who really does need it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, there are other ways you can help that would be appreciated!

Please share our campaign.

Share our Vimeo page.

Share our vision. 

Let's make it happen together!

Thank you for your help!

story:
Short Summary

Paul Kelly has made multiple award-winning short films that involved suit acting including "Terror of the Mutant" and "The Robot Walks". Kelly has worked in the film industry and is a life long Toku fan. 

I have always wanted to make a Tokusatsu series of my own. This series will be an original story.

You can watch the two short films mentioned above with the links below. These were early amateur works, but I have been educated and worked in film since then.

Terror of the Mutant: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=53U1muwYFu0

The Robot Walks: https://youtu.be/scNSkz2dJKo

We made these with ZERO budget and no experience many years ago, so imagine what we can do now!

What We Need

We are asking for 1,000 dollars. I have already put a lot of my own money into this passion project. Many props and some costume elements have already been purchased. We still need money to pay for the theme song. The costumes for the monsters and villains still need to be made. I would also like to provide food and drinks for the cast and crew since many of them are working for free. We already have camera equipment and editing software from previous projects, but we do need another editor for digital effects. I will be making no personal profit off of this project. It will be available on YouTube for your viewing pleasure.

Risks & Challenges

The first risk is, of course, not raising enough money. Another challenge is that I have very little experience with digital effects and will need to bring on a reliable effects editor. Finding a good schedule that everyone can work on will be difficult, but I am sure we can do it. We all have our own jobs and some of us even have college to attend. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not afford a donation that is no big deal, but please, share our campaign so we can raise the money we need.

story:
Red Velvet Revolution Plot

A Corporation called the Life Makers Corporation anonymously directs the lives of its users (called the Life Seekers) who have signed an agreement with the Corporation but have no recollection of it as they have ingested a medicine which erases that particular memory from their minds. The contract itself allows the Corporation to constantly surveil the Life Seekers and to sign any kind of other contracts on behalf of the Life Seekers. A team of employees (called Life Makers) works behind the scenes to arrange various serendipitous events that lead to the success of each Life Seeker who believes these events are caused only by their skills, appearance or charisma since the Life Seekers have no recollection of the existence of the Life Makers Corporation. In the background the Life Makers make specific arrangements with corporations and institutions on behalf of the Life Seekers and for that service the Life Makers corporation takes a cut of the Life Seeker’s income (thus acting as a kind of human broker). 

The story opens with the life of a young boy, Dion (a Life Seeker), who earns a living as a social media influencer and receives offers to promote various brands in his videos. The viewers are introduced to his daily life under surveillance by the Lifemakers corporation and in parallel we are introduced to the team of Life Makers behind Dion and his success. We learn that the Lifemakers are actually motivated by ideals of helping improving disadvantaged people’s life conditions and view the Life Maker job as morally ethical. 

As the story unfolds, it becomes clear that there are insurgents within the Lifemakers corporation who seek to bring it down and expose its work as manipulative and self serving. The open end to the plot serves as an invitation for the viewers to anticipate the next episodes of this series.

About the Director

Viviana Di Capua is a London-based freelance videographer and co-founder of London Filmmakers, an independent film and music collective that over the years worked hard to become one of the most respected names in audiovisual production.

Trained as a filmmaker and graduated with honours in Cinema from La Sapienza University of Rome, working on a variety of projects ranging from promotional video content and live events to music videos, and wedding proposals.

https://www.vivienrosewood.com 

Message from the Director, Viviana Di Capua

Since I decided to open a crowdfunding campaign for Red Velvet Revolution I knew I wanted to give more than an idea to the people who would invest in the project. 

So I and other brave people made this Prologue as a pledge to the audience; 

The Prologue (the Pilot) is a ZERO BUDGET short film, filmed in 2 and a half days, with mostly only our enthusiasm and passion, in small and stuffy spaces and under very difficult circumstances. Due to the lack of budget that the first short film was conceived almost as a 15-minute mega trailer giving lots informations and showing pieces of plot. 

However, we have achieved the contrast between the world of the Life Makers, which is dark, stuffy, almost infected, and the world of the Life Seekers, more colourful and with some hope, even though all these characters are kind of trapped in the shots -to suggest their real condition.

The idea of people’s lives being controlled by Life Makers is an allegory to describe the society in which we are living nowadays.

I had the most amazing cast I could have ever imagined 

Khuzam Kedgeworth   https://www.spotlight.com/3334-6728-3874  

he believed in the project from the very beginning and helped me a lot to adapt the script in English. He played the role of Allan Rid exactly as I had in my mind.

Sonera Angel  https://www.soneraangel.com 

who bravely accepted the challenge of playing the very difficult role of Shiori and brilliantly succeeded in it. 

Jessica Jane https://www.mandy.com/actor/profile/jessicajane 

became Fay and with her talent somehow changed the character in a very positive way. 

Emilia Johannesen had to prepare herself for the role of Rose in 10 minutes (the most difficult situation we have faced during the shooting) and she gave a stunning performance. 

Nick Ivakhiv https://www.mandy.com/actor/profile/nick-ivakhiv

he prepared himself to show the opposite sides of Dion’s personality and he succeeded in the best way possible. 

David Toso  https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4866474/

he was simply amazing, playing the role of the CEO of the Life Makers Corporations. 

My crew was also the best crew ever: 

Valentin Doychinov https://soundcloud.com/v-stok 

much more than a producer, he composed and produced the whole soundtrack by himself, he collaborated with the sound department during the shooting and the editing and he supported me like nobody else. I will never thank him enough. 

Riccardo Cavani https://riccardocavani.com

a friend, producer and teacher. He also believed in the project and helped me a lot, lending me some equipment, sometimes being my cinematographer and always trying to improve this project. 

Camila Pai and Dane Burge who did a great job with audio recording and audio post-production with such a poor equipment - especially Dane who make miracles happen when we found out that many problems had to be fixed in post-productions and he did it, making the audio acceptable. 

Simona Guarino http://www.simonaguarino.com 

an incredible artist who created the whole scenography just with papers and green painting and who also was a great support during the shooting. 

Veronica Grasso, tireless worker, fantastic artist, amazing friend who was in charge of costumes and makeup. 

Why we need your help?

In the second and third episode I would like to develop the story to show the structure of the Life Makers corporation and how the Life seekers get involved with the company.

I would like to show the stories of the characters and whether they would join the insurgency which has arisen in the corporation to ultimately destroy it.

Your help in completing the last two episodes of Red Velvet Revolution would be invaluable to us.

It would enable us hire professional equipment and locations and to pay additional staff to achieve high quality production. For example, we would be able to hire more cameras and camera operators, use better microphones, afford high quality scenography and high quality of post production. 

We have created the following opportunities to pledge funds for the project and offer the following rewards and benefits you will receive for the pledged amount, please see the Perks section for details.

story:
Who we are

We lackeys at Q.B.E Films wish to take you on a journey to a world filled with devilishly dark elves, abominable goblins, villainous warlocks and mythical cities. Boozy good for nothing hero? Check. Extraordinary kingdom and creatures? You bet! 25K for first episode? HELP!
 

  • We have a Fantastic Eargasmic Composer in the US that will dedicate every waking minute to produce a Hollywood Sci-Fi quality that will knock your socks off
  • Killer make-up and prosthesis's
  • Imaginative fantastical set-design
  • Badass costumes and wardrobe
  • A dab of majestic visual FX to make Blue Fame extra magical

We will take you away, far far away, to the extraordinary city of West River!

What we will do

Lets break it down, all the way to goblin town! $25000 ( yes dollars not amulets, gold, jewels, or gnomish treasures ) will be used for producing our pilot episode.

  • Cast and Crew. We will scavenge the land far and wide for the bright talented people we need.
  • Set Build and Locations. We must assemble goblin huts, dark villainous lairs, and magical cities while finding our main character a decent pub to go grab a drink in. Saving the world is thirsty work!
  • Costumes, props, and elf ears, oh my! Elves aren't elves without their ears, magical staffs don't feel very wondrous if they are just broken off branches, and our people need awesome armor to do battle in!

How we will do it

We may be running around swinging our swords and maces but it is with purpose! Here is our campaign calendar once we launch.

  • February 4th 2019 - First update for our supporters and allies!
  • February 11th 2019 - Video update for the advancement of the campaign.
  • February 18th 2019 - Special live-stream from the Blue Flame team to rally up the masses!
  • February 25th 2019 - Second update and more about SOS magazine for our Blue Flame fans
  • March 4th 2019 - Halfway live stream update from Quinton Barr CEO
  • March 11th 2019 - Bloopers, and our favorite tweets and messages from our fans update
  • March 18th 2019 - Special short video story
  • March 25th 2019 - Official poster and t-shirt design update
  • March 31st 2019 - Campaign wrap up and special message from the Blue Flame team.

Synopsis 

Warlocks are the most powerful magical creatures, and the most powerful Warlocks are those in control of the three sacred amulets.

Around the first campfires of this dawning age, stories were whispered of a majestic, but lost City. The City of West River, beautiful beating heart of the ancient world.

To keep peace in this world, and protect the Holy City, three crystals were endowed with tremendous power. These crystals were of the truest blue, hardened in the sacred flames. The crystals in turn were mounted into three encrypted amulets, one went to the Elves, one to the Warlocks, and one to the High King, (ruler of West River).

During the ensuing centuries, protected by the amulets, the noble city prospered and became a sanctuary for mystical creatures of every shape and kind.

Sadly however, great power and great wealth, inevitably engender great jealousy and great envy. Eventually a Cloaked and Evil Force assassinated the High King, stole his amulet, and slipped into the endless night. During the ensuing chaos the other amulets were also secreted away, and the long years of unending Darkness began -- a period of confusion, crime and war, desperation and desolation. A hell on Earth.

Over time the remaining guardians were decimated... and the great city was locked down. West River was a frightened, besieged place, a power no longer. Sadly, keeping evil out, also meant keeping out progress, hope and heroes. There were rumours of course, rumours that told of dreams and prophesies.... possible ways in, possible ways out. Unless the three amulets are recovered and restored to their rightful place however, there is little real hope for the future.

During this desperate time, when hope was a threadbare thing our hero appears. A comet slices the sky. Portents shift. And an orphan is left at the City gates. Blue Flame follows James Dowling as he comes of age, a young man of unique and surprising gifts.

Initially a reluctant hero, James is something of a screw-up, a con-man, a trickster, and riddled with self-doubt. Happily however, guided by a ghostly soul James begins to see, and he joins in the fight for the light as he does so, more and more of his unique powers are revealed. Still, life is never easy... in a world fraught with magical demons, dragons, evil warlocks, and an almost insurmountable darkness James is soon locked in an almost daily life and death struggle.

Too much? Not enough

Let's say our bad guy Creed casts his wicked magic on our campaign and we do not make our goal, fret not friends, we will continue to share the Blue Flame world with you by making short clips and videos until we are triumphant and victorious in our efforts!

If the power of the Blue Flame boons us with a surplus of support from our fans and friends we shall create more episodes, more incentives, and we will hold a theatrical screening in Vancouver Canada, location and schedule details after the end of the campaign.

The Power Of The Blue Flame Rests With You!

You are the light in the darkness. Our hero James Dowling needs your help and support if he ever is to master the power of the Blue Flame, to save the city of West River, and to defeat the dark magic of Creed. We are crowdfunding because we need the crowd!

If you want more adventure, more bingeable stories to watch, and more magic in your world we need to work together to prove that there's an audience out there that wants Blue Flame. So that we can prove to a network or online platform that we all want more fantasy and drama. Then the big guys can agree to pick up the show and keep it going for future episodes and seasons.

Share this campaign, follow us on Facebook, give us a tweet on Twitter, and mention us on Instagram and together we can make magic come alive. With our partnership with SOS magazine, we hope to share our stories with as many friends and family as possible. From our family to yours, we thank you so much for your time and donations.

February 18th 2019 - Special live-stream from the Blue Flame team to rally up the masses!
February 25th 2019 - Second update and more about SOS magazine for our Blue Flame fans
March 4th 2019 - Halfway live stream update from Quinton Barr CEO
March 11th 2019 - Bloopers, and our favorite tweets and messages from our fans update
March 18th 2019 - Special short video story
March 25th 2019 - Official poster and t-shirt design update
March 31st 2019 - Campaign wrap up and special message from the Blue Flame team.

Synopsis 

Warlocks are the most powerful magical creatures, and the most powerful Warlocks are those in control of the three sacred amulets.
Around the first campfires of this dawning age, stories were whispered of a majestic, but lost City. The City of West River, beautiful beating heart of the ancient world.
To keep peace in this world, and protect the Holy City, three crystals were endowed with tremendous power. These crystals were of the truest blue, hardened in the sacred flames. The crystals in turn were mounted into three encrypted amulets, one went to the Elves, one to the Warlocks, and one to the High King, (ruler of West River).
During the ensuing centuries, protected by the amulets, the noble city prospered and became a sanctuary for mystical creatures of every shape and kind.
Sadly however, great power and great wealth, inevitably engender great jealousy and great envy. Eventually a Cloaked and Evil Force assassinated the High King, stole his amulet, and slipped into the endless night. During the ensuing chaos the other amulets were also secreted away, and the long years of unending Darkness began -- a period of confusion, crime and war, desperation and desolation. A hell on Earth.
Over time the remaining guardians were decimated... and the great city was locked down. West River was a frightened, besieged place, a power no longer. Sadly, keeping evil out, also meant keeping out progress, hope and heroes. There were rumours of course, rumours that told of dreams and prophesies.... possible ways in, possible ways out. Unless the three amulets are recovered and restored to their rightful place however, there is little real hope for the future.
During this desperate time, when hope was a threadbare thing our hero appears. A comet slices the sky. Portents shift. And an orphan is left at the City gates. Blue Flame follows James Dowling as he comes of age, a young man of unique and surprising gifts.
Initially a reluctant hero, James is something of a screw-up, a con-man, a trickster, and riddled with self-doubt. Happily however, guided by a ghostly soul James begins to see, and he joins in the fight for the light as he does so, more and more of his unique powers are revealed. Still, life is never easy... in a world fraught with magical demons, dragons, evil warlocks, and an almost insurmountable darkness James is soon locked in an almost daily life and death struggle.

Too much? Not enough
Let's say our bad guy Creed casts his wicked magic on our campaign and we do not make our goal, fret not friends, we will continue to share the Blue Flame world with you by making short clips and videos until we are triumphant and victorious in our efforts!
If the power of the Blue Flame boons us with a surplus of support from our fans and friends we shall create more episodes, more incentives, and we will hold a theatrical screening in Vancouver Canada, location and schedule details after the end of the campaign.
The Power Of The Blue Flame Rests With You!
You are the light in the darkness. Our hero James Dowling needs your help and support if he ever is to master the power of the Blue Flame, to save the city of West River, and to defeat the dark magic of Creed. We are crowdfunding because we need the crowd!
If you want more adventure, more bingeable stories to watch, and more magic in your world we need to work together to prove that there's an audience out there that wants Blue Flame. So that we can prove to a network or online platform that we all want more fantasy and drama. Then the big guys can agree to pick up the show and keep it going for future episodes and seasons.
Share this campaign, follow us on Facebook, give us a tweet on Twitter, and mention us on Instagram and together we can make magic come alive. With our partnership with SOS magazine, we hope to share our stories with as many friends and family as possible. From our family to yours, we thank you so much for your time and donations.

story:
We Love Food

And who doesn't? Dine & Dish Nation is a show for the everyday foodie. You don't have to be a culinary expert or have a refined palate to know when something is simply yummy! Season One has left a great taste with our viewers and we are excited to be filming Season Two!

  • Dine & Dish Nation was founded by Kam Carman, a local television and radio personality with more than 25 years of media experience. Moved by her passion for food and the Detroit area, she decided to start a show that highlights both. Since our premier in September 2018, the show has gained more and more viewers, and our social media feeds and website are beginning to flourish, as well. We consistently have thousands of viewers tuning into our show each week.
  • One of the greatest things about Dine & Dish Nation is that it showcases every day, local people. Each episode features a fresh panel of three community “foodies” discussing three distinct dining establishments while chatting about local culture.
  • Help us continue to bring this rich program to the Detroit area by contributing to our campaign, and we'll show our thanks by sending you a gift! 
  • Together we can capture the resurgence of Detroit and all the great restaurants the area has to offer! 

Why The Campaign?

Creating a television show is very costly! As much as we love and support our community we need our community to do the same for us. We are an independent production company that paired with Detroit Public Television to broadcast our show to you, which means we receive no funding from PBS. But, like them, we’re dependent on contributions from viewers like you. 

  • We don't expect our viewers to fully fund us, that's why we also have sponsors. But to truly make the best show we can, every dollar we can get helps. Each donation will go directly toward our cost of bringing this show to you!
  • We've compiled an exciting lineup of gifts to show you how much we appreciate your donation. As we are foodies, we have set up these levels to reflect a five-course meal. This is the first time we are offering any merchandise for the show, and once this campaign ends, we don't know if or when we will again. This may be your only chance to get some of these items!
  • To learn more about each "perk" click on the side picture to expand it's description.
  • Your support, no matter the amount, helps us to keep bringing quality programming to every home in the Detroit area. 

*IMPORTANT* Since we broadcast through Detroit Public Television we are REQUIRED by the FCC to list ALL  the names of those who donate to us during the show credits. If you choose to donate anonymously here, your name will still appear in our credits.

We Love Our Community (The Impact)

We hear it all the time when we're out filming. People who run or work at restaurants and live in Detroit, talk to us about how even just 5 years ago, many of the streets were lifeless. People didn't come out to dine let alone even walk around. But now... Detroit is having its renaissance and we want to capture it! The restaurant scene is growing quickly and we aim to highlight those bringing new business to The D and those who have held their ground through the tougher times. It's America's comeback kid and this city deserves its time in the spotlight!

Risks & Challenges

Sixty-five percent of shows in our genre get canceled their first season. We've made it to Season Two thanks to our loyal viewers! But while we've already gotten "off the ground," we need help with additional funds to continue to deliver for the community! Every little bit helps! 

Can't Contribute At This Time?

You can still help us!

  • Spread the word about our show and our campaign! Please share our campaign across social media:
  • Facebook- @dineanddishnation
  • Instagram- @dinedishnation
  • Twitter- @DineDish_Nation
  • You can also use the share buttons built into Indiegogo
  • Watch our show! It airs on Monday nights at 7:30 pm or Wednesday nights at 11:30 pm. But if you're busy or miss the show, you can watch previous episodes online! 

It's easy as pie. And we love pie!

story:
This web series follows the BROKEN HEARTS DIVISION, an under-funded division created by the LAPD for goodwill in the community.

The department is spear-headed by Officer Mackenzie Merriweather.  Mack has had an awful love life and as such is the perfect cop to head this department.  She's a loose canon so the department assigns her Internal Affairs officer, Brad Honeycut (played by Andy Milder of Weeds) a by-the-book bureaucrat.

The BHD gets no respect by top brass, gets housed in the LAPD Janitor's Closet and shares 'office space' with Jerry The Janitor.

Each episode follows a new case while Officer Merriweather tracks the infamous Serial Dater. 

 

The cases for SEASON ONE: 

With the Season Finale revealing the Identity of the Serial Dater!

 

Nicole Feenstra conceived of this show after years of heartbreak..and a deep love of 'Law and Order: SVU' and all things procedural.  She created this character, this world and this show as a way to shine a light on treating each other better in the affairs of the heart.  The lead, Officer Mack Merriweather, is fighting for justice for the broken hearted.  

In 2016, Nicole personally financed the pilot, then in 2017 she raised enough budget (here on Indiegogo!)  to shoot the series and NOW, we're back for a final push in post production so that the show is network ready.

She brought in a top notch team that's she's known since Sophomore year at USC, Drama 3/4 - who are wildly talented - already proving their chops with a kick-a** trailer below. 

Inspired by “The Broken Windows Theory,” Mack finds that the answer is simple: 

Handle the small crimes to prevent the big crimes.

How we act in the affairs of the heart affects not only ourselves but everyone we encounter.

 

Watch the Official Trailer:

 
 

Nicole Feenstra / CREATOR & EXECUTIVE PRODUCER – Nicole Feenstra's work has won awards at ITVFest, Rome International Festival, First Glance Philadelphia and Shriekfest.  She starred and wrote in the long running Improv Olympic show, "Big News" and has worked in advertising for years on campaigns for POM Wonderful, Neutrogena and Chrysler. This is her first project as Showrunner.

Scott Rodgers / DIRECTOR – Scott's first directing feature, THE DRAMATICS (A COMEDY) was acquired and distributed by The Orchard. Scott directs the award winning improvised play THE BLIND DATE PROJECT, directing countless amazing actors including Margot Robbie, Joel Edgerton, Emmy Rossum to name a few. His acting credits include: THE MASTER, KEY&PEELE and MARRIED(FX).

Drama 3/4 / POST PRODUCTION – Founders David Fickas and Brice Beckham both attended the USC School of Dramatic Arts with Nicole. For two decades Drama 3/4 has been providing production and post production services to projects such as VH1’s “I Hate My 30’s” and pioneer digital series such as MSN's “Mr. Robinson’s Driving School,” “5 Minute Office Workout” with the Biggest Loser’s Bob Harper, award winning web series “Suitemates” with Kevin Pollak and Ray Wise, and Kincaid Walker’s “Hug it Out” (recent winner of LA Comedy Film Festival for best web series). 

Andy Milder / BRAD HONEYCUT – Andy is known for playing ‘Dean Hodes’ on the Showtime show, ‘Weeds’, where he garnered two Screen Actor Guild Award nominations with the cast as Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble/ Comedy.  He is also known more recently for his work in Bones,  Rizzoli and Isles, Grey’s Anatomy, NCIS, Masters of Sex and Criminal Minds to name a few.

Ryan Mirvis / JERRY THE JANITOR – Ryan "Mirv" Mirvis is an actor and stand up comedian, working at UCB, Comedy Store and The Improv.  You may recognize him from the images above. He will also be seen on Chuck Lorre's new Netflix sitcom, "Disjointed."  You may recognize him as a Viking from Capital One or from that time his Tinder profile went viral.

 

Having self-financed the pilot on a shoe-string budget, Producer Nicole Feenstra  knows how to make money stretch but she also believes it’s important to pay everyone for their talent.  This money goes to all the hard working men and women both in front and behind the camera who make all the magic happen. It takes a village and the funding goes to paying that village. 

In a time, when so many BIG THINGS are happening, you may ask yourself WHY THIS PROJECT?  Well, during troubling times we need to laugh.  During crazy times we need perspective.  During…all the time – we want love. This project brings all of that. 

PLUS, if you’ve ever thought – I want more women to have a seat at the table of story-telling – THIS IS YOUR CHANCE TO BE PART OF THAT. The majority of projects in Hollywood are helmed or led by men. This is a female voice and a female vision emboldened with a wildly talented cast and crew of men and women.

Here are just a few of the perks we'd love to give you as a thanks for your donation!

In the last year and a half, we've garnered over 30,000 views, 3,200 followers, and 500+ subscribers to our channel with only 9 episodes of Growing Down TV shot. This passion project has grown-up tremendously in this short time, and we don't want it to stop.

story:
Hi Hunties,

Thank you all for visiting our Indiegogo page! Last year we did Season One of Garbage People for fun, out of our own pockets, because things were looking really dark and we thought, what does the vast interwebs need? DUH, a webseries about two lovable social drinkers with 40+ years of therapy between them and an addiction to attention and broadway that rivals the most seasoned NYC drag queens. 

For Season One, we produced 4 episodes with the help of our amazing director Matt Strickland. With a budget equivalent to a weekend bar tab we were able to get over 15K views and laughs, and lock down a spot in NYC Web Fest last year! 

Take a look at what we did in Season One:

Our Drunk Garbage Pilot

Our Tinder Date

Super Adult Drinking

We're Just Garbage People

Now we need your help to make Season Two even bigger, gayer and worse (in the best way)! We really can’t keep paying our crew and other actors in pizza and warm Bud Light. This time we’re hoping to shoot a full series arc, with at least 10 episodes with more special guests, walk-ons, go-go boys and all the garbage antics you love or want to see us get into in the future.

But we need your help! Lights, camera equipment, a sound boom that isn’t a swiffer, locations that aren’t our apartments, 40s, makeup to hide our tequila glow, and post-production to make us look halfway presentable cost money. Sadly, no matter how much we cry and/or try and thieve, we can’t do it alone.

We decided to create Garbage People because we both love comedy - we grew up on Will and Grace and Absolutely Fabulous and always had dreams of inspiring and comforting others the way those shows inspired and comforted us #emo.

But we also created Garbage People to show the sassy, silly, drunk, sometimes grounded and sometimes tragic aspects of our real life friendship. Looking at some of our favorite shows and some of our favorite gay man and straight woman relationships, we only saw parts of ourselves. 

Where are all the body positive and unique gay characters at? We've all grown a bit tired of the tragic female lead in desperate need of fashion and love advice (spoiler alert - if you regularly refer to your best friends as 'your gays' you're probably doing the whole friendship thing wrong).**

**Obviously a lot of shows besides us get this super RIGHT; special shout out to Titus and Kimmy, Jack and Karen, Darryl and Paula and many more.

Garbage People is about being real. Sometimes you are the life of the party, sometimes everyone at the party would just really like you to get SVU’d and go far, far away. So yes - for Emily, this is about attention, and for Matt, this is about art. But for both of us, it is about well rounded representation and getting drunk on camera.

Take a look over at the dope, pants wetting rewards you'll get when you become a backer, starting at only $1 and going all the way up to the limits of your Sugar Daddy’s AMEX Black Card or MTA bus accident monthly payouts.

We will love you for whatever you can donate! Seriously, we have a lot of love to give, expect lots of hugs and incomprehensible 3AM voicemails.

Xoxo the Garbage People

story:
The Story

 

"They say anything is possible. You gotta dream like you've never seen obstacles"- Jermaine Lamarr Cole

For all the dreamers, believers and overachievers; the in-betweeners, the doubters, all working those 9-to-5 hours, This one's for you. Help us turn our 5-to-9 into our 9-to-5.  #JustDream

"Just Jamear" is a relatable show for young, entrepreneurs of color.

If you loved "That's So Raven" and "Sex in the City", then you will love "Just Jamear". It has that fun, unpredictable aspect of "That's so Raven" and the grown and sexy from "Sex in the City". Throughout the first season of the show we follow a group of five iconic friends who journey through their adversarial 20 something's. Each friend works a full time job while also trying to follow their dreams on the side.

Just Jamear embodies the millennial experience of people from all walks of life uniting to chase their dreams. The cast and crew consists of majority POC with diverse backgrounds, class, gender, sexual identities and abilities. Our scripted series aims to inspire individuals to believe and achieve no matter who you are. 

 

The "It" Factor

 

 

What makes "Just Jamear" unique is the fact that it is heavily musically driven. Our mission is to give independent and underground artists a platform to showcase their music on the web series and at any of our networking events. Every episode will highlight at least one song from an indie artist. Any artists, musicians or poets who would like to submit their work, email justjamearmusic@gmail.com. Music must not contain a sample and must be mixed. We would prefer a link to Spotify, Apple Music, Soundcloud or Tidal for your work. In the email please provide your full name, stage name, social media handles, contact information, and links to music or projects.

 

The Ambition

 

Our mission is to showcase the hardships millennial entrepreneurs endure while trying to achieve their dreams. On the outside, the public sees success and prestige when someone achieves their goal, but no one ever sees the difficult journey they took to get there. Lots of sleepless nights, terrible bosses, low pay, and social sacrifices sprinkle the journies to success. We plan to show the good, the bad, and the ugly of each character's journey.

We feel it is important for audiences to realize success doesn't come easy and everyone's journey is different. Success is like a math equation; there are many formulas that can be used but they all lead to the same result.

 

The Schmoney

 

We can't make all this magic happen without your contributions to our project. Please help us build an inclusive, creative, and empowering environment for young entrepreneurs around the world that will be relatable, showcase the best tunes, and provide nonstop laughter. With your support, we'll be able to make the best web series possible by giving all the cast & crew has to offer to this project.

We've taken this opportunity to show you how important it is to us to be able to give you quality content by making a whole CHART! These percentages are based off being able to get our entire dream budget!

 

The Motto

 

Follow your dreams and be ICONIC! We appreciate all of your support! Don't forget to follow us on social media and subscribe to the show on YouTube.  Ta-Ta for now!
story_txt: The Story "They say anything is possible. You gotta dream like you've never seen obstacles"- Jermaine Lamarr ColeFor all the dreamers, believers and overachievers; the in-betweeners, the doubters, all working those 9-to-5 hours, This one's for you. Help us turn our 5-to-9 into our 9-to-5.  #JustDream"Just Jamear" is a relatable show for young, entrepreneurs of color.If you loved "That's So Raven" and "Sex in the City", then you will love "Just Jamear". It has that fun, unpredictable aspect of "That's so Raven" and the grown and sexy from "Sex in the City". Throughout the first season of the show we follow a group of five iconic friends who journey through their adversarial 20 something's. Each friend works a full time job while also trying to follow their dreams on the side.Just Jamear embodies the millennial experience of people from all walks of life uniting to chase their dreams. The cast and crew consists of majority POC with diverse backgrounds, class, gender, sexual identities and abilities. Our scripted series aims to inspire individuals to believe and achieve no matter who you are.  The "It" Factor  What makes "Just Jamear" unique is the fact that it is heavily musically driven. Our mission is to give independent and underground artists a platform to showcase their music on the web series and at any of our networking events. Every episode will highlight at least one song from an indie artist. Any artists, musicians or poets who would like to submit their work, email justjamearmusic@gmail.com. Music must not contain a sample and must be mixed. We would prefer a link to Spotify, Apple Music, Soundcloud or Tidal for your work. In the email please provide your full name, stage name, social media handles, contact information, and links to music or projects. The Ambition Our mission is to showcase the hardships millennial entrepreneurs endure while trying to achieve their dreams. On the outside, the public sees success and prestige when someone achieves their goal, but no one ever sees the difficult journey they took to get there. Lots of sleepless nights, terrible bosses, low pay, and social sacrifices sprinkle the journies to success. We plan to show the good, the bad, and the ugly of each character's journey.We feel it is important for audiences to realize success doesn't come easy and everyone's journey is different. Success is like a math equation; there are many formulas that can be used but they all lead to the same result. The Schmoney We can't make all this magic happen without your contributions to our project. Please help us build an inclusive, creative, and empowering environment for young entrepreneurs around the world that will be relatable, showcase the best tunes, and provide nonstop laughter. With your support, we'll be able to make the best web series possible by giving all the cast & crew has to offer to this project.We've taken this opportunity to show you how important it is to us to be able to give you quality content by making a whole CHART! These percentages are based off being able to get our entire dream budget! The Motto Follow your dreams and be ICONIC! We appreciate all of your support! Don't forget to follow us on social media and subscribe to the show on YouTube.  Ta-Ta for now!

story:
About Gentrified:

Gentrified is a dramatic series that follows the lives of four Black millennials battling to find themselves in a city that is quickly changing. Coretta, a young woman trying to cope with the loss of the only mother figure she's known, while battling to save her generational home. Aaron, a newlywed fighting against stereotypes while trying to balance family. Dania, a recently outed gay woman working through family trauma, looking for love and a place to call her own.

By supporting our project you're giving opportunities to Black creatives both in front of and behind the camera.

What We Need & What You Get:

Season one of our series consists of five episodes. Each episode has a run time of approximately 10 minutes with a 20 minute jaw dropping finale! We cover 10 locations, have a full cast and a hard working crew all eager to make our dream series a reality.

Here's a detailed breakdown of what your contributions cover:

 

The Perks:

In exchange for your contributions we're offering amazing perks, some of which were donated by members of our Production team!

  • Ever wondered what it feels like behind the scenes? Purchase "Backstage Pass" and join the Gentrified cast and crew for an unforgettable day on set!

  • "Red Carpet Experience" Join us at our exclusive premiere party and get VIP treatment!
  • Want to start a web series of your own but you aren't sure where to start? "And, Action" gives you access to commentary about casting, budgeting and more from the creator Tia Williams.

Our Team:

Golden Globe winner Regina King recently pledged to hire 50% women for all of her projects and asked that others, no matter the industry, do the same in hopes to improve gender equality. Representation matters and it was one of our priorities when organizing the production team!

Tia Williams, Creator

Tia found her creative niche while podcasting and combined her true love for writing and love for people of color to begin blogging about victims of Police brutality, and expanded her storytelling abilities with romantic short stories and screenplays. As a new filmmaker Tia’s goal is to use HER art to tell the stories that help not only entertain, but break down societal norms and highlight Black excellence.

Maureen Lomo, Producer

In addition to producing, Maureen is a published author, public speaker and skilled copywriter. She contributes topical and engaging content to various digital platforms and has been featured in Huffington Post, Ms. X Factor, etc. Before the arts, Maureen excelled at a worldwide human resources career and credits her time abroad for enhancing her professional speaking and writing. 

Justin Humphrey, Director of Photography

Justin brings accountability and artistic integrity to every project and endeavor he works on. His creative vision, determination, and skills are what propel him to be recognized among the global community of creative greats!

Jeanetta Brantley, Sound Mixer and Ashley Kemp, Colorist

Jeanetta Brantley and her partner Ashley Kemp make up A & J Marketing and Media. A & J Marketing and Media is the perfect solution for organizations that have trouble with communicating the value of their product, project, or event. 

Dom Steele, Wardrobe Stylist

As a Black, queer, non-binary stylist, it is important to them that anyone who engages with gingerolive.thrift does not feel limited by their gender, race, size or socioeconomic background. Dom aims to curate styles that enhance identity and personality, showcasing the truest self.

Learn more about the rest of our cast and crew at Gentrifiedseries.com

Other Ways You Can Help:

Unable to donate at the moment? We understand. Our campaign will run for 60 days so come back if you can! Here are other ways you can help:

  • Like us on Facebook: facebook.com/GentrifiedSeries
  • Follow us on Instagram: @Gentrifiedseries
  • Follow us on Twitter: @GentrifiedS
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign

Want To Work With Us?

Interested in promoting your local business, donating art, music, food or locations? Please email us: GentrifiedSeries@gmail.com

story:
About the Series

When media outlets talk about Chicago, they either mention gun violence, political corruption, or the frigid weather. Such narratives impact young people in this city that either instills fear or pessimism over a brighter future. Chicago has a host of problems, but activism runs deep in this city’s history.

As proud Chicago filmmakers, examining the hardships and triumphs of citizens who molded Chicago and actively learning from their experiences is our focus. Whether they fought for workers rights, cultivated communities for their people, or transformed the artistic landscape, this city consists of defiant people who challenged the status quo. Young Chicagoans should not only possess pride in their city, but feel empowered to transform their communities, and the world.

Your support for this series will allow us to tell the people’s story to a massive online audience and facilitate outreach screenings at schools and community centers. The web series format is an effective tool for lasting change and we’d like you to participate in this effort with us.

Thank you,
Olivia Pearson (Producer/Director)
Mark Blottner (Executive Producer/Director)

 

Series Structure

Out of the book's 77 poems, we are adapting 6 poems into ten minute episodes. The episodes are:

  • Shikaakwa - the history of American Indians in Illinois and the impact of environmental racism in communities of color.
  • Albert Parsons Can Hang - the examination of the life of radical activists Albert and Lucy Parsons, the Haymarket Affair, and labor history in Chicago.
  • Gwendolyn Brooks Stands in the Mecca - a celebration of the late Poet Laureate Gwendolyn Brooks and the significance of the Bronzeville neighborhood and the Mecca Flats.
  • The Assassination of Chairman Fred Hampton - an overview of the leadership and assassination of late Fred Hampton, Sr., the Black Panther Party, COINTELPRO, and the surveillance of communities of color.
  • We Charge Genocide - the history of the organization We Charge Genocide, the lives of Dominique "Damo" Franklin and Rekia Boyd, and police brutality in Chicago.
  • Chicago Has My Heart - an introduction to the life of the award-winning poet Kevin Coval, the inspiration behind A People's History of Chicago, city issues concerning Chicagoans and their hopes for the place they call home.

Along with Kevin Coval’s poetry each episode includes interviews with artists and activists such as Dr. Haki Madhubuti, Angela Jackson, Amisha Patel, Bill Ayers, Rachel-Rae Williams, Heather Miller, Jorge Mujica, and Charles A. Preston.

 

How We Intend to Use the Funds

We have an $80,000 cash budget. That means that we’re not including the countless volunteer hours our crew has put in. We’ve received a $4,000 grant from the City of Chicago Department of Cultural Affairs and Special Events (thank you DCASE!) that was used for producing the trailer, including shooting most of our interviews. Half of our budget is allocated for post-production. With your support, we can pay for the following services and complete the series:

  • Editing & assistant editing
  • Music composition
  • Audio mixing & sound sweetening
  • Motion graphics & title design
  • Color correction
  • Archival film & photo licensing

 

Your Impact

By backing our project, you’re making a direct impact on the challenges we face in Chicago. Advocacy in education works. Think of the power of publicly available streaming video along with the increased effectivity of this tool when shared in person during panel discussions, screenings, and other community gatherings.

Along with financial support, we greatly encourage you to participate in the outreach activities we'll be sharing on our website: https://peopleshistoryofchicago.com. We appreciate volunteering and contributions of any kind.

Please spread the word about our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools along with your favorite social media!

story:
LOGLINE

In coping with bipolar disorder, Malcolm crafts the newest comic book superhero “ManicMan!”  with the help of his small-town friends.

 

MISSION

I want to spread awareness for bipolar disorder in a fun way that will not be triggering or harmful to the community. I want people to see us, know us, and I want people who are like us to feel comfortable sharing who they are (as long as they feel safe doing so). People with bipolar are just human, and they cannot fight this battle alone; they need a support system, and Malcolm’s friends are the perfect example of a support system. Maybe they don’t always do what’s best for him, but they are constantly working on learning more about the illness and adjusting themselves to help Malcolm get better, even if that just means making sure he gets up in the morning. 

Lavender Blackbird's mission has always been to tell the stories that need to be told, that provoke real human emotion and real global change. It is part of our mission to provide visibility and representation to minority groups, especially people of color in the LGBTQ community. With an ensemble cast made up of diverse characters with different backgrounds, sharing stories from the Asian-American population as well as the Queer community.

 

GENRE

This is a comedy-drama hybrid, kind of like Schitt’s Creek or Parks and Recreation meets Breaking Bad. It’s dark and deals with really scary topics sometimes, but it isn’t meant to send your heart palpitating. It’s meant to teach you while still putting a smile on your face. The point is to show how crazy of a life a life with bipolar can be. From climbing out your window because your friend didn’t say goodnight to looking down from a tall building to staying up until eight in the morning working on that project that you said you’d put down to scheduling thirty-three meetings on the same Monday you have work and dinner with the folks. Impulsive actions, impulsive shopping, and more!

 

STRUCTURE

In true Bipolar fashion, the series will jump back and forth between Malcolm’s mania and depression in five episodes of unpredictability. Each episode will start with a scene from the fictional comic, Manic Man, as the cold open. The series will mostly follow Malcolm and his three best friends who help him cope.

 

IMPACT BREAKDOWN

General breakdown of where your money would go:

  • 10% for locations and art department.
  • 40% for cast and crew compensation.
  • 50% for camera, sound, and lighting gear.

Donors of any amount will receive a link to the LIVE workshop on March 28, 2021 at 7:00 pm CST.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you cannot contribute right now, there are other ways you can help:

  • Share our campaign with family and friends. Spreading the word makes a huge difference!
  • Volunteer your business, location, or film equipment for use.

story:
Who Are We?

Hi! It's Chayla & Bee Jack, and we are the founders of Made by Wo/Men Productions! Made by Wo/Men Productions is a female-owned, production company that strives to create more content that is created, written, produced, and directed by women (especially women of color). While the company does not restrict men from being involved in projects, our overall goal is to change the gender inequalities in film and television, while also tackling the lack of creative representation for people of color in the industry. We aim to unashamedly, and unapologetically, create/produce unparalleled stories with a distinct, feminine voice.

 

What is "Deep Sh*T."?

Concept/ "What If" Question: 

What if you’re the catalyst that caused all of the chaos occurring in your life, but you’re too “woke” to see it?

Logline: 

A snooty, yet “enlightened,” bisexual poet surrounded by mediocre minds & lackluster love, is desperately seeking an unparalleled connection. After multiple self-induced circumstances leave her in one messy bind after another, she begins to realize that maybe, just maybe, she’s not as “woke” as she thought. 

Genre: 

Comedy-Drama (Dramedy)

Follow the Founders:

Bee L. Jack (@beejacks_back) and  Chayla Simpson (@saychayla)

Be sure to follow @madebywomenproductions on IG!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, everyone.  Welcome to our campaign to complete BOMBSHELL the series.  Not only is BOMBSHELL a true heart project, but it's also one of the first out-and-out sex comedies about a gay transman.  BOMBSHELL tells the story of Jay as he navigates LA's gay dating scene.  Oh, and it also features a cartoon penis.  Yes, you read that right.

My name is Jonathan Andre Culliton and I am the trans filmmaker who wrote, directed, and produced our web series with the help of a cast and crew of seventy amazingly talented people.  By donating to our campaign, you will be contributing to the realization of a dream I share with a lot of gay transguys:  to see a crazy, fun sex comedy about a guy like me.

Visit heathandhenshaw.com/bombshell

What We Need & What You Get

Our entire series is nearly complete.  This is the first time we are having a public fundraising campaign.  We have a few very specific needs.

Animation:  The animation is currently in production.

Sound:  Some post work would help us sound our best.

Music:  We would love to license a couple more songs by trans artists.

Colorization:  Footage shot on a RED deserves the fine tune.

Any additional funds would go to promo.  If we don't reach our goal, the funds will go to animation first.  

Our perks feature apparel and art to transform you into the queer icon you are, honey!  Be the BOMBSHELL!

The Impact

"Where's the Brad Pitt of transmen?  Where's the heartthrob everyone's drooling over like he's Donnie Wahlberg?"  - Jay, BOMBSHELL the series

We need more trans comedy.  Less jokes about us, more BY us.  Bored with whatever comedy you watched last?  There's a whole world of untapped humor here you've never heard before.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN.   If you want more trans comedy, let people know!  We are here, we are hilarious.
