story:
*Please note that you can donate ANY AMOUNT (no minimum) - just enter it in the "make a contribution" box*

Our WHY

We aim to educate, inspire, recognise, honour and entertain our amazing overseas FIlipinos in Europe and beyond. We are passionate about shining the light on the different faces of "Juan" and helping them stay connected to their Filipino roots as well as connected to the countries they have adopted as their second home.

Our HOW

Through the power of story-telling, in a way that is accessible to ALL.

Our WHAT

Juan EU Konek is a digital programme available on our Facebook and YouTube platforms.

We launched our pilot episode for the new season on the 28th September and have had over 20,000 view on Facebook since the launch and are slowly building our YouTube subscriber base. We have had very positive feedback from our kababayans all over the world as well as our non-Filipino friends. If you haven't seen it yet, you can watch our pilot episode HERE.  

We will have brand new content every last Saturday of the month for the next 11 months to complete the season.

We are grateful for your support!

Our programme is our labour of love for our overseas Filipino community and is not for profit. 

It is independently funded and produced by JREM Media Productions, made up of our small team of like-minded individuals sharing a common goal and passion. 100% of the money raised here will go towards production costs and equipment especially while we are trying to pursue/negotiate other means of longer-term funding. 

You can donate ANY amount or avail of one of the perks offered (you do not have to avail of a perk if you prefer to just make a straight donation).

Other Ways You Can Help

Please like our Facebook page, subscribe to our YouTube channel and tell all your friends and family about us!

MABUHAY KAYO AT MARAMING SALAMAT PO!
story_txt:
*Please note that you can donate ANY AMOUNT (no minimum) - just enter it in the "make a contribution" box*
Our WHY
We aim to educate, inspire, recognise, honour and entertain our amazing overseas FIlipinos in Europe and beyond. We are passionate about shining the light on the different faces of "Juan" and helping them stay connected to their Filipino roots as well as connected to the countries they have adopted as their second home.
Our HOW
Through the power of story-telling, in a way that is accessible to ALL.
Our WHAT
Juan EU Konek is a digital programme available on our Facebook and YouTube platforms.
We launched our pilot episode for the new season on the 28th September and have had over 20,000 view on Facebook since the launch and are slowly building our YouTube subscriber base. We have had very positive feedback from our kababayans all over the world as well as our non-Filipino friends. If you haven't seen it yet, you can watch our pilot episode HERE.  
We will have brand new content every last Saturday of the month for the next 11 months to complete the season.

We are grateful for your support!
Our programme is our labour of love for our overseas Filipino community and is not for profit. 
It is independently funded and produced by JREM Media Productions, made up of our small team of like-minded individuals sharing a common goal and passion. 100% of the money raised here will go towards production costs and equipment especially while we are trying to pursue/negotiate other means of longer-term funding. 
You can donate ANY amount or avail of one of the perks offered (you do not have to avail of a perk if you prefer to just make a straight donation).

Other Ways You Can Help
Please like our Facebook page, subscribe to our YouTube channel and tell all your friends and family about us!
MABUHAY KAYO AT MARAMING SALAMAT PO!

story:
We have a special announcement

Please read our official statement below regarding our Indiegogo campaign and funding status. 

 

 

Why should you support another season of NarcoLeap? 

 

Season 1 of NarcoLeap is an 8-part Sci-fi Web Series starring Chelsey Reist, Madison Smith, Austin Eckhert, Nicole Oliver, and Aleks Paunovic. In Season 2 we are going to be bringing you longer episodes! Currently, we are green light for four 15 minute episodes with a possibility of more...but we need your help. 

 

 

In producing and building the world of NarcoLeap, the KGP Films team have applied for grants and funding from all possible sources in order to bring you the high-quality sci-fi production via YouTube and HighBall TV. Now, we have tapped out every avenue possible, so this is why we are turning to our fans and the Indiegogo community for support in making Season 2 possible. 

 

Due to the ongoing pandemic and COVID-19 related production regulations, the KGP team now require more funding than previously expected to cover personal protection equipment (PPE) for cast and crew members. These extra costs include hiring extra cleaners, purchasing more hand sanitizer and cleaning products, renting more space and tents to abide by social distancing rules, and supplying crew members with full suits and gowns as per regulations. A health safety officer is also required on-site to ensure compliance. 

 

In 2018, YVR Screen Scene called NarcoLeap “the sci-fi escape that the world needs right now”. Looking back in 2020, given what is going on around the world, NarcoLeap Season 2 is perhaps the sci-fi escape that the world needs more than ever before. 

 

To our fans: we appreciate you, and your continued support. We want to give you the opportunity to be more involved in the production of NarcoLeap and get insider access to how Season 2 is created. 

 

We want this web series to inspire you to find your own inner superpower, grow into your own skin, and find your place in the world. 

 

 

 

 

Chelsey Reist

Chelsey Reist graduated from Capilano University with a degree in acting for the stage and screen. She got her start as the host of the internationally broadcast travel series, Discovering Great Towns. Chelsey’s TV credits include a recurring role on The 100 (CW), as well as roles in Aftermath (Syfy/Space), Psych (USA Network), Cedar Cove (Hallmark) and The Tomorrow People (CW).  Chelsey feature film work includes the lead role in No Tell Motel, which appeared in the Cannes Film Festival. Chelsey is also a trained dancer of sixteen years.

 

Madison Smith

From a young age, Madison always wanted to be an actor, but instead he decided to attend college on a baseball scholarship and pursue a marketing career. After a few years feeling he was on an incorrect path, Madison followed his dream to get involved in acting, and packed up his bags, left Kelowna, B.C for Vancouver, and enrolled in Vancouver’s Academy of Dramatic Arts.

After graduating from the academy in 2011, Madison quickly began booking numerous roles and has appeared in Netflix's The Order and Chilling Adventures of Sabrina The CW’s Riverdale, Supergirl, and Supernatural, CBS’ Salvation, and SyFy’s Aftermath.

 

Austin Eckhert

Austin Eckert is originally from Regina, SK. Following high school, he attended the Canadian College of Performing Arts in Victoria, BC. Upon finishing his studies at the college in spring 2015, Austin moved his whole vans worth of gear to Vancouver and has been an active member of the arts industry ever since. He starred in numerous theatre productions, including MISS UNDERSTOOD (Frank Theatre), Spring Awakening (CCPA/ Belfry), HAIR (Mayfield), MAMMA MIA! (WCT), many Bard of the Beach productions and more. His television credits include Supernatural, The Flash, Batwoman (CW), Project Bluebook (History), Narcoleap (Telus/CBC), Colony (USA), The Magicians (SyFy).

 

 

Aleks Paunovic

Acting came to Aleks while he was onstage in his hometown playing in a heavy metal band, his livelihood since he was 16. Remarkably the role offered was one completely against type as it was that of Roddy McDowall's butler in the 1994 TV movie Heads. Now bitten with the acting bug, Aleks combined his athleticism from his lifetime of boxing and turned it into a very busy career as a stunt actor.

Since coming to Vancouver Aleks has built an amazing resume with over 100 credits. When you meet Aleks, or you watch him perform these difficult roles, you just know that with all of that leading man charisma there's star power in this man and that you will be seeing a lot more of Aleks Paunovic.

 

Nicole Oliver

Nicole Lyn Oliver was born in Ottawa, Ontario. She has a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from York University, a Masters Degree in Communication from Royal Roads University, and additional training from the British American Drama Academy in Oxford and London. She was a prominent member of the Union of BC Performers, she served on its executive board (2002-2005), chaired several committees, and continues to be part of the negotiation team during collective bargaining. She is married to Chris Ainscough, an award-winning composer in the film industry. They live in Vancouver with their two sons William and Grady.

 

Cameron Bancroft

Born in Winnipeg, Cameron now based in Vancouver has over 83 acting credits to his name. He is of course best known for his role on Beverly Hills 90210, Simple Things, and 24. Cameron Bancroft made a brief guest appearance in Season One as Kelsey’s long lost Father.

 

 

 

Kate Green is an award-winning director, writer, and producer. Kate is the creator, director, and producer of NarcoLeap a sci-fi web series currently airing on TELUS Optik, CBC GEM, and Air Canada and has sold internationally as well. NarcoLeap garnered a Canadian Screen Award nomination, Writers’ Guild of Canada, and three Leo Award nominations and won Best sci-fi at Miami web fest, Baltimore and Asia web festival. NarcoLeap is currently in pre-production for season 2 and development as a television series. Kate’s latest short film, a zombie, western dark comedy, Murphy’s Law is set to be released on CBC this Spring.

 

Kate has worked on numerous programs in lifestyle and factual television as a producer or director as well. Her work has aired on various networks such as HGTV, W Network, CBC, History, Fuel TV, and Slice. Kate’s first documentary, Not A Stranger, won the Audience Choice Award at the Vancouver Short Film Festival and was nominated for Best ‘Made in Canada’ Short at the Northwestfest. Kate’s second documentary, Melting Stars, won Best Short at the International Wildlife Film Festival.

 

Kate is a proud Alumna of Women in the Director’s Chair Story & Leadership Program, the National Screen Institute of Canada, Reykjavík International Film Festival Talent Lab, Vancouver Island University, and the University of British Columbia.

 

This is her second Indiegogo campaign!

 

 

Jeff Zwicker (DoP)

Jeff Zwicker is a Cinematographer that has been around a camera since he was 7 years old. Born and raised on Vancouver Island Jeff made the move over to Vancouver at 17 and has been working in film ever since. With numerous best Cinematography nominations and awards Jeff is perfecting his visual style with every shot he creates. Knowing that nothing can be done without the collaborators around him, Jeff insists on creating a cohesive, fun, and positive film making experience for everyone around him. 


Scott Phelan (Production Designer)

Scott is a driven and pragmatic creative with a passion for visual storytelling. He approaches each visual element of the film as an opportunity to add depth to the story and enrich the audience’s experience. He worked alongside Director Kate Green, as Production Designer on Murphy’s Law, a genre-bending short film set in 1897. Recently he worked as Art Director on Crazy8s Finalist psychological horror short film Itsy Bitsy Spider.

 

Jon Cooksey (Head Writer)

Jon Cooksey is a Writer/ Producer/ showrunner who divides his time between LA, Toronto, and Vancouver, and is a dual American/ Canadian citizen. Jon is currently an Executive Producer and Writer on the second season of the sci-fi digital series, NarcoLeap, and is writing on a new YA animated series for 41 Entertainment, Supernatural Academy. Prior, he was developing The Weather Girl Mysteries, a new series for Shaftesbury and Rogers based on a popular Japanese format. Before that, he was the Co-EP on season two of Killjoys (SyFy). Jon’s worked in both film and television, including comedy, drama, and family, and has won Humanitas, Gemini, Leo, and Cable Ace awards in TV, plus numerous awards for his comedic feature documentary, How to Boil a Frog. Previous credits as Showrunner include Arctic Air, Shattered, The Best Years, and his original series The Collector. He’s developed numerous pilots for various prod-cos and networks, including Comedy Central, FX, and ITV, and has run series for Disney Channel and Nickelodeon in the US, for Global, CBC, and Space in Canada. Altogether he’s produced over 170 hours of TV.

 

David Schmidt (Writer)

David has worked as creative producer/head writer on Diagnose Me and Outrageous Births: Tales From the Crib for Discovery Life and TLC, and Million Dollar Neighbourhood for OWN, and as head writer on Timber Kings for HGTV and X-Weighted on Slice. David has also held senior-level writing and story editing positions on Shattered, Falcon Beach and The Best Years on Global, Alice, I Think on CTV and The Comedy Network, and Untold Stories of the E.R. on Discovery Fit & Health and TLC. His additional writing credits include Tom Stone on CBC, Stargate Atlantis on The Space Channel, and Twisted Tales of My 9 to 5 on Investigation Discovery.


 

KGP Films is a Vancouver, BC-based independent production company that produces provocative and innovative factual television series, documentaries, and web series. KGP also has a branded entertainment and corporate video division where we meet the needs of our clients to ensure the smooth running and delivery of every project on time and on budget. All of this experience combined makes us experts at short-form content.

 

 

  • NarcoLeap garnered a Canadian Screen Award nomination, Writers' Guild of Canada, and three Leo Award nominations and won Best sci-fi at Miami web fest, Baltimore and Asia web festival.
  • Kate Green received three best director nominations from the UK web Festival, New Zealand web festival, and the Asia web festival.

 

'NarcoLeap' is the sci-fi escape that the world needs right now - YVR Screen Scene

Exclusive – Kate Green’s NarcoLeap - Hollywood North Magazine

Feature: Actor Madison Smith Talks “Salvation” on CBS, “NarcoLeap” on YouTube, and More - Occhi Magazine

 

 

Welcome To The Family 

$20 CAD

Every bit counts. Thank you for your support and the $20 donation! You have our infinite gratitude and we will buy a cast or crew member a coffee on your behalf (and write your name on the cup) when we deliver it to them! 

Included:

  • Heartfelt Thank You - from the bottom of our hearts!

 

 

"I Want To Be Scared Not Dead"

$55 CAD

A cast or crew member will create a personalized shoutout video to thank you for your support. This video will be posted on NarcoLeap’s official Twitter and Instagram accounts. 

Included:

  • Personalized Shoutout Video

 

 

 "Aidan Has a Birthmark"

$120 CAD

Get exclusive live stream access to select production meetings, or on set tours (virtually), or  ‘show & tell’ department meetings. 

Included:

  • Live stream access to select production events for NarcoLeap Season 2
  • Personalized shoutout video

 

 

"You'll Have To Trust Me"

$200 CAD

Help us stay safe! Buy a NarcoLeap face mask for our cast and crew members, and get one for yourself. 

Included:

  • Face mask with NarcoLeap logo
  • Live stream access to select production events for NarcoLeap Season 2
  • Personalized shoutout video 

 

 

"Are You Sure It Was Only A Dream?"

$480 CAD

No, you’re not dreaming, this perk package is packed full of excitement. You will get a signed copy of the pilot script from all cast members, a sleep mask with the NarcoLeap logo, a VIP invitation to our Season 2 screening event, and more!

Included:

  • Signed Copy of Pilot Script
  • Sleep Mask with NarcoLeap Logo
  • VIP Invitation to Screening (dependent on social distancing regulations; travel costs are not covered)
  • Face mask with NarcoLeap logo
  • Live stream access to select production events for NarcoLeap Season 2
  • Personalized shoutout video 

 

 

VIP Only

$800 CAD

This is your chance to officially be part of the NarcoLeap web series. Get a brand new character named after you in the show. 

Included:

  • A New Character Named After You (first name only)
  • Signed Copy of Pilot Script
  • Sleep Mask with NarcoLeap Logo
  • VIP Invitation to Screening (dependent on social distancing regulations; travel costs are not covered)
  • Face mask with NarcoLeap logo
  • Live stream access to select production events for NarcoLeap Season 2
  • Personalized shoutout video 

 

 

The Trippers

$1000 CAD

Become a part of NarcoLeap crew by getting a special thank you screen credit "The Trippers"!

  • Special Thank You Screen Credit
  • Signed Copy of Pilot Script
  • Sleep Mask with NarcoLeap Logo
  • VIP Invitation to Screening (dependent on social distancing regulations; travel costs are not covered)
  • Face mask with NarcoLeap logo
  • Live stream access to select production events for NarcoLeap Season 2
  • Personalized shoutout video

 

 

Please support the NarcoLeap family in any way you can. You can purchase one of our perks, or share our campaign with your network. 

 

If you can't help out financially but believe in what we are doing - we still think you're awesome! There are lots of other ways to join us and help us on this journey. 

 

SHARE the links, tell your friends, repost, retweet, etc. Every time you talk to someone about this project, it creates awareness and that we need to succeed! 

 

 

 

We are racing against the clock to get production started for August 2020! We want to ensure that we have time to procure the PPE and cleaning supplies required before production starts.

 

 

  1. Where can I watch NarcoLeap Season 1?  All eight episodes of NarcoLeap Season 1 are now available on the NarcoLeap official YouTube channel, Telus Optik TV on Demand, the CBC TV app, and cbc.ca/watch.
  2. Where can I watch NarcoLeap Season 2? Season 2 will be available on HighBall TV and the NarcoLeap official YouTube channel.
  3. When will my perks ship? We will ship any physical perks such as masks and signed pilot scripts toward the end of October, 2020.
  4. Who should I contact for media inquiries? Please reach out to Kate Green at kate@kgpfilms.com

 

If you have any additional questions, suggestions, or feedback, you can always reach us at narcoleaps2@gmail.com.

story:
My name is Steve Alten, and I am the NY Times and international best-selling author of 20 thrillers, including The MEG series (now a major motion picture starring Jason Statham, with the sequel, MEG-2: The TRENCH in pre-production). Two more of my series have also been optioned as movies: The LOCH and one other underwater feature, which I cannot announce just yet.

Ten months ago, I awoke at 4 am with the ingredients to an amazing new sea monster universe taking root in my head. I crawled out of bed and hobbled upstairs. I spent the next six hours researching and writing what may be the best backstory for a thriller I've ever written.

Take this to the bank: One year from now, WHERE SEA MONSTERS ROAM will be the most popular and talked about episodic TV series PERIOD. Remember, this is my wheelhouse.  While I enjoyed The MEG I had no say, no control, no opportunity to contribute. This time Daddy's not only calling the shots, he's writing them... and I know what you want -- you want big teeth and lots of blood and terror mixed with a whiff of sex, plenty of eye-candy and a dash of semi-raunchy humor. I've recruited amazing 3D animators and producers, and a hungry talented young director and future star in Max Ginolin - shark bait for our lovely ladies. 

There are 3 key elements to this new entertainment dynamic: 

SeaMonsterCove.com is up and running  - and wowing its guests with virtual interactive experiences that mirrors the TV series and places YOU in the action.  Go check it out!

 WHERE SEA MONSTERS ROAM (the TV series) is the driving force behind the project and with YOUR HELP we can exceed even our own high expectations.

Sea Monster Hunt - the Video Game is in development. When it is added to www.SeaMonsterCove.com you will be in command, stalking and capturing these creatures while competing against others.

I've drained my savings to bring us to Base Camp; YOUR DONATION is needed to get us to the summit and will cover the costs of post production on the Pilot Episode (the shots are already in the can after months of filming in France during the COVID-19 epidemic. How did this crew of 30 get the job done? Because a hungry dog will outwork everyone to eat, Everyone involved loves the project so much, they worked for free. just to be a part of this.)

We've put up some amazing incentives to donate, but knowing you were a part of something very special... seeing your name in the credits - as Max says, "that is Super Cool."

--Steve Alten
story_txt: My name is Steve Alten, and I am the NY Times and international best-selling author of 20 thrillers, including The MEG series (now a major motion picture starring Jason Statham, with the sequel, MEG-2: The TRENCH in pre-production). Two more of my series have also been optioned as movies: The LOCH and one other underwater feature, which I cannot announce just yet.Ten months ago, I awoke at 4 am with the ingredients to an amazing new sea monster universe taking root in my head. I crawled out of bed and hobbled upstairs. I spent the next six hours researching and writing what may be the best backstory for a thriller I've ever written.Take this to the bank: One year from now, WHERE SEA MONSTERS ROAM will be the most popular and talked about episodic TV series PERIOD. Remember, this is my wheelhouse.  While I enjoyed The MEG I had no say, no control, no opportunity to contribute. story:
Short Summary

 

  • Lifties is an indie comedy web series and the first of its kind to originate from the Midwest. The series follows the crew of Mt. Schole, Minnesota as they struggle through the ski season and deal with a shell shocked head of ski patrol, a soulless city council bureaucrat, and the occasional moose encounter. There are currently two episodes available for free online.  
  • In order to continue the series, donations from viewers and sponsors are vital! The series has the potential to become the next Letterkenny, Trailer Park Boys...but it needs support to make it as great as it can possibly be. 
  • We are asking for your support to help create the first-ever viral live-action web series to come from the Midwest! Help us revitalize snowboard/alpine culture and showcase the creative talent that our region has to offer, and finally to prove that the best creations don't have to come from a studio lot in Los Angeles. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our current goal to produce Lifties Episode 3 is $1500.  Your contribution will go towards funding the production and nothing else. 
  • We are currently offering Lifties merchandise including custom travel mugs, stickers, t-shirts, and hats as perks for your support.
  • The creators of the series are not taking a paycheck. Even if we are unable to reach the $1500 goal we will use what we do raise to help offset the costs of production. Your money will go towards hiring crew members and cast, catering for the production, equipment, and licensing. 

The Impact

  • In order for us to elevate the series to professional quality. It deserves we need your financial support. Your donation will go towards creating something that has never been done before in the Midwest or snowboard industry. 
  • Our past two episodes were made on almost a zero-dollar budget with most of the costs being paid out of pocket by the creators themselves. If we can accomplish that with almost nothing just imagine what we can do with your help!
  • We are not wealthy, trust-fund creatives, we are ordinary people with a passion for art and storytelling. Help us tell our story and the story of midwest snowboarding!

Risks & Challenges

  • We understand that COVID-19 has made things financially difficult for everyone this year.  Running a production during uncertain times presents a lot of unique challenges, but we are well tasked to mitigate these risks with safe, COVID conscious sets, and a tight budget to ensure not a cent of your donation is wasted. 
  • Our production team includes experienced filmmakers who have handled far greater amounts of money on feature-length projects. Your donation is in good hands. If you are interested in learning more about our budget breakdown and how the money you donate will be used feel free to reach out!

        

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Whether or not you are able to donate,  please share our campaign with those you think may be interested! 
  • Remember to use the share tools built into the Indiegogo campaign website! 

See you on the slopes!

We are currently offering Lifties merchandise including custom travel mugs, stickers, t-shirts, and hats as perks for your support.
The creators of the series are not taking a paycheck. Even if we are unable to reach the $1500 goal we will use what we do raise to help offset the costs of production. Your money will go towards hiring crew members and cast, catering for the production, equipment, and licensing.

In order for us to elevate the series to professional quality. It deserves we need your financial support. Your donation will go towards creating something that has never been done before in the Midwest or snowboard industry. 
Our past two episodes were made on almost a zero-dollar budget with most of the costs being paid out of pocket by the creators themselves. If we can accomplish that with almost nothing just imagine what we can do with your help!
We are not wealthy, trust-fund creatives, we are ordinary people with a passion for art and storytelling. Help us tell our story and the story of midwest snowboarding!


Risks & Challenges

We understand that COVID-19 has made things financially difficult for everyone this year.  Running a production during uncertain times presents a lot of unique challenges, but we are well tasked to mitigate these risks with safe, COVID conscious sets, and a tight budget to ensure not a cent of your donation is wasted. 
Our production team includes experienced filmmakers who have handled far greater amounts of money on feature-length projects. Your donation is in good hands. If you are interested in learning more about our budget breakdown and how the money you donate will be used feel free to reach out!

        
Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you are able to donate,  please share our campaign with those you think may be interested! 
Remember to use the share tools built into the Indiegogo campaign website! 
See you on the slopes!

story:
Unstable follows the life of an Afro-Latina who decides to pursue her dreams in Hollywood. Soon she finds that it's not as easy as she thought, as she deals with heartbreak, homelessness, and trying to fit in she follows along on the journey of life.

Our goal is to empower Afro Latinos to embrace their heritage and transform the image of the Latinos in the media.

Our main character Dashay Jocelyn is a Dominican cutie from Yonkers, New York, who is destined for television. Her quirky personality, Latina flair and beautiful melanin is a combination that came to slay.

She spends her days working as a server, and her spare moments dreaming. Finding a balance between doing what she loves (acting/creating), and living sustainably. 

We're telling a story of growth. Taking situations that seem unfortunate and finding light no matter what. We're so excited to share our truths with you and give you some giggles! 
 

What We Need & What You Get

We've set our goal at $20,000, but of course every contribution matters! This money is going to be used in many spectacular ways.

We'll be using the funds raised for locations, COVID tests, production design, equipment, wardrobe, transport and of course to pay and feed our awesome cast and crew!

We have also added some awesome perks to bribe you all and thank you for helping us create this story.

 

The Impact

Unstable is my baby. It's crawling and ready to start walking, and eventually one day running. With your help we will be able to achieve this. You have no idea how much your contribution means to me, and the impact it will have on my journey as a storyteller. It will be forever appreciated! We hope you will join us and be part of helping this beautiful project grow. You never know how strong you are until you need to be!

 

Risks & Challenges

As this is based on our personal journey navigating "The City Of Angels," The most important thing is keeping this honest, authentic, and fun! The story itself is powerful, encouraging and hilarious. I have no doubt we can help change the world if we take our time, have patience, and always do our best!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please follow our process on our Instagram page @unstableofficial

Share us, talk about it, and help us make it great!

Thank you again for your time, and I hope we can make some really awesome things come to fruition together =)

story:
Permite que este llamado a volver a nuestro origen se manifieste

Hola, somos el equipo de  Akasha Productions, una productora audiovisual donde buscamos registrar a través de nuestros lentes; todo atibo de conciencia en este mundo donde somos bombardeados constantemente con mensajes de odio y desconexión con nuestra esencia, hemos decidido crear un programa de Tv que constara de dieciseis capítulos llamado Legado; El retorno

En esta primera entrega buscamos grabar las manifestaciones, culturales, ecoturisticas y espirituales de la cultura Piaora en El Autana en la Amazonia Venezolana. Los piaroas son una comunidad indígena que habita en esta región, son guardianes de una sabiduría ancestral que guardan un mensaje de sencillez y amor a la humanidad

  Las comunidades Piaroas son un baluarte importante y un pilar de la humanidad. Con tu ayuda estas fomentando a la creación de conciencia, a mostrar un mensaje de unión a una antigua tradición, a ser parte de una comunidad que informa de manera diferente los ativos de la humanidad. Te invitamos a ser parte de la solución de una difusión masiva de esperanza. 

Se parte del llamado del espíritu de conexión que anida en cada uno de nosotros, se la luz que enciende el ánfora de salvación en los corazones de la humanidad que pide paz, 

 En nuestro viaje visitaremos el cerro Autana, mejor conocido como el cerro de las almas o el árbol de la vida por los Piaoras. Ubicado en el Amazonas Venezolano haremos el recorrido en medio de la selva, capturando la hermosa fauna y flora del origen del pulmón más grande de Latinoamérica. El rescate de la biodiversidad mostrando la conexión de nuestra naturaleza interior con la imponente manifestación de la naturaleza del mundo.

Conoceremos a fondo la cultura de los Piaroas, sus tradiciones impulsando al mundo a conocer nuevas tierras y rescatar su legado y practicarlo en nuestro día a día. Mostrando el chamanismo inherente en su linaje, caza, pesca y demás formas de vida de su comunidad

La falta de recursos monetarios debido a la situación económica de Venezuela no nos permite poder trasladarnos por nuestros propios medios es por eso que recurrimos a ti para poder cumplir nuestro objetivo

 Nos destacamos en ser positivos y con muchas ganas de realizar más proyectos que ayuden a concientizar a la humanidad, a promover cambios positivos que ayuden a la evolución y a la armonía global

Necesitamos de ti y tu aporte económico el cual nos permitirá costear:

               .-Transporte (son 2 dias de viaje desde nuestra ciudad hasta Puerto Ayacucho que es la ciudad mas cercana a la comunidad Piaroa)

               .-Guias especializado en la selva Amazonica (indispensable pues son doce horas desde la ciudad más cercana hasta el punto de conexión con la comunidad indígena en canoa)

               .-Comidas y viáticos

               .-Aporte económico a la comunidad que nos recibirá y que muy amablemente nos abrirán las puertas de su hogar

               .-Soporte económico durante el viaje.    

Si colaboras con nuestro proyecto aparte de ser parte de esta gran red podremos recompensarte con estos detallazos.

Si colaboras con 10 usd o mas; apareceras en los agradecimietos al final de los creditos

Si colaboras con 30 usd o mas: podras aparecer en agradecimientos especiales al final de los créditos

Si colaboras con 50 usd o mas: Recibiras una artesanía autóctona de la comunidad Piaroa.

Si colaboras con 100 usd o mas: Recibiras un collar de protección piaroa cargado con rezos y cantos.

Si colaboras con 500 usd o mas: Recibiras un amuleto de poder por parte de un chamán Piaroa exclusivamente para ti.

 

Si no logramos reunir los fondos suficientes, estos irían a nuestra caja de ahorros pues nuestro sueño es a como dé lugar continuar con nuestro proyecto, mostrando alternativas de vida que nos permitan interactuar con nuestro entorno de otra manera

 Agradecemos todo el apoyo y las buenas energías de todos aquellos que desean que este mensaje de cambio y conciencia se manifieste. Es por ello que si no puedes colaborar monetariamente por favor; se difusor de este llamado de conciencia, de este llamado a que nuestras almas vuelvan a conectarse con ese ser interno, con ese legado, con esa conciencia ancestral que pide ser recatada. Se la voz que ayude a llevar este mensaje de conciencia.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ciro Dapagio. At one point in my life I was a prominent figure in two different mob families. At a different point I was a prominent figure in a Latin gang. After 19 years in prison I am finally telling my story- or the parts I am allowed to anyway.

We have veteran actor Antoni Corone. We have EMMY award winning editor Jorge "Jokes Yanes". We have Paul Thompson, our expert head writer. And of course we have me, Ciro Dapagio.

Now all we need is you.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,000. This money will be going to producing our remaining 10 mobisodes (webisodes). Once we have those created we will be showing those and a pilot to cable networks and streaming sites. Netflix has already expressed interest.

I know people. People don't want to give you something without something in return. This is what I can offer you:

Pledge $50- be able to visit the set

Pledge $100- Special Thanks credit

Pledge $250- become background extra with 1 line of dialogue

Pledge $500- get an associate producer credit

Pledge $1000- get a sneak peak at all material

Pledge $15,000- get a producer credit

The Impact

Your contribution will make television better. It will allow people to see what being in the Family is all about. It will allow people to begin to understand what being an ex-con is all about, what being a Boss is all about, what being a true gangster is all about

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate- that's fine. Share my story. Recruit your friends. Tell them on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter. Let them know- The MobKing is coming.

story:
INSPIRATION

Inspired by the success of recent comedy web series that have found large followings and then transitioned to Cable and Streaming platforms, three comedy writers were reflecting on their own struggles of attempting to sell a show, get staffed, or noticed, or vaguely acknowledged. When they were considering applying to the HBO Diversity Program, they found themselves stymied in determining who was actually, in fact, eligible (Their conclusion: White men – no. Women – yes. Gays and the handicapped – surprisingly only yes if they were also a minority or a woman.) They decided to stop crying and start laughing – thus was born Adversity.

SERIES LOGLINE

Eight writers in a TV network diversity program, designed to cater to PC culture, compete for a staff position while being led by a racist, washed-up exec left over from the days before cable.

A WEB SERIES ABOUT DIVERSITY (FEATURING A DIVERSE CAST AND CREW)

Adversity is a web series about diversity starring a cast that is 66% people of color and almost half female. To date, the crew is 73% women and 55% people of color. It's not hard to be an inclusive project, even if Hollywood seems to think otherwise. We're excited to give people of all types the opportunity to excel. This project is about diversity in every way!

STORY

This offbeat, shameless comedy follows the lives of eight diverse writers vying for a staff writer position on a television series at United Broadcasting Station (UBS), a once-prominent, but now-declining dinosaur network.

Morty Fischbein, network executive in charge of multiple Emmy-winning shows from the  1970's and 1980's, has finally been demoted down to Head of the Diversity Writing Program, as the UBS legal team fights the many lawsuits filed against him for discrimination and sexual harassment. His new position disappoints the diverse writing mentees, who expected anyone but an old white racist guy.

Unfortunately, they’re in for an even bigger shock when the final mentee arrives – a seemingly straight, seemingly white, seemingly male writer. But the original seven mentees scheme to figure out how this white guy got in, and at least it takes their minds off of the disaster program they find themselves trapped in.

As the series progresses, the writers become a kind of dysfunctional family, with all the positive and negative aspects that implies.

WE'RE GIVING BACK 5% TO CHARITY

We want to support organizations that support diversity. That's why we will be donating 5% of Adversity's net profits to five charities and organizations that help both support diversity and protect equal treatment for all:

Anti-Defamation League
GLAAD
Human Rights Campaign
NAACP
National Diversity Council

WHAT WE NEED

Making a web series can be an awesome, collaborative, fulfilling endeavor. But, it also costs money. Every episode takes a lot of effort, a lot of time and a lot of people to make it happen. We firmly believe these creative and skilled people from the actors to the set designer, from lighting to sound, from the costume designer to the makeup artist, from the director to the cinematographer to the editor deserve to be compensated.

Your generous support will be used to help us pay for our 12-member cast, all crew positions, equipment rentals, insurance, locations, permits, transportation, food for the cast and crew, music, and post-production services, as well as festival fees. We greatly appreciate donations of any amount.

Adversity is an independent production and everyone on our team has full-time jobs in the industry, but for this very amazing project, they are volunteering their services, even giving up paid jobs to get this series made. We are humbly grateful for their contributions. To date, this project has been self-financed by our Producers and is only being made possible through the incredibly generous support of our many collaborators, friends, partners, and now your donations. 

OUR CAST

We’ve spent a long time casting and have found a very talented, wonderful ensemble cast. You’ll be given the chance to meet many of the actors further down the page.

OUR CREW

Our goal has been to find a diverse crew, as well as achieve a crew ratio of 50/50  women and men. It’s shaping up to be that and even more, and not because we’re trying very hard. It just turns out that there are a lot of very qualified women and minorities in the entertainment industry who are very eager to work on a show that promotes diversity, both onscreen and behind the scenes.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

As with any creative endeavor, there will always be unforeseen challenges and obstacles. 

We are attempting to shoot ten episodes – with a final combined running time equivalent to that of a feature film – in twenty days. That's twenty days where anything can happen. Whether you're an indie production or studio-backed blockbuster, mistakes are bound to happen. Which is to say, there are some things that we can’t even anticipate at this moment that will certainly require us to use a contingency portion of our funds to fix the problem and make it go away!

NO MONEY? NO PROBLEM! OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Support us by SPREADING THE WORD! More eyes mean more opportunity for us to share our project, and for us that's a big win. Blog about this fundraising effort, Facebook it, Snapchat it, Tweet about it, and e-mail your friends using the share tool, asking them to consider pledging, posting on their Facebook pages, and, soon enough, watching Adversity.

PERKS: DANESE DESIGNS

We are pleased to announce our newest sponsor, Danese Designs. Danese Designs has given us the opportunity to say a special thanks to some of you exceptional, generous individuals. Danese Designs produces necklaces with a personal touch and history combined with a high-end luxury feel. A few of these will be the perks given back to some of our sponsors who find themselves in the enviable position of being able to donate a bit more than the average person.

What makes Danese Designs different: Danese’s inspiration is rooted in her love of the ocean and her passion for the environment and wildlife. Danese uses only the finest natural gemstones from around the world. In each piece, she incorporates as many natural raw materials as she can. Holding the belief that, when you take raw materials directly from Mother Earth, it is important to give something back. Adversity will donate 1% from each qualifying purchase to the following ecological charities: Greenpeace Fund and the Ocean Conservancy.

One of Danese's creations:

THE CAST

Eileen Soong

Eileen is an actor/writer/comedian born and raised in Southern California. Currently, she can be seen performing around the LA comedy scene in the all-female-of-color sketch team "Illuminaughty by Nature". She is very excited to be part of the cast of Adversity.

Eileen will play Melanie Lee, who is known to don purple wigs, wear neckties over her sleeveless jean jacket, and always carries a copy of The Joy Luck Club. She explains to people that she’s “a little more Korean, and a lot gayer, than she looks.” Melanie's current project is an Asian Golden Girls set in an opium den.

Tamir Yardenne

From the Bronx, Tamir attended the New York University Tisch School of the Arts. While attending NYU, he was asked to join the Negro Ensemble Company, where he performed several Off-Broadway productions. He traveled to London to do Sartre's No Exit. Now in Los Angeles, he has starred with Jada Pinkett Smith on Hawthorne as Vernon. His past television guest spots include Dexter, NYPD Blue, The Young and the Restless, The Pretender, Ghost Stories, That's Life, Guiding Light, New York Undercover and All My Children.

Tamir plays Langston Johnson, named after Langston Hughes (an American poet, social activist and novelist). Langston is a militant gay man and militant devotee of Whitney Houston. He writes about the Harlem Renaissance, the golden age of artistic explosion in the African American culture, and, perhaps surprisingly, high-finance intrigue.

Kyla Schoer

Originally from New York City, Kyla is now proudly based in Los Angeles. With a BFA in Music Theatre from The Hartt School. Kyla has acted Off-Broadway, regionally, in Indie films, and TV. Recent credits include Angie Tribeca (TBS) and My Crazy Ex (LMN). As an acting coach, Kyla's clients have been on Broadway, Off-Broadway, Indie film and TV. www.aschoerthing.com

Kyla will be bringing to life Jessica Greenberg, daughter of half-Jewish and half-WASP affluence who proudly (and falsely) claims full Jewhood. She writes upper-middle-class existential suburban malaise and is a warrior for the rights of minorities, even to her own detriment.

Aroon Nayer

Born and raised in the southern Indian state of Kerala, Aroon was always interested in the performance arts. He sang for various bands while pursuing an education as an engineer.  His artistic ambitions drove him to change careers and complete the acting conservatory program at Stella Adler, in Los Angeles. He has been involved in many theater play productions, as well as short and feature films.

Aroon is very excited to be on board with Adversity, and looks forward to playing Dwight, (full name: Danveer Ramanachandran), a Mumbai-born, London-private-school educated urban-rap aficionado. Dwight writes about the streets and is working on a sequel to The Wire.

Krystal Willis

Krystal Willis was born in Lafayette, Louisiana and began acting in church plays at the age of 5. She continued acting in school plays like The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe, Cinderella, and programs for Delta Sigma Theta Sorority. In 2012, she was cast in Vin Diesel’s webseries for Fox, called The Ropes. She was later cast in a promo for the ABC Family show Huge. When Krystal isn't working, she enjoys studying at Speiser/Sturges Acting Studio or spending time with friends and family. She also enjoys seeing plays, and DIY projects around the house. Krystal is currently based out of Los Angeles, California.

Krystal will play Courtney White, a J-Crew-wearing black girl who grew up an Army brat, and thus slips in and out of different accents and dialects, often alternating between, “Yunz”, “Y’all”, “Yah”, and “Yo”. Courtney specializes in melodramas that highlight systemic  racism in the U.S.

Manny Rodriguez

Manny Rodriguez is an actor from Brooklyn, NY.  After graduating from Baruch College with a B.A. in English Literature, he went on to study at The Acting Studio, and then The School for Film and Television and UCB LA.  He has appeared in several plays in New York and LA, including Cactus Flower, Six Degrees of Separation, Jack Kerouac: Catholic, Karp’s Last Text, and Shadow Zone.  He recently co-starred in Secure Storage at the 2017 Hollywood Fringe Festival. In addition, he has starred in three plays at the NYC Fringe Festival: Analog Friend, Choke City, and Savage International.  He can also be seen on YouTube in the web series Benny, as well as in various upcoming short films (After Nine, Beat, Angel’s Tacos.)

Manny will become Jesús Martinez, a buttoned-up Christian Latino from Chicago who peppers his speech with questionable Spanish and constantly name drops his cousin-by-marriage, Celebrity Chef Roy Choi. He’s working on a Friends knockoff set above a taco shop in Guadalajara he's aptly titled Amigos.

Nida Khurshid

Nida Khurshid was born in Lahore, Pakistan, and raised predominantly by her mother Naheed Yousaf, a school teacher and jewelry designer. Nida is of Pakistani, Irish and Indian ancestry, and grew up in a small farm town, East Bernard, Texas. She is fluent in Urdu and Hindi. She started modeling at 18 years old, her first gig being a contestant on Tyra Banks' America's Next Top Model. After returning from filming, she continued pursuing her journalism major at the University of Houston, but after a couple years, she decided to concentrate on becoming a model and actress. She moved to Los Angeles and got her acting career started when executive producer of American Crime, John Ridley, cast her in a recurring guest star role in his pilot, Presence. After shooting that, she was cast in another ABC pilot as well as roles on Nickelodeon and Fox, and modeled in several modeling campaigns.

Nida will transform into Farah Nejem, a transgender Dari-speaking Afghani who wears a brilliant purple burqa, but only when it serves her. Other times, she’s a sexy, rouge-wearing, high-cheekbone stunner who goes clubbing in WeHo in a little red dress. Farah's working on a drama set behind the scenes of international beauty contests.

Matt McHugh 

Matt is from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. He moved to Los Angeles from Mumbai, India, for a girl, but, when that tanked within the month, he stayed for all the other girls (spoiler alert: He doesn't date (further: ...not by choice...)). He actually stayed for the writing. Before the memory of that girl was even cold, he and his writing partner had written a sitcom script that would eventually make the finals of the prestigious Austin Film Festival.

When he realized how useless that was, Matt decided that, to get his stuff made, he'd have to do it all - write, act, produce. So, here he is, doing all three on Adversity.

Matt will act as Chad Chironna III, who dresses like a homeless frat boy going hiking in Runyon Canyon. Chad writes raunchy kegger farce, faith-based fidelity horror, and stop-motion anime musicals.

Nick Riggall

Nicholas has been in over 27 indie film projects, multiple web-series, commercials, and has been an avid student of multiple voiceover, scene study, audition technique, and improv classes blah blah blah blah…This is Nick. He loves acting and is grateful for the opportunity it has given him to explore himself and aspects of life he may never directly experience. He is really looking forward to seeing a few films he's been in (Mensch, American Muscle, The Murder Man) go to festivals, and to film his upcoming projects, Untrafficked and Adversity. He lives in LA, walks his Doxie-Pin, Royce, and rides his motorcycle to as many auditions as he can. Want to know more? http://nicholasriggall.com

Nick is set to play Sean Donati, a straight-laced, well-to-do law student who's just screaming to rebel. He’s Jessica’s fiancé, but he may be gay, but he also may just be scared of commitment...and a bit bi-curious.

Jonathan Konishi

Jonathan is an actor living in Los Angeles. He is excited to be a part of Adversity. He has starred in numerous commercials, television shows, short films, voiceover projects, music videos, theater shows, and comedy clubs. He can currently be seen on the Hollywood Casino billboard at 4542 S. Centinela Ave. (Don't forget to wave hi!) His hobbies include improv-ing at UCB, watching WWE, eating at curry houses, and dancing at EDC.

Jonathan will bring to glorious life Hiro Masuki, a hipster who wears fine European slim-cut suits and clunky-framed glasses and who runs the UBS TV network. Hiro has an MBA from Fordham but doesn’t even watch TV. 

OUR TEAM

Producers/Writers, Director, DP, Line Producer, Casting Director

Matt McHugh - (Producer/Writer/Actor) - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6515885/

Matt has co-created, written, co-directed, acted in, and edited another web series, Sibling Rivalry. (Here, he is obligated to state that it was originally his sister’s idea.) He looks forward to this upcoming web series, as he will have other people to chip in. However, he has to buy them lunch, which is a pain. He once produced a short film for a 48-hour festival with only himself and a dog (and the dog’s owner’s voiceover, sent from the other side of the U.S.). Now that he thinks about it, he realizes that he had to feed the dog, so, he supposes this won’t be too different.

A script he co-wrote about an alcoholic high school football coach who accidentally becomes a life coach was a finalist in the Austin Film Festival.

His shoulder made a cameo in the pilot episode of a Bollywood soap opera. It was cancelled during its first season.

He suspects he may have accomplished one other thing, but he can’t recall it as of the time of this writing.

Amelia Solomon - (Producer/Writer/Actor) - http://www.filmandtvmania.com                        

Amelia is a Los Angeles-based Producer and Screenwriter, with a comedic writing portfolio that includes short films, original TV pilots, and web series. She has been awarded several placements in top international screenwriting contests. Her TV pilot Jail Bound was a recent Semi-Finalist in the Creative World Awards and a Quarter-Finalist in the ScreenCraft Screenwriters Residency Program. Another TV pilot, Rebecca Resets, was a Semi-Finalist in the SoCal Film Festival, and a Quarter-Finalist in both the Creative World Awards and the ScreenCraft Pilot Launch TV Contest. Her short, The Will, was an Official Selection in the 2017 Hollywood Comedy Shorts Film Festival.

As a Producer, Amelia is in pre-production both on the hilarious satirical comedic web series Adversity and on Hurria, a dramatic short film about a Syrian refugee family seeking to come to America. Both projects are set to film in 2018. She is also Co-Producing Scapegoats, a drama short, which is currently in development.

Amelia is excited to play Amanda Kern, Morty's sexually harassed executive assistant, on Adversity, where she can finally put to use the acting techniques she acquired under the tutelage of Cliff De Young at the Santa Monica Playhouse. You may remember Cliff from the film Protocol, starring Goldie Hawn. He had an important scene with her in the bathroom.

Tamir Yardenne - (Producer/Writer/Actor) - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1127948/

In 2007, with a dream of creating quality work, Tamir launched Tamirfilms Ltd., a film and TV production company.  As Chief Executive Officer, he is responsible for the worldwide production, marketing and distribution of all Tamirfilms entertainment, including motion pictures, television, cable, syndication and home entertainment.

Tamir produced the short film Silencio, starring Emmy Award Nominated Actor Meshach Taylor. It tells the story of a male teenager, raised by a devout Catholic mother and an abusive father who questions his manhood. Between being bullied and victimized by peer pressure, he struggles to make sense of the world around him. He crosses paths with a street gang and fails to resist them. Caught in the gang bangers grip, he is forced to commit an unimaginable crime, which leads to heartbreaking circumstances.

As a writer, Tamir has made it to the second round of the Sundance Episodic Lab, with his one-hour TV pilot, Citizen Troy.

DL Fairbanks - (Director) -  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0493464/

San Francisco, 1968, with an audience mainly of flower children...hippies from the Haight district...my dad took me to a screening of 2001: A Space Odyssey...lots of smoke in rows 1 through 3...slowly wafting our way. My dad was kind of a "square"...but I respected him. I watched him throughout the screening for his reactions. During the "hallucinatory" part of the film - entitled Infinity and beyond - I saw him...he was awestruck. What I thought was, "How did this director, Stanley Kubrick, get all those scenes filmed in space?" It was real...and I was hooked.

I wanted to Direct. Super 8 film was my first tool. I created with stop-motion animation - people as "cars" driving down real streets. People flying across the screen - without wires. Killer green pumpkins escaping the law. An epic remake of Spartacus.

All on Super 8mm. It was my canvas. I've worked for many great filmmakers. Listening to them and watching them work.

This led me to a collaboration with a great animator, Henry Selick (of Tim Burton's The Nightmare Before Christmas)...for which we won a Clio Award for an MTV top-of-the-hour station ID, Insect, which I photographed. I learned a lot from Henry. Mostly about patience, and belief in one's vision.

30 years later, my dream continues...I am honored to direct Adversity! Thank you all for contributing to our cause!

Senda Bonnet - (DP) - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1819811/

Born and raised in France, Senda Bonnet graduated from the prestigious La FEMIS Cinema School of Paris with a concentration in cinematography. Senda was classically trained to shoot on film, but quickly adopted digital technology. She is a third generation filmmaker and has been passionate about the medium of motion pictures and the possibility of telling stories through images since she was a little girl—filmmaking is in her blood.

Her documentary work and feature films have taken her around the globe and her work has won awards and been shown at major film festivals. One of her more recent projects, “La Robe Bleu (The Blue Dress)”, premiered at the Berlin Film Festival.

Senda is a dreamer, strong leader and problem solver with a passion for bringing stories to life and helping directors and producers capture their vision.

Joyce Lee - (Line Producer) - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0497607/

Joyce Lee is a producer, actor and writer living in Los Angeles who began her career in production management in Santa Clarita, CA with Jimmy Lifton’s Casket Lake’s series “Twelve to Midnight ” as POC and 2nd AD.   Her play “The Dean’s Office” is being featured in Houston’s Fade to Black, playreading series and her campaign  End Racism Now is kicking off with the short screenplay, “Essence of Love,” which she wrote about hate crime.  Since receiving an MFA in Acting from NYU, she has worked in TV, film and theatre and has taught acting at Cornell University in Ithaca, NY and the International Academy for Film and Television in Burbank, CA.    Ms. Lee also has a passion for youth development and holds a certificate in Social Emotional Healing through the Arts from UCLArts, Santa Monica.

Tiffany McCreight - (Casting Director) -  tiffanymccreight@yahoo.com

Tiffany McCreight is an entertainment professional with extensive experience in multiple areas of the industry. She received her MFA in writing in 2016. Tiffany is a published writer, director, and a casting professional.  In her spare time, she loves a good cup of coffee, conversation with good friends, or a sunny day at the beach.
story_txt:
INSPIRATION
Inspired by the success of recent comedy web series that have found large followings and then transitioned to Cable and Streaming platforms, three comedy writers were reflecting on their own struggles of attempting to sell a show, get staffed, or noticed, or vaguely acknowledged. When they were considering applying to the HBO Diversity Program, they found themselves stymied in determining who was actually, in fact, eligible (Their conclusion: White men – no. Women – yes. Gays and the handicapped – surprisingly only yes if they were also a minority or a woman.) They decided to stop crying and start laughing – thus was born Adversity.
SERIES LOGLINE
Eight writers in a TV network diversity program, designed to cater to PC culture, compete for a staff position while being led by a racist, washed-up exec left over from the days before cable.
A WEB SERIES ABOUT DIVERSITY (FEATURING A DIVERSE CAST AND CREW)
Adversity is a web series about diversity starring a cast that is 66% people of color and almost half female. To date, the crew is 73% women and 55% people of color. It's not hard to be an inclusive project, even if Hollywood seems to think otherwise. We're excited to give people of all types the opportunity to excel. This project is about diversity in every way!
STORY
This offbeat, shameless comedy follows the lives of eight diverse writers vying for a staff writer position on a television series at United Broadcasting Station (UBS), a once-prominent, but now-declining dinosaur network.
Morty Fischbein, network executive in charge of multiple Emmy-winning shows from the  1970's and 1980's, has finally been demoted down to Head of the Diversity Writing Program, as the UBS legal team fights the many lawsuits filed against him for discrimination and sexual harassment. His new position disappoints the diverse writing mentees, who expected anyone but an old white racist guy.
Unfortunately, they’re in for an even bigger shock when the final mentee arrives – a seemingly straight, seemingly white, seemingly male writer. But the original seven mentees scheme to figure out how this white guy got in, and at least it takes their minds off of the disaster program they find themselves trapped in.
As the series progresses, the writers become a kind of dysfunctional family, with all the positive and negative aspects that implies.
WE'RE GIVING BACK 5% TO CHARITY
We want to support organizations that support diversity. That's why we will be donating 5% of Adversity's net profits to five charities and organizations that help both support diversity and protect equal treatment for all:
Anti-Defamation LeagueGLAADHuman Rights CampaignNAACPNational Diversity Council
WHAT WE NEED
Making a web series can be an awesome, collaborative, fulfilling endeavor. But, it also costs money. Every episode takes a lot of effort, a lot of time and a lot of people to make it happen. We firmly believe these creative and skilled people from the actors to the set designer, from lighting to sound, from the costume designer to the makeup artist, from the director to the cinematographer to the editor deserve to be compensated.
Your generous support will be used to help us pay for our 12-member cast, all crew positions, equipment rentals, insurance, locations, permits, transportation, food for the cast and crew, music, and post-production services, as well as festival fees. We greatly appreciate donations of any amount.
Adversity is an independent production and everyone on our team has full-time jobs in the industry, but for this very amazing project, they are volunteering their services, even giving up paid jobs to get this series made. We are humbly grateful for their contributions. To date, this project has been self-financed by our Producers and is only being made possible through the incredibly generous support of our many collaborators, friends, partners, and now your donations. 
OUR CAST
We’ve spent a long time casting and have found a very talented, wonderful ensemble cast. You’ll be given the chance to meet many of the actors further down the page.
OUR CREW
Our goal has been to find a diverse crew, as well as achieve a crew ratio of 50/50  women and men. It’s shaping up to be that and even more, and not because we’re trying very hard. It just turns out that there are a lot of very qualified women and minorities in the entertainment industry who are very eager to work on a show that promotes diversity, both onscreen and behind the scenes.
RISKS & CHALLENGES
As with any creative endeavor, there will always be unforeseen challenges and obstacles. 
We are attempting to shoot ten episodes – with a final combined running time equivalent to that of a feature film – in twenty days. That's twenty days where anything can happen. Whether you're an indie production or studio-backed blockbuster, mistakes are bound to happen. Which is to say, there are some things that we can’t even anticipate at this moment that will certainly require us to use a contingency portion of our funds to fix the problem and make it go away!
NO MONEY? NO PROBLEM! OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
Support us by SPREADING THE WORD! More eyes mean more opportunity for us to share our project, and for us that's a big win. Blog about this fundraising effort, Facebook it, Snapchat it, Tweet about it, and e-mail your friends using the share tool, asking them to consider pledging, posting on their Facebook pages, and, soon enough, watching Adversity.
PERKS: DANESE DESIGNS
We are pleased to announce our newest sponsor, Danese Designs. Danese Designs has given us the opportunity to say a special thanks to some of you exceptional, generous individuals. Danese Designs produces necklaces with a personal touch and history combined with a high-end luxury feel. A few of these will be the perks given back to some of our sponsors who find themselves in the enviable position of being able to donate a bit more than the average person.
What makes Danese Designs different: Danese’s inspiration is rooted in her love of the ocean and her passion for the environment and wildlife. Danese uses only the finest natural gemstones from around the world. In each piece, she incorporates as many natural raw materials as she can. Holding the belief that, when you take raw materials directly from Mother Earth, it is important to give something back. Adversity will donate 1% from each qualifying purchase to the following ecological charities: Greenpeace Fund and the Ocean Conservancy.
