Nick Riggall

Nicholas has been in over 27 indie film projects, multiple web-series, commercials, and has been an avid student of multiple voiceover, scene study, audition technique, and improv classes blah blah blah blah…This is Nick. He loves acting and is grateful for the opportunity it has given him to explore himself and aspects of life he may never directly experience. He is really looking forward to seeing a few films he's been in (Mensch, American Muscle, The Murder Man) go to festivals, and to film his upcoming projects, Untrafficked and Adversity. He lives in LA, walks his Doxie-Pin, Royce, and rides his motorcycle to as many auditions as he can. Want to know more? http://nicholasriggall.com
Nick is set to play Sean Donati, a straight-laced, well-to-do law student who's just screaming to rebel. He’s Jessica’s fiancé, but he may be gay, but he also may just be scared of commitment...and a bit bi-curious.
Jonathan Konishi

Jonathan is an actor living in Los Angeles. He is excited to be a part of Adversity. He has starred in numerous commercials, television shows, short films, voiceover projects, music videos, theater shows, and comedy clubs. He can currently be seen on the Hollywood Casino billboard at 4542 S. Centinela Ave. (Don't forget to wave hi!) His hobbies include improv-ing at UCB, watching WWE, eating at curry houses, and dancing at EDC.
Jonathan will bring to glorious life Hiro Masuki, a hipster who wears fine European slim-cut suits and clunky-framed glasses and who runs the UBS TV network. Hiro has an MBA from Fordham but doesn’t even watch TV. 
OUR TEAM
Producers/Writers, Director, DP, Line Producer, Casting Director
Matt McHugh - (Producer/Writer/Actor) - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6515885/

Matt has co-created, written, co-directed, acted in, and edited another web series, Sibling Rivalry. (Here, he is obligated to state that it was originally his sister’s idea.) He looks forward to this upcoming web series, as he will have other people to chip in. However, he has to buy them lunch, which is a pain. He once produced a short film for a 48-hour festival with only himself and a dog (and the dog’s owner’s voiceover, sent from the other side of the U.S.). Now that he thinks about it, he realizes that he had to feed the dog, so, he supposes this won’t be too different.
A script he co-wrote about an alcoholic high school football coach who accidentally becomes a life coach was a finalist in the Austin Film Festival.
His shoulder made a cameo in the pilot episode of a Bollywood soap opera. It was cancelled during its first season.
He suspects he may have accomplished one other thing, but he can’t recall it as of the time of this writing.
Amelia Solomon - (Producer/Writer/Actor) - http://www.filmandtvmania.com                        

Amelia is a Los Angeles-based Producer and Screenwriter, with a comedic writing portfolio that includes short films, original TV pilots, and web series. She has been awarded several placements in top international screenwriting contests. Her TV pilot Jail Bound was a recent Semi-Finalist in the Creative World Awards and a Quarter-Finalist in the ScreenCraft Screenwriters Residency Program. Another TV pilot, Rebecca Resets, was a Semi-Finalist in the SoCal Film Festival, and a Quarter-Finalist in both the Creative World Awards and the ScreenCraft Pilot Launch TV Contest. Her short, The Will, was an Official Selection in the 2017 Hollywood Comedy Shorts Film Festival.
As a Producer, Amelia is in pre-production both on the hilarious satirical comedic web series Adversity and on Hurria, a dramatic short film about a Syrian refugee family seeking to come to America. Both projects are set to film in 2018. She is also Co-Producing Scapegoats, a drama short, which is currently in development.
Amelia is excited to play Amanda Kern, Morty's sexually harassed executive assistant, on Adversity, where she can finally put to use the acting techniques she acquired under the tutelage of Cliff De Young at the Santa Monica Playhouse. You may remember Cliff from the film Protocol, starring Goldie Hawn. He had an important scene with her in the bathroom.
Tamir Yardenne - (Producer/Writer/Actor) - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1127948/
In 2007, with a dream of creating quality work, Tamir launched Tamirfilms Ltd., a film and TV production company.  As Chief Executive Officer, he is responsible for the worldwide production, marketing and distribution of all Tamirfilms entertainment, including motion pictures, television, cable, syndication and home entertainment.
Tamir produced the short film Silencio, starring Emmy Award Nominated Actor Meshach Taylor. It tells the story of a male teenager, raised by a devout Catholic mother and an abusive father who questions his manhood. Between being bullied and victimized by peer pressure, he struggles to make sense of the world around him. He crosses paths with a street gang and fails to resist them. Caught in the gang bangers grip, he is forced to commit an unimaginable crime, which leads to heartbreaking circumstances.
As a writer, Tamir has made it to the second round of the Sundance Episodic Lab, with his one-hour TV pilot, Citizen Troy.
DL Fairbanks - (Director) -  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0493464/

San Francisco, 1968, with an audience mainly of flower children...hippies from the Haight district...my dad took me to a screening of 2001: A Space Odyssey...lots of smoke in rows 1 through 3...slowly wafting our way. My dad was kind of a "square"...but I respected him. I watched him throughout the screening for his reactions. During the "hallucinatory" part of the film - entitled Infinity and beyond - I saw him...he was awestruck. What I thought was, "How did this director, Stanley Kubrick, get all those scenes filmed in space?" It was real...and I was hooked.
I wanted to Direct. Super 8 film was my first tool. I created with stop-motion animation - people as "cars" driving down real streets. People flying across the screen - without wires. Killer green pumpkins escaping the law. An epic remake of Spartacus.
All on Super 8mm. It was my canvas. I've worked for many great filmmakers. Listening to them and watching them work.
This led me to a collaboration with a great animator, Henry Selick (of Tim Burton's The Nightmare Before Christmas)...for which we won a Clio Award for an MTV top-of-the-hour station ID, Insect, which I photographed. I learned a lot from Henry. Mostly about patience, and belief in one's vision.
30 years later, my dream continues...I am honored to direct Adversity! Thank you all for contributing to our cause!
Senda Bonnet - (DP) - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1819811/

Born and raised in France, Senda Bonnet graduated from the prestigious La FEMIS Cinema School of Paris with a concentration in cinematography. Senda was classically trained to shoot on film, but quickly adopted digital technology. She is a third generation filmmaker and has been passionate about the medium of motion pictures and the possibility of telling stories through images since she was a little girl—filmmaking is in her blood.
Her documentary work and feature films have taken her around the globe and her work has won awards and been shown at major film festivals. One of her more recent projects, “La Robe Bleu (The Blue Dress)”, premiered at the Berlin Film Festival.
Senda is a dreamer, strong leader and problem solver with a passion for bringing stories to life and helping directors and producers capture their vision.
Joyce Lee - (Line Producer) - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0497607/

Joyce Lee is a producer, actor and writer living in Los Angeles who began her career in production management in Santa Clarita, CA with Jimmy Lifton’s Casket Lake’s series “Twelve to Midnight ” as POC and 2nd AD.   Her play “The Dean’s Office” is being featured in Houston’s Fade to Black, playreading series and her campaign  End Racism Now is kicking off with the short screenplay, “Essence of Love,” which she wrote about hate crime.  Since receiving an MFA in Acting from NYU, she has worked in TV, film and theatre and has taught acting at Cornell University in Ithaca, NY and the International Academy for Film and Television in Burbank, CA.    Ms. Lee also has a passion for youth development and holds a certificate in Social Emotional Healing through the Arts from UCLArts, Santa Monica.
Tiffany McCreight - (Casting Director) -  tiffanymccreight@yahoo.com

Tiffany McCreight is an entertainment professional with extensive experience in multiple areas of the industry. She received her MFA in writing in 2016. Tiffany is a published writer, director, and a casting professional.  In her spare time, she loves a good cup of coffee, conversation with good friends, or a sunny day at the beach.

story:
SO MUCH!!

OUR CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED VIA INDIEGOGO however we are still accepting donations via PAYPAL and Cash App... If you'd like to continue assisting us, please share our PAYPAL, CASH APP & THIS PAGE with your network!


PAYPAL           Email: Hazelsgifted@yahoo.com or 
CASH APP      cash.me/$DolphyProductions  

 

 

What is "RELATIONSHIP"? 

Peace and blessings,

I'm Hazel Dolphy and I'm an actress, producer, director, screenwriter and the creator/writer of Relationship Drama Series. I've also had the great assistance of a co-writer, Jennifer Post.
I've been creating content for over 10 years. I decided to create a web series that deals with the joys and complications of relationships. Now when I say relationships I mean those with a significant other and those we call our friends.

By donating to "RELATIONSHIP" you are allowing us to create a great show where we explore the dynamics of relationships. 
This campaign is extremely important to me because reaching the funding goal will allow me to further my artistic freedom, give other artists a platform to perform and also give our audience great story lines to connect with while being entertained.

 

Dolphy Productions is a film production company that was founded in 2005, by Hazel Dolphy. 
Since then Hazel has created projects by herself and has done some collaborations. 
With the conception of "Relationship" Drama Series, Hazel Dolphy met with Jennifer Post and created a great writers collaborative bond.
Both Hazel and Jennifer are responsible for the entertaining dialogue that the actors will perform. 
In addition, the production has great producers, Dana Hanna and Shawntelle Hubbard, who will help make the series come together successfully. 

Always serving the post production sound needs for Dolphy Productions, is the very talented music producer, Jamiyl "Hellz Yea!" Adams. 

WHAT WE NEED 

We are raising 35K to make 10 Episodes that will be  15-20 minutes each.  
That's $3500 an episode which in theory is a very small budget (as most half-hour television drama shows have budgets of around $300,000 - $500,000 per episode), however we will put in a lot of hard work and dedication to give our supporters and audience great episodes!

Your contribution would help pay for everything that makes a show great: 
Lights, cameras, sound, actors, film crew, editing, sound mixing, original music, color grading, marketing and the costs of entering into renowned film festivals.

The allocation of the $35,000 will be: 

$6,000: Renting equipment and Updating our equipment. 

With renting and getting new equipment we would be able to make season 1 look phenomenal. 

$5,000: Food and Beverage. We provide our cast and crew with breakfast, lunch, and dinner when they are on set with us. We will probably shoot 25 to 35  days to complete our season which breaks down to around 75 to 105 meals. We’ve got a lot of mouths to feed! 

$4,000: Marketing. The most important part is getting "RELATIONSHIP" out into the world. $4,000 for marketing would allow us to hire a marketing firm and to cover the cost to submit "RELATIONSHIP" to renowned film festivals as well as the cost of buying business cards and other advertising items so that we can show "RELATIONSHIP" to as many people as possible. 

$6,000: Cast and Crew Expenses. One of the most magical parts of indie filmmaking is that it's usually a passion project. With getting to our funding goal we would be able to pay our cast and crew a nominal stipend to show how much we appreciate their hours of hard work.

$6,000: Locations, Props, Gas, and Insurance/Incidentals. You never know what's going to come up on set, and since we will film in Atlanta we want to make sure we are covered for any potential problems or challenges we may run into along the way. 

$4000: Sound Mixing: Sound is very unforgiving in film/tv shows. If the audio is hard to hear we will definitely lose our audience. This will cover an experienced sound mixer/sound department that will level our music and dialogue throughout the 10 episodes. 

$4000: Post Production: It's important that after we have all that hard work completed we turn it over to a talented editor and colorist that can make our project look it's best! 

If we don't make our goal we would be at risk of not completing the season in addition to not having the greatest production value. Your contribution would make a huge difference, no matter how small.

I believe this series is extremely valuable because it's raw, it's real and it's entertaining. I bet you've been in a relationship with a mate or friend that wasn't supportive of your dreams or aspirations. With our series we will see a couple go through this. How about having an amazing day and going home and hearing the worse news. What I love about Relationship Drama Series is that we tackle true problems.

 AND 

Of course there will be risks but without risks there aren't any rewards. A major risk/challenge is that after we shoot a fantastic show, no one would know that it exists. To tackle this issue we would hire a marketing firm that has expertise in this area. The goal is to then promote Relationship Drama Series to several markets and countries.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

I know there's times in our lives that money is an issue.  I truly understand that feeling.
I'm one woman with a huge dream and desire to leave a great legacy for my kids. I ask that you kindly donate as little as $25 to our campaign so that we can produce 10 episodes.

WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO TO HELP?

If you want to support "RELATIONSHIP" but don't feel that you can contribute financially you can help tremendously by FOLLOWING AND LIKING ALL OF OUR SOCIAL MEDIA PAGES.

IG: www.Instagram.com/RelationshipDramaSeries
Facebook: www.Facbook.com/RelationshipDramaSeries
Twitter: www.twitter.com/Relationshipds 

You can also become an Official "RELATIONSHIP AMBASSADOR"


How can you do that? Help spread the word to the WORLD/ all your NETWORK!

You can create a video informing your friends/family/network to follow our youtube channel and to follow our social media pages.
Remember to hashtag us so we can see it:   #RelationshipDramaSeries & #DolphyProductions

MOST IMPORTANTLY, subscribe to www.Youtube.com/DolphyProductions as that's the only place the show will be aired (until we get a great network deal!... LET'S PRAY!)
Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools as this also help us get the word out.
Let’s make some serious noise about this campaign.


  WE NEED

More money = even better results!

We can produce a very good TV Series if we reach our fundraising goals. But we can make a much bigger impact if we get more money to work with. It’s not rocket science.
The more we get, the better the final results can be. With more money, we will have more production time, more sophisticated equipment, better soundtrack,  improved marketing capabilities, etc.
We only have one chance and we want to make the best of it.
When the initial part of this crowdfunding campaign is over it will still be possible to donate funds to this project until the launch of the series.

 

Thank you so much for you contributions and we look forward to presenting you with a fantastic finished Season 1!

story:
Hi everyone, 

My name is Michaela P. Shelton and I am starting this campaign to raise money for season 2 of my web series, Reckless Behavior The Series. I am the creator, director, producer, writer and star of this series. 

 The web series will share the story of Michaela Holloway, a post college black millennial and aspiring writer, who navigates through life attempting to find herself and avoid reckless behavior. The web series is loosely based on my life and its purpose is to create something for us and by us that promotes the beauty and culture of the Bay Area. Its dual purpose is to bring to life my Reckless Behavior lifestyle blog series that was created four years ago. I am very passionate about creating relateable content and after the success of my self funded first season, I am hoping to continue contributing to black storytelling and inspiring as many people as I can. Through my web series, I have given opportunities to aspiring actors, up and coming musical artists and promoted a number of black owned businesses.

Reckless Behavior The Series has been mentioned on popular Bay Area radio station 106.1 KMEL, it has been featured on many blogs and podcasts and it has been selected for viewing at the 2020 Pan African Film and Arts Festival, the largest and most prestigious black film festival in America.

Please donate if you can! I would really appreciate it :).

Here is a link to season 1 episodes:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLF3EQvVv...

story:
Short Summary

                                                            CROSSOVER
                         A 13 x 42 minute supernatural teen drama tv serial. 

            “When the goddess comes hunting. Find the mother..... mother nature”

          When a teenage girl’s ancestry threatens to devastate everyone she holds 
       dear. Trinity and her friends become dangerously enthralled in an age old feud in 
        a supernatural quest to unearth the truth.

Jessica Fay is a multi award winning film maker from the North West U.K. At just 13 years old she put pen to paper on the pilot episode of "CrossOver". A year on she has written a 13 episode series complete with Tv bible and pitch documents. 
Jessica has been actively meeting with commissioner's, working with professionals in relation to her script and receiving invaluable support from seasoned industry pro's.

What We Need & What You Get

The time has come to make a sizzle reel to add to her pitch. The cost of this is approximately £3500. We are seeking help with raising £1500 which will go directly towards paying for our talented cast's travel, accommodation, aswell as location hire and food with Jessica funding the remainder.

We are offering professional photoshoots as perks, so if you are an actor in need of headshots or a family wanting to update your albums please consider helping us.

The Impact

If the sizzle reel has the desired effect you will be supporting Tv history. A teenage girl having her show brought to life. It may sound like a pipe dream but Jessica has proven herself time and time again, being recognised at festivals all over the world. 

A direct quote taken from an industry professional on her pilot script

"; take it from me: you can write. I read hundreds of scripts a year and this pilot is well above average. I believe in you as a writer. And as you are on a level with many adult writers out there, I am going to treat your script as I would an adult's because you deserve it. You don't need special treatment."

The fact that the writer of the above is a script consultant on iconic shows such as Harry Potter and Star Wars pushes Jessica even more in her quest to bring this to the screen.

Risks & Challenges

The risk is that you support Jessica and CrossOver is never commissioned. I suppose you only fail when you stop trying. That is not something Jessica is planning on and I will be here to support her every step of the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share, please send the campaign link to your friends and family. Please talk about CrossOver and help create a buzz. Please visit the Sparkle & Shine social media pages and say hi. Check out the Sparkle & Shine Production page on IMDb.

story:
Short Summary

My name is K. Lullaby (Kristen Acruz) and I am an English major and Personality and Social Psychology minor at San Diego State University. I have always had such a deep passion for storytelling and film making, which has sparked my motivation to pursue this particular story "for real." 

My web series, "Housemates," is about a group of college students from completely different backgrounds, learning how to live with one another and support each other through the many hardships that college students go through nowadays. This project is important to me because it highlights difficult topics such as sexuality, finances, immigration backgrounds and more, and though it is in a comedic tone, the purpose of this series is to show that students with different life stories can support each other and live together, as well as show audiences that their struggles are seen, valid and represented.

With stylistic inspiration from the television shows The Office, Friends, Superstore and Brooklyn 99, this web series is definitely the one to keep funded. Your contribution allows Lullaby Cinematics to hold a solid location, have sturdy and consistent props, and provide food for the actors and crew for the hard work they will be doing during the lengthy film dates. 

What We Need & What You Get

In specifics, we will need funding in the following areas:

  • Location Fees
  • Catering for Cast & Crew
  • Props/Production Design
  • Printing costs toward scripts and contracts
  • Transportation Reimbursement
  • Equipment Repair (just in case)
  • Possible team merchandise 
  • Post-Production

If you contribute to the following prices, you may receive:

  • $ Your name in the "Sponsors" section of the credits
  • $ Access link to episode before it's released
  • $ Exclusive behind the scenes footage
  • $ Exclusive production vlogs
  • $ Exclusive photo prints of cast and stills from the set
  • $ Social media shoutout
  • $ Special representation in an episode
  • $ Personalized Thank You from the producers
  • $ Credit as an Associate Producer

***If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds will go towards food and small props for the actors, crew, and set. 

The Impact

As I have mentioned before, this series is valuable because it showcases many students with different backgrounds coming together to live with one another, and offers representation for each and many. Yes, it is a comedy and yes, these issues may not be the loudest piece of information in the room, but the actors do their best to portray dynamic differences between each character, to display the realities of many college students today. This show represents the following backgrounds: emotionally unavailable parents, Asian-American culture, adoption, LGBTQ+ struggles, financial struggles, atheism, Christianity, agnosticism, young pregnancies, etc. The goal of this project is to represent these backgrounds in a setting that is fun, comedic, accepting and inclusive, and to display how living with different people should really be like. 

I have always believed that even through different views, backgrounds, and beliefs, love surpasses all. This is the show to prove it. 

Risks & Challenges

Some risks and challenges for this project would be the fact that we are all students. Some of us are working full-time jobs, others are attending school, and some are doing both. We are all trying to make this project happen with clashing schedules, difficult lives and different priorities. However, we are all determined to push through it as we have been these past few months. 

Our efforts have been nothing but successful ever since the project began, and we are all very professional towards each other, being respectful and careful of everyone's time and feelings. The fact that we are all still here, fighting for this project to happen, says more than enough about this group of people, and frankly, I could never ask for a better team. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that monetary contributions are not for everyone, but that does not mean you are incapable of helping! If you may, please share this project anywhere that you believe will help us out. Also, we are strong believers of prayer, so please keep the safety and financial provision for our team in your prayers (and if you don't pray, please do send positive vibes). 

Remember to use Indiegogo share tools and thank you so much for your contribution.
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is K. Lullaby (Kristen Acruz) and I am an English major and Personality and Social Psychology minor at San Diego State University. I have always had such a deep passion for storytelling and film making, which has sparked my motivation to pursue this particular story "for real." 
My web series, "Housemates," is about a group of college students from completely different backgrounds, learning how to live with one another and support each other through the many hardships that college students go through nowadays. This project is important to me because it highlights difficult topics such as sexuality, finances, immigration backgrounds and more, and though it is in a comedic tone, the purpose of this series is to show that students with different life stories can support each other and live together, as well as show audiences that their struggles are seen, valid and represented.
With stylistic inspiration from the television shows The Office, Friends, Superstore and Brooklyn 99, this web series is definitely the one to keep funded. Your contribution allows Lullaby Cinematics to hold a solid location, have sturdy and consistent props, and provide food for the actors and crew for the hard work they will be doing during the lengthy film dates. 

What We Need & What You Get
In specifics, we will need funding in the following areas:

Location Fees
Catering for Cast & Crew
Props/Production Design
Printing costs toward scripts and contracts
Transportation Reimbursement
Equipment Repair (just in case)
Possible team merchandise 
Post-Production

This show represents the following backgrounds: emotionally unavailable parents, Asian-American culture, adoption, LGBTQ+ struggles, financial struggles, atheism, Christianity, agnosticism, young pregnancies, etc. The goal of this project is to represent these backgrounds in a setting that is fun, comedic, accepting and inclusive, and to display how living with different people should really be like.

Some risks and challenges for this project would be the fact that we are all students. Some of us are working full-time jobs, others are attending school, and some are doing both. We are all trying to make this project happen with clashing schedules, difficult lives and different priorities. However, we are all determined to push through it as we have been these past few months. 
Our efforts have been nothing but successful ever since the project began, and we are all very professional towards each other, being respectful and careful of everyone's time and feelings. The fact that we are all still here, fighting for this project to happen, says more than enough about this group of people, and frankly, I could never ask for a better team.

If you may, please share this project anywhere that you believe will help us out. Also, we are strong believers of prayer, so please keep the safety and financial provision for our team in your prayers (and if you don't pray, please do send positive vibes). Remember to use Indiegogo share tools and thank you so much for your contribution.

story:
Welcome to a preview of my life:

  • Hi there thanks for exploring the Gangsters crowd funding page.  I am Freddie Basnight, actor, producer, co-creator, director and your tour guide on this new adventure you have luckily stumbled upon. I have been in entertainment for seventeen years so you are in very knowledgable and  capable hands. I have served in the US Army for over 11 years, and my experience has led me to this project. 

Gangsters believe it or not is an enormous asset to the entertainment industry. 

  • This  campaign is important to me because, "Gangsters" is a completely independent project. It was created to showcase the talents of up and coming professionals who care and love the art of film.  We are a group of young professionals who’s main goal is to create new meaningful media content.  The world needs to see  the well trained cast, which consists of experienced actors who have been featured in films, television series, independent projects and more.

Providing the building blocks for an original, dynamic series.

  • Yes you guessed it. Every donation, every time you speak or share information about this campaign, every time someone subscribes to the youtube channel is a way of helping us build a series that not only entertains but educates.  Each of your valuable contribution will help bring a great story to life and provide employment for numerous people who are trying to make a name for themselves in the entertainment industry; therefore you are helping build careers. 

What do we need to continue creating this exciting new world.

  •  We need funding for: Locations, props and set design, production costs,  costume and make up, Transportation, post production, marketing and publicity , and we also need money to pay all those hard working people that are spending their time and energy to make this TV show a reality. 
  • We also need your help to further the arts of independent filmmakers by donating to this project.  It will help us achieve our dream of successfully creating a web series that can captivate it’s audience and advance to prime time television. 

What benefits do you get from doing such a great deed?

  • You get awesome perks in the form of original  Gangsters merchandise such as pens, fashionable clothing, autographed posters and a package deal also,  an opportunity to help create something wonderful for television. 
     

You ask what will happen to your valuable contribution if we don't meet our goal? Here is the answer:

Funds will remain designated for the production of Gangsters and we will continue to raise funds for the continuation of the series. 
 

Here are the ripple effects  your donations will cause.

  •  By donating, you will be greatly contributing to young filmmakers who desire to create work that showcases people with various talents.
  • We need your help to fully fund Gangsters, so that we can produce and successfully launch the series on our YouTube channel , in the hope that it will end up on other reputable distribution avenues such as for example:  Netflix, Hulu, Amazon  etc. , therefore giving those who contributed their talent to show what they have to offer to the world. 
  • Gangsters is a web series created in the hopes of evolving into an hour-long television drama on a cable network. 

 There are other ways you can help us create a great legacy.

  • Gangsters is an independent web series. If you are one of those people who have awesome  capabilities which go beyond monetary contributions, and your interests align with the project, please feel free to contact the  creators of this new adventure they are:  Mr. Freddie Basnight, his  email  address is fbasnight@gmail.com or Ms. Tiffany S. Lewis her email address is lewistiffanys@live.com. 
  •  Every donation is a huge building block which will help make the Gangsters TV show survive and grow. Can’t contribute? Spread the word. 
  • Spread the word already? Subscribe to our social media accounts and keep updated with the latest Gangsters' news and progress.

story:
Prepare yourself for action adventure like you have never seen it before, poorly lit and starring people that you have never heard of. The Adventures of Indiana James is a web series produced by Thomas Pimentel and TNT LTD. PRODUCTIONS. This action/adventure/parroty (NOT A TYPO), spoofs The Indiana Jones films while telling an original storyline wrapped around the music and influences of Jimmy Buffett. Truly a one of a kind experience, Indiana James tips its fedora to some of the greatest films ever made including Young Frankenstein, Star Wars, Blazing Saddles, The Blues Brothers, Airplane and many more. An action/comedy with a cast of hundreds.

Coming to Vimeo in 2017. Join us for the adventure. You'll be sorry that you did. Thank you and Phinz up!

We are seeking completion funds to complete this highly anticipated web series, The Adventures of Indiana James. Notable people from the entertainment world including Jimmy Buffett and Frank Marshall, the producer of Indiana Jones, have seen rough cuts of our project and are waiting for us to complete it. Our production is also a part of a documentary titled, Parrot Heads, that will be coming out in January of 2017 that is also produced by Mailboat Records. Our goal is to have the web series stream on Vimeo when the project is completed. We knew that making a parroty (get it, parroty instead of parody!) of the Indiana Jones movies would be popular since the films have been so successful all over the world.

 

“All About the Show”

Dr. Indiana James is a professor at The New England University of Mixology and is a favorite among the student body for his dedication to Mixology and adventures around the world.

The web series Chapters will be less than 30 minutes each and will be streamed on Vimeo in high quality HD with, premium sound mixing and original music by composer, T.J. Kross.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4581550/?ref_=fn_al_...

Our cast includes - http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1951148/)

Thomas Pimentel starring as Indiana James

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1582660/

Jimmy Walker-Pearson starring as Dr. Marcus Denny

http://m.imdb.com/name/nm2800506/

Christina Rondano starring as Marion Greatwoods

http://www.take12tom.com/indianajamescast.html

Michael LoPresti as Captain Jack Ticketscalper

http://www.take12tom.com/indianajamescast.html

We knew however that it would be risky to incorporate the Jimmy Buffett twist but since I am a lifelong Parrot Head and Indy fan, it made sense to me. The similarities between Buffett and Indiana Jones are pretty amazing and weaving the two genres was actually quite easy once we got started. The web series is done in the style of the old Mel Brooks movies, Airplane, and Naked Gun. The jokes and action are not forced but instead come naturally and move our story along. You can also expect to see a few song and dance numbers along the way. We recreated all of the set pieces from the original Raiders of the Lost Ark film. It was monumental but it adds to the authenticity of the project which is something that we want the audience to feel. This project has been ambitious to say the least but when it is completed it will be epic.

We’re 98% Done and Need Just a Little More Gas

98% of the series is done in terms of shooting and post production. This crowdfunding campaign helps us raise the funds we need to finish post production and editing so it’s ready for the world.

We have many ways of thanking you for backing us including full download access to the series.

We also have lots of cool swag for backers so pick the perks you like and we’ll ship them right out to you. They’re already made, ready and in stock and ready to go.

Our Production company is also the largest military and law enforcement prop rental company in New England. Take a look at our huge inventory that you can use for your next production. We have some amazing Prop Packages available as perks. www.take12tom.com

$150 USD

FILM MAKERS! Prop Package

A 300 dollar Prop Package from TNT LTD. PRODUCTIONS. Choose from our vast inventory of props to use in your own production, film, or reward video. www.take12tom.com Standard prop agreement applies.

We just need your help to get us to the finish line. Please help us. You're our only hope!

story:
Phi is a second generation Vietnamese Australian, a typical Vietnamese girl, who studies HARD to make her mother proud. But deep down all Phi ever wanted in life was to be a Superstar.

Vietnamese Australians have been working and living in Australia for over 42 years, but we are hardly represented in western TV or films. We want to dive right in and explore the Vietnamese stereotypes, break down the misconceptions and have fun doing it. 

Written by two Vietnamese Australian women who grew up in Springvale, Fiona Chau and Diana Nguyen have transformed their 4.5 star reviewed Melbourne International Comedy Festival theatre show into a web series.

From 2011 - 2015 the show started off as hugely successful comedy theatre and been featured at the Melbourne & Sydney Comedy festivals, along with the Adelaide & California Fringe Festivals. In 2017 the show went international again, playing at the Edinburg Fringe Festival. We hope to bring the same spark and passion to our webseries. In 2014, we successful crowdfunded $11k with over 106 supporters from 6 countries. Again, we like to thank our GOLD LIXI supporters: Crystal Palace Catering, Local Pool Renovations and Australian Vietnamese Women's Association (AVWA).  Over the past 3 years we have realised to make the Australian Vietnamese web series we need to make the best and we want to be the best.

PHI NGUYEN aka The "Studious" daughter 

Chi Nguyen’s full name is Nguyen Thi Kim Chi; yes, you read it correctly: Kim Chi-like the spicy Korean dish. So it goes without saying that Chi is a massive food addict, live-to-eat-not-eat-to-live kind of girl. She is also a drama queen since birth, a professional shower-singer, a Sudoku enthusiast and a loud and proud Hufflepuff. Chi has just completed her three-year Acting training at the Victorian College of the Arts,

AND 

KIM HUONG NGUYEN aka ME (The Mum)

Diana  Nguyen named after the Princess, her dream was to be a doctor, to buy a house at 19 – wait, 2 houses and have no BF until after university. None of that happened, but the disappointment continues. She is 32, not married and no grandchildren for her mum…WHEN WILL IT END?!?!

including - 

DON TRAN (Uncle Ray)

MARIA TRAN (Aunty 8)

GABBY CHAN (BA OX)

SLONE SIDURO (DANNY)

NINA HARRIS (HARR)

MONI LARS STORZ (GRANDMA)

www.phiandme.com.au/cast


LUCINDA BRUCE - Producer

SERENA HUNT - Co Producer

MEL KILLINGSWORTH - Director

MARK KENSFIELD - Director of Cinematography

GARTH ERNSTZEN - Production Designer

ANNA CHARALAMBOUS - Associate Producer

With a minimum of 20,000, it will pay:

  • $8,700 - Camera/Lighting Equipment/MUA/SFX
  • $5,150 - Cast/Crew - including flights and accommodation to Springvale Melbourne.
  • $3,000 - Post-Production
  • $2,500 - Marketing/PR

 

 

The $9000 raised in 2014 paid for: 

  • $5,650 - Food & Crafty - 20 Crew x $20 x 7 days PLUS Drinks/Snacks/Sugary things to keep crew awake
  • $550 - Public Liability
  • $1000 - Props/Printing Costs 
  • $1800 - minus .09% - Indiegogo Setup Fee
  •  

The Challenges.

How you can help!

We have received DRAGON MOTHER in-kind support over the years, and also with the webseries, but we need your help to make sure Phi & Me webseries to be produced and edited with love, care and with high production value. Let's make it VIP. 5 STARS! and we need some Dong$$!

Email us at hiphiandme@gmail.com for more information.

Want to know more, visit phiandme.com.au

story:
Short Summary

Blackveil Entertainment and its inaugural project, Foreman, were developed with the goal of giving individuals who might otherwise struggle to break into the industry a fighting chance. Our founder, Jillian Miles, is an Autistic trans woman, and a staunch believer in the cause of social justice - knowing that her chosen field might not be kind to her, she decided it was her responsibility to launch projects that would showcase her skills and the skills of like-minded individuals, especially those from marginalised groups.

This campaign hopes to fund Foreman's first and second serials - the first, Nirvi, introduces our lead (played by Sonera Angel) and our Doctor (Ms. Miles herself), as well as Nirvi's ex-boyfriend, trans man Alex Starling. This inaugural two-part story explores concepts as wide-ranging as drug abuse, the need to belong, the journey from self-interest to self-sacrifice, and much more besides - all filtered through a heady sci-fi lens.

The second serial, Predator, Pray, explores the far future of the human race, sending the Doctor and Nirvi to Eschaton, hub of super-religion 'the Faith'. There, they encounter the Witness and come under attack by wasp-like aliens and their dangerous superweapon, the Raston Warrior Robot.

With your help, we can get the ball rolling on what promises to be a long and colourful career for Blackveil - we have several more projects in the pipeline and it is our sincere hope that Foreman will help boost our profile and showcase what our talented team can really do.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We've set a modest budget of £10,000 for our first two stories, much of which will go towards our film equipment and props, costume, and locations. While it is difficult to estimate the precise costs of creating our creatures and effects, we do know that our choice of camera and lenses will come to £4906. The remaining £5303 will help cover rent on our TARDIS set and otherwise pay for the costs of developing the project - we already own a wide array of fantastic camera equipment, we just don't have the camera or lenses!

However, knowing that transparency is important, we will make sure to update regularly with the quotes and estimated costs of our concept art, costume development, prop and location costs.

We'll be offering a range of weird and wonderful perks, including prop replicas, concept art, meet-n-greets, signed scripts, cameos and credits, and much more besides!

Were the campaign to make less than we hope, we will scale back and shoot the pilot alone, and work from there on successive launches, campaigns and similar to continue producing the series. If the minimum of £4697 to cover our equipment costs isn't met, we will rent and hire as needed to shoot the pilot, until successive campaigns can cover the cost of purchase - and if we don't make enough to meet our higher tier rewards, we will negotiate refunding and reimbursement as soon as possible.

 

Risks & Challenges

FOREMAN is a fan-produced series and is not authorised by the BBC nor it's licensees. It is a not-for-profit production and all proceeds from the crowdfunding initiative will be utilised in the production itself. The possibility remains that Foreman will face a legal challenge and be forced to cease production, at which point crowdfunding will be discontinued and all backers will be refunded their last payment where possible.​

Beyond this, there are always huge hurdles to producing the quality of visual and narrative we want - scheduling, design, construction and the like. But we've already met many challenges head-on and delivered. Our astonishing TARDIS, TARDIS set, and other sundry props and designs have all been delivered by a minimal, hard-working team. We now have dedicated crew, makers, designers and the like - we can exceed every expectation we've placed on ourselves with a bit of time, and a bit of give and take.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond pitching in to the campaign, it's absolutely possible for you - yes, you in the back - to get involved with Foreman and other Blackveil projects anytime. Just drop Jillian an email at cco@blackveilentertainment.org and let her know what you can bring to the Blackveil stable of artists, actors, designers and builders - we'd be delighted to have you on-board.

You can also share our campaign on any and all social media - we're not fussy!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Blackveil Entertainment and its inaugural project, Foreman, were developed with the goal of giving individuals who might otherwise struggle to break into the industry a fighting chance. Our founder, Jillian Miles, is an Autistic trans woman, and a staunch believer in the cause of social justice - knowing that her chosen field might not be kind to her, she decided it was her responsibility to launch projects that would showcase her skills and the skills of like-minded individuals, especially those from marginalised groups.
This campaign hopes to fund Foreman's first and second serials - the first, Nirvi, introduces our lead (played by Sonera Angel) and our Doctor (Ms. Miles herself), as well as Nirvi's ex-boyfriend, trans man Alex Starling. This inaugural two-part story explores concepts as wide-ranging as drug abuse, the need to belong, the journey from self-interest to self-sacrifice, and much more besides - all filtered through a heady sci-fi lens.
The second serial, Predator, Pray, explores the far future of the human race, sending the Doctor and Nirvi to Eschaton, hub of super-religion 'the Faith'. There, they encounter the Witness and come under attack by wasp-like aliens and their dangerous superweapon, the Raston Warrior Robot.
With your help, we can get the ball rolling on what promises to be a long and colourful career for Blackveil - we have several more projects in the pipeline and it is our sincere hope that Foreman will help boost our profile and showcase what our talented team can really do.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We've set a modest budget of £10,000 for our first two stories, much of which will go towards our film equipment and props, costume, and locations. While it is difficult to estimate the precise costs of creating our creatures and effects, we do know that our choice of camera and lenses will come to £4906. The remaining £5303 will help cover rent on our TARDIS set and otherwise pay for the costs of developing the project - we already own a wide array of fantastic camera equipment, we just don't have the camera or lenses!
However, knowing that transparency is important, we will make sure to update regularly with the quotes and estimated costs of our concept art, costume development, prop and location costs.
We'll be offering a range of weird and wonderful perks, including prop replicas, concept art, meet-n-greets, signed scripts, cameos and credits, and much more besides!
Were the campaign to make less than we hope, we will scale back and shoot the pilot alone, and work from there on successive launches, campaigns and similar to continue producing the series. If the minimum of £4697 to cover our equipment costs isn't met, we will rent and hire as needed to shoot the pilot, until successive campaigns can cover the cost of purchase - and if we don't make enough to meet our higher tier rewards, we will negotiate refunding and reimbursement as soon as possible.

It is a not-for-profit production and all proceeds from the crowdfunding initiative will be utilised in the production itself. The possibility remains that Foreman will face a legal challenge and be forced to cease production, at which point crowdfunding will be discontinued and all backers will be refunded their last payment where possible.​
Beyond this, there are always huge hurdles to producing the quality of visual and narrative we want - scheduling, design, construction and the like. But we've already met many challenges head-on and delivered. Our astonishing TARDIS, TARDIS set, and other sundry props and designs have all been delivered by a minimal, hard-working team. We now have dedicated crew, makers, designers and the like - we can exceed every expectation we've placed on ourselves with a bit of time, and a bit of give and take. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Beyond pitching in to the campaign, it's absolutely possible for you - yes, you in the back - to get involved with Foreman and other Blackveil projects anytime. Just drop Jillian an email at cco@blackveilentertainment.org and let her know what you can bring to the Blackveil stable of artists, actors, designers and builders - we'd be delighted to have you on-board.
You can also share our campaign on any and all social media - we're not fussy!

story:
All about the Project!

___________________________________________

The food you eat can either be the safest and most powerful form of medicine or the slowest form of poison. Which would you choose?

We all know at least one person suffering from a chronic disease and that number is growing. The rates of autism, diabetes, arthritis and auto immune conditions have sky rocketed in the last decade. A student of mine told me 6 of her family members currently have cancer! They live in the Canadian countryside surrounded by farms that are heavily sprayed with toxic pesticides. This is not normal.

People don't know how good it feels to feel good. To be able to sleep soundly at night and wake up in the morning and be full of energy and not need coffee. To feel energized and light in your step.

Let food be thy medicine and medicine thy food. It's a lot simpler than you think.

Choosing a plant-based, whole foods diet can be the single biggest environmental impact we make as an individual. Even more than if you decided to walk everywhere for the rest of your life.

The vision for the TV series is to show how simple whole, plant-based foods can heal the body and correct nutrient imbalances within us all while guiding us towards a happier, healthier self. We will rediscover, uncover and raise awareness about the plant-based lifestyle and how it can greatly impact our nutrition, health, and sustainability of our beautiful planet.

We plan to make this happen next spring, summer and fall while traveling cross Canada in a small home (tiny house/RV/camper van). Heal and Ignite Across Canada needs help to turn this vision into fruition. I'm looking at gathering $35,000 to get things started, which is 10% of our budget - the other 90% will come from grants dedicated to providing new and original Canadian content on TV.

My team and I are applying for a large grant via TELUS Fund. TELUS Fund provides funding to exceptional content that tells stories, engages, and enlightens the audience on their health choices. Their ultimate goal is to promote health and well-being of Canadians and to improve the quality of their lives. As an applicant, one of the things they require is to have a portion of the project funded, and proof of support from the community.

Heal and Ignite Across Canada already has 15 experts on board, from chefs to best-selling authors, doctors to athletes, healers, dieticians and naturopaths. We also have a broadcaster already! This means it will air on television! (This is one of the hardest things to secure and we've already accomplished it!)

Furthermore, those who contribute to the campaign will make up the community of individuals who advocate the benefits of this lifestyle, and believe that this project takes the necessary steps towards creating a healthier, happier Canada.

Should the funds we gather not reach the targeted amount, we will still pursue the project. In effect, the TELUS Fund’s grant amount will likely be reduced equivalent to what we’ve raised and we will re-evaluate the budget.

The Impact

I want to share with everyone that the key to good health and long life is not a drug that is yet to be discovered or an extreme surgery and neither the next big fad diet. What we need in terms of nutrition, are the most power-packed whole foods that could be growing right in our own backyards. I want to promote an adventurous, mindful, sustainable, and nourishing modern lifestyle to the world.

But I can only do so much, and I need all the help I can get to reach more people and get the word out. TELUS Fund shares this objective, and I hope that you do, too. With the afflictions that we face daily, chronic diseases and illnesses in children and adults – it is only logical that we do what we can to protect each other, the planet we live on, its creatures and our resources.

Support this campaign any way you can by contributing or sharing with your friends and family on social media. There are also many perks of contributing which make great holiday gifts! Cookbooks, private nutrition coaching, t-shirts, cooking classes, and even an opportunity to appear on the TV series!

  • Your support will contribute to the tipping point of consumer education, by empowering Canadians to take back their health and heal themselves with whole foods.
  • This TV series is just one project of many that I have been involved in over the years. It is a natural progression from the 5 cookbooks I've published and allows my passion to reach a larger audience. Being named one of Canada's most influential vegan influencers by Impact Magazine, I am motivated to live up to the honor. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! This makes it super easy to pass the word.

Being named one of Canada's most influential vegan influencers by Impact Magazine, I am motivated to live up to the honor. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools! This makes it super easy to pass the word.

story:
Beer Farmer 

Picturesque farms surround old fashioned, blue collar Chilton, Wisconsin.  Settled by German immigrants in the 1850’s, little has changed in decades and that’s the way they like it.  

Brewing beer here is a way of life and a means of sustenance.  Originating in the pioneer days, Calumet Brewing Company has been the Rowland’s family business for over 30 years.  Under Pat Rowland’s crass yet lovable leadership, both the brewery and the family bar continue in the great Packerland beer tradition.

A football coach and former chef, Pat’s undeniable appetite has him smoking bacon and grilling venison when he brews his beer.  His non-stop intensity gets the job done, but not without a story along the way, punctuated with his hearty laugh.  

Whether making deliveries or harvesting hops, Pat understands the value of friends and community— and also their willingness to work for beer.

Now in its 26th year, Calumet Brewing Company hosts an annual microbrew festival which has grown so large it is now held at the County Fair Grounds, but the polka remains the same as it ever was. 

In Pat’s words, when he’s rich and famous, he wants to host his own hunting and fishing tv show.  Or maybe make that ice fishing…

_______________________

I grew up in Chilton.  Pat and I were in Boy Scouts together.  The bar, then run by his Dad, was on my paper route, and sometimes I got a free candy bar on Fridays.  

When I returned to the area to shoot the documentary Waterways, interviewing Pat reminded me how funny, gritty and colorful community can be.  I want to share that authentic slice of small town Midwest.  Preferably over a beer.    

The Filmmakers

Our Los Angeles based team are all originally from Wisconsin and attended UW-Madison.  For an overview of our creative team's current projects in development, production and post production, please visit torsoentertainment.com.  

Paul Hertel, Producer
A veteran of lifestyle publishing, including Time Inc., Martha Stewart and Conde Nast​é, Paul relocated from Brooklyn to Los Angeles to return to his acting roots and produce documentaries, television and new media.
 
Sarah Josephs Yapelli, Director
Sarah Josephs Yapelli specializes in visual branding, creative convergence and content development.  For over 20 years she has conceptualized, curated and produced images, film, and music. Currently she directs films, represents talent and packages projects.  

 

Nick Josephs, Editor
An actor, musician and filmmaker,  Nick has appeared in numerous network tv shows and national commercials. He has completed five feature film scripts, the first of which is currently in production. 
 

Production Costs

The majority of the funding to develop and produce the pilot episode has come from the Filmmakers. There is, however, a gap between the current funding and the total budget- the purpose of the campaign is to bridge that gap.  

We appreciate your support and have designed our perks to be fun and personal.  Enjoy! 

 

Risks & Challenges

Location filming presents logistical, technical and story direction challenges; this is especially true when filming an unscripted episodic.  However, the Filmmakers have extensive experience shooting in Wisconsin (with it’s ever changing weather!) and are prepared to adapt as necessary.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share BEER FARMER with your friends online

  • Share BEER FARMER with your friends in person

  • Share BEER FARMER with your friends over a beer (recommended)

And that's all there is to it.
