story:
What is the Zomb Squad?

Welcome to the Post Post-Apocalypse! Mankind has survived the Zombie Wars! The undead threat has been greatly reduced with the introduction of the “Z” Vaccine. Everything is now as it once was: working schools, busy streets, stocked stores. There is, however, one significant exception: the occasional stray zombie’s still gotta eat! 

For SGT. JAKE ROMERO, and his unconventional team of hardened zombie hunters, this means business has just come back to life! Once heroes, who helped saved mankind from the brink of extinction during the Zombie Apocalypse, Jake and his Zomb Squad have now become nothing more than glorified animal control officers in keeping the living dead off the city streets. Whether it be an underground zombie fight ring, or a stray ambler locked in Annie May Sheffler's laundry shack, the Zomb Squad is here to clean up the mess!

ZOMB SQUAD is an improvised comedy/horror scripted episodic program masquerading as a reality tv show that follows the Post Mortem Subdual and Acquisitions Unit, or Zomb Squad, as its more popularly known. The show pays tribute to all the iconic zombie classics that have come before (WALKING DEAD, NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD), while taking the piss out of a market oversaturated with zombie culture in the hilarious stylings of RENO 911. The series is set after the zombie apocalypse and generates laughs with everything from gross out humor to satirizing the politically correct nature of our times. This ain't your typical zombie storytelling!

 

What The Hell Are We Doing Here?

To put it simply, we need your help. We are seeking funding for 3 episodes of the ZOMB SQUAD web series. As you know, to do it right, making a television show, film or web series is a costly endeavor, and while we here at ZOMB SQUAD have access to talent, crew and equipment, and a plethora of great ideas, we are all blue collar artists working in the entertainment industry and barely scraping by at times. But this is what we love. And the thing we need most, the thing we have the least access to, is funding. That’s where you come in, Oh IndieGoGoer.

A few years ago, I spent years trying to get a feature film produced. The script was original, funny and unique and we came close a few times, but the funding always fell thru in the end. I put the project back in the drawer and spent the next year shaking my head trying to figure out how to get work produced. I began to write scripts for an original television show and pitched it to producers with the same result. And then, I read something in the back of a tv pilot scriptwriting book that I will never forget. Now, I’m paraphrasing, because its been awhile, but it read something like this: ‘You don’t have the clout to take a script and put it on a producers desk and get it produced. That takes time. You may never get there, but if you don’t try, you’ll never know’. Now I know that was supposed to be uplifting, but what I saw instead was, ‘You don’t have the clout’ and ‘You may never get there…’ and for a guy like me, who loves what I do and the ability to create, the thought that I may never get there or have the clout to make great entertainment, well, it just made me feel dejected. So, I tried to figure out how to gain the clout. And you do that thru the power of the people! 

The most important reason to use Indiegogo, is because I know that throughout this community, there are passionate, stalwart and powerful individuals who are likeminded and who understand the creative urge, and who will help support an organized, creative and well thought out effort to do so. So, what the hell ARE we doing here? Glad you asked! We’ve decided to cut out the middle man and appeal to you, the audience, to give us the clout we need to get the job done. It ain’t rocket science, and it may be just funny lil zombies, but ZOMB SQUAD is an opportunity to take charge of our own careers and make fun, entertaining content that people can get behind! I don’t have the clout to put my script on a producers table and get it made, but collectively, “WE” do!

 

The (Twisted?) Minds Behind The Zomb Squad!

CHRISTIAN STOKES is the creator, head writer, co-director, co-producer of ZOMB SQUAD and will play the role of Sgt. Jake Romero. Christian just returned from touring the US, Canada and Europe last year as the Performance Director for MARVEL UNIVERSE LIVE, the biggest arena stunt show of its kind, featuring the Avengers, Spider-Man, Wolverine and many, many more! 

Christian is no stranger to film and tv, having acted in ESCAPE PLAN with Sylvester Stallone, MONSTER with Charlize Theron, and BERNIE with Matthew McConaughey, just to name a few. He was one of the mutated inbred brothers for the ‘8 Films To Die For’ feature, LAKE DEAD. He has done stunt work for such shows as ALIAS, NO ORDINARY FAMILY, and stunt double to series regular Zac Orth on the popular NBC tv show, REVOLUTION.

See Christian's IMDb page here: http://www.imdb.me/christianstokes

TODD E. BRALEY is the other half of the Dynamic Duo that will co-produce and co-direct the ZOMB SQUAD. Braley is a prolific writer and indie filmmaker that lives in Grand Junction, Colorado, with over 800 various projects, ranging from films to commercials, under his belt. 

Todd is the kind of filmmaker that has an idea, puts a group of driven individuals together and gets it done. His most recent works include THE CONFESSION, RAIN, MISFIT, KILL SHOW and the web series SURVIVING THE UNDEAD.

 Todd just returned from Los Angeles where he directed the video for the first single off the new album from the legendary rock and roll band, Great White. Todd's professionalism, hard work and inspiration are glowing examples of why he is such an essential part of the team. He doesn’t just talk the talk, more importantly, he walks the walk!

Take a look at Todd's Great White music video for the single, "Big Time": https://youtu.be/lkDa3spwZJI

 

Who’s Who in the Zomb Squad!

*all character sketches courtesy of illustrator Carlton H. Hoyles.

SGT. JAKE ROMERO (Christian Stokes)

Jake is the leader of the Squad. He is one part Rick Grimes from the Walking Dead, one part Dog the Bounty Hunter, and one part Phil Robertson from Duck Dynasty. Romero is a decisive leader, particularly when engaging the undead and he’s been doing it for a long time. He tends to put himself in danger because he has a sense of invulnerability and predestination. Used to date Vasquez once upon an apocalypse. He is the tie that binds them all together.

JESSE “GAF” COOTS (Jesse Van Swol)

Gaf is a gay man trapped in a hairy heterosexual’s bear man body. Somewhat overweight. His homosexuality is non-chalant.  His bitching and constant state of defeatism is not. Always waiting for the other shoe to drop and knows the next apocalypse is right around the corner. Probably rabid alpacas or some other horror or another. Sometimes allows his daughter, Brittany, to join the team on missions for extra credit.

GRIFFON COOTS (Cody Evans-Gan)

Grif is Gaf’s younger brother, and is the best zombie tracker there has ever been. In fact, he eats like a zombie, sleeps like a zombie and breathes like a zombie. In other words, for all intents and purposes, he is pretty much a zombie. Except he ain’t. He doesn’t speak much. Silent but deadly. And, Yep! You guessed it. He smells horrible.

MARVIN MARVINS (TBD)

Marvin is a poor man’s Dave Chapelle. Wiry and quick. Cries alot. On the Squad serving  out his community service. He’d rather be ANY place else. Funny in a crackhead sort of way. Has a thing for Gaf’s daughter Brittany. May be the only thing keeping him from running away screaming. And Griffon makes him nervous…a poopy pants kind of nervous!

BERTHA (Heather Carson)

Bertha is a big boned man hater and master interrogator. She is always in a bad Moo-Moo and in a worse mood. Woke up on the wrong side of bed every single morning. Enjoys whacking men and zombies alike with her bowling ball filled ditty bag! Kind of has the sweets for Griffon, but probably because he keeps his mouth shut. 

Here are a few words from Bertha herself! (Actress Heather Carson)

VASQUEZ (TBD)

Vasquez is in great shape and built for combat! She makes Sarah Connor look like a Sunday school teacher. She is militant and knows how to use every weapon in the book. She can take you out quicker than you can say, “Wanna Netflix and chill?” Bad ass and in control. Hand grenade in one hand and a can of whoop ass in the other. She is to zombies what Rambo was to commies! Yeah, she’s the real muscle of the team!

‘TEXAS’ TIMMY MACK (TBD)

Texas Tim is an OG Zombie Hunter. Tim is wheelchair bound because he cut off both legs after being bitten by a zombie because he didn’t care for needles! No zombie vaccines for Tim! He is the Chuck Norris of the Post-Post Apocalypse! WWTTD! “What Would Texas Tim Do?” The man is a legend. A true cowboys and tough as nails. Likes to play guitar and fire off his shotgun. Some people tell he used to be a famous country and western singer before the world went to hell.

Get the latest casting updates at our official FaceBook Page: https://www.facebook.com/zombsquadtv

 

How Can I Join The Squad?

Simple. Take a look at the Top Right of this page at all of our cool and interesting Perks and the dollar amount attached to each. You see something you like, please invest. Because that’s what you are: Investors. And not only will you invest and contribute to the ZOMB SQUAD, but, hey, we get to give something back to you for your investment! We have tried to put our heads together to come up with some cool and unique perks for our backers. And know that every dollar you invest goes into breathing life…or unlife, if you will…into creating the ZOMB SQUAD! 

How much should you invest? Only invest what you can freely give. We have different investment levels and rewards for both individuals and sponsoring corporations. You can only afford $10? Great! That just bought our printer paper for our Zombie Extra release forms. $25? You just helped us buy Sgt. Romero’s bloodstained cowboy hat! $100? You made our SFX guy happy by buying his prosthetics for the celebrity zombies in Episode 3, “Celebrity Zombie Deathmatch!” How bout $1000? Now the Squad gets to chase zombies in style because you just rented their ride for a week, the converted Ice Cream/Ambulance known as ‘Little Boy’, complete with ice cream music serenade! 

If you can’t support us with dollars, we understand! We have been starving artists more than once in our career. If that’s the case, then please get behind us instead with your enthusiasm and moral support. Share us with friends and family and groups on Facebook and Twitter, Instagram and Tinder, and Snapchat and Tumblr…Hmm, I said Tinder didn’t I? Must have been my subconscious showing! Start conversations and mention us around the water cooler and comic shops, in the comic-cons and on those Tinder dates. Let people know how to find us! Get it on til the break of dawn and spread the word! Any and all support, monetary or otherwise, is welcome!

 

What Happens To All That Cash?

I know! $20,000 sure sounds like a lot of cash to me, too! But, believe it or not, for what we are attempting, that figure is on the shallow end of the cemetery when it comes to producing network quality content. And don’t get us wrong! We aim to try to get this show picked up by a network or streaming service at the end of the day, so every dollar counts when it comes to production value. We want to make sure ‘low budget’ isn’t equated with ‘low quality’. 

This is Phase 1 of the funding for ZOMB SQUAD. In this initial crowdfunding campaign, we are trying to find the funds to physically produce the project. This includes travel, production, equipment, SFX, etc. At this time, cast and crew are working for free. Now, being a professional, I believe in paying an honest dollar for an honest day’s work. So, Phase 2 will be geared specifically to pay cast and crew. Finally, Phase 3 will begin after shooting is complete in August and will go towards post-production on the series. The overall budget from all three phases of fundraising will be $50,000.

In Phase 1, we will need to build out our illegal zombie fighting ring location, purchase or create props and wardrobe, rent offices and space for The Kennel (Zomb Squad HQ), as well as convert vehicles into lean mean Zombie Apocalypse Fightin’ Machines! And, because we are keeping crew and production prices down by shooting in Grand Junction, CO and using my co-producer Todd Braley’s team of filmmakers, we will spend the majority of our Phase 1 money on transporting talent into the Colorado wilds and making sure they are housed and well fed.

The breakdown for Phase 1 is as follows:

 

How The Hell Are We Gonna Get To $20K?

It’s not as crazy as you might think! It looks a little something like this!

If we have 100 people invest $25.

50 people invest $50

50 people invest $100

10 people invest $500

5 people invest $1000…

=

$20,000

Phase 1 Complete! We make ZOMB SQUAD and you get some SWAG!!!

 

NEW PERK ALERT!!!!!

PERK ALERT: We have just added two awesome swag items for those of you holding out on your contributions for the good stuff!

Introducing an original and singular piece of jewelry, created by the actress that plays the role of Bertha, Miss Heather Carson. You can have the unique item, Bertha's Apocalyptic Charm Bracelet, by contributing to our IndieGoGo Campaign!! Please contribute under the Zomb Squad Charmer Perk Level.

Our second new item would be a Zombie Head in A Jar...that's right. You can now have a zombie trophy of your own to help you remember the good ole days that was the Zombie Apocalypse. As Poison sang before Bret Michaels was eaten by a tour bus of Motley Crue groupie zombies, 'Nothing but a Good Time"! Get your own Zombie Head in a Jar by contributing to the Zomb Squad Head Hunter Perk Level!

Yes! What About That Swag?

I am glad you asked! We didn’t want to just offer the same ole same ole, so we mixed it up a little bit. Sure, we offer the customary video shout outs, t-shirts and dvd’s, but we also offer some pretty interesting and unique perks as well. Allow me to draw your attention to the Adopt-A-Zombie perk! That’s right! You get a dossier with a photo, bio and backstory from the life and undeath of one of the many zombies that inhabit the world of Zomb Squad. Who were they? Where did they come from? How did they become zombies? And what happens to them next? Each Adopt-A-Zombie is unique and different! Just don’t try to pet them!

We will also offer a ZOMB SQUAD blooper reel, making of video, and cast audition video for qualified backers. We also plan to have original music spread throughout the various episodes. With a Rock/ Country theme, we will offer qualifying backers the Zomb Squad Official Soundtrack composed of some great songs from up and coming stars out of Nashville, Ft. Worth and elsewhere.

One of my favorite perks is the Horror Themed Photoshoot with Todd Braley and our SFX artist, Bruce Inman. Make Halloween special this year and send these awesome shots to your loved ones and significant others! Or hell, just drop a shot in the neighbors mailbox to make for some interesting neighborhood gossip.

As we move into the corporate and executive producer packages, we offer  qualifying backers a chance to join Todd, myself (Christian), and another actor of your choice from the ZOMB SQUAD series for lunch in the famous French Quarter of New Orleans, followed by some frights and scares at The Mortuary, the famous and actually haunted Haunted House in the City of the Dead!

And at the top of our Corporate Perks package, we offer to fly the entire series regular cast in to your city to play your team of personally picked deadbeats, whether it be your golf buddies or your board of directors, in a game of ‘Biter Ball’ ( a vicious little twist on the game of kickball as introduced in the pilot episode of ZOMB SQUAD) for a fundraiser to the charity of your choice. We want to give back for what you’ve given us to give back to you. Or something like that. Yeah!

There you have it! Please invest. And we’ll kill zombies (as long as the people from ETUP [Ethical Treatment of Undead People] don’t find out about it!).

As Sgt. Romero would say, God is good, and good is God, now let’s get to rambling!!!

 

PERK DISCLAIMER:
Please be aware that the majority of perks may not be delivered until after filming has been completed, however we will keep you updated and informed of any and all delivery times. For on-site perks and premier invitations, these will take place in Grand Junction, Colorado. For backers below the EXECUTIVE PRODUCER level, you will be responsible for your own transportation and accommodation. Additional paperwork may be required to fulfill some rewards, including ‘Zombie Extras’ and ‘Co-Starring’ perks. On-set visits will require signed legal agreements to protect both parties. If you are under the age of 18 and wish to attend the table read, or visit the set, you must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at your expense

Table Read Perk: Table read TBD in August. Table read will take place in Grand Junction, CO. NO TRAVEL or ACCOMMODATIONS provided for In-Person participation. Must be 18+, or accompanied by a parent/guardian.

Horror Photoshoot Perk: Photoshoot will take place in Grand Junction, CO. NO TRAVEL or ACCOMMODATIONS provided.Must be 18+, or accompanied by a parent/guardian.

Set Visit Perk/ On-Camera Perks: Filming dates TBD in August. Shoot will take place in Grand Junction, CO. NO TRAVEL or ACCOMMODATIONS provided. Must be 18+, or accompanied by a parent/guardian.

Premiere Perk: Premiere dates TBD in October. This will take place in Grand Junction, CO. NO TRAVEL or ACCOMMODATIONS provided. Must be 18+, or accompanied by a parent/guardian.
story_txt:
What is the Zomb Squad?
Welcome to the Post Post-Apocalypse! Mankind has survived the Zombie Wars! The undead threat has been greatly reduced with the introduction of the “Z” Vaccine. Everything is now as it once was: working schools, busy streets, stocked stores. There is, however, one significant exception: the occasional stray zombie’s still gotta eat! 
For SGT. JAKE ROMERO, and his unconventional team of hardened zombie hunters, this means business has just come back to life! Once heroes, who helped saved mankind from the brink of extinction during the Zombie Apocalypse, Jake and his Zomb Squad have now become nothing more than glorified animal control officers in keeping the living dead off the city streets. Whether it be an underground zombie fight ring, or a stray ambler locked in Annie May Sheffler's laundry shack, the Zomb Squad is here to clean up the mess!

ZOMB SQUAD is an improvised comedy/horror scripted episodic program masquerading as a reality tv show that follows the Post Mortem Subdual and Acquisitions Unit, or Zomb Squad, as its more popularly known. The show pays tribute to all the iconic zombie classics that have come before (WALKING DEAD, NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD), while taking the piss out of a market oversaturated with zombie culture in the hilarious stylings of RENO 911. The series is set after the zombie apocalypse and generates laughs with everything from gross out humor to satirizing the politically correct nature of our times. This ain't your typical zombie storytelling!
 
What The Hell Are We Doing Here?
To put it simply, we need your help. We are seeking funding for 3 episodes of the ZOMB SQUAD web series. As you know, to do it right, making a television show, film or web series is a costly endeavor, and while we here at ZOMB SQUAD have access to talent, crew and equipment, and a plethora of great ideas, we are all blue collar artists working in the entertainment industry and barely scraping by at times. But this is what we love. And the thing we need most, the thing we have the least access to, is funding. That’s where you come in, Oh IndieGoGoer.
A few years ago, I spent years trying to get a feature film produced. The script was original, funny and unique and we came close a few times, but the funding always fell thru in the end. I put the project back in the drawer and spent the next year shaking my head trying to figure out how to get work produced. I began to write scripts for an original television show and pitched it to producers with the same result. And then, I read something in the back of a tv pilot scriptwriting book that I will never forget. Now, I’m paraphrasing, because its been awhile, but it read something like this: ‘You don’t have the clout to take a script and put it on a producers desk and get it produced. That takes time. You may never get there, but if you don’t try, you’ll never know’. Now I know that was supposed to be uplifting, but what I saw instead was, ‘You don’t have the clout’ and ‘You may never get there…’ and for a guy like me, who loves what I do and the ability to create, the thought that I may never get there or have the clout to make great entertainment, well, it just made me feel dejected. So, I tried to figure out how to gain the clout. And you do that thru the power of the people! 

The most important reason to use Indiegogo, is because I know that throughout this community, there are passionate, stalwart and powerful individuals who are likeminded and who understand the creative urge, and who will help support an organized, creative and well thought out effort to do so. So, what the hell ARE we doing here? Glad you asked! We’ve decided to cut out the middle man and appeal to you, the audience, to give us the clout we need to get the job done. It ain’t rocket science, and it may be just funny lil zombies, but ZOMB SQUAD is an opportunity to take charge of our own careers and make fun, entertaining content that people can get behind! I don’t have the clout to put my script on a producers table and get it made, but collectively, “WE” do!
 
The (Twisted?) Minds Behind The Zomb Squad!

CHRISTIAN STOKES is the creator, head writer, co-director, co-producer of ZOMB SQUAD and will play the role of Sgt. Jake Romero. Christian just returned from touring the US, Canada and Europe last year as the Performance Director for MARVEL UNIVERSE LIVE, the biggest arena stunt show of its kind, featuring the Avengers, Spider-Man, Wolverine and many, many more! 

Christian is no stranger to film and tv, having acted in ESCAPE PLAN with Sylvester Stallone, MONSTER with Charlize Theron, and BERNIE with Matthew McConaughey, just to name a few. He was one of the mutated inbred brothers for the ‘8 Films To Die For’ feature, LAKE DEAD. He has done stunt work for such shows as ALIAS, NO ORDINARY FAMILY, and stunt double to series regular Zac Orth on the popular NBC tv show, REVOLUTION.
See Christian's IMDb page here: http://www.imdb.me/christianstokes
TODD E. BRALEY is the other half of the Dynamic Duo that will co-produce and co-direct the ZOMB SQUAD. Braley is a prolific writer and indie filmmaker that lives in Grand Junction, Colorado, with over 800 various projects, ranging from films to commercials, under his belt. 

Todd is the kind of filmmaker that has an idea, puts a group of driven individuals together and gets it done. His most recent works include THE CONFESSION, RAIN, MISFIT, KILL SHOW and the web series SURVIVING THE UNDEAD.

 Todd just returned from Los Angeles where he directed the video for the first single off the new album from the legendary rock and roll band, Great White. Todd's professionalism, hard work and inspiration are glowing examples of why he is such an essential part of the team. He doesn’t just talk the talk, more importantly, he walks the walk!

Take a look at Todd's Great White music video for the single, "Big Time": https://youtu.be/lkDa3spwZJI
 

Who’s Who in the Zomb Squad!
*all character sketches courtesy of illustrator Carlton H. Hoyles.
SGT. JAKE ROMERO (Christian Stokes)

Jake is the leader of the Squad. He is one part Rick Grimes from the Walking Dead, one part Dog the Bounty Hunter, and one part Phil Robertson from Duck Dynasty. Romero is a decisive leader, particularly when engaging the undead and he’s been doing it for a long time. He tends to put himself in danger because he has a sense of invulnerability and predestination. Used to date Vasquez once upon an apocalypse. He is the tie that binds them all together.
JESSE “GAF” COOTS (Jesse Van Swol)

Gaf is a gay man trapped in a hairy heterosexual’s bear man body. Somewhat overweight. His homosexuality is non-chalant.  His bitching and constant state of defeatism is not. Always waiting for the other shoe to drop and knows the next apocalypse is right around the corner. Probably rabid alpacas or some other horror or another. Sometimes allows his daughter, Brittany, to join the team on missions for extra credit.
GRIFFON COOTS (Cody Evans-Gan)

Grif is Gaf’s younger brother, and is the best zombie tracker there has ever been. In fact, he eats like a zombie, sleeps like a zombie and breathes like a zombie. In other words, for all intents and purposes, he is pretty much a zombie. Except he ain’t. He doesn’t speak much. Silent but deadly. And, Yep! You guessed it. He smells horrible.
MARVIN MARVINS (TBD)

Marvin is a poor man’s Dave Chapelle. Wiry and quick. Cries alot. On the Squad serving  out his community service. He’d rather be ANY place else. Funny in a crackhead sort of way. Has a thing for Gaf’s daughter Brittany. May be the only thing keeping him from running away screaming. And Griffon makes him nervous…a poopy pants kind of nervous!
BERTHA (Heather Carson)

Bertha is a big boned man hater and master interrogator. She is always in a bad Moo-Moo and in a worse mood. Woke up on the wrong side of bed every single morning. Enjoys whacking men and zombies alike with her bowling ball filled ditty bag! Kind of has the sweets for Griffon, but probably because he keeps his mouth shut. 
Here are a few words from Bertha herself! (Actress Heather Carson)

VASQUEZ (TBD)

Vasquez is in great shape and built for combat! She makes Sarah Connor look like a Sunday school teacher. She is militant and knows how to use every weapon in the book. She can take you out quicker than you can say, “Wanna Netflix and chill?” Bad ass and in control. Hand grenade in one hand and a can of whoop ass in the other. She is to zombies what Rambo was to commies! Yeah, she’s the real muscle of the team!
‘TEXAS’ TIMMY MACK (TBD)

Texas Tim is an OG Zombie Hunter. Tim is wheelchair bound because he cut off both legs after being bitten by a zombie because he didn’t care for needles! No zombie vaccines for Tim! He is the Chuck Norris of the Post-Post Apocalypse! WWTTD! “What Would Texas Tim Do?” The man is a legend. A true cowboys and tough as nails. Likes to play guitar and fire off his shotgun. Some people tell he used to be a famous country and western singer before the world went to hell.
Get the latest casting updates at our official FaceBook Page: https://www.facebook.com/zombsquadtv
 
How Can I Join The Squad?
Simple. Take a look at the Top Right of this page at all of our cool and interesting Perks and the dollar amount attached to each. You see something you like, please invest. Because that’s what you are: Investors. And not only will you invest and contribute to the ZOMB SQUAD, but, hey, we get to give something back to you for your investment! story:
The Story

10 to 6 is, at it's core, an honest portrayal of London life for young people fresh out of education. This particular story features Alex and Becca, two aspiring actors with high expectations and low motivation levels. Our first series explores their first few weeks in the big city, showing us the ups and downs (but mostly downs) of their first attempt at "adulting."

My name is Cameron O'Ware, and I'm an acting student from Northampton. 10 to 6 is my first venture into writing, producing and directing (no pressure then) so I am extremely passionate about making this series something beautiful.

Anyone who knows this industry knows how hard it can be to break into, and for all of us involved in 10 to 6, this is us breaking in and leaving our mark - and that's why we need your help!

This is our beginning. This will be just the first project to come from this group of talented, passionate people. It's going to be something special - and you can be a part of that!

What Are We Asking For?

Unfortunately, making a show is expensive. We've sat down to work out costs and we've come up with £1500 as the bare minimum we need to crowdfund to make this series a reality. That money will go towards;

  • Equipment Purchase/Hire - to make it beautiful!
  • Location Shooting Costs - to make it interesting!
  • Payment/Travel Costs for Cast & Crew - to make it fair!
  • Promotion & Advertising - to get it seen!

Rest assured we're not just relying on you to cover these costs - we'll also be doing our own fundraising on the side of this campaign which we'll be sure to keep you updated on, so do keep checking back!

Be sure to check out the perks we're offering at the side of this page - who wouldn't want our faces hanging on their bedroom walls!?

    Other Ways To Help

    Donating isn't the only way to help us out! I cannot stress enough how helpful it is to simply share this campaign around.

    Above all else, we just want people to watch and enjoy our series. So if you share this post, and a few of your friends share it on, then a few of their friends share it on, that will make such a huge difference to the amount of people that find us.

    So give the social media buttons at the side of this page a click - it takes just a few seconds and makes such a huge impact!

    Thank you!

    Thank you so much for reading! I really hope I've managed to share some of my passion for this project with you and that you want to bring it to life as much as I do!

    So donate if you can, share if you can't, and I'll speak to you again soon!

story:
ABOUT PLAIN SIGHT

PLAIN SIGHT is a dramatic  television series set in Trinidad & Tobago.  Based on the complex relationship between two highly motivated, bright, and ambitious characters that grew up together, only to become arch rivals, since one became a ruthless mafia leader and the other a shrewd forensic scientist/ detective. Both are fighting for what is best for their community, but obviously one’s method is lawful and the other’s is not. They are both in their early 30s. The Mafia leader is James, who has been disillusioned by government policies, sociological prejudice and economic inequalities. Through James we are introduced to a cast of characters that straddle several socio-economic groups.

The detective, Sarah, is a highly educated woman who won a scholarship straight out of high school for a prestigious university in North America. After a tumultuous childhood and some prodding from her father, she left Trinidad and barely looked back. She left Trinidad to further her studies abroad and was snatched up by a foreign CSI and was well on her way to success when she receives a phone call from Trinidad that her sister has been murdered. From that moment, the focus of her life shifts forever and puts her on a direct collision course with James.

The series as a whole, works toward the dramatic climax when Sarah eventually comes face to face with her emotional connection with James, and her sense of morality and justice. As they focus intensely on each other, the people in both their lives must live in the here and now - against the backdrop of a seemingly idyllic island where danger lurks just beneath the surface, and criminals hide in plain sight.

 

Director Danielle Dieffenthaller talks through a scene with lead actress Marie-Ange Ramirez. (Photo by Lori Antoinette Williams)
 

WHERE WE'RE AT

We have been actively working on fundraising and production of Plain Sight for over three years. In terms of the specifics, here’s where we’re at:

  • We have almost completed casting the pilot – we will have to make a few last minute replacements as we lost Winston Duke to the Marvel Universe and are on the lookout for a new Police Commissioner (like our country!).
  • We have plotted out the entire first season with storyline for the next 5 seasons, recognising that these stories are fluid and can change with time and circumstances.
  • We have completed production on half of the pilot with six more days of shooting to be completed before we move on to editing and scoring.
  • We have secured partial funding from two large organisations and have been pledged funding by two companies.

 

WHAT WE NEED and WHAT YOU GET

We need to raise enough money to complete production on the pilot episode of Plain Sight so that we can shop it to the international market. Our target for this Indiegogo campaign is $35,000 or more.

We have put together what we hope you’ll find to be a great selection of perks and benefits for you, our backers, from streaming links to our hit series, Westwood Park to merchandise, acting lessons and walk-on parts in the pilot!  

In addition to the perks currently listed, we will be adding special one-off perks throughout the campaign, so do keep checking back in with us!

 

Preparing to film a riot scene in St Barbs.

 

The IMPACT

I have been working on Plain Sight for several years now: in terms of developing the story-arc for the series, scripting the pilot, casting the pilot and crewing up, plus extensive fundraising over a period of years. I began shooting the pilot episode in late 2016, but soon hit a major stumbling block: one of my confirmed funders withdrew half its funding after we had completed several days of filming and all our pre-production, which made it impossible to complete production on the pilot. Needless to say this was a devastating blow.

We have been meeting with potential funding partners who will commit to funding the series once we can produce a full pilot. In addition, we already have a distributor in place to sell the series on the international market, but he is unable to do so without at least the pilot episode in hand. So, not wanting to lose him, we have to act now to make sure that the pilot is completed and ready to be sold. So I’ve dusted myself off and am determined to finish the pilot so that it can be shopped regionally and internationally.

This is why we must do this crowdfunding campaign now! With your help, we hope to raise US$35,000 or more so that we can work towards completing the pilot and getting it in the hands of our distributor. Ultimately, we need to raise US$100,000 to complete the pilot, so every penny we can get through Indiegogo is a crucial step towards achieving this and we are absolutely determined!  We also believe that hitting our goal on Indiegogo will be an invaluable morale boost to continue pushing to make our fundraising target.

 

The cast and crew of Plain Sight filming at Sealots.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Unfortunately, even with a pilot, there is no guarantee that the series will be picked up for production and distribution. However, what I know for sure is that without a pilot, there is no way that Plain Sight is going to get anywhere! I also know that I am deeply committed to this project which, when it is made, will be the first dramatic series to  be made in Trinidad in over 10 years!

My experience with Westwood Park – a series which is now 20 years old and is the most successful Caribbean drama ever made – has taught me that there are large and varied audiences for drama series, and the life of a series is long! Also, having worked in this industry for 30 years now, I know how to pull this off and am certain of my ability to do so well. I continue to push to overcome hurdles with this series, and I'm so grateful for any support you give.  



Filming a Plain Sight scene with Valmike Rampersad in Carenage.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you aren't able to contribute financially, it would be great if you could encourage others to get involved by sharing this via facebook, twitter and e mail. Every single contribution (no matter the size) takes us closer to our goal!  If you have any questions, I'd be happy to hear from you. You can email me at ddieffenthaller@gmail.com

Thanks a million!

 

ABOUT the CREW


 

ABOUT the PRINCIPAL CAST

campaign_city: Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago

story:
The Series

Threshold: Mysteries of the Border Patrol is hosted by Rocky Elmore, a retired Border Patrol agent with 20 years' service. You'll ride along with Rocky as he spins tall tales of borderland intrigue and digs into the background of each rollercoaster adventure story.

This TV/web series is based on Rocky's popular book Out on Foot: Nightly Patrols and Ghostly Tales of a U.S. Border Patrol Agent, and is produced with the kind assistance of U.S. Customs and Border Protection in the Department of Homeland Security.

The Border Patrol is frequently featured in the news these days, and immigration and border control are hot-button issues. However, we decided to do something different: to produce a series that is totally non-political and focuses on the human element. Wherever you're coming from, you'll experience the trials and tribulations of the real-life characters in these stories as they actually happened.

We hope you'll join us on this journey. It'd be great to have you along!



Episodes 1 and 2

Our crowdfunding goal for this campaign is to fund the first two broadcast-quality episodes of the series, which will be available for viewing on major web streaming services. Each episode may contain stories featuring rescue attempts, mountain lion attacks, unsolved murders, death-defying air and sea missions, ghostly apparitions of Native American warriors and lost children, weird satanic rituals, footprints that might belong to Bigfoot, coyotes protecting a lake with a deadly secret, and cliffs on the borderland so treacherous that no one dares approach them.

Location shooting is planned for fall 2018, with episodes to be released in 2019 via streaming services and DVD. We plan to make more episodes, so stay tuned!

Our production team includes retired Border Patrol agent Rocky Elmore (host and executive producer), TV writer/producer Allan Duffin (multiple projects for History & Discovery channels, syndicated programming, Air Force veteran), and Maryland-based actor Leo Rogstad (who's also a paranormal investigator, believe it or not!).

This is one series you won't want to miss. Get involved by donating to the Threshold campaign by clicking on a donation level to the right.

Get involved in this one-of-a-kind series

There's nothing else like this show. Would you please help us spread the word?

  • Use the Indiegogo share buttons at the upper right of this webpage to follow us and share this campaign with friends, family, and coworkers via Facebook, Twitter, links, or embedding.
  • Revisit this page often for updates, and visit our website at thresholdmysteries.com or email us with any questions you may have at info@thresholdmysteries.com.
